On Friday afternoon, a man entered the BP at 4222 E Washington Ave, and asked the store clerk for cigarettes.  As the employee was pulling down the carton of cigarettes, the 33-year-old man lunged over the counter, grabbed the clerk’s wrists, and forcefully pulled the cigarette carton out of their hands and ran out of the store, and fled in his car.  BP employees were able to give police license plate information of the suspect.
 
Later, officers were able to locate Joshua W. Koiman at his registered address.  Kooiman was booked into Dane County Jail and tentatively charged with robbery, bail jumping, and a probation violation.

On Friday night, a 23-year-old man was causing a disturbance inside the food court at East Towne Mall, standing on tables throwing things at employees and striking mall security with chairs while yelling “I’m going to kill you”.  Kejuan T. Hill actively resisted officers as they tried to prevent him from causing further harm.  Hill continued to exhibit violent and assaultive behavior towards officers and was eventually taken into custody using an electronic control device.   
 
Two mall security officers (77-year-old man and 75-year-old female) were treated at a local hospital with substantial injuries caused by Hill.  One victim had a broken clavicle and stitches on the face while the other victim had a broken collar bone with stitches on the head.   
 
Hill was transported to a hospital for an evaluation and tentatively charged with substantial battery, attempted robbery, resisting, and disorderly conduct.  Hill was involved in a similar incident a year ago at the McDonald’s on Dryden Drive (2020-065468)

Yesterday morning, a store manager at an East Towne Mall business called police to report that a person stole over $400 worth of merchandise.  Officers located Cassandra C. Beecher, age 19, a short distance away hiding between trees.  Beecher was taken to Dane County Jail and tentatively charged with retail theft, possession of drug paraphernalia, possession of cocaine, and 11 counts of bail jumping.

On 1/24/21 at approximately 10:49 a.m. Madison Police responded to the 2800 block of Curry Parkway.  A citizen, not known to the youth, located a six year old and three year old lingering in the area.  The two young boys asked the citizen for help as they wanted to go home.  The citizen called police and Officers responded. The Officers took care of the frightened youth and gave them a ride back to the east side of town, to begin the investigation.  Neither the six year old or three year old knew their last name.  Officers were trying to figure out how these youth made it all the way over to the South side of Madison from the east side.  Metro was contacted and drivers did not recall giving a ride on a Sunday morning to such young youth traveling without an adult.  Hours went by and a relative learned the youth were not at home and contacted police, to which the investigation continues.  The youth were returned home.  We are appreciative of the South side resident who contact police sensing the youth needed help.

A Madison resident was recently scammed out of a large sum of money.  The victim reported to police they received a phone call from someone stating there was an issue with an online purchase they had made.  Confused, the victim told the caller they did not make a recent purchase and was persuaded to give their bank account information to show they didn’t make the transaction.  Shortly after the phone conversation, the victim discovered a large sum of money withdrawn from their bank account. 
 
If you were scammed or think you saw a scam, report it to the Federal Trade Commission.
 
What You Can Do to Avoid a Scam
 
  • Block unwanted calls and text messages. Take steps to block unwanted calls and to filter unwanted text messages. 
  • Don’t give your personal or financial information in response to a request that you didn’t expect. Legitimate organizations won’t call, email, or text to ask for your personal information, like your Social Security, bank account, or credit card numbers. 
If you get an email or text message from a company you do business with and you think it’s real, it’s still best not to click on any links. Instead, contact them using a website you know is trustworthy. Or look up their phone number. Don’t call a number they gave you or the number from your caller ID
  • Resist the pressure to act immediately. Legitimate businesses will give you time to make a decision. Anyone who pressures you to pay or give them your personal information is a scammer. 
  • Know how scammers tell you to pay. Never pay someone who insists you pay with a gift card or by using a money transfer service. And never deposit a check and send money back to someone. 
  • Stop and talk to someone you trust. Before you do anything else, tell someone — a friend, a family member, a neighbor — what happened. Talking about it could help you realize it’s a scam.

Today around noon, a person called 911 stating they placed explosive devices at the 7-Eleven at 673 State Street and indicated they could detonate the bombs at any time.  Officers quickly setup a perimeter and out of an abundance of caution began to evacuate nearby buildings.  A MPD K9 Unit specializing in explosives detection, was on scene and after a thorough search, did not locate any devices or suspicious items.  Detectives are still working to identify the caller and circumstances surrounding this incident.
 
While officers and detectives were investigating this threat, another similar threat was called in for the 7-Eleven at 2201 S Park St at 12:51PM (2021-32579).  Officers were able to secure this business and establish a safe perimeter.  An Unmanned Aircraft System (UAS) and a K9 Unit from UWPD assisted in clearing the 7-Eleven.  Again, no explosive device or any other evidence was located.
 
Out of an abundance of caution, MPD reached out to the other area 7-Elevens to notify them of the pattern we were seeing.  There were no other reports of threats. Investigators will continue to followup on these incidents.

Address: Fish Hatchery Rd and W Badger Rd
Details:
Late last night officers were sent to a car that crashed into a pole near the intersection of Fish Hatchery Rd and W Badger Rd.  A 53-year-old passenger was transported to a local hospital with serious injuries.  The driver was identified as Antoine L Branch, age 45, and booked into Dane County Jail on the following tentative charges:
  • OWI Causing Great Bodily Harm (3rd Offense)
  • Possession of Cocaine
  • Felony Bail Jumping (1 count)
  • Misdemeanor Bail Jumping (2 counts)

MPD officers were dispatched to a weapons offense in the 4200 block of Maher Ave. One subject was transported to an area hospital with serious injuries. One person of interest was taken into police custody. The Violent Crimes Unit is leading the investigation. The investigation is active and ongoing.

If anyone has information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com

On Saturday afternoon, a 33-year-old man was threatening customers and employees inside the Subway at 7011 Watts Rd. Officers attempted to deescalate the man’s behavior, however Tony P. Olson continued his behavior and officers placed him into custody. 
 
Olson resisted and spat at officers as they attempted to secure him in a police car. He was then taken to a local hospital and offered a medical evaluation, but while there he attempted to assault medical staff. Tony Olson was ultimately transported to the Dane County Jail on the following tentative charges:
 
- Disorderly Conduct
- Threats to Law Enforcement 
- Resisting/Obstructing Law Enforcement 
- Battery to medical personnel
- Carrying a Concealed Knife
- Felony Bail Jumping
- Probation Violation

Early Saturday morning a burglar forced entry into the Walgreens at 2121 S Park St and stole an undisclosed amount of cigarette cartons.  The suspect is described as wearing a camouflage coat, gray pants, green gloves, and black and white shoes. 
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

On Friday, around noon, two co-workers went to Milios Sandwiches at 6698 Odana Rd to order some food.  They exited the shop with their food only to find their 2021 Nissan Armada rental SUV missing.  Keys were left inside the cup holder.  No suspect information.
 
Last year the MPD received 744 stolen auto reports.  Of that 744 stolen autos, 345 of them had keys in them or readily accessible and 115 of them were running at the time.  The 744 stolen autos represented a 46.9% increase from 2019.

Address: Donald Dr and Crest Line Dr
Details:
Early this morning, a confrontation led to a shots fired incident and abandoned vehicle near the intersection of Donald Dr and Crest Line Dr. 

After a verbal dispute at a north side bar, an unidentified man punched a woman and left with others in a BMW X5.  The woman and a friend followed the BMW to attempt to “ram” it and later reported to police shots were fired from the moving car in the direction of their vehicle (no injuries or property damage, however bullet fragments were found in the roadway by officers). 

The BMW was located by police abandoned in a snowbank near the intersection of Donald Dr and Crest Line Dr.  Officers and a K9 unit did not locate the other involved parties after finding the BMW abandoned.  The investigation is continuing with more follow-up by detectives.

This morning a car was stolen outside a coffee shop in the City of Monona.  A short time later, a MPD officer observed the stolen car at the Mobil gas station at 3019 E Washington Ave.  The 22-year-old driver struggled and resisted officers as she was taken into custody.  After the investigation, Antonia M Crawford was taken to the Dane County Jail on the following tentative charges:
 
Antonia M Crawford, age 22:
  • Operating Vehicle Without Owner Consent
  • Retail Theft (Warrant)
  • Resisting/Obstructing
A 28-year-old female passenger was also tentativley charged with possession of cocaine, possession of drug paraphernalia, and a parole violation.

Address: E Washington Ave and Independence Ln
Details:
K9 Bowie and his handler successfully apprehended a suspect who ran earlier from a traffic stop this afternoon.  Brandon L Rankin, age 26, was pulled over for a traffic violation near E Washington and Independence Ln by officers.  

As officers approached the car, they noticed a handgun in plain view.  Rankin quickly sped away from officers, but crashed nearby into a 86-year-old motorist, who was uninjured.  Brandon Rankin fled from his car into the nearby neighborhood where multiple officers and K9 units were quickly able to establish a perimeter to contain the suspect.
 
K9 Bowie, along with other officers were able to apprehend Rankin.  He was taken to a local hospital for an evaluation and will later be taken to the Dane County Jail on the following tentative charges:
 
  • Hit and Run
  • Resisting/Obstructing
  • Possession of a Controlled Substance
  • CCW Violation

Madison Police responded to a shots fired/road rage incident eastbound on the beltline near the S Park St exit. The operator of an involved vehicle reported that his car had been struck by gunfire. The suspects were unknown to the victim. There were no injuries.

The suspect vehicle was described as a two-tone SUV, possibly Hyundai.

If anyone has information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com

Last evening, a 37-year-old male caused a disturbance at the East Transfer Point by fighting, yelling, and harassing other metro passengers. George R Staisil resisted and struggled with police when they attempted to take him into custody.  During the struggle with officers, Staisil spat and made repeated threats towards them.  He was taken to a local hospital for a medical evaluation and later booked into the Dane County Jail on the following tentative charges:
 
  • Disorderly Conduct
  • Resisting/Obstructing
  • Bail Jumping (2x)
  • Threats to Law Enforcement
  • Discharge Bodily Fluid in Public (2x)
  • Urinating in Public

This morning, a silver 2015 Lexus was left running in the parking lot at the Pick ‘n Save on McKee Rd when it was stolen.  A short while later, officers spotted this stolen car leaving the west side Walmart at a high rate of speed.  Officers did not pursue the car, but it later crashed into a traffic standard at Watts Rd and S Highpoint Rd.  The suspect driver fled from the crash and jumped into a waiting dark blue Lincoln SUV (previously stolen) and escaped from the area.  Investigation continuing.

Early this morning around 4:00am,  a homeowner in the 100 block of Alton Dr woke up to the sound of the overhead garage door opening.  The homeowner checked on his sleeping family and went downstairs with his dog and was startled to find a person standing in his kitchen rummaging around.  The suspect fled after the homeowner yelled and the dog barked.  Cars in the garage and driveway were rummaged through and a wallet and garage door opener were reported missing.  The investigation is continuing.

A 20-year-old downtown resident called for police after a man was standing outside her bedroom window watching her in the 500 block of W Mifflin late last night.  The victim said the man exposed himself and described him as 30-40 years old having long curly brown hair, pulled back into a ponytail.  The victim alerted her roommates and they went outside to look for the suspect with no success.  Police provided extra patrol to the area throughout the night.  Investigation continues.

Pancheros, at 402 S Gammon Rd, was robbed this morning by a 20-30 year-old man wearing a black mask and red jacket.  The suspect entered through a back door, ordering one employee to the ground while directing two others to empty contents of the cash register. A gun was implied, but not seen as the man fled the store with an undisclosed amount of money. No injuries were reported. Investigation continuing.

This morning an 81-year-old driver hit a pedestrian in the crosswalk at the intersection of Raymond Rd and McKenna Blvd. A 72-year-old man was walking his dog with the walk-light when he was struck at slow speeds by the motorist.  The victim was offered medical attention by EMS but does not have significant injuries.  The driver was cited for Failure to Yield to Pedestrian.

Madison Police Department officers responded to a single vehicle crash involving a privately owned bus in the 1200 Block of East Washington Avenue. There was one reported minor injury. The bus was transporting adults. There were no students involved in the crash.

Members of the Dane County Narcotics Task Force seized more than $2700, a handgun magazine, ammunition, 228.2 grams of methamphetamine, 6.9 grams cocaine powder, drug packaging, and other evidence, at an Oregon home Monday morning.
 
Arrested at the scene was Martel D. Braxton, age 33.  Braxton has been the subject of an ongoing drug investigation.  He was tentatively charged with several crimes including delivery of cocaine, maintaining a drug trafficking place, possession with intent methamphetamine, possession with intent cocaine, and possession with intent THC.
 
A 36-year-old woman was also arrested at the scene and tentatively charged with delivery of cocaine.

Early this morning, individuals dressed in all black, were seen around 4:00am checking car doors in the parking lot of the Radisson Hotel at 517 Grand Canyon Dr and were reported to be associated with a silver SUV. 

Officers arrived to find a silver 2012 Dodge Journey stuck in a snow bank with one person still inside the driver’s seat.  An investigation revealed the Dodge Journey was previously stolen overnight from the 1800 block of Prairie Rd.  The 16-year-old driver was taken into custody and tentatively charged with operating a vehicle without owner consent.  He was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center while the Dodge Journey was returned to the owner.

On 2-5-21, at approximately 9:36 pm, an employee of the Farm and Fleet was still in the business after the store had closed. While the employee was in an office, the employee saw on the security system, a male inside the store. The employee called police, and MPD Officers arrived on scene, and also utilized a MPD K9 Officer and a MPD Drone Officer as well. MPD officers checked the building and it was determined that the suspect was no longer in the store. Unknown at this time if any items were taken.

Victim: Missing: Cyril M Hetsko. Male/White, 5-25-1942, 6'00, about 225 pounds, Grey Hair,  Hazel Eyes.
Details: The Madison Police Department was contacted shortly after midnight, on 2-6-21, reference a family member they have not seen since Wednesday, February 3rd, at approximately 4:30 pm. The missing family member is Cyril A Hetsko, born in 1942. He drives a 2016 Jeep Patriot with Wisconsin plate, 194-UNN. Family is concerned as he has been suffering from Dementia, and does not have friends or family anywhere in the area. If he is located, please contact Dance County Dispatch Center at 255-2345, or call 911. A Silver Alert has also been issued for Hetsko.

The victim was walking across the parking lot when a suspect jumped out of a previously reported stolen vehicle (21-045094) and ripped a purse from the victim's left hand, causing injury. The suspect then re-entered the stolen vehicle and fled.

Early this morning, a Park Meadow Dr homeowner woke up in bed and saw a person standing outside his bedroom door wearing a headlamp.  The unidentifed suspect quickly fled back out through the garage door.  The victim indicated they may have left their garage door open overnight.  Nothing was reported to be taken.

MPD has a few property crime prevention tips:
 
  • LOCK IT
    • Ensure your car doors and all doors to your residence are kept locked.
  • REMOVE IT
    • Removing valuables from your car is better than hiding them.  This includes garage door openers and spare keys.
  • LIGHT IT
    • Leave exterior residence lights on at night or utilize motion detecting lights.
  • CLOSE IT
    • Keep your garage door closed and double-check it is closed at night.
  • HIDE IT
    • Keep valuables in your garage, car, and home out of sight.
  • REPORT IT
    • Report all criminal and suspicious activity immediately.
      • Emergency: 911
      • Non-Emergency: 608-255-2345
      • Crime Stoppers: p3tips.com or 266-6014

Last night, a car driven by a 39-year-old man, traveled at a very low rate of speed, weaved in and out of traffic and eventually crashed into a snow bank in the 6800 block of Schroeder Rd.

After an investigation, officers tentatively charged Edwin Reyes with his 6th offense of drunken driving.  He was booked into the Dane County Jail with a tentative operating while intoxicated charge and given multiple traffic citations.

This morning, a 62-year-old woman was knocked over in the parking lot of Hy-Vee at 3801 E Washington Ave.  The victim was pushing her cart when suspects jumped out of a recently stolen 2017 red Jeep Cherokee (21-045556), knocked her over, and stole her purse.  They fled the area in the stolen SUV.  Investigation continuing.

Yesterday afternoon, officers were sent to check on a 28-year-old woman who had a large knife, walking outside towards the lake on Waunona Woods Ct, stating she was going to stab someone.  Officers were able to contact the woman from a distance in attempt to de-escalate her behavior.

During the dialogue in 0-degree weather, the woman made many references that she wanted police to come shoot her.  After about 20 minutes of various dialog and de-escalation techniques, officers were able to convince the woman to drop what later was determined to be a 12” metal knife sharper, and safely took her into custody.  The woman was taken to a local hospital for a mental health evaluation.

The MPD is investigating a recent string of stolen cars.  8 vehicles were stolen yesterday while warming up unattended in the extremely cold weather.  This morning, another car was reported stolen warming up:
 
  • 02/07/21 – 7:42AM - 4600 block Hayes Rd (21-045017) 2017 Subaru Impreza
  • 02/07/21 – 8:20AM - 3300 block Clove Dr (21-045033) 2019 maroon Kia Sorento
  • 02/07/21 – 9:44AM - 800 block Jana Ln (21-045094) 2019 gray Nissan Rogue (used in a robbery yesterday, 21-045165)
  • 02/07/21 – 11:58AM - 2722 E Washington Av (21-045205) 2017 black Toyota Rav 4
  • 02/07/21 – 1:29PM – 4921 Commercial Ave (21-045306) 2012 black Buick LaCrosse
  • 02/07/21 – 5:31PM – 2900 block Maple Grove Rd (21-045556) 2017 red Jeep Cherokee (used in a robbery today, 21-046246)
  • 02/07/21 – 6:37PM – 1000 block Engelhart Dr (21-045624) 2014 silver VW Jetta
  • 02/07/21 – 7:12PM – 3300 block Portage Rd (21-045656) 2016 blue Honda Civic
  • 02/08/21 – 7:31AM – 4300 Crawford Dr (21-046056) 2015 black Mercedes C300
 
Some of these stolen vehicles have already been found abandoned, while others have been reported to be involved in recent robberies in store parking lots, one yesterday targeting an 86-year-old woman (21-045165) and another today targeting a 62-year-old woman (21-046246).
 
Last year the MPD received 744 stolen auto reports.  Of that 744 stolen autos, 345 of them had keys in them or readily accessible and 115 of them were running at the time.  The 744 stolen autos represented a 46.9% increase from 2019.
 
Please do not leave your cars unattended while warming up, even if it’s just for a few seconds.

At 8:52 PM Madison officers were dispatched to a report of shots being fired in the 3000 block of Webb Ave. on Madison's east side.  While officers were on scene a 35 year old African American male showed up at a local hospital with a non-life threatening gunshot wound as a result of this incident.  On scene officers located fired casings in the area.  The Madison Police Department's Violent Crime Unit is in contact with the victim and is leading the investigation at this time.  At this time no suspect is in custody.  Our agency's investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Yesterday evening, a 42-year-old man pulled a knife on an employee at Woodman’s at 711 S Gammon Rd.  Juan E. Fraire Garcia was concealing merchandise when a loss prevention officer approached him.  Fraire Garcia made slashing motions with a folding knife and fled on foot.  Responding officers were able to locate Fraire Garcia running behind a nearby building, ordered him to drop the knife, and safely took him into custody.  Juan E. Fraire Garcia was booked into the Dane County Jail with tentative charges of disorderly conduct, retail theft, and four counts of bail jumping.

The Madison community has experienced recent strong-armed robberies, car crashes, and other reckless driving behavior that has been associated with a sudden increase of stolen cars. 
 
Because of these strong-armed robberies, and other associated crimes, we redirected resources yesterday to this problem.  Multiple officers and detectives conducted follow-up investigations, provided extra patrols in neighborhoods, and focused their efforts on Madison area store parking lots.
 
Our focused efforts resulted in:
  • 3 Recovered Stolen Cars
  • 5 Arrests
  • Multiple drugs recovered
  • 4 Guns Removed from our Streets 
“Crime prevention is a joint effort, so please continue to lock your cars and do not leave them running unattended, even if it’s just for a few minutes.  We will continue our efforts as needed to address this problem as we are committed to make Madison a safer place for us all.” – Chief Barnes
 
Please see the attached video message to the community from Chief Barnes.

Yesterday, a 67-year-old woman was leaving the Princeton Club on Watts Rd when someone pulled her purse off her shoulder in the parking lot. 

The victim was about to put her backpack and purse into her car when a silver Honda pulled up along side of her and a passenger quickly hopped out of the car and slipped her purse off her shoulder.

The victim was not hurt and described the suspect as 15-19 years old, wearing a dark, light-weight jacket with a white shirt underneath.

The woman was able to cancel her credit cards, but unfortunately not before there was an unauthorized transaction at a local store.  The 2019 silver Honda CRV is a recently stolen car out of Oregon, WI.  Investigation is continuing.

Address: E Washington Ave and N Fourth St
Details:
Early this morning, a 67-year-old man was driving on E. Washington Ave when his car was struck by a previously stolen white Kia Forte.

Just prior to the crash, another person saw the white Kia Forte racing a dark-colored SUV going around 100mph on E. Washington Ave.  The driver of the Kia lost control, hitting the victim’s car (no reported injuries) near N Fourth St. 

The suspect quickly abandoned the car and fled the scene in the waiting dark-colored SUV.  Investigation continuing.

Last night there was a verbal disturbance inside Kelly’s Market at 33 Junction Ct where a handgun was reported to be displayed.  A store employee told police a 6-foot man with a skinny build, early 20’s, wearing a gray or black jacket with Air Force One shoes, was arguing with another person inside the store.  When the suspect was asked to leave, he stated “I got a strap” and lifted his shirt to display a handgun in a holster.  The man made verbal threats as he left the store on foot.  Investigation continuing.

At around 6:00PM tonight, an unsecured running vehicle was stolen from the 1900 block of Winnebago St. while the driver was inside of a food establishment waiting for food. Inside the vehicle at the time was the driver's young child. Upon returning and finding the vehicle gone, the driver flagged down a passer-by and advised him that his car was just taken with his child inside. Police were then called.

The passer-by began to check the neighborhood on his own while police were responding to the area; and found the vehicle minutes later near Winnebago St. at Linden Ave. Thankfully, the child was safe and sound inside, and reunited with parents. No suspects have been identified at this time, and the investigation is ongoing.

As a general public safety reminder: Theft of autos occur daily, and most commonly the targeted vehicles are those that are running and left unattended. This occurs both in residential areas as well as commercial parking lots. Please do not leave your vehicles unattended and unlocked, even while warming in cold weather.

The victim checks into a hotel on Crossroads Dr. with a female friend.  Sometime later, two men burst into the room and rob the victim of approximately $200.  During the robbery, a chemical irritant, possibly OC, is sprayed in the room.  The victim felt the female may have aided in the robbery by letting the two suspects into the room.  The victim was unable to provide a name for his female friend and only vague descriptions of the two, male suspects.  The investigation in on-going at this time.

A 33-year-old woman was at Sky Zone Trampoline Park with her young children Saturday night, when an argument broke out between her and another 31-year-old woman.  The two women are known to each other.  The 33-year-old woman was pepper sprayed and received multiple scratches on her face, requiring stitches.  The 31-year-old woman was gone upon police arrival.  Investigation continuing.

Members of the Dane County Narcotics Task Force seized 8.1 grams of cocaine base, 3.7 grams of THC,  drug packaging, and other evidence, in a hotel room on E Springs Dr last week.
 
Arrested at the scene was Christopher T Jenkins, age 41.  Jenkins has been the subject of an ongoing drug investigation.  He was tentatively charged with several crimes including delivery of cocaine, delivery of heroin (3 counts) and possession with intent cocaine.

Last night, a 19-year-old and his friend sold an Xbox online and arranged to meet the buyer in the parking lot in the 7600 block of Mineral Point Rd.  The buyer pulled out a handgun and pointed it at the victims.  The suspect took the xBox, two cell phones, and the 19-year-old’s 2009 black Honda Civic.  The victims called 911 from a nearby Kwik Trip and described the suspect as a black male, approximately 25-30 years old, 5’05”, 130lbs, with an olive green jacket and black stocking hat.  Investigation continues.

Around 4:30pm on Saturday, a 40-year-old woman was eating in the West Towne Mall Food Court when a 16-year-old quickly grabbed her purse off the table and fled into a waiting stolen blue Mitsubishi Outlander. 

Shortly after this incident, the juvenile stole another car and crashed into a snowbank downtown and ran from police.  He was apprehended after a foot chase and later taken to the Juvenile Reception Center on multiple charges, including this theft.  He was found to be wearing a court ordered GPS monitoring device. See case 2021-053162 for more details.

Saturday evening, a silver 2011 Nissan Rogue was taken while left unlocked and running in front of a restaurant on Willy St. 

The victim, who was picking up a food order, called 911 and an officer quickly spotted the car heading onto John Nolen Dr along with another recently stolen car.  The Nissan Rogue hit two other vehicles before it finally crashed into a snowbank at North Shore Dr.  The occupants quickly fled the crash scene while officers chased on foot. 

After a successful dragnet, patrol officers apprehended two juveniles.  One juvenile was found to be wearing a court ordered GPS monitoring device. 

After an investigation, the 16- and 14-year-old boys were taken to the Juvenile Reception Center and tentatively charged with operating a motor vehicle without owner consent, resisting/obstructing, and a theft charge for the 16-year-old regarding an earlier incident at West Towne Mall Food Court (2021-053092).  The juveniles are also suspects in another recent stolen auto case.

Friday afternoon, a woman was in a store parking lot on S Whitney Way when her wallet was stolen after she was approached and grabbed by a suspect.  The 32-year-old victim told police a younger black male, approximately 5’07” with a medium build, no facial hair, wearing a black stocking hat and a black jacket jumped out of a SUV and said, “Give me your wallet.  Give me your phone.”  As the suspect grabbed her, she kicked and hit him, but he was able to flee with her wallet and phone back into a recently stolen black Jeep Cherokee.  Investigation continuing.

Members of the Dane County Narcotics Task Force seized $1500, 7.7 grams of cocaine base, 5.3 grams of heroin, drug packaging, and other evidence at a Middleton home last week.
 
Arrested at the scene was Maurice L Bryant, age 29.  Bryant has been the subject of an ongoing drug investigation.  He was tentatively charged with several crimes including delivery of fentanyl, delivery of heroin (2 counts), delivery of cocaine (2 counts), possession with intent cocaine, possession with intent heroin, and felony bail jumping.

Early Friday morning around 3:00am, two men, ages 21 and 22, were robbed at gunpoint while walking in the 500 block of W Johnson St.  The victims were walking to their residence on University Ave when a man approached them from behind and yelled, “Give me everything you have!”  The suspect pointed a handgun at them as they emptied their pockets.  He stole their keys, cell phones, wallets, and a backpack.  The victims described the suspect as a black man in his late 20’s, 5”08”, wearing a gray hoodie.  Investigation continuing.

Suspect:
Male Black, 20 years old
Male Black, 22 years old
Details: The Madison Police Department responded to the 900 Block of South Park St for a weapon's violation shortly after 12:40PM.  The 19 year old victim told Officers that two known subjects followed her in a vehicle through various parts of the City of Madison and that both were armed with handguns.  One of the suspects exited his vehicle and pointed a handgun at the victim and attempted to take her vehicle.  Both suspects fled after the victim advised them that she called the Police.  Officers are attempting to locate the two suspects.

Arrested: Male Black, 36 years old, Madison, WI
Details: Madison Police responded to the Subway on N Sherman Ave for an armed robbery. A male black suspect produced a gun in the store and removed the cash register. Officers located a 36 year old black male in the area running with a cash register in hand. He was arrested for a variety of charges related to this incident.

This morning, officers were dispatched to the 1700 block of Blossom Lane for a 52-year-old man who was found deceased in his residence.  An autopsy is scheduled and it will be up to the Dane County Medical Examiner to determine the cause and manner of death.  The investigation is continuing.

Since January 1st, over 100 vehicles have been stolen in our city, most of which are running unattended warming up in the cold weather. Some of these auto thefts are tied to recent strong-armed robberies, reckless-high-speed driving, and car crashes.
 
Our focused efforts yesterday resulted in recovering 4 stolen cars and 3 additional arrests, some of which are related to previous stolen auto activity.
 
Crime prevention is everyone’s responsibility, and it starts with all of us in the community including working with those partners in our local justice system. Many partnerships and efforts through our neighborhood officers, community policing teams, gang unit, and our community outreach units focus on building and strengthening relationships, especially with our youth.
 
"I am told warmer weather is approaching, but please continue to lock your cars and do not leave them running unattended, even if it’s just for a few minutes. We will continue our focused efforts as needed to address this problem as we are committed to make Madison a safer place for us all." - Chief Shon Barnes

Please see the attached video message to the community from Chief Barnes.

Yesterday morning, a 5-year-old was found wandering alone outside an apartment complex in the 1100 block of Moorland Rd.  A passerby brought the child to the front apartment office to wait for police assistance. 

As the 5-year-old waited with police, officers checked the nearby area for any signs of the child’s guardians.  Unfortunatley, the 5-year-old could not speak as officers later learned he is autistic.  A detective brought a car-seat in order to transport the child back to the South District where he was given snacks and toys while waiting for everything to get sorted out.

About an hour later, the 5-year-old was reuinted with a guardian.  Police were told a babysitter had fallen asleep and the child was able to leave the apartment on his own.  He was found wearing boots and a winter jacket.  Child Protective Services was notified and the child was reuinted with a guardian.  We are appreciative of the South Side resident who sensed the child needed help.

On 2-20-21, at approximately 2:50 a.m., multiple callers called about hearing what sounded like gunshots in the Eastwood Drive area.  Madison Police Officers arrived on scene, and did locate a single shell casing on Eastwood Dr near Amoth Ct. At this time, no property damage has been located, and there were no reported injuries at this time.

Arrested: Dmitry Malin, age 45, was booked into the Dane County Jail Sunday morning on tentative charges of neglecting a child and operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated with a passenger under 16 years old.
Address: N Gammon Rd at Fiskdale Cir
Details:
An intoxicated driver struck two parked Middleton police cars near N Gammon Rd at Fiskdale Circle early Sunday morning. 

Two Middleton PD officers were on a separate OWI investigation, when one of their squads was hit by a car traveling southbound, which pushed the squad  into a second marked police vehicle. 

Prior to the crash, both squads were parked on the side of the road with their emergency lights activated.  Vehicles involved sustained damage and one person was taken to a local hospital for an evaluation. 

Madison Police officers investigated the crash and arrested a 45-year-old man on multiple charges to include operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated with a passenger under 16 years old. (A 10-year-old child was in the intoxicated driver's vehicle at the time of the crash.)

The Madison Police Department responded to the 3900 Block of East Washington Ave for a weapon's violation shortly after 5:10 pm.  The victim told officers that they were involved in a disturbance that occurred with the suspect.  The victim stated that during the disturbance the suspect displayed a firearm.  The suspect fled the scene prior to officers arriving on scene. The investigation is still ongoing.

This afternoon, a 29-year-old man was dropped off in front of the UW Health Union Corners Clinic at 2402 Winnebago St with a life-threatening gunshot wound.  Life-saving efforts were attempted and the victim was subsequently transported by EMS to a local hospital where he later succumbed to his injuries.

During the preliminary investigation, officers and detectives from MPD’s Violent Crime Unit determined this incident occurred in the City of Sun Prairie.  The Madison Police Department will continue to assist Sun Prairie PD with this active and on-going homicide investigation.

If anyone has information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com

Address: E Washington Ave and N Dickinson St
Details:
Yesterday afternoon, a MPD detective spotted a wanted person walking along East Washington Avenue with another individual.  Patrol officers converged into the area to assist in contacting the two people.  One person complied with officers and was safely taken into custody as another took off running.

Kory L. Washington, age 17, was taken into custody after a foot pursuit.  Washington was booked into the Dane County Jail on new charges of resisting officers and also charges related to previous incidents:
  • ID Theft (21-12428)
  • Operating Motor Vehicle Without Owner Consent (21-45366)
  • 2nd-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety (21-45366) 
JaQuann L. Williams, age 18, complied with officers at the scene as he was taken into custody and later taken to the Dane County Jail on charges of felony bail jumping and felony possession of a firearm.  A loaded handgun was found on his person.

Yesterday afternoon, officers were sent to a disturbance, with mention of a firearm, in a parking lot on Waunona Woods Court.  As officers were investigating, a gray Toyota Highlander fled the area at a high rate of speed.
 
Officers from MPD’s Central District Community Policing Team spotted the SUV on Fish Hatchery and subsequently located it unoccupied on High Ridge Trail.  A male, later identified as Jaylen E. Hayes, age 20, attempted to get into the parked SUV, but quickly ran after seeing officers approach him.
 
The foot pursuit lasted nearly a mile through heavy snow, creeks, and the nearby golf course.  The dragnet was successful after Hayes surrendered to police in the 2300 block of Traceway Dr.
 
Hayes was taken into custody and taken to the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of resisting and felony bail jumping.  He was found to have over $6,000 in cash on his person.
 
This investigation and subsequent arrest was a joint effort by Patrol officers, Community Policing Teams, Neighborhood Officers, K-9 Units, and officers from Fitchburg Police Department.

This morning, the MPD's Special Victims Unit (SVU) arrested a 20-year-old Madison man for distribution of child pornography.

MPD SWAT, West District Community Policing Team, and SVU executed a search warrant on Lucas L. Hensen's home in the 900 block of N High Point Rd.

Henson was booked into the Dane County Jail on six counts of sexual exploitation of a child as well as felony bail jumping.

Suspect:
Suspect 1 described as a black male, 16-17 years old, wearing a gray hoodie and jeans.
Suspect 2 described as a black male, 16-17 years old, wearing an orange shirt and brown jeans.
Details:
MPD was dispatched to an armed robbery in the 200 block of S. High Point Rd. The victim had arranged to sell their iPhone X via Facebook Marketplace today. When the suspects arrived they took the phone without payment, producing a handgun during the incident. The suspects fled in a green sedan that was parked in the 200 block of S. High Point Rd. No injuries to anyone involved.

If anyone has information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com

The Madison Police Department is investigating an officer involved critical incident that occurred last night in the parking lot of Days Inn & Suites at 4402 E Broadway Service Rd.  No Madison Police officers were involved in this incident and the MPD has been asked by the Wisconsin Department of Justice (DOJ)  Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI) to lead this investigation. 
 
Last night, at approximately 10:20pm, as part of an ongoing multi-jurisdictional investigation, DCI agents attempted to apprehend a wanted subject in a vehicle in the parking lot of a hotel.  During the attempt to take the subject into custody, a DCI agent fired a round.  No one was struck by the gunfire.  The subject was taken into custody after an attempt to flee. 
 
The subject was transported to a local hospital for minor injuries sustained during the incident. 
 
The law enforcement officer was not injured, and no other individuals were injured as a result of the gunfire. 
 
The MPD was asked by the DCI to lead this investigation and we are being assisted by other agencies.  All involved law enforcement are fully cooperating with MPD during this investigation. 
 
The MPD is continuing to review evidence and determine the facts of this incident and will turn over investigative reports to the Dane County District Attorney when the investigation concludes.
 
The investigation is ongoing and further information will be released when it becomes available.

Last night, multiple people called 911 for a person acting out of control, slamming doors, damaging hallway mailboxes, throwing a fire extinguisher, yelling racial slurs, banging on shared walls, and more at an apartment complex in the 800 block of S Gammon Rd. 

When officers contacted the 32-year-old man, he began to resist and squared up to fight officers.  An electronic control device was used to get him under control.  Robert M. Bolz was arrested for criminal damage to property, three counts of disorderly conduct, two counts of felony bail jumping, seven counts of misdemeanor bail jumping, and resisting.

MPD Officers sent to the 1400 Block of Pleasure Dr for a vehicle that was stuck in a snow bank.  Officers arrive to find the driver Ellen C. Oswald, age 55, outside of the vehicle attempting to it dig out of the snow bank while not wearing shoes or socks.  The vehicle was still in gear and the tires were still spinning. 
 
After a medical clearance Oswald was tentatively arrested on the following charges:
Operating While Intoxicated 8th Offense
Operating While Revoked
Bail Jumping
Warrant for 7th Offense OMVWI
Warrant for Bail Jumping

On Sunday, February 28th, Madison Police were dispatched reference an armed robbery that occurred in the 1100 block of Moorland Rd., at approximately 2 AM.  The victim states that he stepped out of his residence and was contacted by three unknown subjects requesting to use his cigarette lighter.

Once the victim pulled items from his pockets, one of the suspects displayed a handgun and then demanded all of the victims cash.  The suspects fled on foot from the scene.

Madison Police asks that anyone with information on this incident, please contact Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014.

Suspect: Black Male, 6'01" - 6'02" wearing all black, gator style facemask
Details: Madison Police were called to the Kwik Trip Gas Station at 7717 Mineral Point Road just before 12:30PM for an automobile theft that had just occurred and that the vehicle owner had been run over by the vehicle.  Officers made contact with the 34 year old victim who stated she was filling up her vehicle's tires with air when the suspect entered her running vehicle. She attempted to get him out from the passenger side door but the suspect put the car in reverse and ran over her right leg/thigh. The victim is 20 weeks pregnant and was transported for soft tissue injuries to her leg.  The suspect fled with the vehicle. Officers are trying to get video footage from Kwik Trip.

Officers responded to USH 12 EB/Rimrock Road for a three car crash. One of the vehicles involved was reported as stolen after the incident occured. This vehicle struck one vehicle, then drifted to the left lane, and struck another before coming to a rest at the median. Two subjects fled from the scene.

MPD K9 Officers responded to do a track. 

Contact was made with the female passenger that had initially fled, and stated she had just met the male driver on Park Street before the crash.

Minor injuries to those on scene.

The driver is still at large. The investigation is still ongoing.

Madison Police Officers were originally dispatched to a damage to property for a bullet that had damaged a window. Officers made contact with the caller, who stated that a bullet had damaged a window and screen. Officers located an intact fired projectile between the outside window pane glass and inside window pane glass. It is unknown when the damage occurred, but most likely in the last day or two while residents were home. No injuries were reported. No other damage to the outside of the building was located. There were no reports of shots fired incidents in the area.

Madison Police Officers and Madison Fire & EMS were dispatched to the intersection of E Washington Ave and N Ingersoll St to check on an unconscious driver slumped over the steering wheel.

The driver, Marcel Martino, was transported to a local hospital.

After an investigation, officers tentatively charged Marcel Martino with his 5th offense of operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated, operating while revoked, failure to install ignition interlock device and possession of open intoxicants. Marcel Martino was booked into the Dane County Jail with the tentative charges.

Madison Police Officers responded to the 8800 block of Timber Wolf Trail for a report of a missing vehicle. The 2016 Hyundai Elantra, red in color, had been parked on the street, and the keys for the vehicle were accounted for.

A short time later, the stolen vehicle was associated with a theft from auto at the Kwik Trip at 3153 Maple Grove Drive. Subject(s) associated with the stolen auto took the driver’s purse that had been inside the vehicle while the driver was pumping gas. Victim did not see the theft.

No suspect information at this time. Investigation is ongoing.

Last night, officers were sent to a disturbance at Hilldale Mall where two women threatened Macy’s employees.  Before officers arrived, the women fled in a previously stolen car, but officers were quickly able to locate the vehicle. 

Twanna N. Johnson, age 31, was tentatively charged with operating a motor vehicle without owner consent, possession of drug paraphernalia, and an outstanding warrant for theft.
 
Molly M Williams, age 30, was tentatively charged with disorderly conduct and two counts of felony bail jumping.
 
The white 2015 Chrysler 200 was previously reported stolen on February 21st and returned to owner. (2021-070872)

This morning, a man entered the Associated Bank at 4407 Cottage Grove Road and demanded money from the teller.  No weapon was observed and the suspect left with an undisclosed amount of cash.  The investigation is ongoing. 
 
The suspect is described as a white man with blue eyes, brown jacket, blue jeans, and a white cloth over his head and lower part of his face.
 
If you have any information regarding this bank robbery, submit a tip to Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

This morning, multiple people called 911 to report gunshots and a person running with a handgun in the 1700 block of Lake Point Drive.  Officers quickly arrived and setup a perimeter to search for the suspect.  Officers checked the area and located approximately 10 bullet casings near the 1600 block of Lake Point Drive.  No reported injuries or property damage.  Suspect has not been located.  Investigation continues.
 
Witnesses describe the suspect as a tall black man around 20-years-old with longer hair, faded jeans, and a baggy red hooded sweatshirt. 
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

A 93-year-old man received a phone call last Friday from someone claiming they were from the FBI.  The caller stated the victim's social security number would be deactivated and all his credit cards and bank accounts would be frozen.  The law enforcement impersonator told the victim to withdraw $88,000 via cashier’s check and deposit the money into an account, providing the victim with an account number.  The victim did not transfer any funds.
 
On Monday, the 93-year-old man received another call from someone claiming to be a police officer with the Madison Police Department stating the victim had committed fraud and that he would be arrested. 
 
These types of calls are scams as people are impersonating the authorities and conjuring up different schemes to fool people into giving them money. 

Report these type of activities to authorities.  Here are some tips and advice from the Federal Trade Commission on these types of scams:
 
https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/blog/2015/07/scammers-impersonate-police

Around 11:40 PM MPD officers were dispatched to a report of shots being fired and an unknown vehicle fleeing in the 2900 block of Turbot Dr. on the city's southside.  When officers arrived they located fired casings in the driveway of a residence.  At this time no injuries have been reported and no damage was located.  The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Shortly after 4:00 AM MPD officers were dispatched to the 5900 block of Schroeder Rd. for reports of shots being fired.  Our agency received multiple calls regarding this incident.  While the number of shots heard varies, three casings were recovered in the area.  At this time no damage or injuries have been report.  MPD's investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Early Sunday morning, the Central District Community Policing Team located a previously stolen white Chrysler 300 in the parking lot of a hotel on Grand Canyon Dr. 

After an investigation, Alwayne S. Jones, age 24, was booked into the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of operating a motor vehicle without owner consent, possession with intent to deliver THC, and felony bail jumping.

Yesterday afternoon,  officers were sent to a disturbance in the parking lot of Little Caesars Pizza at 2833 E Washington Ave for a person armed with a baseball bat screaming at people. 

The 19-year-old man fled nearby on Farwell, running through yards.  Officers were able to locate Bryan D. Russell and take him into custody. 

After an investigation, Russell was booked into the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of resisting, disorderly conduct while armed, two counts of receiving stolen property, and two counts of bail jumping.

Early this morning, a Maple View Dr couple woke up to a loud noise coming from their garage.  When they went to see what all the commotion was about, they noticed their Toyota Rav4 and Toyota Camry were missing.  They also discovered major damage to their garage door and frame likely caused by a car as the suspects fled the scene.
 
A short time later, an officer spotted the Rav4 driving recklessly on McCormick Ave on the north side of Madison.  The stolen car pulled into a nearby parking lot, and as the officer investigated, the Rav4 took off again at a high rate of speed.  The officer soon discovered the other stolen car, the Toyota Camry, unoccupied in the parking lot. 
 
Since her purse is still in the stolen dark blue 2019 Toyota Rav4, the victim canceled her credit cards.

There have been numerous theft from autos reported to the Madison Police Department from overnight:

2021-081769 Multiple cars were reported to be rummaged through overnight on Crawling Stone Cir. 

2021-081777 A victim reported their car in an underground parking lot in the 1000 block of N Highpoint Rd had the window smashed out with a purse stolen. The purse was in plain view.

2021-081958 Windows were reported to be smashed on a car at another location on the 1000 block of N Highpoint Rd.  Unknown what was taken. 

You can help prevent property crime.
  • Ensure your car doors and all doors to your residence are kept locked.
  • Leave exterior residence lights on at night or utilize motion detecting lights.
  • Keep valuables in your garage, car, and home out of sight.
  • Removing valuables from your car is better than hiding them.  This includes garage door openers and spare keys.
  • Keep your garage door closed and double-check it is closed at night.
  • Report all criminal and suspicious activity immediately.

Last Friday, a 67-year-old east side resident reported that she fell victim to a scam in early February.  The woman told police a message popped up on her husband’s computer telling him to call tech support and ended up writing a check for $999 and sending it to a tech company, later determined to be a scam.  Last week, the couple started to receive phone calls telling them to spend $3,000 for computer security software, also a scam.
 
Tech support scammers want you to believe you have a serious problem with your computer, like a virus. They want you to pay for tech support services you don't need, to fix a problem that doesn’t exist. They often ask you to pay by wiring money, putting money on a gift card, prepaid card or cash reload card, or using a money transfer app because they know those types of payments can be hard to reverse.
 
Please visit the Federal Trade Commission Consumer Information website for more details on this particular scam and steps you can take to protect yourself:
 
https://www.consumer.ftc.gov/articles/how-spot-avoid-and-report-tech-support-scams

Shortly after 4:00PM MPD responded to the 200 block of N. Gammon Rd for shots fired.  Witnesses reported seeing a black and silver sedan fleeing the area after the shots were fired. Officers located 4 casings in the roadway. At this point no property damage or injured persons have been located.

MPD was dispatched to an armed robbery that occurred in the area of Starflower Dr./Aster Ln. Two vehicles met for a drug transaction. Both the victim and the suspect knew each other. A 21-year-old suspect robbed the 19-year-old victim of his money and stole his vehicle. MPD's Violent Crime Unit is involved in the investigation. This is an on-going investigation.

This morning, at the Shell gas station, an occupant of a recently stolen car shot multiple rounds at a vehicle that was at the gas pumps.  No one was injured, but one of the fired bullets struck a window near the front entrance of the South Park Street gas station.  Shortly after the shooting, the two cars fled from the area.
 
Officers later located the car that was shot at and its occupants who did not sustain any injuries.
 
Preliminary investigation reveals this appears to be a targeted act of gun violence with both parties known to each other.  The investigation continues with the assistance from MPD’s Violent Crime Unit.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

The Dane County Narcotics Task Force arrested a 54-year-old Madison man yesterday near his home in the 6800 block of Park Ridge Dr.  Bruce D. Parker has been the subject of an ongoing drug investigation.
 
More than 13 grams of heroin, digital scales, drug packaging, and other drug paraphernalia were located and seized at his residence.  Parker is tentatively being charged with maintaining a drug trafficking place, possession with intent to deliver heroin, possession of drug paraphernalia, and three counts of delivery of heroin.

MPD located and arrested Xavier J. Bandera, age 23, and booked him into the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of attempted first degree intentional homicide.
 
This investigation involved multiple officers and detectives from MPD’s Violent Crime Unit, Criminal Intelligence Section, Dane County Narcotics Task Force, Community Policing Teams, and patrol officers and detectives from multiple police districts.  The victim remains hospitalized during this time.

During the late night hours of March 9th, the person in this photo parked a white car on Forward Dr and then walked into nearby parking lot areas of Exact Sciences and stole items from unlocked vehicles.  If you can help identify, please call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

(2021-092767) Yesterday, a 26-year-old man told officers that a person claiming to be a MPD detective told the victim to pay money or he would subsequently issue an arrest warrant.  After the victim contacted MPD to verify, this was quickly determined to be a scam.
 
(2021-093183) Also yesterday, a 27-year-old man told officers he was contacted by “MPD Officer Rick Foster”, with caller-ID displaying MPD North District's main number.  The victim was asked to send money through a money app and later confirmed with MPD this was a scam and nobody by the name of Rick Foster is employed with MPD. 
 
(2021-0900847) On March 1st, a 93-year-old man received another call from someone claiming to be a police officer with the Madison Police Department stating the victim had committed fraud and that he would be arrested. 
 
These types of calls are scams as people are impersonating the authorities and conjuring up different schemes to fool people into giving them money. 

Report these type of activities to authorities.  Here are some tips and advice from the Federal Trade Commission on these types of scams:

Last evening, a homeowner in the 1600 block of Mendota St discovered bullet damage to her kitchen window.  The north side resident told police she was awoken the night before between 1:30am and 2:00am when she heard a loud crash in the house.  She later discovered a bullet had traveled through the kitchen window and lodged itself in a can of food in the pantry. 
 
A neighbor told the investigating officer they heard about 10-15 gunshots around the same time frame, possibly originating from the 1600 block of N Stoughton Rd.  There were no other callers or reported injuries.  Officers canvassed the area and the investigation continues.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

This evening, at 7:24pm, MPD officers were outside a men’s shelter for an unrelated medical call when they heard gunshots come from inside the building at 200 N First St.  Officers entered the building and encountered two people, and during the contact, an officer discharged their weapon.  Preliminary investigation reveals that one of the persons encountered had previously sustained a gunshot wound before officers entered the building. 
 
This individual was transported to a local hospital for treatment.  The second person is in police custody.  MPD is not looking for any additional suspects at this time. This remains an active and ongoing investigation. 
 
In accordance with State Law, MPD requested that an outside agency conduct the initial investigation into the officer who discharged their weapon. The Wisconsin Department of Justice’s Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI) responded and is responsible for investigating.

The Dane County Narcotics Task Force recently led a drug investigation involving a 43-year-old Madison man.  James Walker has been the subject of an ongoing drug investigation and has been tentatively charged with 3 counts of delivery of cocaine.  Walker was arrested last week in Dodge County for 4th offense OWI and is currently at the Dane County Jail reference the drug charges.

Yesterday, members of MPD’s Violent Crime Unit, Gang Unit, SWAT, and other personnel took Devion L Thomas, age 23, into custody in the 2500 block of Winnebago Street around 11am.  A gun was also recovered.

Thomas was booked into the Dane County Jail and tentatively charged with 1st Degree Attempted Homicide stemming from an incident in 2020.

Yesterday afternoon, a 70-year-old woman was shoved and had her purse stolen as she was walking into Walmart on Watts Rd.  The suspect quickly fled in a previously stolen car and the victim did not sustain any injuries.  This vehicle was reported to be involved in another incident about an hour later.  Officers later located the car and took multiple suspects into custody.
 
After an investigation, Marcus L. Brinkley, age 18, was arrested regarding this incident and taken to the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of strong armed robbery, bail jumping, and operating a motor vehicle without owner consent (passenger)

Last evening, a 42-year-old woman was in the parking lot of Target at 750 Hilldale Way when a teenager approached her car and reached in and stole her backpack.  The suspect then fled into a waiting previously stolen car. 
 
Officers spotted the blue Toyota driving at a high rate of speed, disregarding traffic signals.  Officers from multiple jurisdictions attempted to pull over the car, however the vehicle evaded officers and eventually crashed near Pheasant Ridge Trail. 
 
The occupants fled on foot and were taken into custody by officers after found hiding in an apartment in the 2600 block of Pheasant Ridge Trail.  Stolen items from a previous robbery and this theft were recovered in the stolen vehicle.
 
4 people were taken into custody and tentatively charged with multiple offenses:
 
  • A 12-year-old boy was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center on a tentative charge of operating a motor vehicle without owner consent (passenger) 
  • A 15-year-old boy was also taken to the Juvenile Reception Center on operating a motor vehicle without owner consent (passenger) 
  • Marcus L. Brinkley, age 18, was taken to the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of strong armed robbery, bail jumping, and operating a motor vehicle without owner consent (passenger) 
  • Curtis L. White, age 17, was taken to the Dane County Jail on tentative charges of operating a motor vehicle without owner consent, fleeing/eluding, and felony bail jumping.

After an investigation, Peterson was taken into custody this morning in the 1400 block of Wayridge Dr and has been booked into the Dane County Jail on a tentative charge of threats to law enforcement.

Catalytic converter thefts continue in the Madison area with thieves often targeting Toyota Prius’s. Tuesday morning, a resident in the 3000 block of Atwood Ave woke up to loud sounds similar to mechanical tools being used. The resident saw a white SUV leave the area after discovering a catalytic converter missing from a Toyota Prius parked outside. Attached is a photo of the possible suspect vehicle. Officers contacted the Prius owner and estimate the value of the stolen catalytic converter at $1800.

On December 29th, 2020, a home security camera captured a catalytic converter theft in the 600 block of S Dickinson St. A homeowner woke up to notifications on his phone showing a car stopping next to his 2007 Toyota Prius with people proceeding to cut off his catalytic converter. This all happened in about a minute and a half. View the video here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=qR9TuTcK4uQ&feature=youtu.be

According to the National Insurance Crime Bureau (NICB), catalytic converter thefts have been skyrocketing nationwide:
“Removing a catalytic converter takes only minutes using some basic, readily-available, battery-operated tools from a local hardware store and for the vehicle owner, it’s costly due to the loss of work, finding and paying for alternate transportation and then paying anywhere from $1,000 to $3,000 to get your vehicle fixed.” - NICB

The NICB recommends vehicle owners:
  • Install a catalytic converter anti-theft device. These are available from various manufacturers and can provide a level of security from theft.
  • Park fleet vehicles in an enclosed and secured area that is well lit, locked, and alarmed.
  • Park personal vehicles in a garage. If not possible and vehicles must be parked in a driveway, consider installing motion sensor security lights. While lights may not provide complete security, it may make some thieves think twice, making them leave the area and your vehicle untouched.
  • Call local law enforcement and your insurer should you become the victim of a catalytic converter theft.
https://www.nicb.org/news/news-releases/catalytic-converter-theft-skyrocketing-nationwide

The second vehicle was stolen, a spare key believed left in the console. Both thefts were reported early this morning and are under active investigation.

MPD received a fraud complaint where a 19-year-old was recently scammed out of nearly $10,000.  The UW-Madison international student reported to police he received phone calls from someone stating they were from US Immigration Services (ICE) and that he would be arrested and deported unless he paid a fine through a bank transfer and multiple gift cards.  After a dozen phone calls asking for more money, the victim found information online that this was likely a scam and subsequently reported to MPD.
 
This is an ongoing scam targeting international students as outlined in an announcement by UW-Madison.  A few reminders:
 
  • ICE Agents and local police do not call immigrants on the phone to warn them that they are about to be arrested and deported for violating immigration laws;
  • Agents do not request financial information (e.g., bank account and credit card account information) or demand money from someone to dismiss an investigation or vacate an arrest warrant. 
You can report suspected ICE agent fraud to the Department of Homeland Security Office of Inspector General at 1-800-323-8603.

At approximately 9:32pm Madison Police responded to a multiple vehicle crash with injuries at the intersection of Raymond Rd and McKenna Boulevard.  The intersection was closed while the crash was investigated and MFD paramedics attended to the injured.  Three persons were injured in a red SUV that failed to stop for a red signal heading east on Raymond Rd at McKenna Blvd.  The red SUV entered the intersection at a high rate of speed, struck a silver SUV going north on McKenna Blvd, and then veered into the median landing on top of the traffic signals and signs on Raymond Rd.  The operator of the red SUV was cited for the Red Signal Violation. 
 
Prior to the crash, the red SUV occupants were involved in an altercation at the Kwik Trip nearest this intersection and fleeing other parties involved. There was mention that a handgun was possibly involved in that altercation and that the red SUV was being chased, however that has not been confirmed at this time.  The Madison Police Department is still investigating this incident.

The Madison Police Department would like to thank the Madison Fire Department, the Dane County Sheriff's Office, UW-Madison and additional city partners for the assistance in keeping the community safe.

At around 3:45PM on 5/9/2021 Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a report of a subject displaying a gun from vehicle, while chasing another vehicle, near the intersection of Cottage Grove Rd and S. Stoughton Rd. The caller provided a detailed description of the vehicles, which included a unique paint job. At approximately 5:00PM on 5/9/2021 a Madison Officer on routine patrol observed two vehicles matching the description provided during the earlier incident parked at James Madison Park, 314 E Gorham St. Numerous officers responded to the area and contact was made with the drivers of the vehicles. The investigation, with assistance from the Dane County Sheriffs K9 unit, developed probable cause to arrest both drivers of the vehicles. 21 year old Jihaad Steele of Madison was booked into the Dane County Jail for Possession of THC, Felon in Possession of a Firearm and Obstructing an Officer. 20 year old Christopher Brown of Madison was booked into the Dane County Jail for Possession with Intent to Deliver THC and Carrying a Concealed Weapon. Madison Police recovered 2 firearms as well as a drum magazine and an extended magazine.

On 2/28/2021 Madison Police Officers responded to the 400 Block of N Frances St in the City of Madison for a report of a disturbance. When officers arrived they located the victim who had suffered significant facial injuries from the incident. The suspect was no longer on scene. Madison Police have identified a person of interest in the case and are attempting to identify the subject below.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014 or on the web at p3tips.com. Persons providing information leading to an arrest may be eligible for a cash reward.

Officers were dispatched to a report of a single gunshot and a male laying in the parking lot. Officers arrive and locate a male with a gunshot wound to the left thigh. Officers immediately apply a tourniquet, and locate a firearm with a spent shell casing nearby. Subject was transported to the hospital with a non-life-threatening injury.

Preliminary investigation indicates this was a self-inflicted injury.

Investigation is ongoing.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014 or, on the web at p3tips.com.

MPD is actively investigating the origin of the post.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 608-255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or, on the web at p3tips.com.

Overnight, officers responded to a robbery in the 3900 block of Dallas Drive. The victim was returning home and while attempting to close the garage door, the door would not close. The victim then goes to investigate what might be obstructing the door when a male subject appears. The subject walks up to the victim, grabs the victim’s purse and runs away. The subject was described as a black male, approximately 20-30 years of age, approximately 5'09" in height. K9 and a drone operator responded for a search; the subject was not located.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

Suspect: light skinned black male, younger/teenage, 5’05”, wearing blue camouflage ski mask
Details:
MPD was dispatched to an armed robbery at Todd Dr. and Post Rd. Officers responded and contacted the 15-year-old victim. The victim had just gotten off of a bus and was walking home when a silver SUV with damage and heavy tint robbed him of his backpack and other items. The suspect pointed a handgun directly at the victim and followed him in the vehicle before speeding off. Investigation ongoing.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

Officers responded last night to a report of a person who fired a gun in an apartment. While on scene, officers learn that the victim had several friends over at his apartment, and during that time, he hears a commotion coming from the front. As the victim is about to walk out of his bedroom to investigate, his bedroom door is kicked in and he is confronted by an unknown black male subject who is armed with a handgun.  This suspect demands "his stuff" and proceeds to strike the victim once on the side of the head with the handgun.  The suspect then fires one round through the bedroom door.  The round continues through an interior wall and into the ceiling.  A canvas of the building is completed with no answer at the adjacent apartments. Investigation is ongoing.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

Officers were dispatched to a homeowner who confronted a group of young males who had entered the victim's garage. Upon fleeing, one of the suspects pointed a handgun at the victim. The victim states that their garage door was left open a quarter of the way, and while sitting in their home, heard the garage door open. The victim investigates and observes four "young" looking males, all dressed in dark hoodies that were cinched closed, in his garage. The suspects run from the garage to an awaiting vehicle and leave the area. It appears nothing was taken from the garage. 
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com Ensure your car doors and all doors to your residence are kept locked.
 
As a reminder:
  • Keep your garage door closed and double-check it is closed at night.
  • Ensure your car doors and all doors to your residence are kept locked.
  • Leave exterior residence lights on at night or utilize motion detecting lights.
  • Keep valuables in your garage, car, and home out of sight.
  • Removing valuables from your car is better than hiding them. This includes garage door openers and spare keys.
  • Report all criminal and suspicious activity immediately.

Officers responded to a residential burglary where unknown suspect(s) gained entry into a garage, via a garage door opener that was left in an unlocked vehicle parked in the driveway.  Suspect(s) rummaged through two vehicles. The only item to be missing at this time is the garage opener. There is no suspect information as of this writing, and the exact time of occurrence is unknown. Due to its proximity, it is believed that this incident could be connected to an attempted residential burglary on the 9400 block of Spirit Street (2021-170200).
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com Ensure your car doors and all doors to your residence are kept locked.
 
As a reminder:
  • Ensure your car doors and all doors to your residence are kept locked.
  • Leave exterior residence lights on at night or utilize motion detecting lights.
  • Keep valuables in your garage, car, and home out of sight.
  • Removing valuables from your car is better than hiding them.  This includes garage door openers and spare keys.
  • Keep your garage door closed and double-check it is closed at night.
  • Report all criminal and suspicious activity immediately.

Officers were dispatched to a residential burglary in the 7100 block of Countrywood Ln.  Victim reports that the suspect(s) entered the home and stole a purse, laptop and keys to a vehicle, and then stole the vehicle.  One of two vehicles parked outside the residence was left unlocked and the suspect(s) gained entry to the home via a garage door opener that was in the unlocked vehicle.  Homeowner was awakened by a pet dog barking and discovered the burglary.

Washington Ave, near the Independence Ln intersection were shooting.  The witnesses reported anywhere from five shots to eight shots being fired.  No injuries were reported and no damage located.

The victim reported that when they woke up on the morning of 5/25/2021 they observed damage to their wall, and then a noticed a hole in the window. A casing was located outside the residence. The investigation is continuing.

  If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com

On 5/24/2021 Madison Police were dispatched to a report of an ongoing disturbance in the 5600 Block of Schroeder Rd in the City of Madison. Upon arrival officers found a group of 20-30 people involved in the disturbance. Tiara C Dixon was arrested after being seen throwing a bicycle at another involved party. When officers went to arrest Tiara Dixon, Audrey Dixon attempted to interfere with the arrest, grabbing at officers as well as Tiara while yelling not to arrest Tiara. Tiara was booked into the Dane County Jail for Disorderly Conduct, Audrey was booked into the Dane County Jail for Obstructing an Officer.
