Officers responded to the 6800 block of Park Ridge Dr for multiple callers reporting shots fired and vehicles leaving the area.  Upon arrival in the area officers observed a vehicle that was leaving the scene with a gunshot wound victim.  This vehicle, and the 40 year old victim, eventually arrived at an area hospital.  The victim is being treated for wounds that are not believed to be life threatening. This investigation is active and ongoing.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Suspect: Male black, mid 20's, light skinned, 6'2" tall, slender, wearing a gray hoodie, a black vest, black pants, black shoes, and a blue mask.
Details:
Officers responded to an armed robbery at the KwikTrip located at 7502 Mineral Point Rd.  The suspect is described as a light skinned black male in his mid 20s, about 6'2" and slender, wearing a blue hoodie, a black vest, black pants, black shoes, and a blue mask.  The suspect entered the KwikTrip with a small black handgun and demanded cash.  The suspect left the KwikTrip on foot with an undetermined amount of US currency.  A K-9 track was attempted but the suspect was not located.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

The Madison Police Department monitored State Street this evening for the Halloween Holiday. Generally people were very well behaved.  Approximately 42 people were cited for infractions such as drinking on the street or sidewalk, underage drinking, disorderly conduct, battery and urinating in public.  The Madison Police Department would like to thank the Madison Fire Department, the UW Police Department, the Dane County Sheriff’s Office, Dane County 911 and additional city partners for the assistance in keeping the event safe.

On 11/1/2021 Madison Officers responded to the area of the intercity bus terminal at Lake Street and Dayton Street for a report of a physical disturbance. When officers arrived on scene they learned that 21 year old Lavonne Polk and 23 year old Audrey Young, both of Chicago, had been attempting to board a bus with juvenile tickets. The bus driver had refused to transport them across state lines unaccompanied, believing that they were juveniles.

When the bus driver refused to transport the two subjects, Young created a physical disturbance. When officers contacted Polk and Young they continued to pretend to be juveniles. Officers eventually determined the subjects were adults, and Polk was found to be in possession of two electric weapons. Polk was taken to the Dane County Jail for Possession of an Electric Weapon and Obstructing. Young was taken to the Dane County Jail for Obstructing and Disorderly Conduct.

On 10/11/2021 the Madison Police Department received a report of a sexual assault that had taken place on the city’s east side on 10/10/2021. On 11/3/2021, following an investigation, the Madison Police Department arrested 17 year old Baboucarr Nyang of Madison. Nyang was taken to the Dane County Jail with charges of 2nd Degree Sexual Assault and Strangulation.

Officers dispatched to 2100 block of East Springs Drive for a subject firing a gun in the parking lot.  Upon arrival officers arrest two subjects in relation to a fight and the shots fired incident.  No injuries or damage reported at this time however, several shell casings were recovered.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Address: 200 block of S High Point Rd
Details:
Madison Police Officers responded to the 200 block of S High Point Rd for a residential burglary. The victim reported their car was parked in an underground parking garage and broken into. An unknown suspect broke the rear car window of the victim's locked car and stole a wallet and essential oils. 
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 608-255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com
  
 As a reminder:
· Keep valuables in your garage, car, and home out of sight.
·  Removing valuables from your car is better than hiding them. This includes garage door openers and spare keys.
· Report all criminal and suspicious activity immediately.

Madison Police Officers are responding to an active fight involving students outside of East High School property. More than 15 officers were dispatched to the scene at this time. This is an open and active investigation.

?Madison Police Officers responded to a traffic complaint in the 5800 block of Balsam Rd involving a silver Toyota Prius which was later revealed to be stolen. Officers arrived in the area and located the stolen vehicle unoccupied. Officers contacted the caller who reported the vehicle was speeding around the area and received a description of a possible driver. Officers located a juvenile suspect matching the description at a nearby park but the suspect denies involvement. Officers then find security footage in the area and are able to positively identify the juveniles in the stolen vehicle. Officers are able to locate the 4 juvenile suspects again and take them into custody.

Madison Officers were called to West Towne Mall for a dispute between two teenage females who reportedly threatened a Madison Metro driver over their request to wear a mask on the bus. The teenage girls also called for Madison Officers to respond as they were reportedly still on the bus, and were unwilling to vacate the bus over the mask dispute and threats.
 
Officers arrived on-scene and found the teenage girls were still on the bus. Metro requested that they be asked to leave the bus because of the threat, which they willingly did after officer’s arrival. After exiting the bus, officers offered the juveniles the opportunity to walk-away, but one of the juveniles became very upset and threw her shoes at the bus. The teen also kicked the bus door window causing it to shatter.
 
Officers ended up arresting the 15-yr-old juvenile for criminal damage to property, resisting arrest, and escape, as she tried to flee officer’s custody, while being cleared at a local hospital before being accepted to the Juvenile Reception Center.
 
The second teenager who was also on-scene, engaging in this disturbance, was arrested for obstructing officers, resisting an officer – causing injury, and possession of an electric weapon.  She was transported to the Dane County Jail, after being medically cleared at a local hospital.  
 
20 MPD officers were ultimately called assist at West Towne Mall in the arrests of these two persons. Both suspects were offered the opportunity to leave but chose to stay, damage property and cause a large disturbance. 
 
One MPD officer sustained an injury that required transport to a local hospital. This officer has been treated and released.

Address: Fish Hatchery Rd and Park St
Details:
The Madison Police Department is looking for a dark sedan, possibly a Dodge Charger or similar, that was involved in a Hit and Run crash in the area of Fish Hatchery Rd and S Park St between 10:30pm and 10:45pm.  The vehicle should have significant front end damage. This crash resulted in serious injuries to a 21 year old bicyclist who was transported to an area hospital.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Address: East Washington Ave at Wright St
Details:
At around 12:20 AM on 11/9/2021 Madison Police Officers responded to the area of E. Washington Ave and Wright St for a report of shots fired. Witnesses reported seeing two vehicles on East Washington Ave exchanging gunfire. A spent bullet was located in the area.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

The Madison Police Department was contacted by a resident reporting that they had been the target of a scam telephone call. The caller reported that they received a call from a subject representing themselves as an employee of a large online retailer. The subject then claimed a large purchase had been made through the residents account, and that they needed to collect personal and financial information in order to cancel the purchase. Luckily the resident recognized this was scam and ended the phone call.

The Madison Police Department would like to remind citizens that they should use caution whenever receiving a phone call requesting personal or financial information, or payments. Citizens receiving a call that makes them concerned should consider ending the inbound call, identifying a verified telephone number for the company or organization, and placing a call to that number to help determine if a scam is taking place.
 
If you are contacted by a scammer we encourage you to report the contact to Federal Trade Commission at the following website: ReportFraud.ftc.gov

On 11/8/2021 Madison Police Responded to the area of Tenney Park for a weapons violation. An injured subject was located and transported to the hospital with non-life threatening injuries. The investigation is open and on-going.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Madison Police responded to the area of Reindahl Park in response to a victim calling and stating that he had been shot.  Officers located a 25 year old victim who had suffered a gunshot wound to the leg.  A Madison Police Officer applied a tourniquet to the affected leg and the victim was transported to an area hospital.  His injuries are not believed to be life threatening.  A suspect is being sought and the investigation is ongoing.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Due to this residents may have noticed an increased police presence in the area.  Madison Police Officers have cleared from this call and there is no threat to the public.

Burglaries were attempted or completed at 7410 Mineral Point Rd, 901 S Gammon Rd, and 6614 Odana Rd.  In each of these crimes, the perpetrator(s) damaged property to enter the dwelling and steal items.

On Saturday, November 13, 2021 at approximately 9:25am, Madison Police were dispatched to a report of a stabbing in the 300 block of State St.  Numerous police units responded to the area in search of the suspect.  The victim, a 35 year old male, was transported to a local hospital with non-life threatening injuries.  The suspect, a 34 year old male who initially fled from the scene on foot, was later taken into custody without incident.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345.

On 11-14-21, at approximately 10:20 pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 1500 block of Trailsway, reference to a sexual assault. When officers arrived on scene, a 25 year old woman told officers when she went outside to her car, an adult male came up behind her, made some inappropriate sexual comments to her, and then inappropriately touched her. The woman screamed, and the suspect left the area on foot. A K9 officer was used for a K9 track, but it did not lead to the suspect, and the suspect is still at large. The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating an armed robbery that occurred Monday morning at a cash store on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1100 block of N. Sherman Ave. around 10 a.m.

An employee told police two men entered the store and demanded money. The employee said at least one of the men was armed with a gun.

The suspects stole cash from the store.

The investigating is ongoing.

Madison police are investigating a homicide on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to a home along the 3500 block of Home Ave. around 12:30 a.m. on Wednesday.

They arrived to find a 24-year-old man injured with gunshot wounds. He was pronounced dead at the hospital.

The MPD Violent Crime Unit has identified and located one person of interest.

Witnesses are encouraged to contact the Madison Police Department with any information.

This is believed to be a targeted incident and there does not appear to be a continuing danger to the public.

The investigation is ongoing.

Two apartments were damaged Wednesday afternoon during a shots fired incident on Madison’s far east side.

Officers were dispatched to an area near the 200 block of Cottage Grove Rd. around 3:20 p.m.

Multiple people reported hearing several shots fired at this time. Two vehicles were also seen speeding away from the area.

Bullets damaged two apartment units, including one that was occupied by a woman and two children.

At least three vehicles were also damaged. 

No injuries have been reported.

Police believe this is a targeted incident. There is no continued danger to the public.

No arrests have been made at this time.

Witnesses are encouraged to contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. Information can also be shared anonymously by contacting the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

A window and door were damaged during a burglary at Tutto Pasta, an Italian restaurant located along the 300 block of State Street near downtown Madison.

The incident was reported to police around 8 a.m. on Wednesday. Staff said the burglary happened sometime overnight.

Officers arrived to find a main window of the restaurant smashed out.

The cash register door, which contained a few dollars in change, was stolen.

A stolen vehicle, with 4 juvenile occupants was observed traveling at a high rate of speed when it ran a red light at Hwy 51 (Stoughton Rd) at Buckeye Rd.  The stolen vehicle crashed into an uninvolved citizen and took down a traffic standard.  All 4 juvenile suspects fled from the crash scene.  Monona Police Officers were nearby for an unrelated investigation and apprehend one juvenile female suspect.  Monona Officers along with Madison citizens were able to keep the other suspects in sight allowing for Madison Officers to apprehend 2 additional juvenile male suspects.  The driver of the victim vehicle suffered minor injuries and was transported to an area hospital.  The 3 arrested juveniles had no outward injuries, however they were assessed on scene by Madison Fire Department Paramedics. The 3 arrested juveniles were taken to area hospitals as a precaution prior to being taken to Dane County Juvenile Reception Center.  State of WI DOT and Madison Traffic and Engineering personnel responded to the intersection to begin repairs on the downed traffic light.

The Madison Police Department is investigating an armed robbery that occurred Sunday afternoon on the city's north side in the 2300 block of Independence Ln. 
 
The victim stated he made arrangements with one of the suspects to sell him shoes and upon meeting the suspect, the suspect and two others pointed their guns at him and stole the shoes and cash. 
 
The investigation is ongoing.

On Monday, November 22, 2021 at approximately 2:45pm, Madison Police were dispatched to the 1100 block of Moorland Rd reference a stabbing. What started as a verbal dispute between three adults devolved into a physical altercation. One of the involved subjects brandished a box cutter and injured the two others. All involved parties were contacted by responding officers; the suspect was taken into custody without issue, and the two victims were transported to a local hospital with non-life threatening injuries. Tentative charges for the suspect include First-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety and Disorderly Conduct (while armed).

 

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345.

Address: US Highway 12 EB near Verona Road
Details:
A woman called the police Saturday morning after finding a shell casing while on a walk with her dog.

The woman was crossing a pedestrian bridge over the Beltline around 10:15 a.m. when she noticed something shiny. The woman was on the bridge near the Verona Rd. and Midvale Blvd. exit.

The responding officer found three casings coming from two different types of guns.

Two people reported hearing shots fired in this area hours before around 3:30 a.m. Officers checked the area initially, but were unable to locate any shell casings at that time.

Madison police are investigating after a man said racial remarks following a physical fight early Sunday morning.
Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of W. Gilman Street around 12:15 a.m.

Witnesses said two men were fighting before one of them and a woman walked away. The suspect reportedly followed them down the block and yelled racial slurs toward the man. Witnesses said the suspect also tried to throw punches at the man during this time.

The suspect tried to block the man and woman from entering a nearby apartment building. The man reportedly punched the suspect to get him out of the doorway.

The suspect admitted to police that he was angry when he made the racial remarks.

The officer tagged the disorderly conduct arrest for consideration for a hate crime enhancer because of the language used by the suspect.

The investigation into this situation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a strong armed robbery that occurred Tuesday afternoon at a jewelry store on the city's east side.

Officers were dispatched to the 2100 block of Atwood Ave. around 1:40pm.

An employee told police two masked men entered the store and after a brief altercation struck one of the employees, and then fled with a countertop jewelry display case containing jewelry. The employee said the suspects fled in a silver sedan with heavily tinted windows and no plates.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

A man was pulled out of a vehicle moments before it was stolen Tuesday afternoon on Madison’s east side.

The 2010 Jeep Grand Cherokee was parked outside a business along the 4900 block of Commercial Ave. and taken around 4:45 p.m.

The owner was inside the business while a passenger waited in the backseat of the vehicle. The passenger said a man approached the vehicle, opened the door, and pulled him out.

The passenger suffered an ankle injury.

This investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a theft of a catallactic converter from a vehicle that occurred on 11/24/2021 in the early morning hours in the city’s central district. It is believed that more than one vehicle was targeted and the additional thefts have yet to be discovered or reported. 
 
During the investigation Officers learned that the suspects may be working as a team to remove catallactic converters, using one as a lookout. 
 
If you are the victim of such a theft, see people checking cars or getting under cars in your neighborhood, and it seems suspicious, call 911. 

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the area of Redwing Ln and Main Ln for multiple callers reporting shots fired in the area.  Upon arrival officers located multiple casings on the street near this intersection.

A vehicle with two occupants that had been driving in the immediate area was struck by gunfire.  No additional damage was located in the vicinity and no persons were struck.

On 11/26/2021 at about 8:34pm the Madison Police Department was dispatched to the Fast Forward Skate Center for reports of a large number of unsupervised minors causing a disturbance.  Upon the arrival of police an estimated 250 persons, mostly juveniles, were located inside of the business.  While officers were on scene, a fight started inside of the business and this fight escalated and eventually spilled out into the parking lot where several large fights were going on simultaneously.  At one point members of the crowd climbed on top of Madison Police Department squad cars that were parked outside.

Two juvenile and one adult arrest was made.  A taser style weapon was taken from this adult after they attempted to use it on another individual.  Members of the crowd attempted to disrupt one of these arrests and pepper spray was required to protect the arresting officers from these individuals and secure the arrest.  A member of the Madison Police Department suffered a minor injury during this arrest. 

The Madison Police Department requested assistance from our law enforcement partners in the area and eventually 27 officers from at least 5 area law enforcement agencies were on scene.  The Madison Fire Department staged ambulances nearby in the event they were needed.  All of these resources were necessary to break up the fights, disperse the crowd, and restore order.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.  Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

At approximately 3:50pm, MPD responded to a rollover crash on westbound US 12 between Midvale and Whitney Way.  A stolen vehicle travelling recklessly sideswiped another vehicle causing severe damage.  The stolen vehicle then flipped and landed on its roof.  Witnesses reported that six occupants fled from the stolen vehicle into the Odana Hills Golf Course and surrounding neighborhoods.  Subsequently numerous people called 911 reporting the suspect’s locations, suspect’s descriptions, and the suspects were trying to break into nearby garages/vehicles.  Officers are able to establish containment on the area and rapidly respond to the suspect’s locations.  Ultimately five of the six suspects that fled from the vehicle were apprehended within a short period of time.  Further efforts to locate the sixth suspect were exhausted.  Traffic was impacted on westbound US 12 at the scene of the crash and Seminole Hwy/Manitou Way – which is where the farthest apprehension occurred.  Several of the suspects resisted arrest.  A K9 from the Middleton Police Department assisted with this incident.
 
Inside the stolen vehicle, three handguns were seized – one handgun was stolen and had a high capacity drum-magazine.  The stolen vehicle was taken on a different date, during a residential burglary in the City of Middleton.  All of the arrested suspects are either out on bail and violating conditions of bail, on active probation/parole status, or have active warrants.  Many have numerous prior offenses for: Stolen Auto (Operate Motor Vehicle Without Owner Consent) and had pending charges with MPD for prior separate OMVWOC incidents. One of the suspects was in possession of cocaine at the time of arrest.  All five suspects were booked into the Dane County Jail, following medical evaluations due to the nature of the crash.  No other persons were significantly injured as a result of the crash.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

On Sunday afternoon, Madison police officers responded to a call of an armed suicidal person inside a home with another person possibly in danger.

Officers encountered an armed person once they arrived at the home along the 4600 block Secret Garden Drive. During the encounter, an officer discharged their weapon and the armed man fired his weapon, taking his own life.

The Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation is conducting the investigation into the matter.  

Per MPD policy, the involved officer has been placed on administrative leave until the investigation is completed. ?

Two residences and two vehicles were damaged during a shots fired incident early Sunday morning in Madison. 

Officers responded to the 1300 block of Regent Street around 1:15 a.m. after people reported hearing gunshots.

Several shell casings were found in a parking lot along this block.

Bullets also entered two nearby rental properties.  No one was home at either property.

No injuries were reported.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

The Wisconsin State Patrol was in pursuit of a vehicle that was westbound on Interstate 94 and approaching the Badger Interchange.  This pursuit was terminated for safety reasons.  At 4:16 PM, the suspect vehicle collided with a bus while both were traveling westbound on STH 30 near N Thompson Dr in Madison.  The bus was occupied by two adults at the time of this crash and neither subject was injured.

The suspect vehicle sustained disabling damage and its occupants fled from the scene on foot.  One subject was detained with the help of a citizen in the 4900 block of Commercial Ave.  Law enforcement was unable to immediately locate the second subject.  Madison Police officers investigated the crash and assisted the Wisconsin State Patrol in their efforts to locate the second subject.

All inquiries related to this vehicle pursuit investigation should be directed to the Wisconsin State Patrol.

Address: US Highway 12 EB at John Nolen Drive
Details:
A juvenile was taken into custody Tuesday morning after crashing a stolen car and running away from the scene.

The crash happened around 7:30 a.m. on eastbound Highway 12 at the off-ramp to John Nolen Drive. One vehicle was involved.

The 13-year-old driver ran away from the crash. Multiple units with the Madison Police Department, including a K9 unit, responded to the area to search for the driver.

Officers found the teen in a stairwell on a commercial property nearby.

The vehicle involved was reported stolen on Monday.

An investigation is ongoing.

Several shell casings were found early Tuesday morning while officers responded to reports of shots fired.

An officer with the Fitchburg Police Department reported hearing shots around 12:15 a.m. coming from the area of Verona Road and Raymond Road.

Madison police found three shell casings near Freeport Road.

No injuries or property damage were reported.

Madison police responded to a residential burglary late Monday night on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to a home along the 6000 block of Driscoll Drive around 10:50 p.m.

A man reported that several items, including a laptop, were taken from his vehicle which was parked in the garage.

The investigation is ongoing.

Madison police responded to a battery complaint at West High School on Monday.

Officers were dispatched around 3:30 p.m. after a teen was punched in the head at the corner of Ash and Regent Streets. 

The teen does not remember the entire incident and believes he may have blacked out.

A 16-year-old was arrested Tuesday night for substantial battery.

An 18-year-old student was arrested Thursday afternoon for having a loaded gun at La Follette High School.

School administrators called police around 1:40 p.m. after receiving an anonymous tip about the weapon.

Officers found the gun on Marquan T. Webb. He attempted to push his way out of a classroom when officers arrived. A school administrator was able to stop him and he was detained.

The gun was loaded and a bullet was in the chamber.

It was reported stolen out of Cottage Grove on Sept. 24.

Marquan T. Webb faces felon in possession of a firearm, possession of a stolen firearm, possession of a firearm on school property, resisting and bail jumping charges.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Madison police are investigating an armed robbery at a cell phone store on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the 6900 block of Seybold Road shortly before 7:30 p.m. Thursday.

Employees said two masked men entered the store demanding cash. One of the men pulled out a gun.

Several cell phones were stolen.

A Madison K9 officer tracked the suspects to a nearby parking lot, where a possible vehicle pick up occurred.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Madison police are investigating after a teen was stabbed during an incident at a fast-food restaurant Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 4600 block of Verona Rd. at 5:45 p.m.

Several teens were involved in a disturbance inside when one of them was stabbed.

Responding officers found the victim at a nearby grocery store with a stab wound to his abdomen.

Officers identified and arrested a 15-year-old male around 7:35 p.m. He was taken into custody in the area of Valley stream Dr. and Romford Rd.

The 15-year-old faces 1st-degree reckless endangerment, disorderly conduct while armed, and resisting and obstructing an officer. He was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

The Madison Police Department is seeing an increase of catalytic converter thefts in certain parts of the city.
 
Over the last two weeks, 14 thefts have been reported. Thieves have concentrated on vehicles in our Midtown District. The thefts happened in the Edgewood, Vilas, Monroe and Camp Randall areas.
 
In nearly every incident, the vehicle targeted was a Toyota Prius. It also appears a select few are doing these thefts.
 
Most are happening overnight between 11 p.m. and 8 a.m. The busiest time of the week is Tuesday night into Wednesday morning.
 
Officers are doing extra patrols of the impacted areas. MPD is also working on some problem-solving efforts with local partners to address this crime long-term.
 
Stealing a converter is unfortunately easy. Your best defense is to avoid parking your vehicle, especially a Prius, on the street. However, we recognize this isn’t always an option for many residents.
 
Anyone who notices a converter theft or suspicious activity on their home security cameras is asked to contact the Madison Police Department. This video could help officers identify suspects and make an arrest.

Several people, including firefighters and paramedics stationed nearby, reported hearing gunshots Saturday night on the city’s east side.

Officers were sent to the 4500 block of Cottage Grove Rd. shortly after 10 p.m.

Witnesses said a man and two women were arguing when the man pulled out a gun. 

Witnesses heard multiple shots fired. Officers found two shell casings in a parking lot on Cottage Grove Rd. 

No injuries or damages were reported.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

A man was arrested after threatening guests with a knife and screwdriver at the Madison Plaza Hotel on Saturday.

The hotel is located along the 3800 block of E. Washington Ave. Staff called police around 9:15 p.m. to report the incident.

A victim told police the suspect poked his chest with the knife and yelled racial slurs near the lobby. The victim told officers he was not injured.

Other witnesses said the suspect also made threats with a screwdriver.

The suspect admitted to threatening other guests with a screwdriver, but did not provide police with other information.

Ryan C. Paschal faces second-degree reckless endangering safety and bail jumping charges.

A man was inside his vehicle when it was damaged during a shots fired incident on the west side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 5600 block of Schroeder Road around 9:50 p.m. Sunday. Multiple callers reported hearing several shots fired in the area.
 
One occupied vehicle was damaged. The owner noticed a bullet struck the driver’s side area of the vehicle.
 
No injuries were reported.
 
Ten shell casings were also found in the area.
 
The incident remains under investigation.?

Madison police are searching for the person who snatched an elderly woman’s purse out of her hands.

The woman was leaving the Pick N Save store on McKee Rd. around 11:30 a.m. Sunday. Her purse was sitting on the child’s seat of the shopping cart when a man approached her.

Two witnesses chased him to a nearby apartment complex after hearing the victim yell for help. They found the purse after the man ditched it along the way. 

The woman was not injured during this incident. 

MPD was able to grab a still image from surveillance video showing the suspect entering the store.

Anyone with information about his identity is asked to contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. You can also remain anonymous and submit a tip to Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

A teenager was arrested after repeatedly hitting an occupied squad car with a metal rod on Monday afternoon.

The incident happened around 4:40 p.m. at the intersection of Carroll and W. Wilson Streets.

An officer was stopped for traffic when someone threw a glass candle jar toward his squad car.

The officer said the teen voiced her dislike for police as she approached the vehicle armed with a metal rod.

The teen struck the squad car several times before trying to open the driver’s door.

A review of city cameras show the teen throwing a metal rod at the officer just before she is taken into custody.

Officers took her into custody without incident. She was taken to the Dane County Jail.

She faces attempted battery to law enforcement officer, disorderly conduct, damage to property and bail jumping charges.

The officer was not injured during this incident.

Madison police are investigating after shots were fired on the city’s near east side Wednesday morning.

Multiple people reported hearing shots along the 10th block of N. Third St around 6:45 a.m.

Officers found seven shell casings at the intersection of N. Third St. and Carey Ct.

No injuries or property damage were reported.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers found four shell casings early Thursday morning while responding to a shots fired incident on Madison’s west side.

Several people reported hearing five to six shots near the Russett Rd. and Whitney Way intersection around 12:25 a.m.

Officers found blood on the road, but no victim was on the scene and no injuries were reported.

Witnesses reported hearing a car speed away afterward.

Officers were not able to locate any property damage.

This investigation is ongoing.

On Thursday, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU) arrested a 21-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.

Members of DOJ Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with MPD GNCAT, SWAT, and SVU served a search warrant on Courtney J. Brown’s residence in the 1400 block of Theresa Terrace.

Brown has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail today on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

SWAT completed its 100th mission/warrant with this case.

The Madison Police Department investigated a threatening photo posted online involving a Madison student.

An anonymous tip was submitted through the school’s Let’s Talk feature. The messaged showed a photo of an East High School student holding a gun and making a vague threat.

Madison police searched the student and their belongings when they arrived at school Wednesday and no weapon was found.

The student apologized for the image saying they were mocking a meme going around online.  

Their parents cooperated with officers during this investigation and said the photo posted was taken more than a year ago.

Officers deemed this not to be a credible threat.

The Madison Metropolitan School District sent a letter about the incident to families earlier this week.

Cash and debit cards were stolen Wednesday night after someone went through the employee locker room at Comedy on State in Madison.

Around 7 p.m., the suspect entered an unlocked rear ally door leading to the venue.

Around $250, debit cards and IDs were stolen from items stored in the employee locker room.

Madison police are looking to identify the person who “fished” out rent checks from a dropbox last month.

The apartment complex is located on Moorland Rd. Several tenants alerted the property management office of an issue after they received late rent notices.

Surveillance video shows a man entering the main office around 4 a.m. on Nov. 2. The video shows him using a long string to fish out the checks.

The property manager said the stolen check amount totaled $2,124. 

Other apartment complexes in the area have had similar check thefts.

The Madison Police Department pulled a still image of the suspect from the surveillance video.

Anyone with information on this person's identity is asked to email MPD Officer Ruben Gonzalez at ROGonzalez@cityofmadison.com.

Anonymous tips can also be submitted to Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is attempting to identify an individual responsible for graffiti in the downtown area.

On Nov. 28, the person used spray paint to tag a number of buildings in the State St. corridor.

Around 4 p.m., the person also tagged several public areas in downtown Madison.

This person is believed to be responsible for seven different incidents.

People are encouraged to contact the police if they see someone vandalizing property through graffiti. 

Anyone with information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. 

Anonymous tips can also be submitted via Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.

A suspect entered the Walgreens at 7810 Mineral Point Road and, after making a few laps inside the store, he went up to the cashier at the photo counter and demanded cash from the register.  The suspect acted as if he had a gun in his hoodie, though one was never seen, and stated several times that he would shoot the employee.  Suspect left the store with approximately $250 in cash.

Address: N. Third St. at Pennsylvania Ave.
Details:
Three drivers reported dealing with a strong glare from the sun during three separate crashes involving pedestrians or cyclists Monday morning.

The first happened around 8:05 a.m. at the intersection of N. Third St. and Pennsylvania Ave.

A driver was turning south onto Third St. and hit a pedestrian in the crosswalk. A 65-year-old man was taken to the hospital out of precaution.

Within the same hour, a pedestrian was hit while in the crosswalk at the E. Washington Ave. and Paterson St. intersection. A 63-year-old woman was taken to the hospital for a possible broken pelvis around 8:50 a.m.

Around 10:20 a.m., a cyclist was taken to the hospital for a possible broken leg. The cyclist was hit while riding in a bike lane on Sherman Ave. near Commercial Ave.

The driver said the sun glare was so bad he never saw the 54-year-old woman.

All three drivers reported dealing with a strong glare from the sun at the time of these crashes.

The investigations into these incidents are ongoing at this time.

Madison police are investigating after someone pulled a woman’s purse off her shoulder and drove away from a store in a stolen vehicle.

Officers were dispatched to the Target on Junction Road around 10 a.m.

Witnesses said three teenage males were inside the store when one approached the woman.

The teens ran out of the store and drove away in a stolen SUV. The vehicle is believed to have been involved in some thefts on the east side of Madison earlier on Monday.

The woman’s purse contained cash, credit cards and keys. One of her credit cards was used at a nearby gas station minutes after the robbery was reported.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to the 2900 block of Turbot Drive reference a stolen auto.  Officers contacted a man who stated that while he was walking to his friend's car in the parking lot, he observed a subject stealing his friend's car.  The man told officers that he yelled at the suspect and the suspect drove off.  The man told officers that as he drove off, the suspect backed into the neighbor's car and then hit the neighbor’s garage.  The man told officers that he threw something at the car when it was fleeing.  Officers contact neighbors who stated they heard a gunshot at the time of the incident.  Officers located the car, which was unoccupied, on McDivitt/Todd.  The recovered car had a hole in the front driver’s side window caused by a bullet that exited the passenger door panel and ultimately struck the door of an occupied residence. The bullet did not go through the door, thus investigators were able to recover the round.  A K-9 track was conducted, however the suspects were not located.

Suspect: m/w, tall, long beard, riding a bike
Details: Two men, who were in the Kwik Trip at 401 N. Third Street, got into a verbal argument inside the store.  One of the men asked the clerk to call 9-1-1.  Both men then went outside where one of the men swung a bat at the other man's head.  The bat struck the victim's hand and the victim fell to the ground.  The victim, who told officers that he did not know the suspect, had minor hand and knee injuries.  Kwik Trip employees broke up fight and confiscated the bat.  The suspect fled on his bicycle. Officers were unable to locate suspect.

A Madison officer administered Narcan while responding to a medical call at a home on the city’s east side Monday afternoon.

Officers arrived to the Corry Street home to find a 40-year-old man unresponsive. The officer performed life-saving measures until officials with the Madison Fire Department arrived.

Two glass pipes and a knife were found on the man. 

He was taken to the hospital and later arrested on several charges, including possession of meth and possession of drug paraphernalia.

Address: Cottage Grove Rd. at Cottage Ct.
Details:
Three people died and another person was injured during a crash on Madison’s east side Tuesday morning.
 
The two-vehicle crash happened around 9:20 a.m. at the intersection of Cottage Grove Road and Cottage Ct. This is near the eastern on-off ramps with South Stoughton Road.
 
The driver of a gray sedan was traveling westbound on Cottage Grove Rd. at a high rate of speed when it ran a red light and t-boned a black SUV.
 
The impact killed both drivers and a passenger in the black SUV. A passenger in the sedan was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
 
The Wisconsin State Patrol and the Madison Fire Department also assisted in the response and investigation into this crash.

Wednesday morning, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU), arrested a 17-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.
 
Members of DOJ Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with MPD GNCAT, SWAT, and SVU served a search warrant on Alejandro F. Sandoval’s residence in the 400 block of Primrose Lane.
 
Sandoval has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail Wednesday on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

The Madison Police Department is monitoring a recent social media trend suggesting possible school violence.
 
This particular TikTok “challenge” vaguely warns about violence in schools across the country and encourages students to stay home from school on Friday. The threat is nationwide and not targeted to any particular school.
 
While the Madison Police Department takes such threats seriously, we do not deem there to be any legitimate threat connected to the posts.
 
The Madison Metropolitan School District plans to go forward with classes as usual on Friday. The district has made parents aware of the situation in case they or their students come across related posts on social media.

Officers were dispatched to the area of W. Gilman Street and University Avenue reference a weapons offense (shots fired).  Upon arrival on scene, officers located three spent .45 caliber casings and one live .45 caliber round on W. Gilman Street near the Cheba Hut.  Eyewitnesses told officers that the male suspect had been in a verbal argument with several other people in the middle of Gilman Street.  The suspect fired 3 rounds into the air and all parties quickly left the area.  Thirty-one minutes after being dispatched to the call, a witness pointed out a man walking towards officers and told the officers that the man was the suspect who had the gun.  After officers told the man to stop, he took off running.  Following a short foot pursuit, the man was taken into custody.  A black .45 caliber semi-automatic handgun was recovered from the suspect.  The suspect was taken to the Dane County Jail.  Charges include, but may not be limited to, 2nd Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Resisting, Endangering Safety by Use of a Dangerous Weapon (Operates or goes armed with a firearm while under the influence of an intoxicant), D.C. while armed.

During the months of August, September, and October 2021, the Madison Police Department investigated a series of armed carjackings. These all occurred in Madison's West District, specifically in the neighborhoods south of McKee Rd. and west of Maple Grove Dr. 

On the evening of Oct. 4th and into the early morning hours of Oct. 5, Madison PD (largely on the east side and west side of Madison) received reports of more than forty smashed out vehicle windows, with personal property being taken from the damaged vehicles and a car being stolen by what we believe are the same suspects connected to this series of armed carjacking’s. 

This trend of violent, armed carjackings, coupled with the extensive, senseless damage to property, caused many who live in these otherwise quiet Westside neighborhoods to fear for their safety. 

Video evidence, physical evidence and extensive collaboration between numerous police agencies to include Fitchburg PD, Cottage Grove PD, Waunakee PD, Middleton PD, Wisconsin State Patrol, Milton PD and Illinois authorities assisted detectives in being able to request charges on some of the suspects. 

A 16-year-old male with ties to the Madison and Rockford area was ultimately taken into custody on Nov. 4 by MPD. He is believed to be extensively involved in all of these crimes. He currently remains in custody at the Juvenile Reception Center.

Because the arrested juvenile is a minor his name has not been released. 

Last week, MPD requested a warrant from the Dane County District Attorney’s office for the arrest of a 16-year-old with ties to Rockford, Ill., whom investigators believe is connected to this crime spree.    

Other individuals involved in these crimes remain at-large and the investigation continues.

A Madison man faces homicide charges in connection to a woman’s death from earlier this year.

Madison police believe the woman died in July. Her body was found decomposing at a home on the far east side Sept. 16.

A notice about a death investigation was initially posted in the Chief’s Blog on Sept. 17.

An autopsy was completed and the manner of death at this time is suspected to be homicide. The final ruling is still pending.

Gregg G. Raether was identified as a person of interest in this case. He was arrested on a parole hold Sept. 23 and has been in custody ever since.

He was formally charged in Dane County Circuit Court on a 1st degree reckless homicide charge on Dec. 20.

Madison police are investigating a shooting along the 4500 block of Verona Road.

Officers were dispatched to the area around 1:15 p.m. on Wednesday.

Shots were fired in the parking lot outside of Home Depot. Two people were injured and called for help from the BP gas station across the street.

One of the injured people suffered a gunshot wound. Both were alert and conscious when taken to the hospital.

It's unknown if this was a targeted incident at this time. There are early indications the people involved were known to one another. There is no ongoing danger to the public.

The investigation into this shooting is ongoing.

At approximately 12:23pm, MFD and MPD were dispatched to a motorcycle vs car crash.  The 23 year old male driver of the motorcycle was transported by ambulance for life threatening injuries to a local hospital.  No other subjects were transported to hospitals.  Packers Ave was closed for approximately one hour as Officers investigated the crash.

Twin brothers were taken to the hospital early Wednesday morning after crashing a stolen vehicle at Brittingham Park in Madison.

The vehicle was reported stolen out of Verona and spotted in Madison around 6:40 a.m. A Madison officer was following the vehicle from a distance when the driver sped away.

The driver hit a patch of ice and crashed into a tree at Brittingham Park. Two 18-year-old males ran away from the vehicle onto the John Nolen Causeway.

Responding officers blocked the road. The teens were arrested and taken to the hospital as a precaution.

The incident remains under investigation.

Madison police arrested three teens Tuesday afternoon after recovering a stolen vehicle with a stolen gun inside.

Officers tracked the vehicle to a convenience store along the 2800 block of Todd Dr. around 3:30 p.m. The stolen weapon was inside the vehicle.

Around the same time, a woman who lives nearby called police to report a group of males inside her shed. 

Officers, including a Madison K9 unit, began tracking footsteps leading away from the shed. The K9 team located the group at an apartment building along the 2000 block of Greenway Cross. 

A 17-year-old, 16-year-old and 15-year-old were arrested. The 17-year-old was taken to the Dane County Jail and the other teens were transported to the Juvenile Reception Center.

Synthetic marijuana and two key fobs for stolen vehicles were found on two of the teens.

The Madison Police Department’s Burglary Crime unit continues to investigate a rash of package thefts that occurred around the holiday season.

Detectives have identified two chronic porch pirates and are currently searching for Terry Campbell and Perzie Teague.

Campbell faces multiple theft charges for stealing packages and wallets from people. He was also involved in three recent shoplifting cases at Target in Madison.

Detectives identified Campbell from past cases as he is currently out on parole for 29 counts of burglary, fraud and theft. He was also wearing the same winter coat in several surveillance videos tied to his most recent theft cases. 

Teague faces multiple theft charges connected to three packaged theft cases. Detectives said she seemed to target homes on the isthmus.

Anyone with information about Campbell or Teague’s whereabouts should call Madison police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

You can self-report package thefts to the Madison Police Department here. If available, Ring doorbell video can also be submitted online to help detectives investigate thefts.

A Metro bus was traveling southbound on Whitney Way facing a green light.  A vehicle traveling northbound, turned through a red signal to try and turn onto the Beltline.  The vehicle and the bus collided and knocked down a street lamp.   Officers directed traffic for about two hours with the street down.   The driver of the vehicle causing the crash was issued several citations.  No injuries were reported at this time.

On 1-1-22, at approximately 12:33 am, MPD Officers were dispatched to the 4300 block of Devolis Parkway reference multiple callers reporting shots fired. When officers arrived on scene, they did located multiple shell casing in the 4300 block of Devolis Parkway. There were no reported injuries, and no property damage was located at this time. This investigation is ongoing.

On 1-2-22, at approximately 12;45 am, MPD officers were dispatched to 2500 block of Calypso Rd, reference shots fired. When officers arrived and heard some of the shots, they approached on foot, when a 39 year old male suspect saw the officers, he dropped the rifle he was holding and then took off on foot. MPD Officers chased after him and after a brief foot pursuit, the male suspect was arrested. He is being tentatively charged with felon in possession of a firearm, 2nd degree reckless endangering safety, and resisting a police officer. There were no injuries to anyone, and there was no property damage located.

On 1-1-22, at approximately 12;11 am, MPD officers were dispatched to the 2000 block of Westbrook Ln reference multiple people hearing multiple shots fired. MPD Officers arrived on scene, and did locate multiple casings in the 2000 block of Westbrook Ln. There were no injuries reported, and no property damage was located at this time. This investigation is ongoing.

Madison police were sent to an eastside bowling alley early Monday morning in response to a bar fight.

Witnesses said an argument broke out around 12:05 a.m. between two men drinking at the bar. One of the men grabbed the other one before leaving the property.

The other man refused to leave the bar. He fell and hurt his head while being directed to the door by a bar employee.

That man was taken to the hospital and placed in protective custody.

The other man involved called the bar while police were there. He refused to share his location. Officers have probable cause to arrest him for misdemeanor disorderly conduct.

Arrested:
Briggham J. Huff
Robert E. Kubly
Details:
Madison police recovered several stolen bicycles on Sunday after a man noticed his was listed for sale on Facebook Marketplace.

The bike was stolen on New Year’s Eve when it was locked to a bike rack along the 900 block of Williamson Street. The owner believed it was worth around $7,000.

The owner made arrangements to buy back his bike on Sunday at a business along E. Washington Ave.

Officers with the North District Community Policing Team were positioned nearby and the owner was able to confirm the seller had his bike in the back of a U-Haul pickup truck.

Officers pulled the truck over. Both the driver and a passenger were uncooperative and provided officers with false information.

Robert E. Kubly and Briggham Huff, both of Madison, were arrested for receiving stolen property and resisting and obstructing an officer.

The men told police they were staying at a hotel on Hayes Road. Officers said two other stolen bikes were found inside their hotel room.

Madison police are investigating after a woman reported having a man wave a gun at her and drive into her vehicle.
 
The woman told police the man rammed into her car while at a business along the 2800 block of E. Washington Ave.
 
MPD has probable cause to arrest the man for other crimes in the city and he has a parole violation issued by another law enforcement agency.
 
Officers attempted to pull him over, but he sped away during these stops.
 
The woman later admitted the man did not ram her vehicle. She also told police she was not sure if the man was armed.

Multiple people called police after hearing gunshots on Madison’s east side Thursday morning.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 5600 block of Summer Shine Dr. around 9:25 a.m.
 
A man and woman were letting their vehicle warm up when they noticed a stranger get inside and drive away.
 
The man, Daniel Hayes, retrieved a gun from inside the home and fired multiple rounds at the vehicle. Hayes is a convicted felon and was arrested for being a felon in possession of a firearm, disorderly conduct while armed and a parole violation.
 
The stolen vehicle was found a short time later unoccupied along the 1600 block of N. Thompson Drive. A bullet hole was located on the passenger side of the vehicle.

A woman was sleeping feet away from where a bullet entered her home late Thursday night.

She and at least four others, including a baby, were inside a home along the 5200 block of Piccadilly Drive when the shots were fired.

People reported hearing the gunshots around 11:15 p.m.
A car parked in the area was also damaged by a bullet.

No injuries were reported.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

On 1/7/2022 at approximately 7:25 PM Madison Police were dispatched to the 200 block of Swanton Road for a subject with a non-life threatening gunshot wound.  This is believed to be a targeted incident and MPD is continuing to investigate.
On 1-8-22, at approximately 11:16 pm, an adult male was dropped off at a local hospital with a single gunshot wound. He is listed as critical but stable condition. This investigation is ongoing.

On 1-9-22, at approximately 3:48 am, MPD Officers were dispatched to an armed robbery of a cab driver.  A cab driver from a local cab company had picked up two males to be taken to a destination. While going to that destination, one of the suspect's in the back seat put a gun to the back of the cab driver and he was told to drive to the Thackeray Rd area. Once in the 1700 block of Thackeray Rd, one of the suspects demanded the cab driver's money and cell phone. After those items were given to the suspects, they both took off on foot.  Madison Police Officers responded to the area and a Madison K9 Officer did do a K9 track, but it did not lead to the suspects at this time. The cab driver was not injured. No further information at this time.

Madison police are investigating after two people were found unconscious in a parking lot on the city’s east side early Saturday morning.

An officer noticed the pair during a routine patrol around 3:30 a.m. near the Olbrich Park boat launch.

A man was found intoxicated inside a running vehicle.

Several containers of alcohol were also found inside the vehicle. He was taken to detox and later arrested on bail jumping charges.

A woman was found lying on the ground next to the vehicle wearing jeans and a short-sleeved top. The weather at the time police found her was around 11 degrees.

She was alive when officers arrived on scene but was later pronounced dead at a Madison hospital.

The woman and man are related. An autopsy is scheduled.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

On 1-10-22 at approximately 10:28 pm, MPD Officers were dispatched to the Mobil Gas Station in the 3100 block of North Sherman Ave, ref an armed robbery. The suspect came in the store to purchase an item, and when the suspect walked up to the counter, he pointed a gun at the employee, and demanded the money from the register. When the register opened, the suspect took the money and fled on foot. A Madison K9 Officer attempted a K9 track, but it did not lead to the suspects. The employee was not injured. No further information at this time.

Madison police are investigating after a man was punched in the face multiple times by a random man he met at a bar.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of State St. around 1:50 a.m. on Tuesday.

The victim said the suspect got upset when he was asked to stop flirting with the victim’s friend. The suspect punched the victim two or three times in the face.

The suspect was kicked out of the bar at this time, but waited outside until the victim and his friend left. 

The victim said the man punched him again and threatened him with a weapon. He called police after running to a nearby apartment building.

This investigation is ongoing at this time.

If you have any information that might assist in identifying the suspect please call Crime Stoppers at 266-6014 or submit a tip online at p3tips.com.

There is a large police presence in the area of Dryden and North Port Drives.

Madison police were conducting a high risk operation when a situation unfolded resulting in a critical incident.

This happened around 12:20 Tuesday afternoon.

One person was injured. 

The investigation remains active at this time.

MPD will update this incident report when more information is available.

A van left warming up early Wednesday morning was stolen from outside of an east side home.

Police were sent to a home along the 400 block of Walbridge Ave.

A man said he left his car unlocked for 20 minutes around 3:30 a.m. and returned to find it missing.

As a reminder, never leave your car unattended while warming up, even if it’s just for a few seconds.

Address: McKee Rd at Maple Grove Dr
Details: On 1/12/2022 at approximately 4:35 PM a woman was driving in the area of McKee Road at Maple Grove Drive when her front vehicle window was struck by a BB fired from another vehicle.  Officers locate the suspected vehicle and parties involved.  A juvenile male was arrested and another was given a citation from the incident.

On 1/12/2022 at approximately 2:10 PM Madison Police officers made contact with a subject who stated he was stabbed during an altercation in the 2100 block of Allen Blvd.  The male suffered a non-life threatening injury and MPD is continuing to investigate.

On 1/13/2022 at approximately 2:40 AM Madison Police were dispatched to the 10 block of N. Franklin Street for reports of shots fired.  Officers located multiple shell casings in the area but no signs of damage or injuries.

Madison police are investigating a shots fired incident on Madison’s north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 1900 block of Tennyson Lane shortly before 10 a.m. Thursday. 
 
A caller reported hearing three shots and provided police with a description of the alleged shooter. One person is in custody at this time.
 
Officers remain on scene. There does not appear to be any further danger to the public.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

On Thursday morning, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU), arrested a 29-year-old man for possessing child pornography.

Members of DOJ Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with MPD Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT), SWAT and SVU served a search warrant on Taylor G. Cahalan’s residence in the 1200 block of E. Washington Ave.

Cahalan has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

Madison police are investigating after a student was injured during a fight at La Follette High School on Thursday.
 
A 15-year-old suffered will likely need oral surgery for an injury to his mouth.
 
The victim told officers a group of students was making fun of him before things turned physical.
 
Video shows the victim and another teen preparing to fight one another. It also shows several teens punching or attempting to punch the victim.
 
Teachers and administrators quickly broke up the fight after it started.
 
Two teens involved face physical abuse to a child and disorderly conduct charges.
 
This investigation is ongoing.

Suspect: A thin African-American male, wearing a black hooded sweatshirt with the hood pulled up, acid washed jeans and sneakers with a red stripe.
Details: At approx 05:22am MPD Officers were dispatched to the 7500 Blk of Crawling Stone Rd. The victim's car was running unattended outside the vicitm's home. The victim confronted the suspect who was attempting to retreive the car keys from within the home via an open garage door. A physical confrontation occurred between the suspect and the victim and a round was fired off from the suspect who was armed. The suspect fled in an awaiting vehicle. The victim did not suffer any injuries. The investigation is ongoing at this time.

MPD officers were dispatched to a two-vehicle crash in the 6200 block of Schroeder Rd. Serious injuries were sustained by multiple occupants of one vehicle, and all occupants from both vehicles were transported to area hospitals. 

Investigative tasks continue at the crash scene, with traffic being diverted away from the affected block.

If anyone witnessed the crash or has video evidence or information about this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com

MPD officers were dispatched to the 10 block of Malibu Dr for reports of a subject who was stabbed inside a private residence. 

Upon arrival, officers located the victim, who sustained non-life-threatening injuries to her head and she was transported to an area hospital for treatment.

Officers located the suspect and arrested him on various charges related to the incident.

The parties involved know each other and there is no ongoing danger to the public.

MPD officers were dispatched to the McClellan Park neighborhood for several 911 callers who reported hearing gunshots nearby.

Many officers responded into the area and officers located evidence of gunfire, which included one occupied vehicle that had been struck by multiple rounds, and several spent bullet casings.

There was a heavy police presence in the neighborhood as officers stayed to speak to witnesses and searched for any additional property damage.

Evidence suggests that the shooter targeted the occupants in this struck vehicle, and there is no ongoing threat to the public.

Fortunately, there have been no reported injuries at this time.

The suspect vehicle was described as a white SUV with tinted windows.

If anyone has more information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com

Detectives in the Burglary Crime Unit have arrested a Madison man wanted in connection to several burglaries to area businesses.
 
Fontaine D. Dillard was arrested on Jan. 6 outside a home along the 1000 block of Gammon Lane.
 
Officers went to the home after identifying Dillard as a suspect.
 
He ran away from officers as they attempted to arrest him. Officers caught up with him a short distance later and he was taken into custody.
 
Dillard was wanted for breaking into multiple businesses on Applegate Court and Applegate Road.
?

Madison police are investigating an armed carjacking on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to a sandwich shop located along the 1700 block of Thierer Rd. around 11:30 a.m.

A woman was entering her car when someone stole her vehicle at gunpoint.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Address: 2700 and 2800 block of E Washington Ave
Details:
MPD officers responded to reports of two separate armed robberies which occurred within minutes of each other at businesses in the 2700 and 2800 blocks of E. Washington Ave, in which a weapon was threatened and implied, but never seen.
 
While responding, officers located and detained a subject matching the suspect description provided by witnesses as he was walking at E. Washington Ave. at Oak St. Further investigation and evidence collected at both scenes led to the subject’s eventual arrest on charges related to the armed robberies.
 
If anyone has more information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com.

A 24-year-old man died following a crash on Madison’s north side early Friday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 900 block of Northport Dr. around 1 a.m.

A vehicle caught on fire after crashing into a tree head-on.

The driver was the only person in the vehicle at the time of the crash. He was pronounced dead at a Madison hospital.

The investigation into this crash is ongoing at this time.

Address: Mineral Point Road and Island Drive
Details:
The MPD is investigating a hit-and-run crash after a vehicle struck a pedestrian who was crossing Mineral Point Rd near Island Dr, Saturday afternoon. The pedestrian sustained non-life threatening injuries and was transported to a hospital. 
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or on the web at p3tips.com.

On 1/22/2022 at approximately 8:40pm Madison Police were dispatched to the 1000 block of S Thompson Dr for a subject with a non-life threatening gunshot wound.   Officers provided medical aid and there is no indication of ongoing danger to the public from this incident.   MPD is continuing to investigate.

A man was run over by a delivery truck during a crash Wednesday morning in downtown Madison.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 300 block of W. Washington Ave. at 11:55 a.m.

The 62-year-old man was pronounced dead at the hospital.

He is known for picking up litter in the area where he was hit.

The driver of the vehicle is cooperating with police.

The investigation is ongoing.

Madison police are investigating after a man was shot multiple times on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1500 block of Troy Dr. around 12:30 p.m. Thursday.

The victim and suspect are known to one another. They were involved in an argument shortly before the shooting.

The victim was taken to the hospital and suffered non-life-threatening injuries. 

No arrests have been made at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

A Madison man was arrested for the fourth time for driving under the influence.

Officers were dispatched to the area of northbound Highway 51 and Voges Road around 5 p.m. on Wednesday. They arrived to find a car crashed into a tree.

The driver failed a field sobriety test. Heroin and drug paraphernalia were found on him and inside the vehicle.

Deshan Henderson, 50, of Madison, was arrested on multiple charges including 4th offense OWI, possession drug paraphernalia and for not having an ignition lock on the vehicle he was driving, which was required.

Madison police were sent to the Madison Plaza Hotel on Wednesday for a suspected overdose.
 
Officers were dispatched to the hotel at 7:20 p.m. after friends of the victim noticed she was turning blue and “slumped over” in a bed.
 
They told police the woman is a heroin user and believed the incident was an overdose.
 
The pair gave the woman multiple doses of Narcan and began CPR prior to the arrival of first responders.
 
Officers found drug paraphernalia in the room where the victim was located.
 
The victim and her friends were all staying at the hotel.

The man renting the room where the victim was found was arrested for possessing drug paraphernalia and bail jumping.

A man had a dumbbell thrown at him by a stranger while walking his dog Thursday evening.

Madison police were dispatched to the 2900 block of Waunona Way around 6:50 p.m.

The man was using a flashlight while walking his dog against traffic on the side of the road since there are no sidewalks in the area.

He told police a stranger pulled up next to him angry that he was shining a light at his vehicle.

The man told police he jumped out of the way when the stranger swung a dumbbell in his direction. The weight ended up hitting the victim on the back.

The suspect remains at large.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The victim reported that a woman he met about a week ago texted him to "meet up".  The victim met with the female "somewhere on Hammersley Road".  The woman exited the vehicle she was in from the front passenger seat.  The female walked up to the passenger side of the victim's car and asked him if he wanted to follow her back to her place.  As the victim and the female were talking, a male exited the driver's seat of the car and walked back to the victim's car.  The male stood by the front driver's side area and asked the victim if he had a cigarette and a light.  When the victim told the male that he did not smoke, the male suspect grabbed his watch.  A tussle ensued.  The male suspect then pulled out a silver handgun.  The victim told officers that he began to drive away when he heard a loud pop.  The victim reported that the male suspect shot a round into the car, through the driver's side window, which ended up being lodged in the front passenger door.  The victim was not struck by gunfire.

On Saturday, January 29, 2022, at approximately 9:00am, Madison Police were dispatched to a traffic crash at the intersection of Milwaukee St. and N. Stoughton Rd.  Initial reports included information that the victim of this crash was pinned in their vehicle.  The victim was extracted by MFD and later transported to a local hospital and remains in critical but stable condition.

The suspect from this crash fled the scene on foot and entered a home in the 10 block of Belmont Rd.  The suspect was observed acting erractically, arming himself with a golf club and knife.  The suspect was also overheard making threats to police.  Numerous police units responded to the area of the residence where multiple attempts were made to negotiate with the suspect.  Ultimately, the suspect did comply with police requests to turn himself in and the suspect did exit the home and surrendered without incident.  This investigation is on-going.

MPD officers were dispatched to the 4300 block of Britta Dr for several 911 callers who reported hearing gunshots nearby.

Many officers responded into the area and officers located evidence of gunfire, which included one occupied apartment that had been struck by a round, and several spent bullet casings.

There was a heavy police presence in the neighborhood as officers stayed to speak to witnesses and searched for any additional property damage.

Evidence suggests that this was a targeted shooting, and there is no ongoing threat to the public.

Fortunately, there have been no reported injuries at this time.

Madison police helped an elderly woman home after she was found wandering outside in slippers and a short-sleeved shirt.

The 94-year-old was confused and unsure of her location. She was found around 7:20 a.m. on Monday along the 300 block of Paterson St., roughly two blocks away from her home.

A responding officer recognized the woman and helped her home. 

Officers connected the woman with an agency in Dane County that specializes in providing health and safety services to senior citizens and adults in our area.

On 1/31/2021 at approximately 4:20pm, officers were dispatched to a shots fired incident in the 4600 block of Hayes Rd. Several shots were allegedly fired at the victim before the suspect(s) fled the area. The victim was contacted and no injuries were reported. The suspect(s) remain at large, with evidence pointing to this being an isolated incident. The investigation is ongoing.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

On 1-31-22, at approximately 8:10 pm, MPD Officers were dispatched to the 2800 block of E. Washington Ave for mutiple people calling reference hearing multiple shots fired. When officers arrived on scene, multiple shell casings were located in a parking lot in the 2800 block of E. Washington Ave. There were no reported injuries, and no property damage was located. This investigation is on going.

The Madison Police Department and EMS with the Madison Fire Department responded to reports of an injured 9-month-old Monday night.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building along the 7900 block of Tree Lane at 7:42 p.m.

The child did not survive.

An autopsy has been scheduled for later this week.

The investigation is active and ongoing at this time.

Address: Mineral Point Rd. at Island Drive
Details:
Four teenagers were arrested Tuesday afternoon after a crash involving a stolen vehicle and another car. 

The crash was reported around 1:15 p.m. at the intersection of Mineral Point Road and Island Drive. 

Witnesses said the teens ran from the car and entered a home along the 6400 block of Keelson Drive. The homeowner invited the teens inside and offered them a snack after noticing them near her backyard.

The teens eventually asked the woman for a ride after they noticed officers outside her home. As she opened her garage door, responding officers and a Madison K-9 unit ordered the teens out of her van.

Two loaded guns were left in the woman’s van. The homeowner was unaware of the crash or guns when she helped the teens.

Two 15-year-old males, a 16-year-old male and an 18-year-old male were taken into custody. One of the teens had multiple sets of car keys on him. All four were taken to the Madison Police Department’s Central District for questioning. 

During the drive downtown, the 16-year-old male slipped out of a handcuff and escaped from the squad car. The teen then ran toward West High School, but a Madison K-9 unit was able to track him down in a nearby backyard. 

Shorewood police and UWPD assisted with the search for the teen that escaped.

The teens were initially riding in a Honda Accord reported stolen in Dane County. The other car involved in the crash only contained the driver. She told officers she was not injured.

A 16-year-old suspect was arrested for operating a stolen vehicle (party to a crime), being an adjudicated juvenile in possession of a firearm (party to a crime), escaping arrest and resisting and obstructing officers. He was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

Tavion Flowers, 18, was arrested for operating a stolen vehicle (party to a crime) and carrying a concealed weapon (party to a crime). He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

Both of the 15-year-olds were arrested for operating a stolen vehicle (party to a crime) and possessing a firearm under 18 (party to a crime). They were taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

All four teens are from Madison.

There is an active officer-involved critical incident involving agents with the Wisconsin Department of Justice Division of Criminal Investigation.
