The incident happened around 8:20 a.m. near the intersection of American Parkway and Eastpark Blvd.
 
Officers with the Madison Police Department were assisting DCI agents with an investigation when the critical incident happened.
 
No Madison officers were injured during this incident.

Madison detectives recovered several items stolen during a burglary at a beauty store on the city’s south side.

Police were initially dispatched to the 1700 block of S. Park St. on Jan. 23 in response to a burglary. 

The victim reported cash, clothing and accessories were stolen from the store.

Working with the department’s Criminal Intelligence Section, detectives with the Burglary Crime Unit were able to identify a suspect from surveillance images.

Alejandro Reyes Mencia, 26, was arrested for burglary on Jan. 30.

The Madison Police Department is looking to identify two people seen on surveillance video stealing bicycles from an apartment building on the city’s east side.

The apartment building is located along the 1000 block of E. Washington Avenue.

Apartment staff contacted police after seeing the video. It shows two men entering the building’s bike storage facility multiple times in late December. The men are seen tampering with locks before taking the bicycles.

MPD is also looking into several self-report burglary cases involving residents of this building.

If you have any information about these thefts or can identify the people pictured, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, you can contact the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. People contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

The Madison Police Department assisted officers in Monona in investigating a bomb threat against One City Elementary School in Monona.

MPD K-9 Karl helped sweep the building for explosives Thursday morning. UWPD’s explosive detection dogs also assisted.

The threat was made over social media and was not deemed credible.

The Madison Police Department needs your help in locating wanted subject, Takenna R. Johnson. 

Johnson is wanted with regards to a disturbance in January. She is believed to be in the Madison area.

Anyone with information should contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.
 
Johnson is 19-years-old. She is described as 5'03", 180 lbs with black hair and brown eyes

A concerned passerby called police after a child was left alone in a running vehicle for more than 45 minutes on Saturday night.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building along the 2900 block of Coho St. around 10:45 p.m.

A woman called police after hearing the child cry out for help. The six-year-old girl told the woman her mother was inside visiting a friend. 

Responding officers found prescription drugs and a BB gun inside the vehicle. Both were within reach of the child. 

An adult family member arrived to pick up the child.

The child’s mother was arrested for child neglect, bail jumping and possession of a controlled substance.

Several callers reported hearing possible gunshots on Madison’s near east side early Sunday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 1900 block of Atwood Ave. shortly before 2 a.m.

Responding officers found no evidence of gunfire, but spent fireworks were found in a parking lot along the block.

Madison police are investigating after a snow blower was stolen during a burglary on the city's east side.

The burglary happened around 10:30 p.m. on Monday at a home along the 300 block of S. Walbridge St.

A man said he saw two people stealing the machine from his garage.  The man said his home was involved in another recent burglary.

The man began following the burglars in his truck and intentionally t-boned their car. A man and woman were injured in the crash and taken to the hospital. 

There is probable cause to arrest the man and woman for one count of burglary.

A driver told police he intentionally t-boned a vehicle during a crash that sent two people to the hospital Monday night.
 
Madison police were dispatched to the 4300 block of Milwaukee St. around 10:30 p.m. for a crash between a car and pickup truck.
 
A man said he saw two people steal a snow blower from his garage and began following them in his truck. He said he intentionally t-boned the driver’s side of their car as they went to turn onto Wittwer Rd.
 
A man and woman inside the car suffered serious, but non-life threatening injuries. Both were taken to the hospital.
 
The driver of the pickup, Corey B. Sanderson, 29, of Madison, was arrested on second-degree recklessly endangering safety charges.
 
Around the same time of the crash, Madison police received a report of a burglary at a home in the neighborhood. A snow blower was taken during this burglary.
 
Officers were able to determine the burglary was related to this crash. A snow blower was found in the trunk of the car that was involved. More information about the burglary can be found here.

Madison Police are investigating an armed robbery at a retail store on the city’s east side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 2200 block of S Stoughton Rd just after 9:00pm on Tuesday. 
 
The store employees stated the suspect pointed what appeared to be a handgun at the employees as they attempted to stop the suspect after exiting the store without paying for merchandise. 
 
Officers located a person of interest nearby, as well as the stolen belongings.  The investigation is ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to the area of S. Park Street and Beld Street reference a weapons violation (shots fired).  The caller reported to Dispatch that someone in a 4-door white sedan had shot at his vehicle.  The suspect was described as being a Hispanic male, in his 20's, wearing a white t-shirt.  The victim told officers that he and his female passenger were driving on the Beltline when they were involved in a road rage incident.  The victim reported that both he and the suspect exited the Beltline at Park Street.  The victim stated that while he and the other driver were stopped at the red light at Park Street and Badger Road, words were exchanged and the suspect threw orange soda into the victim's vehicle.  When the light turned green, the suspect and the victim continued driving north on Park Street.  The victim veered right from Park Street onto Beld Street while the suspect continued on Park Street.  The victim eventually got back onto Park Street from Beld Street and saw the suspect vehicle traveling behind him.  The victim did a U-Turn to try to get behind the suspect vehicle to get the license plate.  As the victim drove southbound, past the suspect, and the suspect continued northbound past the victim, the victim heard three "pops".  When the victim met with officers, they saw the victim's vehicle had been struck by three rounds - two in the windshield and one in the front, driver's side quarter panel.  The victim and his passenger were not injured.  Officers located three, 9mm casings in the road.

Officers were dispatched to JCPenney's, at East Towne Mall, reference a person with a gun.  Upon arrival, officers spoke with the victim, who is a worker with a team salting the parking lot and sidewalks of the mall.  The victim told officers that she was salting the sidewalk with a salt spreader that she was pushing.  The victim reported that while she was working, she saw a gray or silver Ford SUV driving towards her.  The victim told officers that as the vehicle passed, the three younger-looking occupants laughed at her and the front passenger pointed a gun at her.  The victim reported that the car left briefly, but then returned.  The car drove towards her again, but this time, the back passenger pointed a gun at her.  The victim was terrified and ran off to get her co-workers and call the police.

A postal delivery driver was arrested for driving while impaired while in uniform Thursday afternoon.
 
Officers pulled the man’s mail truck over around 4:30 p.m. along the 1900 block of Atwood Avenue.
 
Witnesses also saw the man stumbling and falling down in a nearby apartment building.
Responding officers said the man’s head was slumped down when they pulled him over.
 
Officers could smell the odor of intoxicants and said the man’s speech was slurred during their interaction with him.
 
The driver failed field sobriety tests. He also stated “it’s because I’m intoxicated” when he was unable to finish one of the tests.
 
Michael J. Weerts was arrested for first-offense OWI.

Madison Police Department’s Burglary Crime Unit (BCU) and Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT) worked a joint operation with the Dane County Sheriff’s Office to locate and arrest Colton S. Reindahl, 29, of Madison.

Reindahl was taken into custody along the 2500 block of E. Johnson St. on Feb. 8. Searches were conducted at an address along the 5100 block of Box Elder Rd. in the Town of Medina. Items of evidence were seized at both places.

A trailer stolen during a burglary in Madison was recovered, along with numerous stolen tools and accessories. 

Reindahl was taken to the Dane County Jail on a probation hold as additional charges were referred to the Dane County District Attorney's Office.

Address: 3500 block of Straubel Street, Madison, WI
Details:
On February 16, 2022 at 8:40pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 3500 block of Strauble Street regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

The victim was driving to an apartment complex in the area and upon arrival observed a Mercedes (white in color) was following him and then cut him off/cut in front of him.

From the suspect vehicle, multiple shots were fired at the victim with one round striking the hood of the victim's occupied vehicle and another round striking an unoccupied vehicle that was parked on the street.

The victim fled (driving) the area but the suspect vehicle continued to follow him until they turned off on a side street. Multiple Police Officers, a Sergeant, and an Investigator responded. The victim was not physically injured. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: 3000 block of Todd Drive, Madison, WI
Details:
On February 16, 2022 at 8:56pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 3000 block of Todd Drive regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired call. Multiple callers to 911 reported hearing several gunshots outside (one caller reported hearing 8-9 shots) with a suspect vehicle leaving the area.

Officers and a Sergeant checked but were unable to locate any shell casings, damaged homes, or damaged vehicles and there were no reports of injured persons.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: 400 block of Beld Street, Madison, WI
Details:
February 16, 2022 at 10:31pm, Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant were dispatched to the 1900 block of South Park Street regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

Multiple callers to 911 reported hearing several gunshots. Witnesses described a vehicle leaving the area after the shots as well. Officers checked the area and upon neighborhood canvass discovered an unoccupied vehicle, parked in the 400 block of Beld Street had been struck by at least one round. No damaged homes located and there were no reports of injured persons.

In total multiple pieces of evidence (including multiple shell casings from two different caliber firearms) were recovered. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: 700 block of West Olin Avenue, Madison, WI
Details:
On February 17, 2022 at 12:28am, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 1200 block of Colby Street regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

Multiple callers to 911 reported hearing several gunshots (7-10 shots described by 8 different witnesses) from the area. Officers and a Sergeant responded and checked the area. In the 700 block of Olin Street near the intersection of Whittier Street, several shell casings were recovered. Officers did not locate any damaged homes or damaged vehicles and there were no reports of injured persons. 

This is the fourth confirmed report of shots fired in Madison since the overnight shift began at 8:00pm. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

On February 17, at approximately 8:19pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 2000 block of Greenway Cross regarding a weapons offense – shots fired. 
 
Several callers to 911 reported hearing gunshots.  Officers did not locate any damaged property and there were no reports of injured persons.  Shell casings were recovered.    
 
Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Officers were dispatched to the 3000 block of Nessling Street reference a car vs. house crash.  Upon arrival on scene, officers learned that the driver, who is the registered owner of the vehicle, had fled the scene.  A passenger, who was not injured, remained on scene and spoke with officers.  MFD advised that there was no structural damage to the house.  Officers are looking for, but have not located the driver at this time.

Officers were sent to a residence in the 1000 block of Williamson Street reference what was originally reported to be a residential burglary.  The caller told Dispatch that a man had just broken into her home and he was sitting on her couch.  The caller was so frightened, she ran out of her house, to a park, and called the police and her grand-daughter.  When officers arrived, they learned that the victim's grand-daughter had chased the man out of her grandmother's residence.  Officers were able to locate the man just down the street.  The suspect, who was intoxicated, was charged with D.C. and Trespass to Dwelling and taken to the PSB.

A couple called police Saturday afternoon after returning home to find a burglar sleeping on their couch.

Officers were sent to a home along the 3000 block of Darbo Dr. around 2 p.m.

The couple said the suspect “made a mess” of their home. They also believed he took a shower and was wearing clothing that belong to them.

Officers ordered the suspect, Garrick P. Kautz, 29, out of the home with no issue.

Several items, including AirPods and cellphone charging bricks were found in clothing belonging to the suspect.

Kautz was arrested for burglary and misdemeanor bail jumping.

Madison police are investigating after a stolen vehicle was involved in a hit-and-run crash Saturday morning.

The crash happened around 7:50 a.m. along the 800 block of Jupiter Drive.

Witnesses said a vehicle crashed into a parked car, and a man who had been driving and woman ran away from the scene. Officers located them nearby.

The driver, Kenneth S. Holden, 30, of Westfield, had two warrants for his arrest. He was also arrested for resisting or obstructing and operating a motor vehicle without consent. He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The woman involved was warned for obstructing as she initially provided a false name to officers. She was released.

Several people called 911 after noticing a driver hitting curbs and going in and out of consciousness on Sunday.
 
Officers were dispatched to the area of Sherman Ave. and N. Few St. around 2:45 p.m. 
 
Officers said a vehicle was stopped in the middle of the intersection. 
 
The driver, Daniel Cypcar, 29, of Wisconsin Dells, was found semi-conscious and impaired.
 
Drug paraphernalia was also found in the vehicle.
 
Cypcar was arrested for 4th offense OWI.

Madison police arrested a man caught on surveillance video stealing an elderly woman’s medical supplies.

On Feb. 9, officers were dispatched to the Capitol Centre Apartments on W Dayton St. for a report of stolen packages stolen earlier that week.

A woman and her son reported packages containing medical supplies were taken. Apartment staff said they also received reports from other residents who had items missing from their delivered packages.

A patrol officer took their initial report and obtained video from the apartment building.

On Feb. 11, while on a patrol, that same officer noticed the suspect at the intersection of State St. and West Gilman St. 

James S. Watts, 51, was arrested for burglary, possession of cocaine and resisting and obstructing.

Two Madison police officers were kicked in the leg while responding to a domestic disturbance on the city’s east side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 4900 block of Lien Rd. around 8:25 p.m. on Monday.
 
Two males and two females were found inside the apartment. As officers were questioning the group, a 17-year-old male kept trying to leave the unit. Officers told him he could not leave and the teen became uncooperative. The 17-year-old physically resisted officers as they attempted to detain him in handcuffs.
 
While in handcuffs, the 17-year-old kicked two officers in their legs. He was charged with battery to a law enforcement officer and resisting.
 
This investigation into this case is ongoing at this time with MPD and pending DA action on the arrest.

The Madison Police Department SWAT team served a search warrant at a residence along the 8300 block of Blackwolf Drive.

The warrant service was conducted to assist the Violent Crimes Unit in continuing an investigation of a weapons offense that occurred Sunday evening.  

The subsequent search of the residence yielded three firearms and large quantities of ammunition, cash and drugs.

Two people were detained and potential charges will be pending further investigation.

If anyone has any information regarding the weapons offense, please contact the Madison Police Department Violent Crimes Unit tipline at 608-243-0550 or Madison Area CrimeStoppers at 608-266-6014.

Address: 7200 block of Mid Town Road, Madison, WI
Details:
On February 27, 2022 at 8:57pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 7200 block of Mid Town Road regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

Multiple callers to 911 reported hearing several gunshots (as many as 8) from the area. Officers and a Sergeant responded and checked the area. In the roadway several shell casings from different caliber handguns as well as a live round were recovered. Officers did not locate any damaged homes or damaged vehicles and there were no reports of injured persons. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Madison police are investigating a bomb threat at  Madison Memorial High School.
 
The threat was reported to police around 10:45 a.m. on Monday.
 
Students and staff were evacuated from the school. They were taken to West Towne Mall.
 
An MPD K-9 unit on the scene.
 
Northbound Gammon Rd. is closed at Mineral Point. Please use alternate routes.

On 2/28/2022, a citizen reported that they had likely been the victim of a phone fraud scam when someone claiming to be a federal agent called them to advise their bank accounts had been compromised. That fraudster sent the victim photographs of a fake badge and credentials to convince the victim of their (false) law enforcement status. The fraudster used some common techniques to convince the victim to purchase multiple thousands of dollars’ worth of gift cards and then share the gift card data via text message. The gift cards balances were depleted shortly thereafter. A short time later, the same victim received another phone call from someone falsely claiming to be a Madison police officer who was able to mimic the dispatch phone number so it appeared the phone call was legitimate.
 
The scam described above is one of many common fraud techniques that citizens experience across the country on a daily basis, both over the phone and online. Below are some tips to help you identify some red flags, which may help you avoid finding yourself in a similar situation:
 
-Consider third-party confirmation of information like officers’ names and incident report numbers. This can help you confirm whether or not you have spoken to a real law enforcement officer; and can be done simply, with a call to your local non-emergency dispatcher or by directly contacting the agency the suspected fraudster is claiming to be from.
 
-Gift cards are never a legitimate way to resolve any government-related financial obligations, and any suggestion otherwise should be considered suspicious.
 
-When selling personal belongings or goods in online marketplaces, be weary of potential buyers with new accounts and profiles. Also, be on the lookout when potential buyers create a manufactured sense of urgency when it comes to shipping the goods, when they offer you more than the price you’re asking, and when they try to suggest a payment transaction method that is more complicated than necessary. These three tactics are often employed together and will leave a victim without their goods and without payment.
 
-Fraudsters will often target online social apps and websites, and will spend time developing rapport with their victims before convincing them to send money. They oftentimes create that sense of urgency to get their victims to pay large amounts of money. Be cautious about persons you meet online until you’re confident you know exactly who they are.
 
-Law enforcement will never call you to tell you have a warrant for your arrest and to demand a monetary payment to resolve the warrant. If you have any questions as to whether or not such a warrant exists, call your local police agency.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: Milwaukee Street at E. Washington Avenue, Madison, WI
Details:
On February 28, 2022 at 9:34pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the area of Milwaukee Street and E. Washington Avenue regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

An off duty police supervisor called in the report of three shots and a vehicle speeding away, heading inbound on E. Washington Avenue. Officers checked the area but did not locate any spent casings, damaged homes, or damaged vehicles. There were no reports of injured persons as of this writing. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Madison police responded to two incidents at Vel Phillips Memorial High School on Tuesday.

Around 9:15 a.m., Madison police were called to investigate a false report of a weapon in a backpack. Madison Metropolitan School District administrators placed the school on a brief hold until officers determined the threat to be unsubstantiated.

Around 2 p.m., officers investigated a bomb threat at the school. School administrators received a call that a man was in the parking lot with explosives. MPD's bomb-sniffing dog did an entire sweep of the parking lot and nothing suspicious was located. 

Tuesday's events come one day after a bomb threat forced an evacuation at Memorial High School on Monday.

MPD officers are working closely with district administrators to keep students and staff safe. MPD is also working to determine the origin of these threats.

The investigation remains active.

A 38-year-old man was killed Tuesday afternoon during a tree trimming operation.

The man was electrocuted around 12:20 p.m. near the intersection of W. Broadway St. and Hoboken Rd. 

A company was trimming trees in the area when a branch got stuck on a power line. The 38-year-old man was near a company vehicle below where this happened.

The man was pronounced dead at the scene.

The investigation into this is ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to the area of 7900 Tree Lane and W. Oakbridge Court reference shots fired.  Multiple callers reported hearing 10-15 shots.  A caller from W. Oakbridge Court told Dispatch that his patio door was shattered by a bullet.  There are no known injuries to anyone at this time.  13 casings and 3 unspent rounds were located in the street.  A witness told officers that just before he heard the shots being fired, he heard two people, a man and a woman arguing.  Everyone that called 9-1-1 was contacted, however no one saw anything, they just heard the gunshots.

On Wednesday morning, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU) arrested a 50-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.

Members of the WI-DOJ, Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with MPD The Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT), SWAT, Central Community Police Team, and SVU served a search warrant on Robert A. Wilkins’ residence on the 10 block of Rustic Parkway.

Wilkins has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

On Wednesday morning, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU) arrested a 38-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.

Members of the WI-DOJ, Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with MPD The Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT), SWAT, Central Community Policing Team, and SVU served a search warrant on Theodore V. Tang’s residence on the 10 block of Star Fire Ct.

Tang has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

The Madison Police Department will continue to provide extra patrol this week at Vel Phillips Memorial High School due to recent threats.

MMSD received another threat Wednesday morning, which MPD determined was not to be credible. It followed previous threats on Monday and Tuesday.

Madison police take all threats seriously and are actively investigating these incidents. Multiple detectives have been assigned to this investigation. MPD is working to determine the source of the threats. 

Officers are also working with school administrators to keep students and staff safe.

Madison police investigated a report of an active school shooting at Leopold Elementary School around 3 p.m. on Wednesday.

Officers were able to quickly determine this was a false report. Students had already been dismissed from school at the time of the incident.

At this time it is not believed this incident relates to the recent threats at Vel Phillips Memorial High School.

MPD is working with school staff on this investigation. Officers are trying to determine the source behind the false report. 

This investigation remains active. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

MMSD received a direct call concerning a threat late Thursday morning. We did an exterior sweep of the school and nothing suspicious was located. We believe this threat is consistent with the others Memorial has been receiving.
 
Madison police continue to work with administrators at the Madison Metropolitan School District to keep students and staff safe. MPD will continue to provide extra patrols outside of Memorial HS. MPD investigators and MMSD staff are also having daily conversations regarding the threats.
 
A team of MPD detectives is still working to determine the source of the threats.

A man was arrested after he was found sitting overnight inside a running moving truck early Friday morning.
 
An employee called to report the incident around 1:30 a.m. The company is located along the 300 block of W. Beltline Highway.
 
The man also had a BAC of .289.
 
He initially gave police fake name, but officers were able to determine his identity at the Dane County Jail. They also learned he had three warrants for his arrest.
 
The man was arrested for trespassing, obstructing and bail jumping.

A couple called police early Friday morning after hearing a loud banging sound outside their east side home.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 6300 block of Sharpsburg Drive for a residential burglary shortly before 1 a.m.
 
The couple went to investigate and notice their sliding glass door was shattered during the incident.
 
no suspect was located. 
 
Nothing was taken from the victim’s home. The couple had a wooden dowel at the base of the door which prevented it from sliding open. This dowel likely kept the burglar outside of the home.

A Memorial student was arrested Thursday on two counts of Misuse of 911 after making false reports about a gun at Vel Phillips Memorial High School.
 
This student anonymously called police twice this week saying he could see an outline of a gun in a backpack. Both calls related to this named a specific student in possession of a firearm.
 
No weapon was ever located when police initially contacted the student at school.
 
The teen admitted to making the false 911 calls when contacted by officers later. 
 
The incident remains under investigation.
 
The case is being referred to the District Attorney’s office.

Detectives are actively investigating a recent string of bomb threat calls against Vel Phillips Memorial High School.
 
There continues to be a collaborative effort between the Madison Police Department and the Madison Metropolitan School District on efforts to keep students and staff safe. MPD appreciates the support of district leadership as we continue to investigate the source behind the other threats.
 
Madison police will continue to do extra patrols at Memorial High School on Friday. A team of MPD personnel have been at the school this week investigating the case.
 
The Madison Police Department recognizes the anxiety and stress these types of threats can create in our community and feel for the students and staff who have had their school week disrupted.
 
As of Friday, none of the threats have been deemed credible.

Two people were injured early Sunday morning during a drive-by shooting along the 6400 block of Odana Rd.

Officers were dispatched to a Madison hospital around 1 a.m. after two men arrived with gunshot wounds.

The victims said the shooting happened on Odana Road, shortly after they left a business on Grand Canyon Drive. They said another vehicle pulled up next to their car and began shooting.

Officers found shattered glass and eight shell casings along the 6400 block of Odana Road.

A 34-year-old man and a 35-year-old man both suffered gunshot wounds. Their injuries are not considered life-threatening. 

The vehicle they drove to the hospital was heavily damaged during the shooting.

No arrests have been made at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is looking for assistance in locating a missing 13-year-old. 

Sebastian Murray was last seen on March 1 along the 1000 block of N. Thompson Dr. wearing a red mask, grey hoodie, black coat and black jeans.

Murray has ties to Illinois. 

Anyone with information about Murray’s whereabouts is asked to call the Madison Police Department.  A photo of Murray is attached to this release.

A man was arrested for attempted robbery and attempted sexual assault after holding a woman by gunpoint inside a convenience store bathroom early Saturday morning.

Officers were called to the Kwik Trip along the 1600 block of Stoughton Rd. around 2:15 a.m. 

The victim said a man crawled into her stall and threatened her with a gun. He demanded she perform a sex act on him when he did not receive any money.

A store employee, thinking something was amiss, announced “maintenance” to figure out what was happening.

At that point, the man left the store and began walking away from the area.

The victim was able to provide police with a description of the suspect. 

Officers located the suspect walking behind a fast food restaurant along the 3900 block of E. Washington Ave.

Demarcus C. Willingham, 18, of Madison, was taken into custody without incident. 

Officers found a BB gun on him at the time of his arrest.

Willingham was arrested for attempted armed robbery, attempted sexual assault, disorderly conduct while armed and false imprisonment.

Madison police are investigating a robbery that happened early Wednesday morning on the city’s east side.
 
A man called police around 12:40 a.m. from a gas station along the 3000 block of E. Washington Ave.
 
The man stopped there to use an ATM and was walking home when he was attacked.
 
The suspect punched and kicked the man before breaking his phone and stealing $100.
 
The 45-year-old victim returned to the gas station to call police.
 
No arrests have been made.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The male victim and the female victim went to the Mobil Gas Station, 3019 E. Washington Avenue.  When they entered the store, they saw a male and a female whom they described as acquaintances. The victims told Officers that the conversation with the acquaintances was odd and that it seemed like they were stalling.  The male victim told Officers that he forgot his money in his car, so he exited the store to retrieve it.  The male victim reported that while he was outside, a car pulled up. The male victim reported that one of the occupants in the car got out and began pistol whipping him.  Another occupant exited the car and helped the suspect with the gun beat the male victim.  He then entered the store, where he beat up the female victim with help from the two acquaintances.  The female victim was not hit with a gun, just fists.  $50 was taken from the female victim.  Both the male victim and the female victim were seen at the Hospital.  The male victim needed several stitches for lacerations to his head.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a possible arson involving a Ukrainian flag.

A woman called police around 7:30 a.m. on Monday after she noticed her flag was missing and burnt debris in her yard. The woman said the debris was located where her flag was hanging.

The woman last saw the flag around 7 p.m. on Sunday.

The woman lives along the 1700 block of Winnebago St.
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

A 14-year-old was cited for operating while under the influence following a two-vehicle crash Tuesday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 300 block of N. Sixth Street around 9:45 p.m.

They arrived to find a car pinned against a retaining wall of a home and an SUV nearby with heavy front-end damage.

A 21-year-old woman was driving the SUV. She said the other driver ran a stop sign and t-boned her vehicle.

The 14-year-old admitted to driving the other vehicle. A 16-year-old male was riding in the front passenger seat.

Two adult women, 27 and 38-years-old were in the backseat. The car belonged to the 38-year-old woman.

The women live in the same apartment complex as the teens.

The car was full of open intoxicants at the time of the crash.

The Madison Fire Department and EMS personnel also responded to this crash. They took all five people involved in the crash to the hospital. None of their injuries appeared to be life-threatening.

The 14-year-old was cited for first-offense OWI and operating without a license.

The teens were released to their mothers.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

A woman was taken to the hospital early Tuesday morning following a stabbing at the city’s tiny-home encampment.

Officers were dispatched to the 3200 block of Dairy Drive shortly before 4 a.m. 

A woman walked up to Madison Fire Station 14 to report the stabbing.

The suspect appears to have used a screwdriver in the attack. A 29-year-old woman was taken to the hospital. Her injuries are not life-threatening.

The victim was visiting a friend and does not live at the encampment.

The suspect, a 52-year-old woman, lives at the encampment but left the area before police arrived. No arrests have been made at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

The city of Madison secured the Dairy Drive campground last year for people in the community who are experiencing homelessness and not using the shelter system.
Officers are investigating a traffic incident involving multiple vehicles that occurred on the 5400 block of Raymond Road. The investigation is ongoing.

Address: 5000 block of Eagle’s Perch Drive, Madison, WI
Details:
Madison Police Officers are dispatched to the 5000 block of Eagle’s Perch Drive for reports of shots fired. Multiple people called 911 to report shots fired and a vehicle speeding away; heading eastbound on Eagle’s Perch Drive.

Officers and a Sergeant checked the area and located at least one spent shell casings near the roadway. There are no reports of damaged homes, damaged vehicles, or injured persons at this time. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a burglary to an auto body shop on the city’s south side.

The burglary was reported shortly before 9 a.m. Wednesday at Transmission Latino, which is located along the 1800 block of Park St.

The owner left the building around 9:30 p.m. on Tuesday and arrived to find the front door damaged Wednesday morning.

Security cameras were also damaged in the incident. The burglar stole money inside the business.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man was arrested late Wednesday night for stealing mail.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of W. Dayton St. shortly before 11 p.m. on Wednesday.

Lots of pieces of mail, coming from various addresses in the Madison area, were found in the suspect's backpack. Stolen credit cards and checks written to other people were also found inside.

The suspect was arrested for theft of mail, possession of drug paraphernalia and a probation violation.

Address: Ellen Avenue at Starker Avenue, Madison, WI
Details:
On March 17, 2022 at 10:57pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the area of Ellen Avenue and Starker Avenue regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

The victim was out walking her dog and stopped momentarily at the North/East corner of Ellen Avenue and Starker Avenue when a 4-door sedan style vehicle, tan in color pulled up to her. The vehicle was occupied by at least two individuals, one of whom shouted an expletive regarding the victim’s dog before multiple shots from an airsoft gun or possibly bb gun style of weapon was fired at her. Approximately 20-25 of these shots were fired in quick succession and the vehicle quickly drove off. It is not believed that the victim or her dog were struck by the projectiles.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Arrested:
14-year-old male
15-year-old male
16-year-old male
Avoin K. Howard, 18
Richard M. White Jr., 17
Selena E. Roder, 17
Address: Schroeder Rd./S. Whitney Way and Beltline Hwy
Details:
Six teens were arrested Friday afternoon after crashing a stolen vehicle on the Beltline and running from the scene into traffic.

Madison officers were notified of a stolen vehicle in the area of Schroeder Rd. and S. Whitney Way around 3:30 p.m.

The driver of the vehicle sped away onto the eastbound Beltline after spotting officers.

While a security app through the vehicle provided updates on its location, the stolen auto crashed into another vehicle on the Beltline near Monona Dr. Six teens ran from the stolen vehicle, jumped a median and went into westbound Beltline traffic.

Five of the teens were quickly taken into custody, but one jumped off the Yahara Area Bridge into the marsh below.

Due to inclement weather, finding the 14-year-old became a top priority for officers. The Madison Fire Department and the Dane County Sheriff’s Office provided several boats and thermal imaging was used to locate the teen. It’s believed the teen was in the marsh for more than 90 minutes. 

He was immediately placed in a warm squad car and transported to a local hospital to be checked out.

The teen was eventually taken to the Juvenile Reception Center operating a motor vehicle without consent (party to a crime) and resisting arrest.

A 15-year-old male and a 16-year-old male were also taken to the Juvenile Reception Center for operating a motor vehicle without consent (party to a crime) and obstructing. 

Avoin K. Howard, 18, was determined to be the driver of the stolen vehicle. He was taken to the Dane County Jail for operating a motor vehicle without consent, obstructing and cited for hit-and-run.

Richard M. White Jr. and Selena E. Roder, both 17, were taken to the Dane County Jail for operating a motor vehicle without consent (party to a crime) and resisting arrest.

This incident caused long traffic delays on the Beltline during rush hour. 

The vehicle involved was reported stolen out of Sun Prairie around 3 p.m. on Friday.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating an armed robbery that occurred Thursday afternoon at a restaurant on the city's west side.

Officers were dispatched to the 4500 block of Verona Rd around 2:20 pm. 

An employee told police a man entered the store and demanded money. The employee said a knife was brandished and money was turned over to the suspect.  The suspect then fled the scene. 
 
The investigating is ongoing.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

A Madison man was arrested twice this week for a string of burglaries on the city's south and north sides.

The Madison Police Department's Burglary Crime Unit has been investigating these incidents since November 2021.

Several of them occurred at Subway restaurants or other bars in the city.

Detectives were able to identify a suspect during their investigation and a search warrant was served at his home on Mallard Lane on March 21.

The Burglary Crime Unit, Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team, Forensic Services Unit, Violent Crime Unit, North Police District and SWAT Team resources helped serve the warrant. 

Michael Pisano,43, of Madison, was taken into custody on multiple charges of Burglary, Attempted Burglary, Criminal Damage to Property and Felony Bail Jumping charges.

Several evidentiary items connecting Pisano to the burglaries were found inside his home as well as drug paraphernalia.

A woman inside the home was arrested on an unrelated warrant. 

After Pisano was released from custody, detectives learned of another burglary that had occurred prior to his arrest. Pisano was once again contacted near his residence and arrested on an additional burglary charge.

The Madison Police Department is currently investigating a suspicious object in the 6600 block of McKee Road.  Please avoid this area if possible.

Further updates will be provided when available.

At approximately 10:00 pm, the scene was cleared, and back open to the public.

The Madison Police Department is investigating an arson at the city's tiny-home encampment.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 3200 block of Dairy Drive around 1:20 p.m. after a man lit his cabin on fire.
 
The suspect is a resident of the encampment. He has not been arrested at this time.

No injuries were reported. No other cabins were damaged during the incident.
 
The fire is being investigated as arson.
 
Several officers and the Madison Fire Department remain on scene.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a shooting along the 200 block of S. Carroll St.

One person was taken to the hospital with a gunshot wound.

The shooting happened outside of the Dane County Jail and across the street from the City-County Building.

Multiple rounds were fired around 5:10 p.m.

No one is in custody yet.

Officers were dispatched to Target, 201 Junction Road, reference a male in his teens, wearing only his underwear, who was randomly pushing and punching customers and store employees in the store.  One caller reported that the suspect was not saying anything, but that he was breathing very heavily as if he was panting.  When Officers contacted the man, he was still out of control and uncooperative.  One Officer deployed his ECD (electronic control device). Two other Officers attempted to deploy their ECDs, but the suspect grabbed them.  The suspect also punched one of the Officers in the head.  The suspect will be charged with 8 counts of Disorderly Conduct, 7 counts of Battery, 2 counts of Disarming a Police Officer and 1 count of Battery to LEO.

Officers were dispatched to the Capital Petro Mart, 4601 Verona Road, reference an armed robbery.  The clerk reported that the male suspect came up to the counter to buy some vape products and a pack of Newport 100's.  The clerk put the items on the counter and told the man how much he owed ($50.75).  The suspect then told the clerk to give him money or he was going to shoot him.  The clerk backed up and told the suspect that he was going to call the police.  The suspect then displayed a knife, took the items from the counter and ran out of the store.

Two callers reported hearing shots fired. Ten casings were located in the 4800 block of Tokay Boulevard; two casings were located in the 4400 block of Tokay Boulevard.  No signs of property damage and no reports of injuries.

The persons of interest taken into custody for Wednesday’s homicide were involved in a hit-and-run crash shortly after the fatal shooting.

A man was driving near S. Park Street when his vehicle was struck.

Damage to his vehicle was minor.

No injuries were reported.

Multiple people reported hearing gunshots early Sunday morning on the city’s north side.
 
Officers were sent to the 2300 block of Brentwood Pkway around 4:45 a.m.
 
An officer with the Maple Bluff Police Department noticed a vehicle speed away from the area.
 
No shell casings or other evidence of shots being fired were located.

Six teens were arrested Saturday morning after a vehicle was stolen during a residential burglary.

Officers were initially dispatched to a home along the 9600 block of Shadow Ridge Trail around 7:15 a.m. A man called to report that someone entered his house sometime overnight and stole his vehicle.

Three hours later, dispatchers received a call about a vehicle that lost control and went off the road on the eastbound onramp to the Beltline from S. Gammon Road.

The vehicle was the same vehicle stolen earlier in the morning from Shadow Ridge Trail.

A group of teens was spotted running south and away from the scene. Most were taken into custody nearby. A 14-year-old male was taken into custody in West Towne Mall after running from police.

A 14-year-old, a 16-year-old male, and a 16-year-old female were taken to the Juvenile Reception Center. The female involved admitted to driving and causing the crash.

A 16-year-old male had a BB gun on him at the time of the arrest. He was released to an adult.

The two other teens released to an adult were a 15-year-old male and a 17-year-old male.

The charges ranged from burglary to operating a motor vehicle without consent to unrelated juvenile warrants. 

The investigation into this incident is ongoing at this time.

On April 4, 2022 at approximately 1:44pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to Goodyear Auto Service located at 3773 E. Washington Avenue after a subject walked into the business, placed a 22 inch machete on the counter, and threatened to kill the employees who were present.

The employees retreated to the garage area and called 911. Madison Police Officers quickly arrived on scene and the subject yelled repeatedly for police to shoot him. While Officers were attempting to apprehend the suspect, he physically resisted arrest resulting in one Lieutenant and one Sergeant being injured. The injuries sustained by the Lieutenant and Sergeant did not require hospilization. The machete was recovered nearby. 

Modou Bah was ultimately taken into custody and transported to the Dane County Jail. He has been charged with Resisting Arrest (x 1), Disorderly Conduct while Armed (x 4), and Bail Jumping (x 9) due to his nine different Open Cases since March of 2020.

Two callers reported seeing 4 males walking and then seeing one of the men pull out a gun and fire 7 shots into the air.  The men were last seen running towards N. Sherman Avenue past the Willy Street Co-op.  Seven, 9mm casings were located in the 2700 block of Dryden Drive.

A 14-year-old male was arrested on arson charges for starting a fire at Vel Phillips Memorial High School on Tuesday.

Officers were dispatched to the school around 1:25 p.m.

Video shows the teen using a lighter to set a plastic placard on fire while it was attached to a wall by a classroom door. 
 
The fire caused around $150 in damages to the door.

The teen is also accused of setting two separate bathroom trash cans on fire at the school back in March.

He was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center. 

The investigation is ongoing.

On 4/6/2022 at approximately 4:48 pm MPD Officers were dispatched to Monroe St at Edgewood Ave after a pedestrian walking in the crosswalk was struck by a vehicle.  The vehicle fled the scene prior to police arrival. The pedestrian sustained non-life threatening injuries and was transported to a hospital.
 
Officers are actively investigating the incident.
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or on the web at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department investigated reports of a weapons offense along the 3900 block of Regent Street around 10:30 a.m.

Officers spoke with the involved parties and found no violation of law.

Due to information received during our response, officers encouraged MMSD to place a brief lockdown on Vel Phillips Memorial High School and Jefferson Middle School. This was quickly replaced by a lockout status.

MMSD sent a letter home to Memorial families explaining the differences between a lockdown and a lockout. 
 
Again, our investigation shows no violation of law took place Thursday morning.?

Address: E. Washington Ave. at Portage Rd.
Details:
The Madison Police Department seized multiple illegal guns during three separate traffic stops this past week.

One of those incidents happened around 1:15 a.m. Thursday at the intersection of E. Washington Ave. and Portage Road.

An officer observed bad driving behaviors and conducted a traffic stop.

The driver did not have a driver's license and admitted to having marijuana in the car.

The 24-year-old Mississippi man also admitted to having a gun in the vehicle near the marijuana.

He is not a concealed carry holder and was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The Madison Police Department seized multiple illegal guns during three separate traffic stops during the past week.

One of the incidents happened on April 1 around 7:30 p.m. along the 600 block of W. Washington Ave.

Officers were monitoring a vigil when they observed a man wanted for a weapons violation in Dane County.

The man, Christopher Tibbs, 32, of Madison was taken into custody during a traffic stop away from the vigil.

The driver of the car, Sean Johnson, 31, of Madison, was also taken into custody after a loaded gun was found under his seat.

Johnson was arrested for being a felon in possession of a firearm, carrying a concealed weapon and posessing a controlled substance. 

Tibbs was arrested for the probable cause out of Dane County, possesion with intent to deliver cocaine, posession with intent to deliver heroin, possession with intent to deliver marijuana and posession with intent to deliver narcotics.

A photo of the gun seized during this incident is attached to this release.

Address: E. Washington Ave. and Aberg Ave.
Details:
The Madison Police Department seized multiple illegal guns during three separate traffic stops this past week.

One incident happened around 10 a.m. on March 31 at the intersection of E. Washington Ave. and Aberg Ave.

Officers were working a traffic stop granted and pulled over a vehicle going 60 mph in a 35 mph zone.

While talking to the driver, an officer notices the passenger is struggling to hide a gun with his leg.

Both people were removed from the car.

A loaded gun, marijuana and other items associated with drug trafficking were found inside the vehicle. 

Jayden Wilson, 17, of Madison, was the passenger in the vehicle. He was arrested for possession with intent to deliver marijuana, possession of narcotics and carrying a concealed weapon.

Damari Thomas, 22, of Madison, was driving the vehicle. He was arrested with posession with intent to deliver marijuana, posession of narcotics and a probation hold. 

Both were taken to the Dane County Jail.

Address: 4200 block of Doncaster Drive, Madison, WI
Details:
On April 7, 2022 at approximately 8:25pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 4200 block of Doncaster Drive regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

Multiple callers to 911 called to report hearing 6 or more shots near Rocky’s Liquor and two vehicles speeding away from the area. Officers checked the area but did not locate any spent casings, damaged homes or damaged vehicles. There were no reports of injured persons. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: 4300 block of De Volis Parkway, Madison, WI
Details:
On April 7, 2022 at approximately 9:25pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 4300 block of De Volis Parkway regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call. The shots appeared to be coming from the area of Britta Parkway.

Multiple callers to 911 called to report hearing multiple shots fired and a vehicle speeding away from the area. Officers checked the area but did not locate any spent casings, damaged homes or damaged vehicles. There were no reports of injured persons. 

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

On 4-10-22, at approximately 3:17 am, Madison Police responded to multiple calls of shots fired in the 4300 block of Britta Parkway. When officers arrived on scene, the officers discovered several shell casings, an unoccupied car that was struck, and an occupied residence that was also struck in the 4300 block of Britta Parkway. There were no injuries to anyone in the residence. This investigation is continuing.

On April 11, 2022 at 10:06pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 2326 Allied Drive regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

Multiple citizens called 911 to report multiple shots fired from the area of 2326 Allied Drive. Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant responded and located 10 spent shell casings on the pavement in the parking lot. A thorough canvass revealed that no vehicles or residences were hit or damaged. At this time, there are no reports of any injured persons and the investigation is ongoing.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

A woman was entering an apartment building early Tuesday morning when she was attacked and sexually assaulted by a stranger.

?Officers were dispatched to Brandie Rd. around 12:30 a.m.

The victim was slammed to the ground inside a foyer area of the building moments before the assault happened.

A neighbor called police after hearing the victim screaming for help.

The neighbor also was punched by the suspect when she intervened and tried to prevent him from running away.

A K9 unit was brought in to assist in the search for the suspect.

At this time, no one is in custody for this crime.

Detectives are actively reviewing digital evidence and witness statements.

The suspect is described as a Black male in his 20s with a slender build.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014.

The investigation is currently ongoing and no further information will be released at this time.

The Madison Police Department was dispatched to Sherman Middle School in reference to a fight.

Officers arrived around 12:30 p.m. to find a dozen students involved. 

School staff and officers were able to separate the group.

A student and MMSD staff member were injured. A couple of officers also suffered minor injuries.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

On 4/15/2022, at around 5:30PM, Madison Police Officers responded to the McDonald's restaurant located at 1102 Regent Street for a report of an armed robbery. There were no reported injuries and there is no one in custody at this time. If you have any information regarding this incident please contact the Madison Police Department, or, Madison Area Crime Stoppers athttps://www.madisonareacrimestoppers.org. People reporting through Crime Stoppers may be eligible for a cash reward."

On 4/15/2022, at around 8:50PM, Madison Police Officers responded to the Walgreens located at 311 E Campus Mall for a report of an armed robbery. There were no reported injuries and there is no one in custody at this time. If you have any information regarding this incident please contact the Madison Police Department, or, Madison Area Crime Stoppers athttps://www.madisonareacrimestoppers.org. People reporting through Crime Stoppers may be eligible for a cash reward.

Officers were dispatched to the 1900 block of Northport Drive reference a female in the parking lot who had been stabbed.  Dispatch also received a phone call from a man who reported that a woman who had entered his apartment had been stabbed, but that she had since left his apartment.  Officers learned that the female suspect, who was the one that was stabbed, came to the apartment to settle a beef about something that was said at a birthday party.  The male resident, who is one of the victim's, heard this female outside of his apartment door.  He opened the door and pushed her away, telling her to leave.  The female suspect was with her brother, the second suspect, in the hallway.  The brother entered the apartment started fighting with the male resident while the female suspect ran into the apartment and attacked the female resident.  The male resident wanted to help his girlfriend, but he could not get away from the male.  He was able to grab a kitchen knife with one hand, while still fighting with the male suspect.  The male victim began swinging the knife and was able to stab the female in the right side of her abdomen and her right elbow.  The female suspect and the male suspect then ran out of the apartment.  The female suspect's injuries are not life-threatening. Once she is released from the hospital, she will be arrested for Damage to Property, two counts of D.C., Battery and Residential Burglary.  The male suspect was charged with Disorderly Conduct.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a burglary at a building on the city’s northeast side.

Officers were dispatched to the 5600 block of Manufacturers Dr. around 7 p.m. on Sunday.

A realtor was fixing a broken window when they heard a door slam inside.

The building is supposed to be empty and unoccupied.

Lights were turned on in parts of the building and random items were found inside that were not previously there.

The building was cleared.

No one was located.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department needs the public’s help in locating a man and woman who failed to appear in court for charges related to the death of their infant.
 
There are active warrants out for Arkeem Ashley, 26, and Esthefania Martinez, 22, both of Madison. Photos of both are attached to this release. 
 
The pair have ties to other states and may no longer be in the area.
 
Their baby died in May of 2020.  The Dane County Medical Examiner’s office ruled the cause of death to be a homicide by blunt injuries of the head.
 
Anyone with information is encouraged to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014. Tips can be left anonymously as well via p3tips.com.

Address: E. Washington Ave. at Schmedman Ave.
Details:
A mother and son called to report they were shot at with a pellet gun while on a walk Sunday evening.
 
The pair said the incident happened around 7:45 p.m. as they were walking on E. Washington Ave. near Schmedman Ave.
 
The pair said someone inside an older blue vehicle stuck a firearm through a back window and began firing at them.
 
Both said they were hit by pellets, but did not feel any pain. Nor did they report any injuries. 

Officers were unable to locate any pellets in the area.
 
Video from nearby businesses will be reviewed this week.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.?

Madison police were dispatched to a clinic on the city’s east side early Saturday morning.

The clinic is located along the 3100 block of E. Washington Ave.

Shortly before 8 a.m., clinic staff called police to report two men fighting outside. One of the men was armed with a baseball bat.

Staff separated the men until officers arrived.

One of the men had a head injury and was evaluated by officials with the Madison Fire Department.

The two men are known to one another. 

Jesse J. Ortega, 35, of Monona, was arrested for 2nd-degree recklessly endangering safety.

Madison officers administered Naloxone and helped revive a man late Friday night.

Officers assisted other first responders around 10 p.m. at a restaurant along the 4500 block of E. Towne Blvd.

A bartender told police the 34-year-old man had just ordered a drink when he passed out.

The man was taken to a nearby hospital after he was revived by the Naloxone.

Several people reported hearing gunshots on the city’s far east side Monday night.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 5000 block of Piccadilly Drive around 9:45 p.m.
 
Callers reported hearing around 5-6 shots.
 
Officers did not find any casings or signs of property damage in the area.
 
No injuries were reported.

Madison police are investigating after someone stole two bikes on back-to-back days from the same apartment building.

The building is located along the 1800 block of E. Washington Ave.

A 14-year-old reported the theft on Monday.

He told police he locked his bike up in the bike storage area Saturday afternoon and returned to find it missing.

Video shows a man hopping the fence of this area on Sunday. He used bolt cutters to remove the teen’s bike.

The same man returned the following day to steal another bike from the area.

As of now, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man was arrested for trespassing after entering the building on Monday night.

An officer on patrol noticed a man enter through the broken window around 7:20 p.m.

Additional officers arrived on scene and set up a perimeter around the building.

The man tried running away but was quickly taken into custody.

The man had a Glock magazine on him at the time of his arrest, but no gun was located in his backpack or car.

Jacobye B. Green, 19, was arrested for trespassing and resisting arrest.

This afternoon around 12:30PM, Madison police were dispatched to the 700 block of Braxton Place in reference to a report of a male who had been stabbed.  Officers responded to the area and located the apparent victim, rendering aid at the scene.  The victim was transported to a nearby hospital and his condition was stabilized.  A person of interest was detained pursuant to this investigation, and has been arrested on un-related charges.  Police processed the crime scene and canvassed the area for other evidence and witnesses.  A weapon was recovered and there is no ongoing threat to the public from this incident. 
 
If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345.  If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or on the web at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department has taken a suspect in custody in connection with two recent armed robberies in the city.

The first robbery happened around 5:30 p.m. at the McDonald’s located along the 1100 block of Regent St.

During this incident, a man displayed a gun and demanded employees give him money from the register. 

The man left the area before officers arrived.

No injuries were reported.

Later that evening, officers responded to another armed robbery at the Walgreens located on E. Campus Mall.

During this incident, a male suspect matching the description of the previous incident displayed a gun in the waistband of his pants and demanded the store clerk “give him all the money.”

The man was again left the area prior to police arrival.

No injuries were reported in this case.

Detectives were able to quickly identify a suspect in this case.

That suspect, Scott C. Tolliver, 42, of Madison, was taken into custody Tuesday afternoon by the Central District Community Policing Team.

Tolliver will be charged with two counts of armed robbery and felony bail jumping.

On 4-9-22, a new construction site at 1859 Aberg Ave was burgled.  A local construction company was victim to stolen tools, equipment, and other items.  Video surveillance showed the crime, as well as additional footage that began to record the suspect - as the suspect had stolen the wireless video camera itself.  The video camera continued to film the suspect as he fled the scene and subsequently conducted illegal business.

MPD's Burglary Crime Unit is looking for the public's help in any information about this crime and locating Shane W Manchester.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Arrested:
Daniel N Hynes 5-26-72
Burglary and DOC Hold
Details: On 4-9-22 at approximately 5:49am, at Sequoia restaurant at 1843 Monroe St, a suspect entered the business and stole money.  The suspect was captured on video, and was subsequently identified as Hynes.  On 4-18-22, MPD’s Burglary Crime Unit and GNCAT unit arrested Hynes and recovered evidence from his home related to the crime.  He was lodged at the Dane County Jail.

On 4-15-22 at approximately 12:45am, at Capilia Hair Salon at 1334 Applegate Rd, a suspect entered the business by force and stole items.  The suspect was captured on video.

On 4-19-22, officers from MPD’s GNCAT unit apprehended Dillard.  He was lodged at the Dane County Jail.

MPD’s Burglary Crime Unit had arrested Dillard in a series of burglaries in this same area (and this same business) in late 2021 and early 2022. 

Dillard was out on bond in those cases when this new crime was committed.

Address: 500 block of Bram Street, Madison, WI
Details:
On April 23, 2022 at 9:57pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Bram Street regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

In this case, the complainant heard approximately 10 shots coming from the south of their residence. A police canvass revealed that no vehicles or residences were hit or damaged. At this time, there are no reports of any injured persons. The investigation is ongoing.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: 5400 block of Congress Avenue, Madison, WI
Details:
On April 24, 2022 at 12:01am, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 5400 block of Congress Avenue regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

In this case, the complainant heard approximately 10-15 gunshots coming from the area of Congress Avenue/Burke Road. A police canvass revealed that no vehicles or residences were hit or damaged. At this time, there are no reports of any injured persons. The investigation is ongoing.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

At approximately 12:36pm Madison Police Officers responded to the 100 block of Lansing St for a domestic incident.  The homeowner stated upon returning home he unexpectedly found an individual known to him inside his home.  The homeowner was fearful due to a recent fallout and called officers.  Officers learned of a recent firearm purchase and utilized several Officers and Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) personnel to investigate. Upon entering the home the individual was found deceased from an apparent suicide using a firearm. There is no current threat to the public and the investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a suspicious death involving a toddler on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the 5600 block of Schroeder Road around 2:45 a.m.

A critically injured toddler was located at the scene.  The 20-month-old child was taken to the hospital and later pronounced dead.

An adult woman was also injured during this assault, which officers believe was domestic-related. She is being treated at a local hospital.  There is no on-going threat to the public at this time.

Detectives are investigating this case as a possible homicide, however, the medical examiner will determine the cause of death.

A person of interest, an adult male, was taken into custody immediately by police. 

The investigation into this incident is ongoing at this time.  This case is being investigated by multiple units, including the MPD Special Victims Unit, Violent Crimes Unit, District Detectives, GNCAT, and the Forensic Services Unit.

On April 25, 2022 at approximately 5:25pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 2900 block of Coho Street regarding a weapons offense – shots fired. 
 
Witnesses stated they heard one shot.  Officers canvassed the area and located one spent casing on the ground.  No damage or injuries were reported.   
 
Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a gas station clerk was robbed at gun point.

Officers were dispatched to a gas station along the 600 block of Cottage Grove Rd. around 10:20 p.m. Monday.

The suspect took the victim’s purse and money from the store.

Officers searched for the man, but were unable to locate him.

Victim: MISSING: Darlene J. Hansen F/W  Blonde/Blue
Details:
MPD is requesting public assistance in locating a missing person, Darlene J. Hansen, who was seen leaving her residence on the West side of the City of Madison.  She was seen leaving in a red Toyota Prius with Wisconsin Registration 440URK.

Hansen drives to familiar destinations in the City of Madison only and always returns before dark.  She was last seen wearing a light blue coat, blue shirt, blue pants, and white shoes.  

If located, please contact your local law enforcement agency, or the Dane County Public Safety Communications Center at (608)255-2345.

Address: S. Whitney Way and Endeavor Ln
Details: On 4-28-2022 at approximately 2:14 am, MPD officers were dispatched to a motor vehicle accident with a car that struck a tree. The vehicle contained two adults and both were taken to a local hospital. One of the adults in the vehicle sustained very signficant injuries. The area around S Whitney Way and Endeavor Ln is closed off for now. This crash is still being investigated.

At least three people were injured after a porch collapsed Saturday morning on Mifflin St.

Officers and crews with the Madison Fire Department were called to a home along the 500 block of Mifflin St. around 11:45 a.m.

It's still unclear what caused the porch to collapse.

People are gathered at homes along Mifflin St. as part of the "Mifflin Street Student Block Party."

Officers and leadership with the Madison Police Department spent the last several weeks working with residents who live along Mifflin St. on ways to stay safe during the block party.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department spent hours on Saturday assisting large crowds attending the Mifflin Street Student Block Party.

Around 11:45 a.m., a second-story porch along the 500 block of Mifflin Street collapsed. Two people were taken to the hospital. Neither suffered life-threatening injuries.

By midday, the crowd surged to well over 10,000 people.

The Madison Police Department implemented its traffic contingency plan and closed Mifflin Street and other nearby streets in order to keep attendees safe.

Heavy downpours Saturday afternoon quelled the party and soaked officers and deputies working the event. Large puddles formed in backyards, making for extremely muddy conditions.

Officers arrested around 45 people. Only one person was transported to the Dane County Jail. 

Two officers suffered minor injuries. 

The Mifflin Street Student Block Party overlapped with two other large events in Madison the Crazylegs Classic race and the Election Integrity Rally.  

Multiple units within the Madison Police Department, including SWAT, SET, Mounted Patrol, UAS, department leadership, and patrol officers, assisted with keeping the community safe on Saturday.

The Dane County Sheriff's Office, UW-Police, Capitol Police, Madison Fire Department, and Madison Streets Department also provided support to MPD on Saturday.

On 5/1/22 Madison Police Officers responded to the report of a violent domestic in the 1900 block of Baird St.  The suspect had threatened violence to an adult female and young children in the residence.  Initial Officers responded and gathered information in trying to render safety.  The suspect did not surrender and due to information obtain inside the residence; more police resources responded.  Additionally, UWPD also assisted with the call.  Due to the knowledge that young children were inside, awake, every safety precaution and ounce of professionalism was used to ensure the best possible resolution.  After hours of negotiations, the suspect surrendered peacefully, without incident.  This was another situation where a violent scene erupted, MPD responded and through training, sound judgment, and professionalism we were able to resolve this peacefully.

A woman was cited following a two-vehicle crash on the city’s north side Sunday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Dryden and Northport Drives around 4:30 p.m.

Two vans were involved.

A woman ran a red light and struck the other van. 

No one in the other van was injured.

The driver was taken to the hospital but suffered no significant injuries. She admitted to drinking earlier in the day.

A 15-year-old passenger suffered an injury but did not go to the hospital.

Dominique L. Harris received the following citations OWI 1st offense with a passenger under 16-years-old, OWI causing injury, red signal violation, and imprudent speed.

Madison police are investigating an attempted carjacking that took place Sunday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to a parking lot along the 2100 block of West Beltline Highway around 1:20 p.m.

The victim was waiting outside of a business when
several suspects approached his vehicle, displayed a gun, and attempted to get inside.

The victim said he was threatened after he rolled down the window trying to get the group to stop.

No physical injuries were reported.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating reports of shots fired.

Officers were dispatched to the 1900 block of Axel Ave. around 1:10 p.m.

Officers are currently checking the area, searching for shell casings and property damage.

Callers reported hearing between 5-8 shots.

This incident remains under investigation.

On 5/2/22, Madison Police were notified of suspicious activity in the Hills Farm neighborhood. Police would like to identify and speak with the individual driving this vehicle. Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a shooting along the 4300 block of Nakoosa Tr.

A 21-year-old man was shot multiple times around 6:30 p.m. on Thursday. He suffered serious injuries but is expected to survive.

The man was shot while standing on an apartment balcony. Several rounds entered the unit. Three other adults and a baby were inside at the time. They were not injured.

The suspected shooter and victim are known to one another. 

No arrests have been made in this case at this time.

The investigation remains active and ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to the 7800 block of Big Sky Drive shortly after 1 a.m. Friday.

A window was broken. No one was found inside.

At this time, it is unclear if anything was taken.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a fire at an office building on the city's north side.

The building is located along the 2800 block of International Lane.

Flames were seen coming from the facility shortly after 6 a.m.

The Madison Fire Department responded and quickly put out the fire.

No injuries were reported.

MPD officers and arson investigators are working to determine a cause.

Due to the active investigation, more information will be released later.

Madison Police were dispatched to 3202 Dairy Drive for a Weapons Offense involving two residents. The victim sustained a non-life-threatening injury from an edged weapon, and she was transported to an area hospital.

An edged weapon was recovered from the scene, but the suspect fled prior to police being able to make contact with him. Parties involved know each other, and the investigation is ongoing.

If anyone has information on this incident, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com.
