On Tuesday morning, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU), arrested a 39-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.
 
Members of DOJ Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with MPD, Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT), SWAT and SVU served a search warrant on Aaron G. Alvarez’s residence along the 1100 block of E. Wilson St.
 
Alvarez has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

Two guns were recovered early Saturday morning after police noticed a running vehicle parked in a lot along the 200 block of Gilman St.

A man was found passed out in the driver’s seat of the vehicle.

Once roused, he kept reaching for items in the vehicle and ignored directions to exit.

Two handguns, a loaded magazine and a large amount of marijuana were found inside the vehicle.

Albert L. Hardy, 30, of Madison, was arrested for resisting arrest, carrying a concealed weapon and possession with intent to deliver THC.

The responding officers were working as part of the Downtown Safety Initiative, which is a voluntary assignment that emphasizes high visibility patrol and community engagement in the State Street and University Avenue corridor on weekend nights.

Officers responded to a single vehicle crash where a vehicle struck a utility pole.  Currently all lanes of traffic in the 3200 block of Atwood Ave are closed and traffic is being rerouted.  No significant injuries reported.  MG&E assisting with replacing the utility pole.

Around 1,500 people gathered around the Wisconsin State Capitol for a pro-choice rally on Saturday.

The Madison Police Department and other law enforcement agencies from around the area helped monitor the gathering.

Crowds began to form shortly before 4 p.m. The rally wrapped up about an hour later.

Attendees remained peaceful throughout the entire event and there were no problems or arrests.

Traffic was not affected and roads around the Capitol Square remained open throughout the duration of the event.

The rally was part of a nationwide effort called “Bans off our Bodies” and similar rallies were expected to be held around the country.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a burglary at a gas station on the city's north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 2300 block of Commercial Ave. around 1:35 a.m. Monday.

Officers arrived to find the store ransacked.

Cash and dozens of cartons of cigarettes were stolen during the incident.

A K-9 team was able to track the suspect to where a vehicle pickup location likely occurred.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

At 11:29 p.m. on May 22nd, 2002, a male suspect came into the Kwik Trip at 3528 E. Washington Avenue wearing a black mask and a gray hoodie up over his head.  He asked the clerk for a pack of Newport cigarettes.  When the clerk was ringing up the purchase, the suspect demanded that the clerk give him all of the money in the register.  The clerk thought that the suspect was joking so he kept ringing up the cigarettes.  When the suspect demanded the money again, the clerk still did not react the way the suspect wanted him to.  In frustration, the suspect grabbed the pack of cigarettes and left the store.  No gun was seen, but it was implied. The suspect is currently at-large.

Multiple callers reported hearing 4-7 gunshots in the area of Milwaukee Street and Dempsey Road.  Officers and Deputies in the area searched for evidence, however no casings, damage or injured people were located.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after four children entered an elementary school over the weekend.

Someone saw the children enter the building around 12:45 p.m. on Sunday.

Those involved range from 5 to 11-years-old.

Officers arrived to find a classroom had been damaged. Feces and urine were also found inside this room. 

The children admitted to their actions.

They were released to their parents or a responsible party.

A 16-year-old male was arrested Monday morning for bringing a gun to school.

Officers were dispatched to La Follette High School shortly after 9 a.m. Staff confiscated the weapon from a student's backpack.

An airsoft magazine was found inside the real gun.

The weapon was previously reported stolen.

The teen was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

Extra police presence will be provided in the area throughout the day.

MPD officers were dispatched to a business in the 1500 block of N. Stoughton Road after three people were stabbed.  The unknown suspect fled after the stabbing and is currently at large.  The three victims were transported to local hospitals with what are believed to be non-life-threatening injuries.  The investigation is continuing.

MPD officers were dispatched to the 6000 block of Cottontail Trail after a report of gunshots.  Officers determine an occupied vehicle had been struck by gunfire but no one was injured.  It appears at this time a disturbance occurred prior to the shooting and that the parties knew each other.  The investigation is continuing.

On 5/28/2022, at around 7:30PM, a Madison Police Officer was monitoring traffic in the area of Mineral Point Rd and Racine Rd in the City of Madison. The officer observed a black Ford pickup traveling at a high rate of speed in a posted 35 mile per hour zone. The officer used a laser to obtain a speed of 75 miles per hour, 40 miles per hour over the posted limit. 

The officer caught up to the vehicle near Mineral Point Rd and Yellowstone Dr and attempted a traffic stop on the vehicle. The vehicle then fled, driving in a reckless manner, using the restricted bus/bike lane and failing to stop for multiple red lights. The officer did not pursue the vehicle due to safetly concerns.  

The vehicle was tracked on City Cameras and is first sighted westbound on Mineral Point Rd in front of the Midtown Police Station, 4020 Mineral Point Rd. The vehicle was last seen outbound on Old Sauk Rd, just west of Pleasant View Rd. 

Still images of the vehicle have been attached. The vehicle is likely a 2021 or newer Ford F Series pickup truck, black in color. The vehicle has a distinct emblem in the center of the rear window, believed to be a Denver Broncos logo. The vehicle has black rims and fenders above the wheels. At the time of the incident the vehicle had a hitch attached to the rear, and 2 large items laying in the truck bed. 

Madison Police are attempting to locate the vehicle and any information pertaining to the operator and registered owner. 

If anyone has information on this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345 or Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014, or, on the web at P3Tips.com.

On 5/30/2022, at approximately 4:40 p.m. several officers were dispatched to Penn Park at 2101 Fisher St. reference a large fight in progress. 
 
Upon arrival, officers separated fighting parties and contacted various injured victims throughout the neighborhood. While doing so, a second fight occurred in front of officers. Officers intervened and utilized oleoresin capsicum (OC) spray to break up the fight and called for additional resources to restore order.
 
Several juveniles and adults were involved in the fight. At least four individuals were treated at local hospitals for non-life-threatening injuries. Two individuals were arrested and transported to jail. Two other individuals received citations. Over 20 officers from three agencies were needed to respond to the fight. The investigation is ongoing. 
 
Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online, at p3tips.com.

On 6-1-22 at approximately 11:53 pm, Madison Police responded to multiple calls of shots fired in the 4600 block of Verona Rd. While officers were on scene investigating, a 28 year old male showed up at a local area hospital with a non-life threatening gunshot wound. Shell casings were also discovered in the 4600 block of Verona Rd. This investigation is on-going.

The Madison Police Department is investigating an overnight burglary at a restaurant on the city’s near east side.

Someone broke into Taco Local located along the 800 block of Williamson St., around 12:50 a.m. Friday.

Money was stolen during the burglary.

Doors to the business were also damaged.

No arrests have been made at this time. The incident remains under investigation.

A Madison man was arrested for 5th-offense OWI following a high-risk traffic stop Friday morning on the city’s south side.

Officers were dispatched to the 2500 block of McDivitt Rd. to check on a person making threats involving a weapon.

As officers arrived on scene around 12:40 a.m., they spotted Jeremiah J. McCarty, 37, of Madison, leaving in a vehicle.

He was pulled over and later arrested for 5th-offense OWI, carrying a concealed knife as a felon and bail jumping.

The Madison Police Department is seeking the community's assistance in locating Kadedra Townsend, to check her welfare.  Townsend, who is autistic and limited verbally, was last seen leaving her westside group home early this morning.  Townsend is a 19 year old black female, approximately 5 feet 4 inches tall, weighing 160 lbs.  Townsend was wearing a blue heavy jackey, gray shorts and black Nike shoes.  If you have seen Townsend please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345 or dial 911.

A photo is attached to this press release.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a sexual assault that occurred early Friday morning.

The victim was getting a ride home from the suspect when she decided to walk the remainder of the way.

The suspect began following the victim after she left his vehicle. 

The victim said the assault happened in an alley near Langdon St. A witness in this area called police after hearing a woman call out for help.

The suspect continued to follow the victim until she reached a friend’s apartment.

The victim reported the assault around 2:45 a.m.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Madison Police Officers responded to the 4700 block of E Washington Ave reference a stolen auto with a person with disabilities inside. The suspect entered the vehicle when the caregiver went inside to get food leaving the person with disabilities inside the car still with the engine running. After the caregiver returned, the car and person with disabilities was gone. The Madison Police Department and local law enforcement partners rapidly deployed an extensive amount of resources to look for the endangered person and stolen auto. Approximately, 45 minutes later, the stolen auto was located by the Village of Shorewood Hills Police Chief on University Ave where it was followed waiting for backup. Ultimately, the stolen auto pulled into the UW-Emergency Room entrance area where the suspect was taken into custody. The person with disabilities was located inside the vehicle unharmed and checked upon by UW-ER Staff. It was later revealed that during the incident, the suspect told the victim to get out of the car but couldn’t due to the disability. Thankfully, the victim persuaded the suspect to go to the hospital.
 
The suspect was identified as Jeremy J Imhoff, 43. Imhoff is facing charges of false imprisonment, 1st offense operating a vehicle while intoxicated, operating vehicle without owner’s consent.
 
The Madison Police Department is thankful for the assistance from SHPD and UWPD involved in this multi-jurisdictional incident with a special thanks to the Dane County 911 center. If you have any additional information regarding this incident, please contact MPD at 255-2345, or you can remain anonymous and contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com.

Address: 500 block of Moose Trail, Madison, WI
Details:
On June 7, 2022 at approximately 1:51am, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Moose Trail regarding a Weapons Offense-Shots Fired Call.

In this case, multiple complainants called 911 to report hearing approximately 4-5 gunshots coming from an area East of Moose Trail/Cordelia Cres. A police canvass revealed that no vehicles or residences were hit or damaged. At this time, there are no reports of any injured persons. The investigation is ongoing.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: Mineral Point Rd/S High Point Rd
Details:
On 6/7/22 at 3:53 AM MPD and MFD responded to Mineral Point Rd and S High Point Rd for a traffic crash involving a pedestrian. The pedestrian was pronounced on scene. The driver was located and arrested for homicide by intoxicated use of a vehicle.

WB MPR will be closed from Ganser to Westward for several hours this morning as MPD Traffic Specialists continue to investigate. EB MPR has one lane open, but traffic flow will be impacted.

Thanks to MFD and DCSO for their assistance.

The Madison Police Department is looking to identify the man who stole a grill from outside a business on the city’s west side.

The theft occurred around 7:15 p.m. on May 10 at a business along the 8400 block of Excelsior Drive.

Surveillance video shows a man dragging the grill from a back patio area.

A photo of the man is attached to this release. The stolen grill is a Weber Genesis.

Anyone with information about this crime is asked to contact the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or at anonymously online at p3tips.com.

On Tuesday, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU) arrested a 23-year-old man for possessing child pornography.

Members of the Wisconsin DOJ - Division of Criminal Investigation (DCI), along with Madison Police Department's Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT), Special Weapons and Tactics team (SWAT) and SVU served a search warrant at a home along the 4700 block of Steinhauer Trail.

Bryce A. Culver, 23, of Madison, was arrested.

He has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail on four counts of Possession of Child Pornography.

Suspect: Skinny, Black male, 50-60 years old, balding but with some short white hair, wearing all black clothing.  He was driving a white sedan (unknown make or model) with dark tinted windows and shiny rims.
Details: The juvenile victim, who was walking northbound on Cypress Way, reported that someone pulled a gun on him.  The victim told officers that while he was walking, a white sedan with dark tinted windows and shiny rims pulled up next to him.  The victim reported that the lone occupant exited the car and told the boy to get into his car.  The victim told officers that the man tried to entice him with drugs and alcohol.  When the victim refused to get into the car, the man pulled out a gun, racked the slide and pointed the gun at him.  Just then, the victim's family pulled up to pick him up and the suspect drove away.  The suspect is described as a skinny black male, 50-60 years old, balding, but with some short, white hair, wearing all black clothing.

Officers were dispatched to Walgreens, 606 S. Whitney Way, reference a disturbance involving two subjects.  Officers later learned that the victim in that incident was the victim of random physical violence.  After that incident, another caller reported that the suspect took off running from the Walgreens toward the Hyvee.  Shortly thereafter, a caller from Hyvee reported that the suspect was physically attacking random people in that store.  When officers arrived on scene, they arrested the suspect.  He will be charged with at least one count of Substantial Battery and four counts of Simple Battery in addition to at least one count of Damage to Property.

Officers were dispatched to the 2800 block of Holborn Circle reference a residential burglary.  The victim told officers that he parked his vehicle in his driveway and that the vehicle was unlocked.  The suspects were able to locate and use the garage door opener to access the residence.  While the man was lying on the couch, three suspects entered his residence.  The victim reported that while he pretended to be asleep, one of the suspects went upstairs.  When the suspect came back downstairs, the victim could hear the jingling of keys.  The suspects exited the residence and took off in two vehicles - the one they arrived in and the one they stole from the victim.

On 6/10/2022 at approximately 3:29 PM, Officers were dispatched to a hit and run of a pedestrian at the intersection of eastbound Lien Rd and Eagan Rd. The victim sustained non-life threatening injuries. The vehicle fled the scene and was described as a gray or silver crossover SUV, unknown license plate, last seen eastbound on Lien Rd. Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

On Sunday, June 12, 2022, at approximately 5:30 a.m., the Madison Police responded to a disturbance in the 5600 block of Black Onyx Dr.  Upon arrival, officers located a male subject down with a chest wound.  That subject was transported by EMS to a local hosptial where he was pronounced deceased.

Numerous MPD resources responded to the scene and a person of interest was identified and later taken into custody.  The Madison Police Violent Crimes Unit is actively investigating this incident.  There is no continuing threat to the community.

Anyone with information related to this incident may call Madison Area Crimestoppers at 608-266-6014.

Officers were dispatched along with EMS to Hiestand Park for an unconscious person in a vehicle. Officers broke the window and began life saving measures. EMS arrived on scene and advised the person had probably been deceased for a few hours. After the investigation, it is believed that the person succumb to prescription medication overdose. There was a heavy police presence due to normal park activities and attempts to preserve and investigate the scene. There are no threats to the neighborhood as a result of this incident.
Multiple callers in the Sherman Avenue/Wheeler Road area reported hearing 4-5 gunshots.  Officers located four, .45 caliber casings.  There was no damage located and no evidence of anyone being shot.

A Madison man was cited for endangering safety after his gun was accidentally discharged and sent a bullet into a neighboring apartment unit.

Officers were called to an apartment building along the 600 block of Bear Claw Way around 4:30 p.m. Thursday.

A man reported hearing a loud bang and believed the sound was a gunshot. He also located a bullet in his living room.

Officers arrived and found a bullet hole in a wall of his apartment.

No injuries were reported.

A neighbor admitted to accidentally discharging his weapon while working on his firearm. The neighbor legally owned the firearm involved.

He was cited for endangering the safety of another by way of negligent use of a weapon.

It's been nine years since Julia Majette was shot and killed at her home in the presence of her children.

As we recognize the 9th anniversary of her death, the Madison Police Department encourages anyone with information in this unsolved homicide case to come forward. 

Julia was shot after two unknown men entered her home around 7:50 p.m. on June 12, 2013. She lived along the 700 block of N. Thompson Drive. 

The mother-of-three was 25-years-old at the time of her death.

The Madison Police Department remains committed to bringing justice to Julia and her family. 

If you have information about this homicide, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. 

Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward of up to $1,000 for tips that lead to an arrest.

Address: Darbo Dr. and N. Marquette St.
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man arrived at a local hospital Thursday evening with a gunshot wound.

The 23-year-old victim said he was headed to a gas station in the area of Darbo Dr. and N. Marquette St. when he was shot.

Two bystanders noticed the injured man and took him to a nearby hospital around 5:35 p.m.

The Madison Police Department is still working to determine if this was a targeted incident.

The shooting remains under investigation at this time.

The Madison Police Department's Violent Crime Unit is leading the investigation into this case.

Detectives are working to identify witnesses at this time. 

Anyone with information is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014. Tips can also be submitted online at p3tips.com. People are able to remain anonymous and may be eligible for a reward for their tips.

Arrested: Howard Spacejoy Smith; 48 Years Old, Male
Details:
On June 13, 2022 at approximately 9:02pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to 3650 Milwaukee Street (the wooded area near the Amazon Distribution Center) regarding a Weapons Violation.

Howard Spacejoy Smith was in the area and armed with a very large sword. He claimed to be looking for someone who may be associated with a nearby encampment. When he encountered the victim, he threatened to physically harm him with the sword he was carrying.

Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant arrived on scene quickly and took Howard into custody without incident and recovered the sword. He has been arrested and charged with Disorderly Conduct While Armed and Bail Jumping.

Anyone with information regarding this investigation should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Arrested: Dominique D. Gulley; 29 Years Old, Male
Address: 4600 block of Atticus Way, Madison, WI
Details:
On June 13, 2022 at approximately 11:06pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to 4600 block of Atticus Way regarding a Weapons Violation.

Dominique D. Gulley was at an apartment building and engaged in a verbal argument with someone known to him. During this argument, he retrieved a large kitchen knife from a neighbor’s apartment and then produced it, necessitating a call to 911.  

Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant arrived on scene quickly, took Dominique into custody without incident, and recovered a knife. He has been arrested and charged with Disorderly Conduct While Armed, Felony Bail Jumping, and a Probation Violation/Hold.

Anyone with information regarding this investigation should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

On 6/15/2022 at approximately 6:04pm a rollover crash was reported on the westbound lanes of the Beltline at Mineral Point Road. The crashed vehicle, a stolen silver sedan, had been occupied by five subjects that then fled on foot into a nearby local business. Once police arrived on scene, all five subjects were taken into custody.

Per Sgt Pray

On June 16, 2022 at approximately 7:30pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to Northridge Terrace regarding a weapons violation. A local resident of the area called police to report that he could see someone on the balcony/patio area of a nearby apartment building holding what appeared to be a long gun of some kind. The caller heard a “pop” and observed his sliding glass door was shattered and believed it had been shot out.

Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant responded and were able to ascertain that the projectile fired at the man’s residence was most likely from a BB or pellet gun. Contact was made with a juvenile male and his mother at their apartment. There it was discovered that the juvenile had been shooting a BB gun from his balcony. In addition to shooting his neighbors sliding glass door, it was discovered that he also shot a fellow juvenile in non-vital area while they were playing in the area as well. 

Two BB guns (a Crosman Legacy and Daisy Red Ryder) and Copperhead BB’s were recovered from the residence and taken as evidence by police. The juvenile was very remorseful for his actions. He was issued a juvenile restorative justice referral and was then left in the care of his guardian.

Arrested:
Abdoulah C. Traore-Flores 17-Year Old Madison Resident
(2 Counts Disorderly Conduct  & 2 Counts of Battery)

Alijah C. Johnson 19-Year Old Madison Resident
(Disorderly Conduct & Battery)

Cashius E. Carter 18-Year Old Madison Resident
(Disorderly Conduct & Battery)

15-Year Old Madison Resident
(Disorderly Conduct & 3 Counts of Battery)
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man was attacked while walking downtown late Tuesday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of W. Gilman Street around 10:15 p.m. for the battery.

The victim said he was punched by a group of men, who continued to kick and punch him while he was on the ground.

The victim said the suspects did not take or say anything to him.

Detectives have no information that leads them to believe this attack is racially motivated at this time. 

This is the third battery of this type to occur in the downtown area within the past two weeks. The investigations appear to show these attacks were random in nature. 

Detectives believe this same group of people may be responsible for these attacks. Surveillance photos of those involved have been posted with this release.

If you recognize any of these individuals or have information on these batteries please call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or visit p3tips.com. Tips can be left anonymously. Those providing information leading to an arrest may also qualify for a monetary reward.

The investigations into all three attacks are ongoing.

UPDATE  The above individuals were arrested for a series of battery incidents that occurred over the course of a few weeks in the downtown area.  As a result of the invetigations, MPD was able to identify, locate, and arrest the involved parties.

The Madison Police Department continues to investigate a shots fired incident from last Saturday.

Officers responded to a strip mall parking lot along the 4600 block of Verona Road shortly before 6 a.m.

Witnesses reported hearing several gunshots and seeing multiple cars leave the area.

Several full rounds and 20 shell casings were found at the scene.

No injuries or property damage were reported.

No arrests have been made. 

The Violent Crimes Unit is leading the investigation into this incident. The case remains open and active at this time.

A couple was jolted awake after an SUV crashed into their home early Friday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 1800 block of Rowley Drive shortly before 4:30 a.m.

No one was inside the vehicle when officers arrived.

They quickly realize the vehicle was likely stolen overnight since a back window was smashed.
 
At the time of this response, the vehicle had not been reported stolen. Officers were able to track down the owner in Fitchburg, who informed them she did not give anyone permission to take her vehicle.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a shots fired incident that occurred Wednesday afternoon.
 
Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Freeport and Reez Roads around 1:20 p.m.
 
Two vehicles were involved in this incident. Witnesses reported seeing someone shooting from the sunroof of one of the vehicles toward the other.
 
Two spent shell casings were found in the intersection.
 
Shortly after this incident was reported, a 17-year-old male arrived at a local hospital with a gunshot wound.
The investigation into this incident remains ongoing at this time.

Officers were dispatched to a large disturbance at Demetral Park during several family gatherings. During the fight, several persons displayed firearms, but as of this writing, there were no shooting victims discovered on scene or at Madison hospitals. Madison police seized two firearms, and arrested two males in reference to weapons violations and the disturbance. There is no continued threat to the neighborhood as a result of this disturbance.

Officers were dispatched to the 1000 block of Williamson St in reference to a single motor vehicle that crashed into a building.  The driver of the vehicle suffered a medical/health incident prior to the crash occurring.  The driver had a minor laceration and no other people were injured as a result of the crash.  The driver did not show any signs of impairment and was cited for the traffic violations.  Building Inspection responded to the scene and accessed the damage to the building.

An off-duty police officer called the Dane County 9-1-1 Center to report a black, Kia SUV being driven recklessly on Seven Nations Drive.  The SUV was seen doing burnouts and nearly striking parked cars on the street.  While officers were en route to investigate the reckless driving complaint, the 9-1-1 Center started receiving calls about a rollover crash, involving this same SUV, in the 2900 block of Foxwood Trail.  The SUV struck an unoccupied van which caused the SUV to rollover.  The SUV and the van sustained severe damage.  All of the occupants of the rollover SUV fled on foot prior to police arrival.  Incoming officers located and detained four suspects near Moorland Road and Fell Road.  During the course of the investigation, officers learned that the SUV, a 2017 Kia Sportage, had been stolen from a parking lot on Moorland Road.  The owner of the Kia SUV became aware of the theft of her vehicle around the same time as the crash when a neighbor stopped by to return her driver’s license and other abandoned property he found in the parking lot.  The ignition key was still in the victim's possession, however, the suspects were able to manipulate the steering column and steal the vehicle without a key.  Excellent teamwork led to the arrest of all four suspects involved in the incident.  All four suspects are juveniles under the age of 15 year old.  None of the suspects were injured.

Several expensive power tools were stolen during a burglary at a hardware store early Tuesday morning.
 
Officers were dispatched to the Dorn True Value store along the 1300 block of Midvale Blvd. around 1:50 a.m.
 
They arrived to find someone had forced entry to the building.
 
This is the second time this week the store has been burglarized.
 
Detectives with the Burglary Crime Unit are working to determine if the two burglaries are connected.
 
No arrests have been made at this time.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is seeking the community’s help in locating a missing mother and her four children.
 
Officers were contacted on Monday to check on the welfare of 33-year-old Samella Robinson.
 
Officers were unsuccessful in locating Robinson and her children at their residence on the west side of Madison.
 
Police are searching for 12-year-old Kierra, 8-year-old Yafa, 5-year-old Phillip and 9-month-old Samella.
 
Currently, the investigation has not yet identified any signs of foul play associated with their disappearance.

Robinson has ties to Chicago and may have recently spent time in central Illinois.  Madison detectives have reached out to law enforcement in Illinois for assistance in hopes of locating the family.
 
A photo of Robinson has been attached to this release.

Anyone with information about Robinson’s whereabouts should call 911.

Multiple people called to report shots being fired in their east side neighborhood early Thursday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Witwer Rd. and Milwaukee St. around 12:30 a.m.

Callers reported hearing the shots and a vehicle speeding off.

Responding officers located two spent shell cases in the area.

No injuries were reported. Officers were unable to locate any damage to surrounding buildings or vehicles.

The investigation into this incident remains ongoing at this time.

A teenager was injured during an attempted armed robbery.

The incident happened Sunday night along the 1100 block of Morraine View Dr.

The 16-year-old victim said he was struck in the head during the incident. He was taken to the hospital for his injuries.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing

Officers with the Madison Police Department helped reunite a lost child with his family on Monday.
 
The 5-year-old is part of a summer school and after-school program. A sitter was waiting at his bus drop-off location around 4 p.m., but he never arrived.

Around 90 minutes later, a cyclist reported seeing a child along the 2900 block of N. Sherman Ave.
  
Officers were able to connect the child with his parents, who had also been searching for him.
 
Calls were made to address future drop-off concerns.

The Madison Police Department and the family of Kelly Nolan continue to search for information surrounding her death, 15 years after she was reported missing. 

The Nolan family is also offering a new, $25,000 reward this year for any information that could lead to the conviction of her killer. This particular reward is only active for the next year. 

Kelly was last seen in downtown Madison during the early morning hours of June 23, 2007. Her body was found 16 days later, on July 9, in a wooded property along the 4700 block of Schneider Dr. in the town of Dunn.

Kelly was a 22-year-old UW-Whitewater student living in Madison for the summer. She was subletting an apartment on East Mifflin Street and searching for a part-time job.

She spent the night before her disappearance out with friends. They eventually separated and Kelly remained in the State Street area. Witness accounts place her along the 500 block of State St. between 2:20 and 2:30 a.m. on that Saturday.

Multiple veteran detectives remain assigned to this case. They continue to pursue all new leads and remain committed to finding the person or persons responsible.

They are still working to determine who may have been involved in Kelly’s death and whether she left the downtown area on her own accord or forcibly.
No one is currently considered a person of interest or suspect.

Kelly was wearing an emerald green, scooped-necked shirt and jeans. She was carrying a grayish-green handbag with several outside pockets.

If you remember seeing her downtown that night or have any information regarding this case, please contact police.

All tips are investigated thoroughly. No piece of information or detail is considered too small or too insignificant. It may be what is needed for detectives to solve this case.

Information can be submitted by contacting the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Tips can be submitted anonymously, and people may be eligible for an additional cash reward through Crime Stoppers.

Below is a statement the Nolan family has asked the Madison Police Department to release on their behalf.

Fifteen years have passed since our beautiful daughter and sister, Kelly Nolan, was tragically taken from us. This day in our lives seems so close and yet so distant. Her legacy of kindness, humor, loyalty and intelligence are remembered daily by all those who loved her. Kelly simply had a beautiful soul, and we thank the Lord for sending her to us, even if for a shortened time. The passage of time in no way diminishes the heinousness of the crime. We are still seeking accountability and answers surrounding our daughter’s death. We know there is someone out there, whether locally or elsewhere, that can shed light on what happened to Kelly during her final moments of life. Moments we were robbed of spending with her. We ask that you contact the Madison, Wisconsin, Police Department with any information you might have. No detail is too small or insignificant. Please tell police what you saw, know, heard or believe happened to Kelly. Those details just might be the information that is needed to solve this crime and bring a small bit of peace to our family. We ask that you be brave. And know coming forward will not be easy. There are ways for you to remain anonymous if you choose. We also want to take a moment to thank the Madison Police Department, who remain dedicated to solving this case and work daily to prevent other innocent young women from becoming victims. From the bottom of our hearts, thank you.

 The family of Kelly Nolan

The Madison Police Department is seeking the community's assistance in locating Jampa T. Gagyanpontsang, a 92 year old male who left home at approximately 8am this morning to take a walk and has not returned.  Jampa was last seen wearing a grey baseball cap and grey slippers.  Jampa is approximately 5 feet 7 inches tall, weighing 180 lbs.

If you have seen Jampa T. Gagyanpontsang, please contact the Madison Police at 608-255-2345 or dial 911.

The Madison Police Department is working with other law enforcement agencies ahead of potential demonstrations over the Supreme Court of the United States’ ruling on abortion.

We are encouraging anyone who is planning to participate to do so peacefully. One event is scheduled for Friday night outside of the Wisconsin State Capitol.

At this time, there is nothing to suggest this event would be disorderly or a threat to our community.

Staffing holds are currently in place at the Madison Police Department. This means we are not granting leave requests for Friday or Saturday.

We also have our Special Events Team activated to help monitor and keep crowds safe during demonstrations.

Our department leadership will also be part of a unified command post. These posts allow leaders from multiple local and state law enforcement agencies to work together on response efforts at the same location.

There will be extra patrols this weekend outside of organizations and businesses that may generate interest due to Friday’s ruling.

We’ve also been in communication with downtown business partners and community stakeholders regarding our patrol and coverage plans for Friday night’s demonstration.

The Madison Police Department supports the rights of people to speak openly and freely about their beliefs. Again, we ask anyone who plans to gather this weekend to do so peacefully.

Officers were dispatched to the 300 blk S. Park St. reference shots fired.  A short time later there was a motor vehicle crash in the 2000 blk Fish Hatchery.  The vehicle/crash possibly related to the shots fired call in the 300 blk S. Park St.  No one injured and no damage located/reported.  Investigation is on-going.

At 6:44 p.m., officers were dispatched to Tenney Park reference a strong-armed robbery.  The victim reported that he was in the park when the male suspect approached him and took his wallet.  The victim told officers that the suspect also punched him in the face, causing a minor injury.  The victim provided a description of the suspect and officers located and arrested a man matching that description.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a shots fired incident that occurred on the city’s west side early Saturday morning.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 7200 block of Midtown Rd. shortly after midnight.
 
Multiple people reported hearing the shots. Eleven spent shell casings were found in the area.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

A 15-year-old was arrested Saturday evening following a shots fired incident on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Forster Drive and Alpine road just before 8 p.m.

A caller reported three juveniles walked into a nearby marsh and shot a gun several times.

The caller was able to direct officers to the juveniles once they arrived on scene.

A 15-year-old male was found with a gun tucked into his waistband.

He was arrested and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center for possession of a dangerous weapon for a person under 18. 

The gun was listed in a law enforcement database as lost.

Two homes were hit by stray bullets after dozens of shots were fired Friday night at a packed Demetral Park.
 
The shots were fired around 8:15 p.m. at the same time fireworks were going off in the area.
 
Two officers were at the park at the time of the shooting and immediately went into action. Within moments, they were able to check on those in attendance and secure the scene.
 
Officers believe around 100 people were at the park at the time of the shooting. None reported any injuries and many took off in vehicles shortly afterward.
 
Around a dozen shell casings were found inside both the park shelter and on the basketball courts. A backpack left at the park contained several loaded magazines.
 
More shell casings were located on a nearby bike path.
 
An occupied home, along the 2500 block of Hoard St., was struck by a stray bullet. Another nearby home was also struck by two rounds. No injuries were reported at either of these homes.
 
A group of workers doing construction along the block also recalled having bullets whiz several feet above their heads. None of these workers reported injuries.
 
The Maple Bluff Police Department responded and located two unoccupied cars with guns, drugs and money inside.
 
At this time, no arrests have been made.
 
The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

Two people were taken to the hospital Wednesday evening following a shooting on the city’s north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 2900 block of Dryden Dr. around 5:20 p.m.
 
The condition of those injured is unknown at this time. 

Two suspected shooters drove away from the scene before police arrived. No arrests have been made.
 
The scene remains active at this time.
 
The Madison Police Department’s Violence Crime Unit is leading the investigation.

On 6/29/2022 at approximately 8:30 PM Madison Police were dispatched to a weapons offense in the area of the 2000 block of Fisher Street.  MPD personnel located several shell casings in the area but no signs of injuries or property damage.  The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: Commercial Ave. at N. Sprecher Rd.
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating after three people crashed a stolen vehicle and fired shots at those inside the car they struck. 
 
Multiple people called to report a shooting in the area of Commercial Ave. and Sprecher Rd. around 2 p.m. Thursday.

Two people were inside the second car. Neither were injured during the crash or shooting. They also did not know the suspects.
 
The suspects drove away and eventually crashed again, this time at the intersection of Felland and Burke Roads.
 
Three people were inside the suspect vehicle. They ran from the crash scene toward a nearby wooded area.
 
A perimeter was set and a K-9 team was brought in to help locate the trio. The K-9 team led officers to two of the suspects. A loaded firearm was found on one of the suspects apprehended by the K-9 team.
 
The third suspect was taken into custody by the Madison Quarry.
 
A second gun and a large amount of fentanyl, cocaine and cash were recovered. 
 
Roland J. Scott, 20, Katie M. Moore, 18, and Donquil D. McLemore, 18, were arrested on a variety of charges and taken to the Dane County Jail.
 
A large number of resources and teamwork were needed while responding to this incident. 

The investigation remains ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a stabbing that occurred Thursday morning.
 
Officers were dispatched to a home along the 1200 block of E. Mifflin Street around 8:45 a.m.
 
A man suffered significant injuries and was taken to the hospital. Officers arrived and rendered aid.
 
The man is expected to survive.
 
A person of interest was detained on a previous warrant. This person and the victim are known to each other.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

On 7-2-22, Madison Police responded to calls of shots fired on Stoughton Road and Highway 12/18.  A vehicle believed to be involved was stopped on S Gammon Rd near Highway 12/18 and there were multiple shell casings located on S. Stoughton Rd by Highway 12/18.  There have been no reported injuries, and this investigation is currently ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is actively investigating a graffiti/damage to property complaint at St. Bernard Catholic Church at 2450 Atwood Ave., which likely occurred overnight. The Church’s front door and signage were damaged by the graffiti which contained anti-“pro-life” and anti-police rhetoric.
 
If you have information about this incident please call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or visit p3tips.com. Tips can be left anonymously. Those providing information leading to an arrest may also qualify for a monetary reward.

Officers were dispatched to the McDonald's at 6910 Odana Road reference a man attacking people in the parking lot with a pole or a hockey stick. 

Another caller, a juvenile, told officers that he and his friends exited McDonald's and saw the suspect sitting in the juvenile's car. 

When the victim and his friends confronted the suspect, the suspect hit the victim in the face with the pole, causing a minor injury. 

The suspect was arrested for Battery, D.C. while Armed, Felony Bail Jumping, Physical Abuse to a Child and Resisting and he was taken to the PSB.

A Madison man was arrested Sunday evening for firing a weapon inside his apartment building.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building located along the 900 block of W. Badger Road around 8:45 p.m.

A bullet hole was located in the ceiling of the man’s apartment. The bullet was located in a closet in the unit above, which was unoccupied when police arrived at the scene.

Greg A. Schumacher was arrested for operating a firearm while intoxicated and for criminal damage to property. 

Officers temporarily removed five guns from the apartment for safekeeping.

The incident remains under investigation.

A man was taken to the hospital early Saturday morning following a crash on Madison’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Packers and Commercial avenues around 2:20 a.m.

An SUV was going at a high rate of speed when it hit a curb, rolled multiple times and crashed into a pole.

The Madison Fire Department had to cut the driver from the vehicle. He was taken to a local hospital with potentially life-threatening injuries.

Signs of drug use were found inside the vehicle.

The 34-year-old driver will be cited for operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated and failure to control a vehicle. 

The incident remains under investigation.

Address: Beltline between Whitney Way, Verona Rd.
Details:
A driver, going more than 100 mph on the Beltline, nearly hit another vehicle while fleeing from officers during a traffic stop.

An officer was monitoring traffic on the eastbound Beltline between Whitney Way and Verona Rd. when they noticed the car. The officer clocked the driver going 102 mph in a 55 mph zone.

The officer attempted a traffic stop, but the driver sped away nearly striking another vehicle on the Verona Rd. exit ramp. Officers did not pursue the vehicle.

The owner of the vehicle said she let someone borrow the vehicle earlier in the day. It was eventually found unoccupied along the 5600 block of King James Way in Fitchburg. 

No arrest or citations have been given at this time.

Stopping hazardous driving is one of the key priorities of the 2022 Summer Strategic Plan for the Madison Police Department. The Beltline, E. Washington Ave. and the Mineral Point Rd. corridors were identified, by using a variety of data points and sources, as areas that see a large number of injury crashes and traffic complaints.

You can read more about the 2022 Summer Strategic Plan here.

Officers were dispatched to the parking lof of Target for a report of an armed robbery.  A black sedan was seen fleeing the area at a high rate of speed.  Officers already in the area spot the vehicle as it pulled into the East Towne Mall parking lot and parked.  As officers pulled up, one suspect ran from the vehicle and into the mall.  Officers detained two suspects in the vehicle and a firearm was recovered.  The suspect who fled from the vehicle was taken into custody outside Dicks Sporting Goods and a firearm was also recovered on him.  Investigation is on-going with several charges for the involved suspects.

On 7-9-22, at approximately 10:22 pm, an adult male was riding his bicycle on the bike path near the area of Sargent Street and Dennett Drive. While in that area of the bike path, a male suspect wearing a mask, stepped in front of the bicyclist, pointed a hand gun at him, and demanded the bicycle. The adult male got off of his bicycle at which point the suspect took off on the bicycle. A perimeter was set up, but the suspect was not loacted at this time. There were no injuries to the bicyclist.

Several electronics were stolen during a burglary at a video production business on Madison’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to the 4500 block of Femrite Dr. around 10:00 a.m. on Saturday.

Someone forced their way into Camp Creatability sometime after the facility closed on Friday.

The owner reported several electronics, such as a projector and laptop, were missing.

No arrests have been made at this time.

The incident remains under investigation.

Anyone with information about this burglary is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: Eagle Summit Court at Owl Creek Drive
Details:
A Madison man, out on bail for a case involving a stolen vehicle, was arrested Sunday for stealing another vehicle.
 
An officer was in the area of Eagle Summit Court and Owl Creek Drive around 7:15 a.m. when he discovered the stolen vehicle.
 
The officer detained a man who got out of the driver’s seat of the vehicle.
 
Tommie West, 20, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent and additional bail jumping charges.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a motorcycle was stolen from an apartment building.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of W. Dayton St. around 8 p.m. on Wednesday.

The parking garage door is broken. The motorcycle’s owner said he left town for the weekend and returned home to find his bike missing. 

Officers are reviewing digital evidence.

The investigation remains ongoing at this time.

A man reported two of his guns were stolen from a locked gun safe while he was on vacation recently.
 
Officers were dispatched to an apartment along the 1300 block of E. Mifflin St. around 12:30 p.m. on Wednesday.
 
The man reported two of his five guns were missing from his safe.
 
The guns have been listed as stolen.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.?

A driver was arrested for the third time for driving under the influence following a crash on the city’s east side.

Officers arrived to the 4300 block of Milwaukee St. around 3:40 p.m. Wednesday to find an SUV lying on its side. 

Smoke and flames were also noticed coming from the vehicle.

The driver and only occupant, a 25-year-old man, was standing outside of the vehicle. He suffered minor injuries in the crash and was taken to a local hospital.

The driver admitted to consuming alcohol before the crash. He also mentioned a previous OWI arrest that occurred around the July 4th holiday.

Tyler Sielehr was arrested and taken to the Dane County Jail for 3rd-offense operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated and cited for operating after suspension.

A Madison man was arrested on Wednesday after an officer spotted him driving a stolen moped.
 
The officer pulled the moped over within Reindahl Park around 5:45 p.m. 
 
Cash and marijuana were found on the moped driver at the time of his arrest. At the jail, hidden under several layers of clothing, meth, crack cocaine, heroin and more marijuana were discovered on the man.
 
Pittaris D. Glass, 44, was arrested for possession with intent to deliver, operating a motor vehicle without the owner’s consent and bail jumping.?

within Reindahl Park near the garden/gravel path

A store manager called for police after noticing a man was exposing his genitals outside of her building.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 600 block of State St. around 2 p.m. on Wednesday.
 
Employees observed the man gratifying himself and diverted customers away from a window front.
 
Darren F. Delaossa, 59, was taken to the Dane County Jail for lewd and lascivious charge and a probation hold. He was also cited with trespassing.

An officer noticed a man passed out in his vehicle while patrolling an area near Warner Park on Wednesday.
 
The man refused to leave his vehicle and attempted to drive away from the officer.
 
The officer was able to open the vehicle door and the suspect ran away. He was quickly detained.
 
Officers discovered the man had multiple outstanding warrants from other counties for possession with intent to deliver cocaine.
 
Several baggies of cocaine and narcotics were discovered during a search of his vehicle.
 
Frederick D. Holisield, 36, was arrested for possession with intent to deliver cocaine, possession with intent to deliver a schedule 2 narcotic, resisting arrest, bail jumping and his outstanding warrants.

Arrested:
Everette L Olle, 17 years old - Operating Motor Vehicle without Owner's Consent, PTAC ID Theft, Felony Bail Jumping, Warrants

Adarrius A Findley, 17 years old - Operating Motor Vehicle without Owner's Consent, PTAC ID Theft, Felony Bail Jumping, Possession of Fentanyl, Parole Warrant/Hold

Male, 16 years old - Operating Motor Vehicle without Owner's Consent, ID Theft
Details:
On 7-11-22, a victim reported to Madison Police that someone tried to steal her vehicle and stole their purse from it.

A short time later, a Madison Police Officer observed a different stolen vehicle in the area of the West Towne Mall.  The vehicle fled the area and West Towne Mall staff alerted the officer to a fraud in one of the stores.  Three males had used the victim's credit card to fraudulently purchase hundreds of dollars in merchandise.

The victim's purse was dumped in the 4700 block of Cottage Grove Road and recovered.  MPD worked with the apartment complex management to view surveillance cameras and identify the apartment where the suspects had fled to.  The suspects were identified from their involvement in past criminal investigations for auto theft, stolen vehicles, and using the personal documents of others for financial gain.  The stolen vehicle used in this crime was recovered and returned to its owner.

On 7-14-22, members of MPD's SWAT Team, Burglary Crime Unit, Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT), and MPD West District personnel served a Search Warrant on the residence.  Evidence of the theft and fraud was recovered, as well as two firearms.  One of the firearms had been reported stolen out of Mississippi in a Commercial Burglary in 2020.

Investigation ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to the 2900 block of Milwaukee Street reference a shots fired incident.  Several callers reported hearing 8-10 shots.  Upon arrival, officers located four .40 caliber casings, four 9mm casings and a bullet fragment in the road and two damaged, unoccupied, uninvolved vehicles that were hit by gunfire.  No reported injuries at this time.

Officers were dispatched to the 5000 block of Wintergreen Drive reference a car vs. tree and mailbox.  The caller reported that two vehicles were speeding through the neighborhood before the crash.  The caller saw 4 teenagers flee the scene in the other vehicle after the crash.  The crashed car, which was not listed as stolen, had a broken back window indicating that it may have been recently stolen without the knowledge of the registered owner.  Officers contacted the registered owner who confirmed that his car had indeed been stolen.

Officers were called to the area of Kedzie St for a drug investigation and potential child neglect investigation. As officers were arriving, they saw the suspect vehicle driving away. Officers attempted to stop the vehicle and the vehicle fled and crashed on Aberg Ave near Packers Ave. The mother and child were not injured and the male driver fled the area on foot. A police perimeter was set up and a K9 tracked to where the suspect was hiding in the brush. The suspect was arrested without incident, and had several pre-exiting state charges and a warrant in addition to new charges.

Caller reported hearing "4 pops" which sounded like gunshots coming from the top of a nearby hill.  The caller also reported hearing a car driving away.  Officers located six .40 caliber Smith and Wesson casings in the roadway near a heavily wooded area.  No property damage or injured persons located.

Address: N. Stoughton Rd. at Kinsman Blvd.
Details:
Officers found no signs of a shooting while responding to a shots fired report early Friday morning.
 
They were dispatched to the intersection of N. Stoughton Rd. and Kinsman Blvd. around 7:30 a.m.
 
A caller heard a gunshot and believed the driver of a vehicle was shooting at another drive at the intersection.
 
Officers checked the area and did not locate any shell casings, property damage or other signs of a shooting.
 
No injuries were reported.

Four teens were arrested Saturday evening for attempting to steal a car on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of S. Gammon Rd. around 8:35 p.m.

A woman waiting in the area called for police after noticing the break-in in progress.

The first officer that arrived spotted the four teens walking away from the car involved. 

They were all taken into custody at various locations near West Towne Mall.

The vehicle involved showed signs of a forced entry and a dismantled steering column.

The arrested teens were taken to the Juvenile Detention Center.

Two 16-year-old males were arrested for damage to property (party to a crime), forced entry to a locked vehicle, and obstructing.

A 13-year-old male was arrested for damage to property (party to a crime), entry to a locked vehicle and possession of THC.

A 15-year-old male was arrested for damage to property, entry to a locked vehicle and obstructing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a crash that occurred early Sunday morning on the city’s east side.
 
Officers were dispatched to N. Fair Oaks Avenue around 3:30 a.m.
 
A caller said he saw four people running away from the car after it hit a home.
 
No one inside the house was injured, but the vehicle damaged the front porch.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A woman was arrested Saturday afternoon following an incident at a park near downtown Madison.
 
Officers were dispatched to Reynolds Park, which is located along the 800 block of E. Mifflin St., around 4:20 p.m.

Multiple witnesses reported seeing a woman involved in inappropriate acts at the park. They said the woman became upset afterward when she was unable to find her personal belongings.

The woman left the area briefly. Witnesses said she pulled a knife on a man when she returned. 
 
The woman was taken into custody outside a business nearby.
 
Rebecca L. Luick, 42, was arrested for lewd/lascivious behavior, 2nd-degree reckless endangering safety and disorderly conduct while armed.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is asking for the public's help in identifying a man wanted in a theft case.

On June 24, the man stole the personal belongings of people shopping at the St. Vincent Depaul store on S. Park St.

The incident happened around 3:45 p.m. on that Friday.

Anyone with information should call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014. Tips can also be submitted online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department continues to investigate stolen auto cases involving certain KIA and Hyundai vehicles.
 
On Monday, officers were dispatched to a hotel along the 400 block of Commerce Ave. at 7:20 a.m.
 
An out-of-town guest called for police after his rental car was stolen.
 
The victim was from a different state and unaware of the spike in Kia and Hyundai vehicles being stolen.
 
Broken glass was found on the ground near where the vehicle was last parked.

A Madison man was arrested early Tuesday morning following a weeks-long drug investigation.

MPD Swat assisted the Dane County Narcotics Task Force with a knock and announce search warrant at an apartment along the 300 block of Thompson Dr.

A 40-year-old man was arrested. He is a convicted felon and currently on parole for a previous drug charge.

A firearm was also located inside the home.

Abdullah J. Burton was taken into custody on a parole violation without incident.

A Madison man was arrested Monday morning following a domestic disturbance on the city’s west side.
 
Officers were dispatched to Sonora Ct. around 1:30 a.m. on Monday.
 
Officers arrived to find an armed man attempting to enter the home through a broken window.
 
The man also punched the victim several times while attempting to do so.
 
The suspect and victim are known to each other.
 
Nathaniel M. Smith, 35, was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed, domestic disorderly conduct while armed, domestic battery, carrying a concealed weapon and bail jumping.

Address: W. Main St. at S. Carroll St.
Details:
The Madison Police Department is looking to identify a man wanted for injuring someone attending a protest regarding the overturn of Roe V. Wade.

A victim, a 26-year-old man, suffered two broken bones as a result of being purposefully tripped by the suspect. 

He was in Madison on June 24 documenting the protest around the Wisconsin State Capitol when the incident happened. He was able to capture video of the suspect and turned the images over to police.

Anyone who recognizes the suspect is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com

The Madison Police Department is investigating two incidents of vandalism against religious organizations.
 
Both incidents happened in early July.
 
On July 2, the Madison Police Department received a report about graffiti spray-painted on an exterior wall and the front sign of Abundant Life Christian School. The school is located along the 4900 block of E. Buckeye Rd.
 
Employees said the school was fine when they left on Friday night, but noticed the damage Saturday morning.
 
The graffiti involved a message about abortion and criticized the police.
 
At this time, no arrests have been made.
 
The Madison Police Department previously shared information regarding the vandalism done at Bernard Catholic Church, located on Atwood Ave.
 
Abortion and anti-police rhetoric were spray painted on the front door and sign of the church.
 
Detectives believe both incidents are linked.
 
Anyone with information is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.
 
Tips can be left anonymously. Those providing information leading to an arrest may also qualify for a monetary reward.

Both incidents remain under investigation.

Address: N. Thompson Dr. at Homewood Circle
Details:
A man was arrested for his sixth OWI following a crash on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to N. Thompson Dr. at Homewood Circle around noon on Tuesday.

A truck veered off the roadway and hit a tree. An off-duty officer, from another jurisdiction, came across the crash site and assisted until officials with the Madison Fire Department and Madison Police Department arrived.

Responders with MFD administered a dose of Narcan to the driver. He suffered non-life-threatening injuries in the crash.

Banking cards, belonging to several different people, were found in the truck.

The driver, Christopher D. Joles, 33, was arrested on a number of charges, including sixth-offense operating a motor vehicle while intoxicated, credit card theft, operating while revoked and bail jumping.?

Missing: Joshua Cera
6’ 200lbs, short black hair,
 
MPD is requesting assistance in locating a missing person, 29-year-old Joshua Cera.  Joshua’s last known location was walking near the Barrymore Theatre on 7/20/22 at approximately 9pm.  See attached pictures.
 
If located, please contact your local law enforcement agency, or the Dane County Public Safety Communications Center at (608)255-2345.

The Madison Police Department responded to a security incident at the American Family Insurance headquarters on Thursday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to the 6000 block of American Pkwy shortly after 2 p.m. due to a banned person on campus.

The incident caused a lockdown at American Family.

The person involved was no longer on campus by the time officers arrived. He was pulled over nearby and eventually issued a trespassing ticket.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a crash involving a stolen vehicle.

Officers were dispatched to the 6700 block of Schroeder Rd. around 1:20 a.m. Friday.

A witness noticed someone driving a Kia Soul recklessly before it crashed into a fence. The witness also saw two people run from the crash scene.

A drone and K-9 team were utilized but were unable to locate the suspects.

The Kia was stolen from a residence on Struck St. and another Kia at that location had been tampered with, but not stolen.

The investigation remains ongoing.

Address: WB Highway 12 at Fist Hatchery Rd.
Details:
A driver was arrested for a fifth-offense OWI following a crash on the Beltline.

Officers were dispatched to the off-ramp to westbound Fish Hatchery Rd. shortly after 10 p.m. Thursday.

One vehicle was badly damaged in the crash.

Officers located open canisters of aerosol dusters inside the vehicle.

The driver, Tyler S. Boyes, was taken to the hospital and then transported to the Dane County Jail.

Boyes, 34, was arrested for a fifth-offense OWI and a probation violation.

Madison police are investigating after an auto parts delivery vehicle was stolen.
 
The vehicle was parked outside of the Advance Auto Parts store on Stoughton Rd.
 
It was reported missing around 4 p.m. on Thursday.
 
This investigation is ongoing at this time.

Two people were taken to the hospital following a Thursday morning crash on Madison’s north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Northport Dr. and School Rd. around 7:30 a.m.
 
Multiple witnesses the driver, a 33-year-old woman, was arguing with someone walking in the area. Her vehicle left the road and hit a tree, causing the vehicle to flip over.
 
The driver and a woman riding in the front seat were taken to the hospital. The children in the backseat were not injured.
 
The driver was cited for reckless driving causing injury.

Address: Vahlen St. and N. Sherman Ave.
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating a shooting on the city’s north side.
 
A gunshot victim was located in the area of Vahlen St. and N. Sherman Ave. around 11:20 a.m.  He suffered life-threatening injuries.
 
Additional shots were fired on Vera Ct. around the same time.
 
At this time, MPD is working to determine if the two incidents are connected.
 
No arrests have been made. The scene remains active.
 
The public is asked to find an alternate route if they are needing to come to this area of town.

Address: E. Washington Ave at Continental Lane
Details:
The Madison Police Department investigated a single-vehicle motorcycle crash early Monday morning.  The 911 caller heard a crash and screaming. The caller also noticed two people running from the scene.

Officers on scene contacted STOC, State Traffic Operations Center for assistance. STOC provided information on the direction of traffic and pre-crash driving behaviors.  The cameras captured the driver being picked up in a vehicle. The passenger continued to run from the scene.
 
A MPD K9 Officer attempted to track the subjects but was unsuccessful.
 
The motorcycle was towed from the scene.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman was sexually assaulted by two strangers early Sunday morning.
 
The woman was waiting for a rideshare driver along the 500 block of State St. when she was approached by two men.
 
The men made sexually inappropriate comments and groped the woman without consent. They then led her to a nearby vehicle and drove away from the area.
 
The woman fought back as one of the men continued to assault her. She was eventually able to get out of the vehicle.
 
Multiple witnesses saw her get out of the vehicle and helped the woman get to a safe location.
 
Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously.

Address: Langdon St and N Frances St
Details: Officers were attempting a traffic stop when one of the subjects fled on foot. That subject is in custody but the investigation is still ongoing. Please avoid the area.

The Madison Police Department is looking to identify the man who made an illegal upgrade to his bicycle by stealing a different one.
 
Video shows the theft happened around 11 a.m. on Sunday morning at an apartment building along the 300 block of E. Dayton St. The incident was reported to police Tuesday morning.
 
The bike was locked up in a parking area of the property. The man is spotted clipping the lock and riding away on the new bike, leaving his old one behind.
 
If you are able to identify this man please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a burglary at a market located along the 300 block of S. Brearly St.

The incident happened around 5:20 a.m. along the 300 block of S. Brearly St.

Video evidence shows a man forcing entry into the business. He then stole a cash register.

The business has been broken into several times in the last few months.

No arrests have been made.

The incident remains under investigation. 

Anyone with information about this burglary is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

A man was arrested for crashing a stolen vehicle into a tree and causing the vehicle to start on fire.

The crash occurred at the intersection of Marsh and Voges Rds. around 4:30 p.m. Wednesday.

Witnesses in the area directed officers to where the suspect was last seen. Officers tracked the suspect to a home. 

The suspect sees this and jumped out of a window. He was not injured in the jump and was quickly arrested.

He also did not suffer any injuries in the crash.

Tommie West, 20, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without the owner's consent, bail jumping and damage to property.

A man was arrested for substantial battery, among other charges, after a man was found unconscious on State St.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 600 block of State St. around 11:35 p.m. on Tuesday.
 
The victim was found with non-life-threatening injuries and taken to the hospital.
 
A witness provided a suspect description. The suspect was located on Wednesday wearing the exact clothing as described by the witness.
 
Willie L. Triplett, 60, was arrested for substantial battery, disorderly conduct and possession of drug paraphernalia.

The Madison Police Department is seeking community help in locating a runaway 16-year-old girl.

Quianna M. Krenn was last seen at an apartment along the 400 block of Algoma St. on Friday.

Quianna is 5’07”, around 125 pounds and has long black hair and brown eyes. She may be wearing rectangle-shaped glasses.
 
Quianna was last seen wearing a black shirt with the Los Angeles Lakers logo on it and ripped jeans. The shirt is cut on the sleeves and has safety pins holding them together.
 
There is a possibility Quianna may be in the Milwaukee area.
 
Anyone with information on her whereabouts is asked to call their local police department.

On July 28, 2022 at approximately 10:20pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to 240 East Towne Mall (Buffalo Wild Wings) regarding a stolen auto complaint. The victim, working for food delivery service was picking up a delivery from the restaurant when two unknown individuals got into his vehicle and drove away quickly from the area.

Inside the vehicle, on the front passenger seat was a 10-week-old brown and white Boston Terrier named “Malloy” (see attached photograph). The Madison Police department is asking for assistance in locating both the vehicle and “Malloy” as there is concern that he will not survive if improperly cared for or left abandoned.

The vehicle is a 2014 Chevrolet Cruz, white in color, and bearing Kentucky license plate 028XMB. Anyone with information regarding this stolen auto investigation, or the whereabouts of “Malloy” the puppy should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345.

Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after someone broke into a restaurant by climbing through a drive-thru window.

Officers were dispatched to the Michael's Frozen Custard on Atwood Ave. around 10:00 a.m. on Thursday.

Video shows the suspect attempting to gain entry through the front doors by using a crowbar.

When they were unable to gain entry, the suspect then moved to the drive-thru window.

Money was stolen during the incident.

No arrests have been made and this remains an active investigation.

Anyone with information about this burglary is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Crisis negotiators with the Madison Police Department were able to convince a suspect to release a child and leave a home without incident during a domestic disturbance.

Officers were dispatched to a home along the 5400 block of Camden Rd. regarding a 911 disconnect.

This incident led to an on-duty SWAT call.

Responding officers learned a man was acting violently inside the home and that a young child remained inside.

Negotiators were able to convince the man to allow the child to leave the residence. They also were able to get him to leave the home without incident.

Nathan Selmer, 36, was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed, battery and criminal damage to property. 

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is asking for assistance in locating Ocie Crisler who was last seen at 8pm on July 22nd in the City of Madison, WI and has not been heard from since. He has a heart condition and takes regular medication and did not appear to take any with him. It is out of normal routine for him to be missing and his whereabouts are unknown. Family is concerned and has not heard from him.  

Ocie is a 68 year old black male last seen wearing a white t-shirt, black shorts, gray Nike sneakers and possible a watch on his left wrist.  He was last seen at the South Park Street address and resides in the 1700 block of Blossom Lane.

If located, please contact your local law enforcement agency, or the Dane County Public Safety Communications Center at (608)255-2345.

Arrested:
1) Charles Butler, 48-Years-Old
Charges: 1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Battery, and Disorderly Conduct. 

2) Bruce Parker, 56 Year-Old-Male 
Charges: Battery, and Disorderly Conduct.
Address: 6800 block of Park Ridge Drive, Madison, WI
Details:
On July 29, 2022 at approximately 10:43pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to a residence in the 6800 block of Park Ridge Drive regarding a weapons offense (stabbing). The victim and suspects in this case are known to each other. After an argument, both of the intoxicated suspects physically attacked the victim, causing injuries.

A second argument ensued a short time later in which Charles produced a knife and then stabbed the victim multiple times. The victim sustained additional injuries as a result of being stabbed and was transported to a local hospital. He is expected to survive.

A Madison Police Sergeant, Investigator, Detective, and multiple Officers were at the residence for several hours while processing the scene which included utilizing an Unmanned Aircraft System in the area. The scene of the crime is now clear and both suspects  (Charles and Bruce) have been booked into the Dane County Jail.

Anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Arrested:
Larry Hawkins; 23-Year-Old Male
Charges: Possession of Schedule II Narcotics and Trespass

Joseph Thigpen; 23-Year-Old Male
Charges; Carrying a Concealed Weapon and Trespass
Details:
On July 30, 2022 Madison Police Officers from the Central District’s Community Policing Team (CPT) were working proactive patrol in the Downtown Entertainment Zone.

At approximately 2:10am, these officers observed a vehicle parked in a lot which is posted no trespassing and upon contact with the vehicle driver and its occupants, drug evidence is observed inside the vehicle.

The drive and three occupants were contacted and ultimately Hawkins was arrested for Possession of Schedule II Narcotics and Trespass. Thigpen was arrested for Carrying a Concealed Weapon and Trespass after a loaded handgun was found concealed on his person. The handgun was seized by police. Two other occupants of the vehicle were released with municipal citations for trespass.

On 7-30-22 at approximately 10:42 pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 4500 block of Stein Ave for a disturbance. When officers arrived on scene, an adult male was located outside with multiple gunshot  wounds. The adult male victim was taken to a local area hospital for his injuries, which are non-life threatening, and the victim is expected to live. From the investigation, it appears that the victim was targeted, and this was not a random incident.  Officers utilized a K9 and a drone but the suspect was not located and he is at large at this time. This investigation is ongoing.

On 7-31-22 at approximately 1:41 am,  Madison Police Officers were dispatched to thee 4300 block of the West Beltline Highway Frontage RD reference shots fired. When officers arrived on scene, multiple shell casings were discovered in that area. There was not any property damage located and no reported injuries at this time.

On 7-31-22 at approximately 3:17 am, MPD Officers were dispatched to the 7200 block of Midtown Rd reference hearing multiple shots fired. When officers arrived on scene, multiple shell casings were located in the 7200 block of Midtown Rd. There was no property damage located and there have been no reported injuries at this time.

An officer was on routine patrol, checking businesses in his beat, when he noticed a man laying on the ground next to his wheelchair in front of Discount Tire.  The officer also noticed that the windows of the business had been damaged.  When the officer asked the man if he had damaged the windows, the man admitted that he did and he told the officer that he needed to go to jail.  A total of 6 panes of glass and the glass pane to the front door were damaged.  The man was arrested for CDTP and he was taken to jail.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a fatal crash involving a bicyclist.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Pflaum Rd. and Mustang Way around 2:20 p.m. on Monday.

The crash involved a bicycle and a box truck.

The cyclist, a man in his 70s, was pronounced dead at the scene. His identity will be released by the medical examiner’s office at a later date.

This incident remains under investigation.

Address: S. Stoughton Rd. at Buckeye Rd.
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating a crash involving multiple vehicles that sent one person to the hospital.
