At least one person is injured.

No arrests have been made.

This remains a very active scene.

People are asked to avoid the area at this time.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Cottage Grove Rd and Vernon Ave for a vehicle vs. pedestrian crash. The pedestrian was transported to a local hospital. The investigation into the crash is ongoing.

On 11/30/2022 at approximately 10:05 PM, Madison Police were dispatched to the 1400 block of Northport Drive for a subject with a gunshot wound.  The subject was located and believed to be suffering from a non-life threatening gunshot wound.  The investigation is ongoing at this time but there is no known threat to the public.

Address: Highway 12 at Todd Dr. and Seminole
Details:
There were no injuries after a bullet struck a moving truck during a shots fired incident on the westbound Beltline.
 
Officers were dispatched to the area between Todd Dr. and Seminole Highway around 4:40 p.m.
 
Half of the front passenger window was shot out and the bullet left the vehicle the front windshield.
 
The driver does not believe he was the intended target.
 
No injuries were reported.
 
Officers were unable to locate any bullet casings.

The investigation remains ongoing.

Address: Vilas Ave. at S. Randall Ave.
Details:
A skateboarder suffered injuries after he was hit by a vehicle late Tuesday night.
 
The 19-year-old was going down the hill of Vilas Ave. towards S. Randall Ave. when he was unable to slow down at the intersection.
 
A driver was in the area and unable to stop in time.
 
The driver helped the skateboarder into his vehicle and drove him to the hospital.
 
The skateboarder was issued a citation by the investigating officer.
 
The incident remains under investigation.

Address: Eagan Rd. at East Towne Blvd.
Details:
A 39-year-old man suffered minor injuries after he was hit by a vehicle late Wednesday afternoon.
 
Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Eagan Road and East Towne Blvd. shortly before 5 p.m.
 
The victim tried running across Eagan Rd. when he was hit by a slow-moving vehicle. He suffered minor injuries.
 
He was cited for sudden pedestrian movement.
 
The driver of the vehicle was cooperative and remained on the scene.
Officers were dispatched to the area of 305 N. Frances Street for multiple reports of shots fired. After an investigation, no injuries or property damage  discovered.

Officers responded to 300 N Frances Street for reports of a fight that turned into a stabbing. One of the three involved in the altercation sustained non-life threatening wounds from a knife. The person who committed the stabbing was arrested and the knife was recovered. There is no ongoing threat to the community. Many potential witnesses left the scene before they could be contacted by the police. Anyone with information on this weapons offense should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345

Address: Pleasant View Rd. at Flagstone Dr.
Details:
One person is dead following a fiery crash on Madison’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to Pleasant View Rd. at Flagstone Dr. around 1103 p.m. on Sunday.

Officers arrived to find a vehicle on fire. The vehicle struck a light fixture and a thick metal utility pole during the crash.

A body was found inside the vehicle once the fire was extinguished.

The Medical Examiner’s office will release the identity of the victim at a later date.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A man suffered injuries after he was struck in the head with an axe during an armed robbery.

Officers were dispatched to the Motel 6 located along the 4200 block of E. Towne Mall around 5 a.m. Sunday.
 
The victim was first approached by the suspect in the 1700 block of Theirer Rd. During this interaction, the suspect grabbed the victim and demanded he hand over his wallet.
 
The suspect then followed the victim to the motel. While outside, he hit the victim in the head with a small axe.

The 54-year-old victim suffered non-life-threatening injuries. He was transported to the hospital.

The suspect was not located at this time. No arrests have been made.

The investigation remains ongoing.

Multiple officers in the West District heard several shots being fired early Sunday morning.

Officers believed the shots were fired in the area of Watts and Junction Roads around 12:15 a.m.

Several officers checked near this intersection but were unable to locate any evidence of shots being fired.

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: Old Middleton Rd. at Norman Way
Details:
A Madison man was arrested or his 7th-offense OWI following a Monday afternoon crash.
 
Around 12:40 p.m., an officer on the Traffic Enforcement Safety Team came across a car crashed against a tree in the area of Old Middleton Rd. and Norman Way.
 
The officer notices a man walking nearby and witnesses say he was the driver.

Nathaniel Smith, 46, was arrested for seventh-offense OWI, threats to law enforcement, resisting and bail jumping.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a vehicle was stolen on the city’s west side.

A man loaned his car to a roommate. The roommate returned the vehicle Monday night, but the car was no longer there the following morning.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 6700 block of Schroeder Road shortly before 11 a.m. Tuesday.

A lot of broken class was found where the car was previously parked. The stolen vehicle is a KIA.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after someone broke into a home Wednesday evening.
 
Officers were dispatched to a home along the 2300 block of Commonwealth Ave. around 7:30 p.m.
 
A couple returned home to find their back door was kicked in and that every room had been ransacked.
 
No arrests have been made.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

Madison police are investigating after several shell casings were found on Portage Rd.
 
A passerby located shell casings along the 2000 block of Portage Road around 10:15 a.m. Thursday.
 
Responding officers were able to locate around ten more.

No homes or nearby property were damaged.

No one reported hearing any shots being fired.

The investigation is ongoing.

Several officers, including a K-9 team, worked together to arrest a man who stole several items from a delivery truck.

Officers were initially dispatched to Luna’s Groceries around 10:46 a.m. Thursday to investigate a theft from a vehicle. Luna’s is located along the 2000 block of Red Arrow Trail.
 
A man reported that someone stole his wallet and an iPad from his delivery truck.
 
The incident was caught on surveillance video.
 
Officers received information the suspect was still in the area. A K-9 unit was able to track him down to a nearby garage on Whenona Dr.

Leroy McCambry, 31, was arrested for theft, and resisting and transported to the Dane County Jail.

Power was knocked out to several homes after a crash early Friday morning on Raymond Rd.

Officers were dispatched to the 5100 block around 3 a.m.

A vehicle struck an electrical pole during the crash.

Madison Gas & Electronic responded and several police units helped with traffic control due to the downed power lines.

No injuries were reported.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department has been responding and assisting with multiple vehicle crashes, slide-offs, and traffic issues as a result of the weather.

The department went on priority-only calls around 8:30 a.m. We returned to routine calls for service roughly four hours later.

According to the City of Madison Streets Department, all city streets will be plowed on Friday. Plowing will begin at 3 p.m. and will take approximately 12-14 hours before all Madison streets receive their initial plowing.

The City of Madison snow emergency parking rules will be in effect starting Saturday evening.

You can read more about plow operations and snow emergency guidelines here.

One person was injured Friday evening during a shooting on the city’s north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to an apartment building along the 2500 block of Calypso Road around 5:30 p.m.
 
A 36-year-old man was shot in the hallway of the building. Responding officers provided life-saving aid and he was taken to the hospital.
 
The suspect and victim are known to one another. They were involved in an argument before the shooting.
 
No arrests have been made.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Officers seized two firearms for safekeeping after responding to a disturbance on the city’s west side.
 
Officers were dispatched to an apartment on Sayner Court around 2:20 a.m. Tuesday.
 
They arrived to find blood on the exterior door and at a neighboring apartment.
 
A man and woman at the scene were covered in blood. Both appeared intoxicated and refused to provide a statement to police.
 
Officers conducted a protective sweep of the apartments. No one else was inside. During the search, officers found two firearms in plain view.
 
The guns were seized for safekeeping.
 
Both the man and woman were transported to the hospital for treatment.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Officers were dispatched to the Buffalo Wild Wings to check on a man passed out at the bar.
 
They contacted Morgan W. Little, who had an outstanding warrant for sixth-offense OWI.
 
Little was taken to the Dane County Jail where cocaine as found on him.

He was booked in on the warrant and new charges of Possession of Cocaine.

A man was taken to the hospital after his vehicle crashed into a pole Monday night.
 
Officers were dispatched to the area of Nakoma Rd. and Spring Trail just before 6:30 p.m. Tuesday.

Witnesses observed a car operating erratically prior to hitting the pole.
 
The pole was knocked down during the crash and caused Nakoma Rd. to close down. The pole was not electrical.
 
It’s believed the 50-year-old driver suffered a medical event before the crash.
 
The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after multiple people reported hearing gunshots on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Troy Drive around 2:20 a.m.

Witnesses reported seeing the suspect vehicle speed away from the area. It was located unoccupied at an address on Wyldewood Dr.

Unfired rounds were spotted in plain view inside the suspect vehicle.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a vehicle was stolen from a car dealership lot.

Officers were dispatched to the Russ Darrow dealership located along the 6500 block of Odana Rd.

Surveillance video shows the theft happened on Sunday. The incident was reported around 4:30 p.m. Tuesday.
 
No arrests have been made.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

A Madison man was arrested following a disturbance in the food court at West Towne Mall.

Officers were called to the mall around 5 p.m. Tuesday after a man and woman began arguing.
 
The man had bail conditions not to be in contact with the woman. When officers attempted to take him into custody, he became uncooperative and began to resist arrest.

Christian A. Brown, 29, was arrested for bail jumping, obstructing and resisting arrest.

The investigation is ongoing.

Multiple people reported hearing gunshots on the city’s north side late Wednesday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Troy Dr. around 10 p.m.

Officers checked the area and found nothing suspicious at this time.

No injuries or property damage were reported.

The investigation is ongoing.

A woman was injured after shew as struck by a vehicle on the city’s south side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the area of Moreland Rd. near Manor Dr. around 6:15 p.m. Wednesday.
 
The 47-year-old victim was crossing midblock when she was hit. She was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.
 
The driver involved stayed at the scene and was cooperative. He received an operating while suspended citation.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department and the University of Wisconsin-Madison Police Department are working together after someone vandalized University and city property.

The Madison Police Department received a self-report about the damage Friday morning.

Graffiti was found on the UW Hillel Foundation building and Lowell Hall. The UW Hillel Foundation is a campus organization that supports Jewish students and their faith.

The same paint was used to vandalize a nearby E-bike station the city operates.

The suspect was caught on surveillance video during the act. A still image from that video and a photo are attached to this release.

If you recognize this person or have any information about this incident, please call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014. Tips can also be left anonymously at p3tips.com.

At this time, investigators believe the spray-painted buildings and structures were random and not targeted. However, this remains an active and ongoing investigation.

Address: N. Thompson Dr. at Wayridge Dr.
Details:
A man driving on the city’s east side reported having a gun flashed at him during a road rage incident.
 
Officers were dispatched to the area of N. Thompson and Wayridge Drives shortly before 4 p.m.
 
The victim reported traveling eastbound on Lien Road near the roundabout at N. Thompson when he accidentally cut off another vehicle.
 
The victim told officers the other driver yelled something toward him and pointed a gun at him.

No one was injured. No arrests have been made. The investigation is ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to a restaurant on the city’s east side for an incident early Friday morning.
 
They arrived to find a man and woman highly intoxicated causing a disturbance.
 
The woman involved was placed into protective custody due to her level of alcohol consumption.
 
The man interjected and was restrained by officers. He was taken to the Dane County Jail and will be charged with misdemeanor resisting and obstructing.

An Illinois man was arrested on a variety of charges, including false imprisonment and battery, following a disturbance at a downtown hotel.
 
Officers were dispatched to a hotel on W. Dayton Street around 12:30 a.m. Friday.
The victim was in town from out of state visiting a man she recently met on a social media dating app.
 
The woman told officers the man blocked her from leaving the room and hit her.
 
The man called hotel security after the woman locked herself in the bathroom. The woman fled from the hotel room once security arrived and police were called.
 
Madison officers arrested Nathan H. Doering, 35, for false imprisonment, disorderly conduct, battery and criminal damage to property.

He was taken into custody without incident.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: N. Gammon Rd. at Old Sauk Rd.
Details:
Three vehicles were involved in a rollover crash Sunday afternoon on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of Gammon and Old Sauk Roads just after 2 p.m.
 
Officers arrived to find one vehicle had rolled over in the crash.
 
A witness reported seeing a vehicle run a red light and hit another. A third vehicle was struck after the initial crash.
 
No one was taken to the hospital.
 
The road was shut down until it was safely cleaned up.
 
A 45-year-old driver received a citation.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A K-9 team helped track down a man who was spotted slumped over his steering wheel before driving off and causing a crash.
 
Officers and first responders with the Madison Fire Department were initially dispatched to High Crossing Blvd. and East Springs Dr. around 1 p.m. on Friday.
 
People reported seeing a driver slumped over the wheel of a red SUV that nearly caused multiple crashes.
 
As first responders were on their way, the man woke up and drove to a nearby parking lot.
 
First responders with MFD arrived and chocked the vehicle’s tires. The man came to again and accelerated hard enough to jump the wheel chocks. He almost hit two paramedics as he sped away.
 
The man drove northbound at E. Springs Dr. and struck a vehicle when he ran the signal at E. Washington Ave.
 
The man then ran away from the scene.

A K-9 team tracked the man down on the E. Washington frontage road, near Carpets Plus.

Timothy J. Baumann, 37, was taken into custody without incident.

He was eventually booked into the Dane County Jail for OWI causing injury, operating without a valid license causing injury, hit and run causing injury and second-degree recklessly endangering safety.
 
The investigation into this incident is ongoing.

A 73-year-old woman was found deceased in her vehicle Saturday afternoon.
 
Officers were initially asked to do a welfare check at the woman’s home on N. Wickham Ct. around 5:25 p.m.
 
A short time later, an officer located the woman’s vehicle outside of a Madison business. The woman was found deceased inside.
 
The death is not considered suspicious in nature.

Drugs collected during an overdose investigation tested positive for fentanyl on Sunday.
 
Officers were dispatched to an apartment along the 1500 block of Trailsway around 7 a.m. on Sunday.
 
A woman called for help after finding a 39-year-old man unresponsive. He was pronounced dead at the hospital.
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after thousands of dollars of televisions were stolen from a building under construction.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of E. Washington Ave. around 9:50 a.m. after the crime was reported.
 
Officers are reviewing digital evidence related to this investigation.
 
No arrests have been made at this time.

This remains an active investigation.

Anyone with information related to this incident is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014. Tips can also be left anonymously at p3tips.com.

On Dec. 9, a Madison officer was dispatched to speak to an employee of the Kwik Trip in the 3500 block of E. Washington Avenue. 

The employee reported an incident where a customer of theirs experienced a significant medical event after withdrawing money from the ATM. 

During the medical event, the victim was unconscious – bleeding on the ground while being attended to by Kwik Trip employees and Good Samaritan customers. 

A suspect in the store took that opportunity to feign assistance to the victim, while actually collecting the victim’s scattered cash and fleeing the scene.  The victim was transported to a local hospital for treatment and later gave a statement to an MPD Detective.

This suspect, out on bail for a series of Commercial Burglaries, was quickly identified through store surveillance. 

On 12-14-22, with the assistance of the Sun Prairie Police Department, Michael S Pisano was arrested on charges of Theft from a Person and numerous charges of Felony Bail Jumping.

A woman was arrested for third-offense OWI following a hit-and-run crash on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to Pflaum Rd. and the frontage road at Stoughton Rd. shortly after 4 p.m. on Monday.
 
The victim was not injured in the crash, but his car experienced damage.
 
The license plate of the suspect’s vehicle was left at the scene and officers were able to track her down to a nearby business where she worked.
 
Officers could smell intoxicants coming from the suspect. She also admitted to drinking prior to the crash.
 
Kimberly A. Hiekel, 31, was arrested for third-offense OWI, felony bail jumping and hit-and-run.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: S. Stoughton Rd. at E. Broadway St.
Details:
Officers were sent to help a woman found lying on the ground on the side of the road around 4:40 p.m. Tuesday.

People spotted the woman while drying by the S. Stoughton Rd. and E. Broadway St. intersection.

Officers arrived to find the woman heavily intoxicated.

The woman was transported to a local hospital for medical treatment.

Address: Mineral Point Rd. at Commerce Dr.
Details:
One person was injured during a two-car crash on the city's west side Tuesday evening.

A woman was attempting to make a left turn off Mineral Point Rd. onto Commerce Dr. when she was hit by another vehicle.

The driver of the other vehicle ran a red light before the crash. The driver of this vehicle was taken to the hospital. Her injuries are non-life-threatening.

She was cited for a red-light violation.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Madison police were called after a fight between two neighbors became physical. 

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building along the 1800 block of Aberg Ave. around 3:00 p.m. Tuesday.

A 66-year-old man was arrested for battery and a felony warrant. 

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: E. Johnson St. at Fordem Ave.
Details:
The Madison Police Department responded to a t-bone crash that left one person injured on Tuesday.

Officers were dispatched to E. Johnson St. at Fordem Ave. around 1:45 p.m.

A woman was about to turn onto Fordem Ave. when the crash happened.

The driver of the other vehicle, a 54-year-old man, was injured in the crash and taken to the hospital. His injuries are not life-threatening.

No citations were issued at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

A vehicle narrowly missed several customers as it was speeding through the parking lot of an east-side grocery store.

Officers responded to the HyVee along the 3800 block of E. Washington Ave. around 8:45 a.m. on Monday.

Officers quickly deployed tire-deflating devices to get the vehicle to stop moving. However, the driver still attempted to speed away with three deflated tires.

He eventually pulled over for a passenger, who was inside the store prior to police arrival, buying a birthday cake for the driver.

Charles C. Hannon, 36, of Madison, was arrested for OWI and second-degree endangering safety.
 
The store was placed on a brief lockdown because of this incident.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A man was arrested for third-offense OWI following a rollover crash on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the Schroeder Rd. off-ramp from the eastbound Beltline around 8:30 p.m. on Sunday.

The driver, Curtis Herfel, 37, was medically cleared due to the crash and arrested for third-offense OWI.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A man was arrested for OWI following a traffic incident on the city’s west side.

An officer noticed a vehicle without brake lights and attempted a traffic stop around 2:30 a.m. on Monday.

The vehicle briefly backed up toward the officer's squad car but then sped away a short distance before stopping.

The driver then exited the vehicle and ignored officers asking him to stop.

Wilson D. Clarke Jr., 41, was arrested for second-offense OWI and resisting arrest.

The investigation is ongoing.

Six vehicles were involved a crash on the city’s east side on Friday.

The crash happened on the bridge of Stoughton Rd. over Cottage Grove Rd. around 7 p.m.

It appears ice was a factor in this incident. 

No significant injuries were reported, but the crash caused a road closure.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department assisted with a water leak Saturday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of N. Baldwin St. around 10:30 a.m. for water coming out of the ground near the road.

Madison Water Utility was called and assisted at the scene. Employees believe the water is coming from the basement of a nearby building.

The homeowners were contacted.

The Street's Division also provided sand to the street due to slippery conditions.

Officers responded to a restaurant after a man was found unresponsive on Christmas Eve.

Officers were dispatched to the 1300 block of E. Washington Ave. around 10:30 p.m.

They attempted life-saving measures on the man but he was unable to be revived. 

Nothing suspicious were found at the scene and the man showed no signs of drug use.

The Madison Police Department is warning residents about a police impersonation scam after a college student almost lost $30,000.

The scam was reported to MPD around 1:15 p.m. on Monday.

A woman received phone calls, emails and text messages from someone pretending to be a Chinese police officer. The fake officer instructed her to pay the money due to her involvement in a criminal investigation.

The woman tried to send the money, but thankfully her bank flagged the transaction as suspicious.

This type of scam typically targets the foreign student population and often results in large financial losses. Scammers are also known to impersonate the IRS, Medicare, the Federal Trade Commission, doctors and your grandkids.

In these situations, scammers may know your name, mention the call is being recorded, claim you’ve missed a court appearance and tell you to take action immediately to avoid being arrested.

The best way to avoid being fooled is to never send money to strangers.  Law enforcement agencies will never ask you to purchase bitcoin, gift cards or wire money as part of their investigations.

MPD also advises against sharing information like your address, social security number or bank account information to strangers over the phone.

And do not give in to the pressure. Scammers have been known to try and threaten people. If you ever find yourself in this situation, please reach you to your local agency’s non-emergency number, independently.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman was robbed while unloading groceries from her car.

Officers responded to a home along the 1000 block of Tony Drive around 5:35 p.m. Wednesday.

A woman was parked in her garage, unloading her car, when a man approached her through an open door.

The suspect held scissors to the woman’s throat and demanded money. He stole her keys and wallet, but quickly discarded these items once he realized there was no cash inside the wallet.

A K-9 track was performed, but the suspect was not located.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence in this case. Images of the suspect from home security video cameras in the area are attached to this release.
 
The incident remains under investigation.

Anyone with information is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers 608-266-6014. Tips can also be submitted online at p3tips.com.

A Sergeant with the Madison Police Department was able to use an unmanned aircraft system (drone) to help the Wisconsin State Patrol find a suspect earlier this month.

The Wisconsin State Patrol was involved in a pursuit around 1:45 a.m. on Dec. 21. The vehicle crashed on the off-ramp from eastbound I-90 to westbound Highway 12 and the driver ran from the scene.

An MPD Sergeant in the area deployed the drone and was able to locate the suspect.

The drone followed the suspect as he tried to hide in a dumpster before moving toward a clump of trees.

The drone operator was able to talk officers to his location.

The suspect was eventually taken into custody without further incident.

He was wanted out of Milwaukee for 2nd-degree reckless homicide.

The Wisconsin State Patrol is handling the investigation.

A Madison man was arrested on several burglary charges after a search warrant was served on the city’s north side.

The warrant was served at an apartment unit located along the 1500 block of Wright St. on Dec. 21.

A search team comprised of personnel from the Burglary Crime Unit, Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement team and the University of Wisconsin-Madison Police Department processed the apartment, collecting evidence.

Johnnie L. McGahee, 49, was arrested on four counts of burglary for two MPD and two UWPD cases.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after multiple people reported hearing shots on the north side.

Officers were dispatched to Northridge Terrace around 4:30 p.m.

More than a dozen shell casings were located in the area.

No injuries or damages were reported.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A Madison man was arrested on multiple charges after a domestic disturbance on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Northport and Knutson Drives around 2:30 p.m. Thursday.

A man and woman were arguing when the man left in a stolen U-Haul vehicle.

The victim followed the suspect and the two vehicles were involved in a crash.

The suspect ended up at a nearby home. Officers attempted contact with the suspect, who eventually came outside peacefully.

Jacob R. Hommen, 31, was arrested for second-degree reckless endangering safety, operating a motor vehicle without owner's consent and several counts of bail jumping.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Officers had to position their squad cars to keep a vehicle from moving into traffic after a driver was found unresponsive Thursday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the Beltline at the Rimrock Road exit for an erratic driver.

They arrived to find a woman unresponsive in the front seat of the car with the vehicle still in drive.  After repeated efforts to ask for cooperation through the window, Officers safely extracted the driver from the car before she could attempt to leave. 
 
Jenna M. Frey, 29, was taken to the hospital and then arrested for second-offense OWI.

The investigation is ongoing.

More than a dozen mini alcohol bottles were found inside a woman’s vehicle following a traffic incident Thursday evening.

Officers were dispatched to the VA Hospital, located at 2500 Overlook Terrace, at 6 p.m.

Multiple people called to report a woman driving erratically. The vehicle was also involved in multiple hit-and-run crashes.  At one point, witnesses report seeing the vehicle going in the wrong direction of traffic.

There were no injuries to any of the victims.

Emily D. Copeland, 30, was arrested for second-offense OWI.

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: S. Stoughton Rd. at Pflaum Rd.
Details:
Three vehicles were involved in a crash after a woman drove home from a bar intoxicated.

Officers were dispatched to the S. Stoughton Rd. and Pflaum Rd. intersection around 10:25 p.m. Friday.

Witnesses reported seeing a car speeding before it hit two other vehicles. The driver involved blew a BAC nearly twice the legal limit.

No one was injured during this crash.

Lea N. White, 52, was arrested for first-offense OWI and reckless driving.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A restaurant owner was injured when she tried to prevent a woman from stealing another customer’s food and money out of the tip jar.

Officers were dispatched to a restaurant located along the 6600 block of Mineral Point Rd. around 11 p.m. Saturday.

The restaurant owner followed the suspect out of the door and tried to get the food back. During this time, the suspect hit the owner in the face, leaving a visible injury.

Jenella R. Robinson, 44, of Madison, was arrested for battery, disorderly conduct and felony bail jumping.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

No injuries, casings or signs of damage were located after someone reported hearing shots fire on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1500 block of Wright St. at 11:30 a.m. Saturday after someone reported hearing multiple shots fired.

Again, no signs of a shooting were located.

The investigation is ongoing.

A woman walked out of her bedroom Friday night to find a stranger sleeping on her couch.

Officers were dispatched to the 1700 block of Northport Dr. for this incident around 10:25 p.m.
 
The intoxicated man was still sleeping when officers arrived on scene.
 
Robert Jones, 67, was arrested for trespassing and disorderly conduct.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers were on a proactive patrol of a downtown parking lot when they noticed a gun in plain view of a parked vehicle, with a window partially down.

Additional officers were dispatched to the 200 block of W. Gilman St. around 11:50 p.m. Saturday.

The vehicle involved was registered to a man who did not possess a valid concealed carry permit and was a convicted felon. An image of the gun found is attached to this release.

Marijuana was also found inside.

The vehicle owner has a GPS device placed on him by the Department of Corrections and officers were able to find him at a nearby bar.

Arthur K. Johnson, 28, of Middleton, was arrested for possession of a firearm by a felon, possession with intent to deliver and receiving stolen property.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man unplugged an ATM, loaded it on a dolly and wheeled it out of a hotel lobby around 12:30 a.m. Wednesday.

Officers were dispatched to a hotel located along the 5300 block of High Crossing Blvd. for this theft.

It’s unclear how much money was inside the machine at the time it was stolen.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence connected to this case.

This remains an active investigation.

A couple reported being attacked after they were followed home by several vehicles from an eastside bar.

Officers were dispatched to the 2200 block of Allied Dr. around 5 a.m. Sunday.

A man and woman said they were at a club on the east side when they got into an altercation with some other customers. The couple left to go home and said they were attacked by three men and two women.

Investigators photographed the couple’s injuries.

No suspects were identified and no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Officers with the Madison Police Department were able to find a man experiencing a mental health crisis and transport him to a local hospital.

A man called for help for himself around 6:50 p.m. Officers arrived at his Hayes Rd. apartment to find the man gone.

Officers searched the area near Hayes Rd. but is unable to find the man.

A short while later, officers were dispatched to a hit-and-run crash on Eastpark Blvd. at Inspire Dr. involving the man’s vehicle.

A K-9 team and an MPD drone were brought in to help locate the man.

He was eventually found nearby and taken for medical treatment.

A man was arrested following a weapons-related call on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to a clinic located along the 310 block of E. Washington Ae. Around 6 a.m. on Thursday.

Witnesses reported there was a disturbance, a victim was pistol-whipped and shots were possibly fired.
An MPD K-9 team and officers did not locate any shell casings.

A suspect was identified and located at a home along the 300 block of Russell St. in Baraboo.
The Madison Police Department’s Central District Community Policing Team, detectives with the Violent Crimes Unit and Baraboo officers went to the home.

Chet Hummel, 34, was taken into custody and is currently in the Dane County Jail.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: S. High Point Rd. at Starr Grass Dr.
Details:
A 59-year-old man suffered a minor injury following a crash on the city’s west side Thursday evening.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of S. High Point Rd. at Starr Grass Dr. shortly before 7 p.m.

The victim was attempting to make a left turn onto Starr Grass Dr. when he was rear-ended by another driver.

He was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

The other driver was cited for following too closely.

A bullet entered an occupied car inches from where a driver was sitting during a shooting Saturday evening.

Officers were dispatched to the 4500 block of Village Ln. around 6:45 p.m.

Multiple people were outside and heard the shots.

The 38-year-old driver, scared for her safety, initially left the area but returned minutes later.

She was not injured, but her car was damaged during the incident.

The woman and the suspected shooter are known to one another.

This remains an open and active investigation.

Anyone with information on this case can contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Tipsters can remain anonymous and may be eligible for a cash reward for information leading to an arrest.

Officers helped revive an unresponsive woman from a potential heroin overdose early Saturday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Pluto St. around 12:15 a.m.

Upon arrival, they administered Narcan and began life-saving aid to the woman. Their efforts were effective and the woman became alert and responsive.

She was taken to the hospital for further treatment.

The woman was left with a felony order-in for possession of a controlled substance. She was also provided with MAARI paperwork and charges can be dismissed if the woman follows through with the program. MAARI is a program that targets Dane County residents who commit a non-violent, low-level crimes connected to addiction.

Officers responded to a hotel on the city’s south side after an intoxicated person reported that someone with a gun knocked on their room door.

Officers were dispatched to the 1600 block of Beltline Highway around 3:50 a.m. Saturday.

No armed person was located.
 
Officers were unable to corroborate the person’s story. No probable cause for an arrest was developed.

Address: W. Gilman St. at State St.
Details:
A gun, drug paraphernalia and several empty beer bottles were located inside a vehicle after officers were called to check on an unresponsive driver.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of W. Gilman and State Streets around 2:25 a.m. Saturday.

The vehicle was running when officers arrived at the scene.

The driver was uncooperative and threatened to harm responding officers. He also spit on them.

Deandre J. Fountain, 26, was arrested for first-offense OWI, threats to law enforcement, resisting arrest, disorderly conduct, going armed while intoxicated and discharging bodily fluids at public safety workers.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department responded to a rollover crash Monday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 600 block of Langdon around 8:45 a.m. A woman said her vehicle rolled over after it was rear-ended.

She was not injured in the crash.

The other driver left the crash scene and was detained in the 400 block of Gorham Street.

This accident is currently being investigated by traffic specialists. The case remains open.

This report will be updated once more information is available.

Someone stole cash during an overnight burglary at a fast-food restaurant in downtown Madison.

Video shows someone entering the Taco Bell on State St. around 3:45 a.m. Monday.

Around $200 was stolen.

No arrests have been made at this time.

This incident remains under investigation.

A 27-year-old passenger was taken to the hospital after the car she was riding in crashed into a pole.

Officers were dispatched to the 100 block of E. Wilson St. around 11:30 p.m. Monday.

The driver was not injured. Martha I. Green, 29, was arrested for second-offense OWI causing injury and for not having an ignition interlock device installed. She was also cited for operating without insurance.

The passenger was taken to the hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

Wilson St. was closed for 45 minutes as a result of the crash.

The incident remains under investigation.

A man was arrested for second-offense OWI following a crash between a vehicle and a tanker-truck.

Officers were dispatched to the 1800 block of Park St. around 1:40 a.m.

The tanker slowed for the railroad tracks and was rear-ended by the other car.

Paulino Mendoza-Tepepa, 33, was arrested for second-offense OWI.

No one was injured during the crash.

This incident remains under investigation.

Address: S. Park Street at Erin Street
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating two separate stranger sexual assaults that occurred Tuesday night in the Greenbush Neighborhood.

Two women reported they were walking in the neighborhood when they were approached and attacked by a Hispanic man from behind. Both were able to ward off the attacker and seek shelter.

Each of their attacks appears to be sexual in nature.

During the first attack, a woman was walking near South Park and Erin Streets when she was approached from behind. She was able to initially ward off her attacker but was eventually approached again near St. Mary’s Hospital. She was directed by Dane County dispatchers to seek help and shelter at the hospital until officers could arrive.

Minutes later, another woman was approached from behind in the area of Emerald and Orchard Streets. This victim was able to leave the area with the help of a concerned citizen.

The Madison Police Department is investigating each incident independently but believes there is a possibility these attacks were committed by the same suspect.

Both victims described their attacker as being a male, Hispanic, early twenties and wearing dark clothing.

Both attacks occurred within minutes of one another, in the area of Park Street, Erin Street, Orchard Street and Emerald Street.

The Madison Police Department is in communication with the UW-Madison Police Department and will be providing extra resources to this area.

If anyone has any information should call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Cigars and vape cartridges were stolen during a burglary at a convenience store on Madison's east side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1400 block of Pflaum Rd. around 12:10 a.m.

The front door of the business was shattered. 

Officers are reviewing digital evidence.

No arrests have been made at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit arrested a 25-year-old man for possession of child pornography on Thursday.

Members of SVU, Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team, and Special Weapons and Tactics unit served a search warrant at a home on High Point Oaks Ln.

Casey Thor Vernon was arrested. He has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a 77-year-old woman was assaulted late Wednesday night.

A man called 911 around 11:55 p.m. after hearing his neighbor calling for help.

Officers arrived to the E. Washington Ave. home to find the suspect still inside.

The victim knew the suspect and allowed him inside when he knocked on the door asking for assistance. She suffered injuries during the assault.

Milton L. Hanger, 54, was arrested for first-degree attempted sexual assault, physical abuse of an elder person, false imprisonment, strangulation, disorderly conduct and bail jumping.

This incident remains under investigation.

Officers responding to a burglary on the city’s east side encountered the suspect inside the store.

Officers were dispatched to the Mobil Gas Station along the 3800 block of E. Washington Ave. around 3:45 a.m. on Friday.

The suspect tried getting away from the area but was taken into custody.

Tyler T. Towsley was arrested for burglary, criminal damage to property and felony bail jumping.

The incident remains under investigation.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a stabbing on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1000 block of N. Sherman Ave. around 5:20 p.m.

One person was taken to the hospital with life-threatening injuries.  

No one is in custody at this time.

This remains an active scene and more information will be released later.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after someone broke into a warehouse on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to the building, located along the 3200 block of Progress Rd., around 8:20 a.m.

Two pieces of machinery were stolen.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Television sets were stolen during a burglary that occurred over the weekend.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment along the 4600 block of Atticus Way around 9:30 a.m. Monday.

A woman said she left town for the weekend and returned to find her apartment had been entered.

Two television sets were missing from the unit.

This incident remains under investigation.

A group of high school students in town for a sporting event reported having someone flash a potential weapon at them on the city’s east side.

The teens were at a fast food restaurant along the 1700 block of Theirer Rd. when they were approached by another vehicle.

The group said the other vehicle chased them around and the driver flashed an object at them. The teens believed the item was a gun, but could not fully make it out in the dark.
 
No one was injured.

This incident remains under investigation.

Address: E. Washington Ave. at Thierer Rd.
Details:
Marijuana was located in an unoccupied vehicle not long after it sped away from an officer during a traffic stop.

Officers attempted to pull the vehicle over on E. Washington Ave. at Thierer Rd. after they could detect the smell of marijuana coming from it.

The driver sped away during the traffic stop and the vehicle was later located on Wayridge Dr.

Witnesses reported seeing people running away from the vehicle.

A K-9 track was completed.

Marijuana and other items often used in drug incidents were located inside the abandoned car.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after an infant was found unresponsive at a home on the city’s west side. Officers were dispatched to a home on Welton Drive around 9:50 p.m. on Friday.

Both MPD Officers and Madison Fire Paramedics performed life-saving measures on the infant, which was transported to a local hospital. Unfortunately, the infant was pronounced deceased at the hospital.

This incident remains an active and on-going investigation by the MPD Special Victims Unit.

Madison police were dispatched to a fast food restaurant on the city’s west side following a disturbance Friday afternoon.

Officers were sent to the Wendy’s on Gammon Rd. around 12:30 p.m.

Employees called 911 after noticing a gun on an upset customer who caused a disturbance.  

Miguel Burgos, 30, of Madison, was arrested after his vehicle was located on the eastbound Beltline.
 
He was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed.

The investigation is ongoing.

Multiple people heard a gunshot Monday evening on the city’s north side, but no signs of a shooting were located.

Officers were dispatched to the 2100 block of Fordem Ave. around 8:20 p.m.

Video shows there was some type of incident in the parking lot of a business around this time and a vehicle fled from the scene.

No injuries were reported. Officers were unable to find any casings and no property damage was noticed.

The incident remains under investigation.

A Fitchburg man was arrested on drug charges Friday afternoon after cocaine was found in a coffee cup.

An officer was patrolling the area when he noticed two occupied vehicles parked for some time outside of a restaurant along the 4800 block of E. Washington Ave.

A K-9 team was brought in and had a positive alert on one of the vehicles.

The cocaine was found during a search of the vehicles.

Myron D. Dunlap, 37, of Fitchburg was arrested for possession of cocaine and a parole violation.

The investigation is ongoing.

The cocaine was found during a search of the vehicles.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a third incident where a woman was assaulted by a stranger while walking in the Greenbush Neighborhood.

The woman was walking toward Meriter Hospital around 6:30 p.m. Tuesday when she was inappropriately touched from behind by an unknown man.

The suspect, in this case, matches the description provided by two other women who were sexually assaulted last week in this neighborhood. All three victims described their attacker as being a male, Hispanic, early twenties and wearing dark clothing.

Detectives are asking anyone that lives near Meriter Hospital and or St. Mary’s Hospital, especially those on Mills St., to check and turnover any suspicious home surveillance or doorbell security video.

Officers are still doing extra patrols in this area.  We encourage people to call 911 immediately if they find themselves in a situation like this.
 
Please contact either Crime Stoppers, where video can be submitted online, or contact Detective Sarah Korger directly at 608-229-8214, or via email at skorger@cityofmadison.com if you have information or video to provide.

Address: Fairchild St. at W. Main St.
Details:
Two officers suffered injuries following the arrest of a driver for his fourth OWI.

Officers conducted a traffic stop at the intersection of Fairchild and W. Main Streets around 11:35 p.m. Wednesday.

The suspect was placed under arrest and taken to a local hospital. While being taken into custody, he became combative and physical toward officers.

At the hospital, he bit multiple officers and once again became physical toward them.
 
Moses S. Garcia, 37, was arrested on a variety of charges including, fourth-offense OWI, resisting arrest, attempted battery to law enforcement, battery to law enforcement, resisting arrest causing injury and disorderly conduct.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

This incident remains under investigation.

Officers arrested an armed robbery suspect minutes after the crime occurred.

Officers were dispatched to the Walgreens located along the 3700 block of E. Washington Ave. around 2:15 a.m. Thursday.

The suspect approached the register and demanded money from the clerk. The suspect also indicated he had a gun and would harm the employee. He left the store with a small amount of cash.

Officers arrived to find the suspect still in the parking lot and in possession of the stolen money.

Terry J. Buttke Jr., 41, of Madison, was arrested for armed robbery, resisting arrest and disorderly conduct.
 
No weapon was found on him.

The incident remains under investigation.

Officers were dispatched to the 900 block of Tramore Trail around 3 a.m. Thursday.
 
Officers were able to follow tire tracks and shoe prints in the snow They also noticed the suspect or suspects involved checked the doors of several vehicles parked in this area.
 
At least one garage was entered. One purse has been reported stolen.

The Madison Police Department encourages people to remove all valuable items and lock their vehicles nightly.


Anyone with information about these thefts should call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

A woman was filling her vehicle up with gas when a man pointed a gun at her face and demanded she give him her keys.

Officers were dispatched to the 2700 block of E. Washington Ave. around 8:25 a.m. for this carjacking.

Two men got into the woman’s vehicle and drove away.

The woman was not physically injured during the incident.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

More than $6,000 in lottery tickets were stolen during an armed robbery on the north side.

Officers were dispatched to the BP Gas Station, located along the 1000 block of Sherman Ave. around 9 p.m. Saturday.
 
Two men, dressed in all black and wearing black facemasks, entered the store and displayed a gun.
 
A store employee was ordered to the ground at gunpoint while the other suspect went toward the register.

Cash and around $6,000 in lottery tickets were stolen.

A K-9 unit was brought in to conduct a track.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

No physical injuries were reported.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a burglary at a sandwich shop on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to the Jimmy John’s located along the 1700 block of Theier Rd. around 9:15 a.m. Tuesday.
 
A manager arrived to work to find someone had smashed a window and entered the business overnight. 
 
No arrests have been made.

Officers will review digital and physical evidence collected at the scene.

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: W. Gilman St. at N. Henry St.
Details:
Several crushed up beer cans were located underneath a windshield during a traffic stop early Wednesday morning.

Officers pulled the driver over around 2:15 a.m. at the intersection of W. Gilman St. and N. Henry St.

Witnesses reported the man was yelling threats and driving recklessly.

Kristopher K. Whitaker, 38, was arrested for first-offense OWI and disorderly conduct.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

A brick, containing anti-police chalk messaging, was thrown through the window of a home improvement store on the city’s east side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the Home Depot on E. Springs Dr. around 3:20 a.m. Tuesday.

Employees called to report the incident after a window was broken.
 
Officers are reviewing digital evidence.

No one has been arrested.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a stalking complaint involving a department store employee.
 
The woman called police after a man, on a number of occasions, positioned himself near her as she worked.
 
The man also found out personal information about the woman, information she did not provide him directly.
 
The woman and man are not known to one another.

Terrance Edwards, 78, of Madison, was arrested.

The incident is under investigation.

A car, left warming up in the driveway of an eastside home, was stolen early Saturday morning.
 
The car was taken from a home located along the 4000 block of Stein Ave. around 7:20 a.m.
 
The vehicle has since been recovered.
 
With a cold spell approaching, the Madison Police Department is reminding drivers not to leave their vehicles running and unattended, as this can make them a target for thieves.

A driver hit the accelerator instead of the brake and crash into the exterior wall of a store Monday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the Walgreens along the 8300 block of Old Sauk Rd. around 10:56 a.m.

There was significant damage to the car and some brick displacement in the store.

The incident remains under investigation at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a 29-year-old man was dropped off at a local hospital with a stab wound.

His injuries are not life-threatening.

Officers were dispatched to the hospital around 3 p.m. on Thursday.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a robbery at a bank on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the UW Credit Union  on Northport Drive around 10 a.m. on Thursday.

A man walked in the building and handed the teller a note demanding money.

He left the area with cash.

A K-9 team was brought in to help with a track.

Detectives are reviewing digital evidence in this case.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation remains ongoing.

A woman was threatened with a knife for refusing to give a man a cigarette Sunday night. 

Officers were dispatched to the 4600 block of Atticus Way around 8:45 p.m.

The man approached the woman as she stood outside her apartment. He then grabbed her shoulder and held a knife out when she refused to give him a cigarette.

The woman yelled for help and the suspect ran away with her purse.

The woman was not physically injured but had cut mark on her jacket.

The suspect is described as a black man, in his mid 40s, with a dark complexion. He also has a salt-and-pepper beard that is braided from his chin and beads in the braid. He was wearing a navy jacket and grey jogger pants at the time of the robbery.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014. Tips can also be submitted online at p3tips.com.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a fight outside of La Follette High School where a gun was displayed.

Officers were dispatched to the 700 block of Pflaum Rd. around 12:15 p.m.

Around a dozen people were involved in the fight. When officers arrived, all those involved were gone.

A 16-year-old male was identified as the person who displayed the gun. He was arrested at his home Tuesday afternoon. The firearm was not recovered.

He faces disorderly conduct while armed charges.

Two other officers, who were at the school for a previously-scheduled meeting, were able to provide responding officers with timely information.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Arrested: Harland E Wallace, Jr - 29 years old
Details:
On 1-29-23 at 0512 hours, MPD officers were dispatched to a Residential Burglary in progress at 2417 Badger Lane.  The victim, asleep in their home, awoke to find that a suspect had forced entry into the home.  The suspect, wearing dark clothing, a backpack, and a mask, fled the home.
 
Responding officers arrived on scene and observed tracks leading away from the residence in the fresh snow.  Officers soon found HARLAND E WALLACE in the area, but noted that he was walking in the yards of nearby houses in the deep snow instead of the sidewalk or road.  He was wearing dark clothing and a backpack.  Officers attempted contact with Wallace, and despite obstructing those efforts, he was detained.  The officers noted that he was not wearing any shoes, even in the cold and snowy conditions.  As the officers re-contacted the victim to process the scene, they noted a nearby pair of shoes stuck in the snow. 
 
Officers interviewed Wallace and then placed him under arrest for Attempted Burglary, Criminal Damage to Property, Resisting/Obstructing, Possession of Drug Paraphernalia, and a Probation Hold.

Marijuana and other drug paraphernalia was discovered in a car following a traffic stop on the east side.

A car was pulled over along the 2800 block of E. Washington Ave. around 4:15 p.m. Wednesday.

Responding officers could smell an odor of marijuana from inside the vehicle.

A 16-year-old was arrested and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center for possession with intent to deliver THC.

The investigation is ongoing.

An adult was injured by shattered glass after a bullet entered an apartment on the city’s north side.

Two other adults and a child were also home at the time of the shooting. None of them reported physical injuries.

Officers were dispatched to a neighborhood behind Warner Park, near the area of Monterey Dr. and Brentwood Parkway around 4:30 a.m. Thursday.

Multiple people called to report hearing someone fire off several rounds.

Several fired shell casings were found in the street of Monterey Dr.

More shell casings were found in a parking lot along Monterey Dr.  Around eight bullet holes were found in an unoccupied vehicle.

No arrests have been made.

The incident is under investigation

The Madison Police Department is investigating a robbery at a bank on the city’s north side.

The UW Credit Union on Northport Dr. was robed around 10:45 a.m. on Thursday. This is the second time in a week the bank has been targeted.

The suspect gave the teller a note demanding money.

No weapon was mentioned or displayed.

The suspect left with some cash.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: S. Park St. at Braxton Place
Details:
One person was taken to the hospital following a crash Wednesday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to the area of S. Park St. and Braxton Place around 3:42 p.m.

A 59-year-old driver was attempting to turn left onto S. Park when he was hit by another vehicle in the intersection.

The Madison Fire Department was attempting to extricate the 59-year-old man from his vehicle. He was taken to the hospital for his injuries.

An 18-year-old male driver was cited and released.

The incident remains under investigation.

A 51-year-old man was arrested for possessing child porngraphy Thusday evening by members of the Madison Police Department's Special Victim's Unit (SVU).

SVU, the Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT) and Special William Q. Hartineapons and Tacticst team served a search warrant on 's residence on E. Gilman St.

Hartin has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and was booked into the Dane County Jail on Thursday on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

Officers were dispatched to reports of an injured person in the parking lot of the Lussier Community Education Center. There is no threat to the public. Investigation is ongoing. This incident does not appear to have MMSD connections.

Address: Packers Avenue at Anhalt Drive, Madison, WI
Details:
At approximately 6:20pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the area of Packers Avenue and Anhalt Drive regarding a traffic crash.

The crash involved two vehicles; one of which was making a left turn onto Anhalt Drive before it was struck from behind by a vehicle heading northbound on Packers Avenue. One person, a 67-year-old male, sustained injuries as a result of the crash. He was transported via ambulance to a local hospital but has since died and his identity will be released by the Dane County Medical Examiner's Office. 

The crash scene has been cleared however the crash is still under investigation. Although witnesses were contacted on scene, anyone with information regarding this traffic crash (fatality) should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

At approximately 8:07pm, an off duty law enforcement officer observed a vehicle parked near Panera Bread on East Springs Drive and believed that vehicle contained a suspect who is wanted for serious, felony crimes.

As Madison Police Officers were coming into the area, the vehicle drove off recklessly at a high rate of speed. Over the course of the next 20 minutes, the vehicle was spotted by officers and at a gas station, on Onsgard Road, Oak Street, and East Washington Avenue to name a few; evading apprehension each time.

At 8:28pm, in the 2800 block of Coolidge Street, the vehicle was located abandoned by police officers and seized as evidence. Three different residences, over the course of the next hour or so, including a vacant home in that general area were checked and cleared by officers. Despite those efforts however, the suspect has not been located.  

Anyone with information regarding this incident should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Several people called to report a man was acting “out of control” and throwing things at cars parked outside a grocery store Sunday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the Woodman’s Market along the 3800 block of Milwaukee St. around 11:15 a.m.

The man attempted to fight officers when they took him into custody. He also provided them with false information. Officers eventually learned the suspect also had a warrant out for his arrest in an arson case.

Zachary M. Showers, 32, was arrested for criminal damage to property and resisting and obstructing as well as his charge.

Officers responded to a disturbance at a hotel after a man threatened a woman with a knife.

Officers were dispatched to the 4200 block of E. Towne Blvd. around 6:40 p.m. Monday.

A woman tried to break up a fight after the suspect began attacking another man.

Officers took the suspect into custody as he was walking near East Towne Mall.

Ronnie L. Fuentez, 39, was arrested for two counts of disorderly conduct, battery and bail jumping.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Three women, enjoying the newly-opened Crunch Fitness, had their personal items stolen during their workouts.

Officers were dispatched to the 7400 block of Mineral Point Road around 4 p.m. Monday.

Each woman had her items stored in an unsecured locker.

A group of females stole the keys from two of the victims. A purse was taken one from vehicle and a wallent from another. In both cases the suspects left the keys in the car.

The third victim had cash and credit cards stolen from her locker.

The group of female suspects attempted to use the credit cards at a store on State Street.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence in this case.

The investigaiton is on-going.

The Madison Police Department encourages everyone to lock their lockers while at the gym or other public places. when possible.

A man was warming up his vehicle when he was pulled from his vehicle and thrown in the snow.

The incident happened around 5:15 a.m. Friday along the 6400 block of E. Buckeye Rd.

The suspect stole the victim’s SUV and drove away during the area.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence in this case.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

While on a routine patrol Tuesday night, an officer noticed a strange interaction at a fast food restaurant along the 4600 blok of Verona Rd.

The officer pulled one of the vehicles involved over a short time later.

The driver of the vehicle attempted to run away.

Officers spotted ecstasy pills in plain view inside the vehicle. More drugs, scales and a large amount of cash were also found inside.

Sean M. Johnson, 32, of Madisonwas arrested for possession with intent to deliver designer drugs, resisting and a probation hold.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The suspect in a bank robbery case spit in an officer’s face after he was found hiding out in a local shelter’s bathroom.

An officer, on a routine patrol, spotted the suspect Saturday at the shelter and confronted him. He ran and hid in the bathroom until he was taken into custody.

Officers found several pieces of evidence linking him to a bank robbery at Park Bank on E. Main Street. 

The bank was robbed around 2:30 p.m. on Friday. During the incident, a man slipped a teller a note indicating they had a weapon and demanded money.

No weapon was ever displayed.

The man ran from the scene with a significant amount of cash.

Richard L. Chapman was arrested for discharging bodily fluids at a public worker, resisting and obstructing, possessing drug paraphernalia and on a probation violation.

Additional charges related to the robbery case are likely.

The investigation is ongoing.

Arrested:
Kyheim S. Taylor, 17
Kenyotta K. Jones, Jr., 17
Kemarrion I. Shannon, 18
Details:
For the past several months, Detectives from the MPD Burglary Crime Unit, the 2022 Summer Strategic Plan Stolen Auto group, and partnering Dane County jurisdictions have been working a series of residential burglary, stolen auto, and fraud cases. 

These cases involved a group of suspects working together to accomplish these related crimes.

Three teenage suspects have been charged by the Dane County District Attorney's Ofice.

Kyheim S. Taylor, 17, is charged with seven counts of burglary, three counts of operating a motor vehicle without an owner's consent and identify theft.

Kenyotta K Jones Jr., 17, is charged with two counts of burglary.

Kemarrion I Shannon, 18, is charged with felony escape, operating a motor vehicle without an owner's consent and identify theft.

The Madison Police Department is searching for the man who robbed a woman, who is visually impaired, as she walked downtown.

Officers were dispatched to the 100 block of N. Broom St. around 6:30 p.m. Wednesday.

The victim was using a guide cane as she walked in the area when the suspect came up from behind and grabbed a bag off her arm. There was a brief struggle between the two, but the woman was not injured.

Her personal items, like her wallet and phone, were inside the stolen bag. She remained in the area trying to get the attention of people passing by in order to call police.

A K-9 track was conducted. Officers are also reviewing digital evidence in this case.

No arrests have been made at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

Does your hand feel a little lighter? Or less shiny?

Officers are attempting to return a missing ring to its rightful owner.

A citizen found a gold ring on the road in the 700 block of Douglas Trl. on Tuesday.

The ring is inscribed with "PJG love FAS" and includes a date, which you'll have to provide.

If this ring belongs to you call our Property Room at 608-266-4955.

Officers arrived to find dozens of people fighting in a south side parking lot while responding to a shots fired call early Saturday morning.
 
Someone reported hearing gunshots around 1:30 a.m. in the area of S. Park Street and Plaenert Dr.

Around 100 people were actively fighting when officers arrived. Officers were able to disperse the crowd with verbal commands and sires.

Five shell casings were found in the parking lot.

No injuries were reported, even after officers checked with local hospitals. Officers were not able to find any signs of damaged property.

One person, who was not involved in the fighting, stuck around to provide officers with a statement.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to call Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Tipsters can remain anonymous during this process.

The Violent Crime Unit is leading the investigation into this incident. The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A Madison educator called police after noticing a 4-year-old child along at a gas station on the city’s north side.

The child was not properly dressed for the weather as he rode his bike, whith training wheels, around the gas station Sunday morning . The gas station is located on Northport Dr.

Officers followed the child home. His mother was asleep and unaware the child had left.
 
No arrests were made, but Child Protective Services was notified of the incident.

Officers helped break up a fight between four people early Saturday morning on State Street.

The fight happened around 2 a.m. in the 500 block.

Those involved attempted to run from officers.
 
A 21-year-old man was arrested for misdemeanor disorderly conduct.
 
He said the fight started over something minor in a bar and turned physical outside.

A homeowner said he was “spooked” after waking up early Monday morning to find a stranger inside a screened in porch beyond their home.

Officers were dispatched to a home along the 1200 block of E. Mifflin St. around 12:05 a.m.
 
The homeowner’s wife and child were home at the time.

The suspect never made entry to the main part of the home.

The suspect appeared under the influence of drugs and told officers he was “trying to get home.”

Garret A. Olson, 43, of Madison, was arrested for criminal trespass to a dwelling, disorderly conduct and a probation warrant.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A man reported that his PlayStation 5 was stolen by “some kids” after they broke into his apartment.

The man lives along the 1100 block of Gammon Ln.

He told police was talking with the group of juveniles from his sliding glass door, when they entered his unit without permission and stole the game console.

No other items were taken during Friday afternoon’s burglary.

No arrests have been made. 

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

(Per Lt. Vosburg)

Several residents in the 10 block of Straubel Court reported hearing gunshots outside around 11:41pm. 

Responding officers located fired shell casings in this area and a vehicle with apparent bullet damage. Further investigation on scene revealed the vehicle was occupied at the time of when the shots were fired. 

None of the occupants of the vehicle were injured. 

This incident is still under investigation and no arrests have been made.

On Wednesday, February 15th, at 9:37 p.m., officers were dispatched to Schroeder Road near Struck Street for a report of a man down in the roadway. Upon arrival, officers discovered the man and his dog were both deceased in the roadway. Further investigation indicated that both were struck by a vehicle that fled the scene. If anyone has any information about this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at (608) 266-4988.

The Madison Police Department safely got a man help after he barricaded a woman inside a home during a mental health crisis.

Officers were dispatched to a home along the 2200 block of Portage Ave. shortly before 11 a.m. on Wednesday after someone called dispatch making concerning remarks.

A woman at the address answered the door and indicated the call was a mistake.

A short time later, officers were called back to the address after a microwave was thrown through a closed window.

The woman told officers she was OK, but barricaded inside the home by the man. The man was also armed with a knife when police arrived.

On-duty members of the Special Weapons and Tactics and Crisis Negotiation teams were called in to assist.

Officers negotiated with the man to come out of the home.

He was safely taken to a hospital for medical treatment.

The woman involved was not injured.

An officer heard a gunshot while patrolling on the city’s north side early Wednesday morning.

The officer was near the intersection of Forest Run and Hayes Rd. around 4:50 a.m. when he heard the shot.

No injuries or damages were reported.

No casings were found at the scene.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A Madison K-9 unit was brought in to help track down two people who ran from the scene of a crash involving a stolen vehicle.

A truck was stolen from outside a gas station on Verona Road around 8:30 a.m. Thursday.
About an hour later, officers were dispatched to a crash on the westbound Beltline at John Nolen Dr.
 
They arrived to find the truck crashed into the concrete median divider.
 
A man and woman were spotted running from the crash scene.
 
Officers noticed footprints in the fresh snow indicating the direction they went

A K-9 unit was also brought in and led officers to the suspects in a nearby wooded area.

Responding officers formed a perimeter around the area until the suspects were taken into custody.

Timothy J. Smith, 28, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent.
 
He was taken to the hospital for injuries sustained in the crash before going to the Dane County Jail.
 
The woman was released.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A driver was arrested for OWI after an officer spotted him driving more than 100 miles per hour.

The driver was pulled over around 2:25 a.m. Monday on southbound Stoughton Rd. near Hoepker Rd.

His breath sample result was .11.

Hunter T. McMellon, 22, was arrested for first-offense OWI and booked into the Dane County Jail for a 12-hour hold.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Madison police were sent to help a man who was knocked unconscious after falling outside of his home.

Officers were sent to a home along the 2300 block of Harley Dr. around 7:25 p.m. Friday.

Staff members at the facility said the 64-year-old man went out to smoke when he fell. They were unsure if he slipped on the ice.

Officers provided aid until EMS arrived.

The man was transported to the hospital where he later died.

Nothing suspicious was located at the scene and the death appears to be a medical incident.

A man, holding two small axes, entered a stranger’s home and jumped out a second-story window late Monday night.
 
Madison police received a report of a man knocking on apartments along the 4000 block of Nakoosa Trail around 10:20 p.m.
 
One person opened the door and the suspect entered the unit and jumped out of a window.

Officers found him on Stoughton Rd. near Commercial Dr.

Antonio A. Ramsey, 25, was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed and resisting and obstructing.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man was working in his basement when he heard a voice say “don’t be afraid.”

Details:

That search team included UAS resources in addition to patrol officers on foot and mobile in squad cars. A WCAN Alert was sent out for public dissemination as well.

During the month of March, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin’s alcohol and seatbelt laws. These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation.
 
The goal of these extra patrols is not only to enhance public safety, but to prevent needless tragedies. Someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin and thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.
 
The Madison Police Department needs your help to make our roads safer in 2023.  Please put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.  If you have been drinking, please call a sober friend, a cab or a ride share service to get you home safely.

In late July of this year, the Madison Police Department Burglary Crime Unit began working a spree of related residential burglaries. These crimes coincided with the 2022 Summer Strategic Plan and its emphasis on stolen auto investigations, as many of these crimes had a nexus to stolen autos. Most alarmingly, some of these cases included the stealing of firearms.

BCU worked with other MPD units, as well as numerous other Dane County law enforcement jurisdictions, in identifying, arresting, and charging the suspects in these cases.  Partnering jurisdictions in these cases include: UW Madison Police Department, Shorewood Hills Police Department, Waunakee Police Department, and the Dane County Sheriff’s Office.  These cases impacted over two dozen victims in our community.

Three suspects were arrested and charged in these numerous cases.  These investigations continue and more charges are potentially forthcoming.  All arrested persons in this case were booked into the Dane County Jail, and are presumed innocent until proven guilty.

The Madison Police Department is warning the community about a scam where people are pretending to be MPD employees and requesting money to remedy a missed court appearance.

A woman received a call from a scammer pretending to be an MPD sergeant Thursday night. The scammer told the woman she missed a court hearing and needed to pay $7,000 because she was “in contempt of court.”
 
The woman realized this was fake and hung up. She then immediately reported the incident to police.

The Madison Police Department does not call individuals and demand or request money from community members under any circumstances.

MPD, along with other legitimate law enforcement agencies, will never call community members seeking payment for outstanding traffic citations or warrants. This includes claims of unpaid federal or state taxes.

Below is a list of tips to help avoid becoming a victim to this type of scam:
 
  • Never give personal or financial information to an unsolicited caller or email.
  • Be suspicious of callers who demand immediate payment for any reason.
  • Stay private. Regularly update privacy settings for social media sites. Scammers often make their stories more believable by trolling for personal information on Facebook, Twitter and similar sites. 

If you receive a similar call, hang up. Do not provide any of your private information. And contact your local law enforcement agency when possible.

Kevin R. Dustin, 43, was arrested for fourth-offense OWI, possession of meth, possession of heroin, possession of drug paraphernalia and felony bail jumping.
