No tickets have been issued at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a gun was pulled out during a fight on the south side.

Officers were dispatched to the 2500 block of Frazier Ave. around 10:50 a.m. Thursday.

They arrived to find people running and driving away from the area.

Witnesses reported hearing what sound like a gunshot and a spent shell casing was found in the area.

Officers located an injured person nearby. He did not suffer from a gunshot wound.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be submitted anonymously. Information may be eligible for a monetary reward.
 
This investigation is ongoing.

Two dogs were recovered as part of a burglary investigation Thursday afternoon..

Officers were dispatched to the 800 block of Fulton Ln. around 2:15.

A man was having neighbors watch his dogs while he was away when those neighbors spotted a man removing the animals from their home.

The neighbors reported this to police. Officers were able to track down the dogs to a home on the south side.
 
The suspect and dog owner know one another.

Michael C. Holton, 73, was arrested for burglary and theft.

The investigation is ongoing.

Increased Traffic Enforcement

In September, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, will continue to conduct extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's speeding, alcohol and seatbelt laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. The goal of these extra patrols is not only to enhance public safety, but to prevent needless tragedies. 

Speeding is a leading cause of death and injuries on Wisconsin roadways. And, someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin and thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.

The Madison Police Department needs your help to make our roads safer.  Please put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.

Suspect: Suspect Description: African American male, approximately 17-20 years old, with a thin mustache and goatee, 5’10’’-6’00’’ tall, with a slender build. He was last seen wearing a black Nike hooded sweatshirt, black Nike sweatpants, and white Jordan’s.
Details:
On September 12, 2023 at approximately 9:59pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to meet with two crime victims wishing to report that they were robbed at gunpoint earlier in the evening at Secret Places Park (6001 Sledding Parkway, Madison). The two victims sell shoes and agreed to meet a prospective buyer after connecting on a social media buy/sell marketplace. After the victims presented a pair of Yeezy 350 V2 Zebra pattern shoes to the suspect, instead of presenting the agreed upon cash, the suspect produced a handgun and robbed the victims at gunpoint before fleeing the area on foot. He was last seen heading south toward Canyon Lane and has not been apprehended. 

The suspect was described as an African American male, approximately 17-20 years old, with a thin mustache and goatee, 5’10’’-6’00’’ tall, with a slender build. He was last seen wearing a black Nike hooded sweatshirt, black Nike sweatpants, and white Jordan’s. 

Anyone with information regarding this incident should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

An officer suffered a minor injury while responding to a disturbance call early Sunday morning.

Officers patrolling State St. went to talk to a man who was urinating on private property.

The man provided a fake name and ran away.

He began resistive as officers took him into custody, injuring one of the arresting officers.

Ayinde S. Lawal, 22, was arrested for a Department of Corrections hold and resisting and obstructing causing a soft tissue injury. He was also cited for urninating in a public place and trespassing.

Madison police were called after an intoxicated man caused disturbance at a local hospital.

The man was there to visit a patient and became upset and aggressive after hospital security confiscated his alcohol.

He injured himself in the process. As he was being treated for his injuries, he spit on MPD officers that responded and kicked a security guard.

Patrick R. Knowles, 34, was arrested for discharging bodily fluids, battery and disorderly conduct. He was taken to the Dane County Jail after he was medically cleared.

Address: E. Johnson Street at Fordem Ave.
Details:
Madison officers were dispatched after a minivan went off the road and became struck on a railroad track.

Officers were sent to the area of E. Johnson Street and Fordem Avenue around 8:15 p.m. Tuesday.

The driver had a blood alcohol content nearly twice the legal limit.

She was arrested for first-offense OWI and taken to the Dane County Jail.

A man pulled out a knife and threatened a driver who was powering their vehicle at a downtown Tesla charging station Wednesday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 700 block of E. Washington Ave. around 6 a.m.

The victim reported the man approached him and asked for money. The victim said the suspect pulled out the knife when he didn’t provide any money.
 
Willie T. Thomas, 52, was arrested nearby for disorderly conduct while armed.

A man attempted to bite a Madison officer as he was taken into custody following a disturbance.

Officers were dispatched to E. Mifflin St. around 12:15 p.m. Tuesday.

A caller initially reported a man was threatening him and possibly armed with a knife. As officers investigated, they realized no knife was displayed.

The suspect resisted arrest and attempted to bite one of the responding officers.

Brandon Jordan, 32, was arrested for disorderly conduct, resisting arrest and bail jumping.

Arrested:
Donte D. Streiff, 30
Larry D. Grant, 31
Ashaun L. Stanely, 26
Jimmell T. Boyd, 31
Address: John Nolen Drive at Broom Street
Details:
A gun and drugs were recovered during a traffic stop Thursday morning.

An officer initiated the traffic stop around 12:50 a.m. in the area of John Nolen Drive and Broom Street.
 
Contraband is observed in plain view and the vehicle is searched.

The handgun and marijuana were located during the search.

Donte D. Streiff, 30, was arrested for possession with intent to deliver (party to a crime), going armed while intoxicated, second-offense OWI, resisting and obstructing and threats to law enforcement.
 
Larry D. Grant, 31, was arrested for possession with intent to deliver (party to a crime), felon in possession of a firearm, carrying a concealed weapon and a probation hold.
 
Ashaun L. Stanely, 26, was arrested for possession with intent to deliver (party to a crime).
 
Jimmell T. Boyd, 31, was arrested for possession with intent to deliver (party to a crime).
 
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Arrested:
Christopher E. Aspinwall, 37
Teneshia N. Johnson, 38
Details:
The driver of a U-haul cargo van drove over a median and crashed the van while trying to flee a traffic stop Saturday.

Officers attempted to pull the vehicle over along the 4800 block of E. Washington Ave. around 2:17 a.m.

The driver and passenger ran from the crash scene. The 38-year-old female passenger was detained immediately.

A K-9 unit tracked the 37-year-old male driver to a nearby building.

Christopher E. Aspinwall had felony warrants for his arrest. He was arrested by Madison police for resisting, eluding and bail jumping.

Teneshia N. Johnson also had warrants for her arrest and was taken into custody for felony bail jumping, possession of heroin and resisting and obstructing.

Both were taken to the Dane County Jail.

The Madison Police Department responded to an overdose death at a hotel on the city’s west side.

Officers were dispatched to the 1100 block of Fourier Dr. around 9:10 p.m. Wednesday.

A man called 911 to report the incident and began CPR until paramedics arrived. A 52-year-old man was transported and pronounced dead at the hospital.

Drugs and drug paraphernalia were located in the hotel room.

This incident remains under investigation.

A quick-thinking victim immediately notified local camera stores after someone stole his high-end photography equipment.

The man called police on July 27 to report that someone entered his hotel room and stole the equipment and an Ipad. This theft was captured on video.

While dealing with officers, he also contacted local camera shops, providing them with the serial numbers of his equipment.

On July 31, the suspect, Daryl Patterson, attempted to sell the gear to the Camera Company in Madison. Staff there recognized the serial numbers and called police.

Patterson, 44, of Madison, had already left the store by the time officers arrived, however he was caught on video.

On Aug. 3, he sold the equipment to a pawn shop in Milwaukee. This transaction was once again caught on video.

Detectives had also previously listed Patterson as a person of interest through Leads Online, a pawn transaction database. Leads Online notified out detectives about the incident.

Detectives were able to track Patterson down to a home on Dunn Street. During a search of the home, detectives found more property belonging to the vicitm. 

Patterson was arrested for burglary, resisting arrest and possessing methamphetamine.

Just recently, detectives were able to reunite the victim with most of his missing belongings.
 
The Madison Police Department would like to thank the Camera Company and Leads Online for their role in solving this case.

Anyone who owns an expensive electronic is encouraged to write down the serial number, as the victim in this case did. Doing so is the best way to get your personal items returned if they are stolen.

Address: W. Dayton Street at Broom Street
Details:
A man was arrested for ignoring road blocks and nearly hitting runners during this past weekend’s Ironman triathlon held throughout Dane County.

Around 6 p.m., officers moved the blockade in the area of N. Broom and W. Mifflin Streets to allow an emergency vehicle to pass by.  As this was happening, the driver of a sedan attempted to pass through.

Officers told the driver to use an alternate route and then returned to assisting with the race. The driver drove around the block and when he encountered another barricade, he barged right through it, barely missing an officer and several runners in the process. Attached to this release are video stillframes showing the incident. 
 
The driver eventually pulled into a parking garage along the 300 block of W. Dayton St. and was taken into custody.
 
Devinn B. Taufner, 23, was arrested for second-Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety and taken to the Dane County Jail.

Madison Police officers responded to the intersection of S Whitney Way and Montauk Pl for a single motorcycle crash.  The 30-year-old rider was taken by ambulance to a local hospital where he succumbed to his fatal injuries.  A preliminary investigation revealed that the motorcycle was traveling northbound on S Whitney Way when the rider lost control, struck the median curb and was ejected from the motorcycle.  S Whitney Way traffic was re-opened shortly after 9:15 PM and this investigation is ongoing.

At approximately 10:22 pm, Madison Police officers were dispatched to a weapons offense in the 2100 block of Adderbury Circle. Multiple citizens and residents in the area called the 911 center to report sounds of a disturbance outside along with gun shots. The officers responding to this incident located several people on scene with injuries that are belived to be the result of the disturbance. An injured person with potentially life threatening injuries was transported to a local hospital for treatment. At this time, MPD officers and detectives are still on scene. This investigation is in the early stages and more informatin will be released when available.

A man climbed onto an apartment roof in an attempt to run from police during a domestic disturbance call late Sunday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 2800 block of Moland Street around 10:45 p.m.

Police were called to the area earlier in the night for a man and woman fighting, but neither were there when officers arrived.

When they returned around 10:45 p.m., they are able to make contact with the woman through an apartment door. Officers formed a perimeter around the building and noticed the man on the roof trying to leave.

The man listened to orders to re-enter the apartment unit.

William N. Jones, 25, is arrested for false imprisonment, intimidation of a victim, battery, disorderly conduct, resisting arrest and possession of cocaine.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers recovered a firearm hidden in a vehicle during a domestic disturbance call Sunday night.

Officers were dispatched to a home on Bettys Lane around 8:25 p.m.

A man and woman were involved in a dispute for several days before Sunday’s incident.

The man became angry toward responding officers and threatened those on scene.

Andrew R. Lewis, 42, was arrested for being a felon in possession of a firearm, threats to law enforcement and two counts of domestic disorderly conduct.

Arrested:
Caleb J. Linden, 20
James N. Holden, 20
Details:
Officers were flagged down while driving past the Taco Bell Cantina on State Street around 11:30 p.m. on Sunday.
 
Employees told officers two men were falling asleep at a table and were asked to leave the restaurant. They became angry and punched an employee multiples times.

Caleb J. Linden, 20, was arrested for misdemeanor battery. James N. Holden, 20, was arrested for disorderly conduct and felony bail jumping charges.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers found no signs of a shooting while responding to a shots fired call on the south side Sunday night.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Aldo Leopold Park on Traceway Dr. around 8:25 p.m.

This location and the surrounding area was checked by officers. They also talked with people living nearby and launched a drone. No signs of a shooting were ever located.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

An observant neighbor called 911 after seeing two juveniles enter a north side home.

Officers were dispatched to the 2800 block of Coolidge St. around 4:45 p.m. on Sunday.

The neighbor was able to provide police with detailed suspect descriptions. Officers located the juveniles near the home.

An x-box gaming system was found inside a 12-year-old male’s backpack. He and a 13-year-old male were arrested for burglary and theft (party to a crime).

Officers were able to match the X-box gaming console’s serial number to packaging located inside the home.

The Madison Police Department encourages people to write down or have access to the serial numbers of their electronics in case of burglaries or thefts.

Arrested:
Savan S. Newsome Jr., 26 
Deandre M. Smith, 33
Corey D. Anderson, 36
Address: S. Blair St. at Railroad St.
Details:
Two handguns were recovered during a traffic stop downtown early Sunday morning.

Around 2:40 a.m., members of the Central District Community Team stopped a vehicle for a tint violation at the intersection of S. Blair and Railroad streets.

Those inside were also not wearing seat belts.

While gathering their information, officers spotted a bag known to carry handguns. Two guns were found inside, including one that had two different serial numbers.

Savan S. Newsome Jr., 26, was arrested for a parole violation.

Deandre M. Smith, 33, was arrested for a parole violation.

Corey D. Anderson, 36, was arrested for obstructing, carrying a concealed weapon and felon in possession of a firearm.

All three were taken to the Dane County Jail.

A woman was working her newspaper delivery job when her car was stolen downtown early Sunday morning.

The theft occurred along the 300 block of W. Main St as the woman was doing a paper drop-off.

She chased her car for two blocks before the suspect got out and ran away.

Officers found him nearby. He was showing signs of impairment and was taken to the hospital for a blood draw.

Alejandro Quechol, 22, was arrested for first-offense OWI and operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent.

Address: North Star Dr. at Milwaukee St.
Details:
Officers found no signs of a shooting after multiple people reported hearing gunshots on the city’s east side Saurday evening.

Several officers searched the area of North Star Dr. and Milwaukee St. They also canvassed the Milky Way area and the 6800 block of Milwaukee St.

Officers were unable to find any signs of a shooting or locate a scene.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

A Madison K-9 team located a suspect in a cornfield and got him to surrender during a call Sunday evening.

Officers were initially dispatched to a hotel along the 4800 block of Hayes Rd. for a domestic disturbance.

A man physically assaulted a woman and struck her with a wooden luggage rack as she attempted to call for help.
 
The man left the hotel before officers arrived. He was spotted by an officer in the area of Portage Rd. and Melody Ln. To flee from police, he ran into a cornfield. A perimeter was established and a K-9 unit responded. The K-9 officer was able to lead his handler to the suspect. The suspect surrendered without further incident.

Michael D. Madlock, 37, was arrested for domestic false imprisonment, domestic battery, domestic intimidation of a victim, resisting arrest and multiple counts of felony bail jumping.

Officers were dispatched to an armed person at a Madison hospital early Saturday morning.

The man was pacing back and forth while using the knife to stab at the air.

Officers arrived around 2:15 a.m. and were able to convince the man to drop the knife.

No injuries were reported.

Journey Mental Health was consulted and the man was transported to a medical facility for care.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a child was hit by a car.

Officers were dispatched to the 1000 block of E. Mifflin St. around 5:40 p.m. on Thursday.

A child was attempting to cross the street as a car was coming. The child’s sibling saw what was going on and attempted to push his younger brother out of the way, but the younger boy was still clipped by the car’s mirror.

The driver of the vehicle drove from the scene to find somewhere to park her vehicle. She could not find the children upon her return.

Officers are searching for digital evidence. Anyone with information on this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

No citations have been issued or arrests have been made in this case.

The investigation is ongoing.

While checking security video for a fraud case, a store employee noticed the suspect was still inside the store shopping.

Friday evening, a woman noticed someone had fraudulently used her credit card at the Walgreens Pharmacy on E. Main St.

Officers were dispatched to the store around 6:25 after store employees recognized the suspect.

The suspect was still in the store when police arrived. He resisted arrest as officers took him into custody.

Raymond C. Lightning, 54, of Madison, was arrested for resisting arrest, felony and misdemeanor bail jumping and credit card fraudulent use.

An intoxicated man threatened children and got into a physical fight with several adults after breaking into an apartment early Tuesday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 2400 block of Monterey Dr. around 2:45 a.m.

A man said he heard banging on the exterior door of his apartment building. He left his unit to see what was going on and that’s when a stranger pushed his way  inside.

Once inside, the man become combative toward the adults, striking several of them. He also grabbed a hammer and began threatening two children sleeping nearby.

Antonio A. Ramsey, 26, was arrested for Burglary, Battery, Possessing Burglarious Tools, Resisting/Obstructing an Officer, Criminal Damage to Property, Disorderly Conduct, several outstanding warrants, and a Wisconsin DOJ Department of Corrections hold.

He was medically cleared at a local hospital before being lodged at the taken to the Dane County Jail.

Multiple people reported hearing what sounded like gunshots on the north side Monday night.

Officers responded to the area of Kennedy and Wheeler roads around 10:10 p.m.

Officers did not locate any damage or shell casings in the vicinity.

No injuries were reported.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

On September 19, 2023 at approximately 8:01 PM, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to an armed robbery where there were two victims. The victims reported that an unknown male suspect told them to get on the ground and give him their wallets. One of the victims reported seeing the suspect with a gun and the suspect putting the gun into his back when demanding his wallet. The suspect then fled on foot and was described as a male, unknown race, 30-35 years old, 5’6”, last seen wearing navy pants and a blue sweatshirt. Anyone with information regarding this incident should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Address: EB HWY 30 at N. Thompson Dr.
Details:
A 21-year-old man died following a motorcycle crash on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to eastbound Highway 30 near N. Thompson Dr. around 9:50 p.m.

An off-duty EMS worker stopped and began life-saving measures until officers and other first responders arrived on scene.

The man was taken to the hospital with life-threatening injuries. He passed away early Wednesday morning from those injuries.

Speed appears to be a factor in this case. It is unclear at this time if the man was wearing a helmet.

Eastbound Highway 30 was temporarily closed as officers tended to the victim and investigated the crash.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man was assaulted while walking on the east side.

Officers were dispatched to the 6800 block of Milwaukee St. around 5 p.m. Tuesday.

A man said he was headed home from a nearby bus stop when someone attacked him. He suffered minor injuries.
 
The victim and suspect are known to each other.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man and woman were injured during a road rage incident on the city’s east side Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Milwaukee St. and Rustic Dr. around 8:30 p.m.

The couple was riding their motorcycle when a vehicle almost crashed into them. They attempted to go around the car, which angered the other driver.

The victims said the driver attempted to run them off the road.

Both vehicles stopped in the area of Rustic Drive.

While there, the male driver of the car got out and began physically assaulting the couple. A female passenger also got out and began throwing punches.

The man and woman were bleeding from their injuries when officers arrived on scene. Both were treated by first responders at the scene.

The man and woman in the car were not in the area when officers arrived.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman was robbed on the east side. 

The woman was parked in the park-and-ride lot on Collins Ct.

She was sitting in her car when a stranger approached demanding money. The victim believed the suspect had a weapon, but one was not seen.

The suspect took the money, ran through the parking lot and left the area in a sedan.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Officers were dispatched to the 5000 block of Meinders Rd. reference people firing guns and possibly someone shot.  Officers were eventually able to locate three victims, one at the scene, one located nearby at a closed business and the third self transported to a local hospital.  None of the injuries were deemed to be life threatening.  The victims ranged in age from 16-17yoa.  Early indications are that a house party was being held and a vehicle drove by and shot at the party goers.  The investigation is on-going at this point.

Officers responded after a driver lost consciousness, drove into oncoming traffic and crashed into a horse trailer.

Officers were dispatched to the 4200 block of East Towne Blvd. around 10:15 p.m. Sunday.

A man was driving on inbound E. Washington Avenue when he crossed over a median and into oncoming traffic of outbound E. Washington Avenue.

Drug paraphernalia and drugs were found in the car.

The horse trailer was empty at the time it was hit.

After he was medically cleared at a local hospital, Lance J. Lipinski, 35, was arrested for possession of drug paraphernalia, possessing cocaine and fentanyl, driving with a revoked license, second-offense OWI and felony bail jumping.

A concerned passerby called for help after seeing a young child, alone in a parking lot shouting for his mom.

Officers were dispatched to the 2000 block of Northport Dr. around 5:20 p.m. Sunday.
 
Officers checked some nearby businesses until they ran into the child’s mother, out looking for her son. The mother said the child walked away as she ran inside a store.

No charges were issued, but Child Protective Services was notified.

A toddler suffered minor injuries after a woman, driving under the influence, crashed her vehicle on the east side.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Commercial Ave. and Sprecher Rd. shortly before 2 p.m. Sunday.

A woman rear-ended another vehicle during the crash. Officers arrived to find the suspect driver and a child outside of the vehicle.

They could smell alcohol on the woman and found two empty mini bottles of liquor inside the car.

The toddler was checked by paramedics for his injuries and was released to the care of a family member.  Child Protective Services was also notified. 

The woman driving the vehicle that was rear-ended was not injured.

The suspect driver, Stephanie J. Lopez, 35, was medically cleared at a hospital and taken to the Dane County Jail on OWI and child neglect charges.

This was her third arrest in the past five weeks for this same offense. The other incidents occurred outside the city of Madison.

The Madison Police Department is investigate a report of shots fired between two vehicles.

Officers responded to the 300 block of Rethke Ave. around 2:45 p.m. Monday.

No injuries have been reported. Officers are canvassing the area.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

This remains an active investigation and more information will be released later.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously and may be eligible for a monetary reward.

Day was trespassing at the Aberg Mini Warehouses. When officers attempted to contact Day he fled on a bicycle. Officers set up a perimeter after a short foot pursuit. Day was arrested attempting to walk out of the perimeter after discarding his bicycle. Day was booked into the Dane County Jail for trespassing, resisting and felony bail jumping. Day also had a warrant for his arrest from the Las Vegas Police Department.

Madison police responded after a man was struck be a vehicle on the Beltline.

Officers were dispatched to the eastbound beltline, near the Whitney Way exit, around 11:10 p.m. on Friday.

Officers attempted life-saving measures but the man 58-year-old man was pronounced dead at the scene.

Witnesses reported seeing the man walking on the Beltline prior to the crash.

The driver involved was cooperative and remained on scene. She showed no signs of impairment.

Multiple people called early Sunday morning to report shots being fired on the east side.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Cottage Grove and Stoughton roads around 2:15 a.m.

Several shell casings were found when officers canvassed the area.

No injuries or property damage were located. 

The investigation is ongoing.

Multiple people called early Tuesday morning to report shots being fired on the east side.

Officers were dispatched to the area of the 5900 block of Milwaukee St around 12:45 a.m.

Multiple shell casings were found when officers canvassed the area.

No injuries were reported. 

The investigation is ongoing.

An officer conducted a traffic stop at Troy Dr / Northport Dr. 

During the investigation, a K9 alerts on the vehicle and drug residue on a baggie in the passenger area is found. 

A handgun with an extended magazine is also discovered concealed in the seat pocket behind the driver.

Christian J Brady, 35 was arrested for carrying concealed weapon (CCW) violation.

An officer completing adminstrative tasks at the Midtown District was contacted by a subject whom the officer observes drive into the parking lot. The subject states he is looking for his girlfriend who was recently arrested. 

The contact with the subject quickly turns into an operating while impaired (OWI) investigation when the officer observes the subject has multiple signs of impairment and gave a false name at first.

Craig F Timberlack, 36 was arrested for OWVWI 4th offense, failure to install ignitation interlock device (IID), obstructing, and a probation and parole hold.

The girlfriend was never arrested.

Officers responded to the Langdon St / Carroll St for a report of an unconcious male in the roadway after a fight. Officers located the victim who was in and out of conciousness with substantial injuries (later to be noted in stable condition). 

The investigation revealed a group of high school aged students came from Janesville to Madison to try to get into frat praties. When the group was denied entry, a fight ensued. 

Witnesses stated there was a fist fight involving multiple subjects which resulted in the victim being injuried. The main suspect in the fight could not be located or identified. 

17-year-old male was arrested for battery and disorderly conduct for his role in the fight.

Multiple calls were received by dispatch reporting that shots were fired in the area of S. Few Street and Williamson Street.

A vehicle being driven on Williamson Street appearred to have been targeted by the occupant(s) of another vehicle also traveling on Williamson Street. 

The suspect vehicle left the area traveling outound on Williamson Street. 

A vehicle remaining on scene sustained multiple apparent bullet strikes. No injuries were reoported as a result of this incident.

Also, damage as a result of a fired bullet was observed on a building located in the 1200 block of Williamson Street. The building was not occupied at the time of this incident.

Officers have cleared the scene. The investigation is ongoing. Currently, no suspect information is available.

Recently the Madison Police Department was made aware of several incidents over the summer and early autumn, primarily between 11pm – 2am, where a male subject was repeatedly going onto private property and looking into the windows of a specific residence on the 1200 block of Mound Street in the Vilas neighborhood.

The subject is described as a male in his early 20’s, light to medium brown complexion, 5’11” – 6’02”, thin build, wearing a hooded sweatshirt/jacket. 

If you have any information regarding this subject, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or on the web, at p3tips.com . Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Around 12:30pm today Madison Police Department responded to a call that a person was down in the water at Brittingham Park.

Currently, this does not appear to be a suspicious death. The Medical Examiner was called and will release the name of the deceased per their policy.

This is an ongoing investigation at this time.

At approximately 2:28 PM, officers were dispatched to the 4600 block of East Towne Blvd for a domestic disturbance involving a weapon. The suspect fled the area in a vehicle leading to a pursuit which was terminated. The suspect is still at large.
 
If you have any information regarding this subject, please contact the Madison Police Department at 608-255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or on the web, at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.
There was a weapons offence with some injuries in the 5900 Block of Milwaukee St. Police are on scene and there is no apparent continued threat to the public at this time.

Arrested:
Tomas Barajas, 42-year-old male

Charges: Burglary and Criminal Damage to Property
Details:
On 7-22-23, Madison Police took a report of a Residential Burglary in the 700 block of W Olin Ave.

The victim reported damage to their home and cash, jewelry, and other valuables taken.  Physical evidence was recovered at the scene by investigators.

Detectives from the Burglary Crime Unit made an arrest in this case and the Dane County District Attorney's Office charged Tomas Barajas with the above crimes on 10-6-23.

Barajas is a convicted Felon and was out on Parole for convictions in the crimes of Burglary and Take and Operate a Motor Vehicle Without Owner's Consent at the time of this incident.

Barajas is presumed innocent until proven guilty.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after someone broke into a church early Monday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 2000 block of E. Washington Ave. around 2:40 a.m.
 
A witness saw someone punching the front door and called police.

Officers cleared the building and did not find the suspect.

There was slight damage done inside the church.

Detectives will review digital evidence.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman woke up to find a stray bullet in her nightsand.
 
Officers were dispatched to an apartment along the 5000 block of American Pkwy around 6:20 a.m. Saturday.
 
The woman said a man knocked on her door in the middle of the night, but she did not answer it as she didn’t know him.
 
The next morning she woke up to find the damage.

A neighbor told officers he had friends over, when one of them dropped a firearm that accidentally discharged.
 
He went to check on his neighbor shortly after the incident.

No injuries were reported.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

Address: E. Johnson St. at North Lawn Ave
Details:
A toddler was inside the vehicle when a driver was arrested for driving under the influence.

Officers pulled a vehicle over around 12:30 a.m. Monday in the area of E. Johnson Street and North Lawn Avenue.

Darrell Jackson, 33, was arrested for first-offense OWI with a passenger under 16.

A passenger in the car, Rodney Lee, 35, was arrested for obstructing and was taken to the Dane County Jail for a Department of Corrections warrant.

The toddler left in the care of a family member.

Officers patrolling Tuesday afternoon on the city’s north side spotted a man wanted for a substantial battery.
 
The man took off running and attempted to jump a fence when officers approached him along the 2500 block of Calypso Rd.
 
Drug paraphernalia and a knife were found on the man. A facsimile firearm was located next to him.

The suspect resisted arrested and would not cooperate with jail booking deputies.
 
Mark Young, 56, was arrested for the probable cause and new charges of resisting arrest, possession of drug paraphernalia and carrying a concealed weapon.

A homeowner called police after seeing a group of people break into his home on a security camera.

Officers were dispatched to the 4300 block of Dwight Dr. around 5:15 p.m.

They searched the home, but the suspects were gone. The homeowner sent photos of the suspects to officers.
 
As the scene was being cleared, dispatchers received a nearby call about four teens throwing rocks at cars. The teens matched the description of the suspects from the recent burglary.

A 16-year-old male was arrested for burglary and damage to property for damaging an item at the home.

A 14-year-old male was arrested for burglary.
 
A 13-year-old male was arrested for burglary.
 
A 15-year-old male was arrested for burglary.

All of the teens were taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

A woman was beaten and her backpack was stolen during an incident Tuesday afternoon.

She reported the incident as she was receiving medical care, but said it happened while at a parking lot outside of La Follette High School.

The woman was inside her vehicle when an SUV pulled up beside her. The woman said several people attempted to get inside her vehicle before she was battered.

The vicitm involved is not a current LHS student. Right now, it is unknown if the people who attacked her are students

Investigators are checking into the potential for security camera footage.
 
At this time, no arrests have been made.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

Officers were dispatched to East High School for the battery of a student.

The incident occurred around 10 a.m. Tuesday and stemmed from a dispute on social media.
 
A 17-year-old female was arrested for physical abuse of a child, strangulation and disorderly conduct.

The victim’s injuries are not life-threatening.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

Arrested:
Shawnicia Youmas, 33-Years-Old
Charges: Disorderly Conduct While Armed and Felony Bail Jumping.

Ronald Grant, 32-Years-Old 
Charges: Disorderly Conduct and Felony Bail Jumping x 2.
Details:
On October 19, 2023 at approximately 10:02pm, Madison Police Officers were dispatched to 23 N. Pinckney Street (The Old Fashioned) regarding a Weapons Offense involving a knife.

The female suspect in this weapons offense displayed a kitchen style knife, was threatening to kill, and actively slashed at a male. Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant arrived quickly to the scene and effectively took her into custody without incident. She has been charged with Disorderly Conduct While Armed and Felony Bail Jumping.

As a result of this altercation, a male was also arrested. He has been charged with Disorderly Conduct and Felony Bail Jumping x 2.

The area was canvassed and city cameras checked however, anyone with information should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com

Address: Hammersley Rd. at S. Whitney Rd.
Details:
Multiple people, including two officers, heard several gunshots on the city’s southwest side late Sunday night.
 
Several people reported hearing the shots in the area of Hammersley Rd. and S. Whitney Way around 11:11 p.m.
 
No injuries, property damage or shell casings were located.

No arrests have been made.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously. 

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: Mid Town Rd at Marty Rd
Details:
Multiple people called to report hearing gunshots on the west side early Monday morning.

Officers were sent to the area of Mid Town and Marty roads around 12:36 a.m.

They found 12 shell casings in the road while canvassing the area.

No injuries or property damage were reported.

No arrests have been made.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously and may be eligible for a monetary reward.

The investigation is ongoing.

A teen was arrested after a loaded gun in his backpack during an incident Sunday night.
 
Officers were dispatched to the Walmart along the 4100 block of Nakoosa Trail around 9:50 p.m.

A witness heard the sound of a gun slide racking while a group of teenage employees were in the restroom.
 
The incident was reported to store managers and police were called.

The teen was off-duty when officers arrived. The gun was found in his backpack and missing part of its serial number.
 
The 16-year-old was arrested for possessing a dangerous weapon by person under 18-years-of-age. He was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

Officers were dispatched after a child was hit by a vehicle on the city’s north side Sunday afternoon.

The incident occurred along the 300 block of Oriole Ln. around 2:50 p.m.

Witnesses said a young child darted out in the road from behind a parked vehicle.
 
The driver involved was driving slow, showed no signs of impairment and cooperated with officers.
 
The child was taken to the hospital for her injuries, but is expected to be OK.
 
No citations were issued.

Officers found three shell casings on the city's south side while responding to a shots fired call.

Officers were dispatched to the 200 block of Bram St. around 7 p.m. on Monday.

No injuries were reported. Officers did not see any signs of property damage.

Anyone with information on this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

Several people reporting hearing shots fired on the city's north side early Saturday morning.

Officers found one shell casing along the 1000 block of Northport Dr.

No injuries were reported. No property damage was located.

No arrests have been made. 

The investigation is ongoing.

A parked car was damaged during a shots fired incident late Saturday night. 

Multiple people reported hearing several shots fired along the 1200 block of E. Dayton St. around 11:50 p.m.

Two shell casings were located in the area. The window of an unoccupied vehicle was also broken.

No injuries were reported.

No arrests have been made.

Officers canvassed the area for physical and digital evidence.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 609-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously. 

The investigation is ongoing. ?

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman was injured during an incident early Saturday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the Radisson Hotel located on Grand Canyon Dr. shortly before 3 a.m.

A woman says she was on the dance floor of a banquet room when she was attacked and struck on her head.

The woman was not forthcoming with officers about what occurred. She was treated at the scene for her injuries.

No arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

Three people got into a fight and a woman deliberately hit another vehicle during an incident Sunday night.
 
The incident unfolded along the 800 block of Hughes Place, close to the South District Police Station, and was observed by nearby officers.
 
A woman, watched as a man picked up a female passenger, and aggressively trailed the pair through the South District.
 
The man pulled into a parking lot on Hughes Place where the woman deliberately crashed into his vehicle. The three adults involved then got into a physical fight in this parking lot.
 
Two children were inside the woman’s vehicle as Sunday’s incident occurred.

Iesha B. Young, 32, of Sun Prairie, was arrested for second-degree recklessly endangering safety, criminal damage to property and disorderly conduct. The other adult woman received a municipal citation for disorderly conduct. The man had a warrant for his arrest from another state.

The children were released to the care of other family members.

Address: N. Few St. at E. Mifflin St.
Details:
An officer was on a routine patrol when he noticed two people hanging out the windows of a moving vehicle early Tuesday morning.

The vehicle was stopped around 1:40 a.m. on N. Few St. near E. Mifflin St.

The driver showed signs of impairment. Jason K. Reno, 24, was arrested for third-offense OWI.

A passenger in the vehicle was found to have two outstanding warrants and was taken into custody.

Both men were taken to the Dane County Jail.

A woman called for help after seeing a driver wave a gun out of his vehicle on the Beltline.

The vehicles were headed westbound, near S. Whitney Way, around 1:30 p.m. Monday.

Officers met the man at his home where a gun was found inside the vehicle. The man is a CCW holder.

Zifu Wang, 23, was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed and taken to the Dane County Jail.?

The Madison Police Department is investigating after shots were fired during a party taking place in the parking lot of Warner Park Beach.

Officers were dispatched to the 1100 block of Woodward Dr. around 4:35 a.m. on Saturday.

No one was in the parking lot when officers arrived, but there were obvious signs of a disturbance. Officers found a shell casing and empty liquor bottles in the area.

As they were investigating, officers in another jurisdiction found a damaged car in their village. The car had a flat tire and several bullet holes.

Two adult men were inside, but denied knowing what happened at Warner Park Beach.

One of the men was injured, but denied medical treatment.

At this time, no arrests have been made. 

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after shots were fired from a vehicle Tuesday evening.

Officers were dispatched to the 2300 block of Allied Dr. around 6:15 p.m.

Three shell casings were found in the road.

Children and other adults were outside in the area when the shots were fired. No injuries were reported.

Officers were unable to locate any signs of property damage.

They are reviewing digital evidence as part of this investigation.

Allied Dr. was shut down Tuesday night as officers investigated.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and may be eligible for a monetary reward.

The investigation is ongoing.?

A woman woke up to loud noises coming from the kitchen of her home early Wednesday morning.
 
She headed downstairs to find a stranger, who appeared intoxicated, removing items from her refrigerator and drinking one of her “expensive IPAs.”
 
The woman left her home and called for help when the man refused to leave.
 
Officers arrived at the woman’s home, located along the 2100 block of Lakeland Ave., around 4:20 a.m.

The man had locked himself inside and was refusing to leave.
 
At the victim’s request, officers entered the home. They found the man attempting to hide behind a dining room table.
 
The man was taken into custody without further incident.

Sean Cain, 32, was arrested for burglary and resisting arrest.
 
He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

Four teens were arrested for using a fake gun to scare people at businesses on Friday.

Officers were dispatched to a weapons violation at the Taco Bell located along the 600 block of S. Whitney Way around 4 p.m.

They were told a group of teens flashed a gun while outside the business. Officer also received reports the teens used the weapon to scare people in the nearby shopping plaza.

One teen was taken into custody at the Taco Bell. He informed officers the gun involved was fake.

Multiple MPD units responded to the area. A K-9 team was able to track officers to where the facsimile gun was discarded.

The other teens were arrested nearby.

A 14-year-old male and two 13-year-old males were arrested for disorderly conduct while armed. They were taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

A 13-year-old male was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed and released to his parents.

The teens told police they found the gun earlier and thought it would be funny to prank people.

On October 25th at approximately 9:26 pm, Madison Police Department officers were dispatched to a local hospital reference a report of an adult male who arrived there with multiple gunshot wounds. 

Officers and detectives involved in the investigation learned the shooting took place outside in the 1700 block of Moorland Rd. No other injured persons were located on scene. 

Further investigation revealed the victim in the shooting was specifically targeted during the incident. Suspect information is not available at this time. The investigation is ongoing and is assigned to the MPD Violent Crime Unit.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a customer’s vehicle was stolen from a local car dealership.

The customer’s vehicle had been in the shop for months awaiting warranty repairs. Wednesday morning, he woke up to see GPS alerts on his phone indicating his vehicle was in another city.

The customer alerted the dealership and employees noticed his keys were missing.

The vehicle was located and recovered in Rock County. It is in the process of being brought back to Madison.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

An intoxicated driver attempted to “hug it out” with a victim following a hit-and-run crash.

A hit-and-run crash was reported around 8:50 a.m. near the intersection of N. Sherman Ave. and Rigney Ln.

The victim followed the suspect’s vehicle after the crash. After turning off of Sherman Avenue, the suspect crashed into a mailbox, over-corrected and drove across the road and crashed into a tree.
 
The suspect then got out of the vehicle, apologized for the hit-and-run and attempted to “hug it out” with the victim.

After the hug attempt, the suspect began walking away from the area but was quickly taken into custody by police.

Alexander K. Zimmer, 22, was arrested for first-offense OWI.?

Three students were arrested and two loaded handguns were recovered from East High School grounds on Friday afternoon.

School staff contacted police after they were notified of a photo circulating online showing a student with a gun.

Officers located the student and two others in a common area of the school around 2 p.m.  One 16-year-old male left the building, but was taken into custody while still on school grounds. As he ran from officers, he ditched a loaded handgun that was located during an article search. He was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon, having a firearm on school grounds and resisting arrest.

The other two students remained in the building but resisted arrest. A 17-year-old became combative and injured a sergeant taking him into custody. Another loaded gun was found inside his backpack.

Marquise Johnson, 17, was arrested for possessing a gun on school grounds, carrying a concealed weapon, possession with intent to distribute THC while armed and within 1,000 feet of school grounds, drug paraphernalia and resisting causing soft tissue injury to an officer. He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The other student, a 16-year-old male, was arrested for resisting arrest for trying to take the backpack away from the officers fighting with Johnson. Both 16-year-olds were taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

No injuries were reported among students and school staff. Officers worked with school staff to keep other students safely in classrooms.

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: Troy Dr. at N. Sherman Ave.
Details:
Multiple people reported hearing what sounded like gunshots on the city's north side Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Troy Dr. and North Sherman Ave.

Officers walked the area but did not locate any shell casings or property damage.

No injuries were reported.

One caller believed the sound may have been a fireowrk.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man was arrested for pointing his rifle at an officer Thursday night.

The officer was working along the 1800 block of Northport Dr. around 10:40 p.m.

The officer was sitting in a marked squad car when the incident occured. 

Thao Chuekao was arrested for intentionally pointing at firearm toward a law enforcement officer. He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a smash-and-grab burglary at a gas station early Monday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 1100 block of N. Sherman Ave. around 3:30 a.m.

A burglar used a rock to break a front window. Once inside, a significant amount of cigarette cartons were stolen.

No arrests have been made at this time.

Detectives are reviewing digital evidence.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and eligible for a monetary reward.

The investigation is ongoing.

Arrested:
Daris K. Theus, 26
Dytoria M. Theus, 22
Details:
A woman was assaulted and thrown into a window during a disturbance inside the Cheba Hut late Sunday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of W. Gilman St. around 10:10 p.m.

A woman was sitting inside the restaurant and after a brief conversation with 2 individuals unknown to her, she was physically assaulted by the individuals. 

A restaurant employee tried to break up the fight, but was hit by the pair during the process.

Officers arrived on scene and took the man and woman into custody without incident.

Daris K. Theus, 26, was arrested for battery, disorderly conduct, criminal damage to property and resisting arrest.

Dytoria M. Theus, 22, was arrested for battery, disorderly conduct and criminal damage to property.

The victim suffered minor injuries and was not transported to the hospital.
 
A window to the restaurant was damaged during this incident.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after one person was stabbed during a disturbance early Sunday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 2300 block of Allied. Dr. shortly before 5 a.m.

Officers arrived to a chaotic scene, as dozens of people remained in the area and some attempted to interfere with the police investigation.

Officers from outside agencies also assisted on this call to help secure the area.

Officers learned there was a dispute between two groups of people over a crash in the apartment building’s parking lot. A 31-year-old woman was stabbed during this incident. She was taken to the hospital for her injuries. She has since been discharged as her injuries were not life-threatening.

The suspect involved in the stabbing has not been arrested at this time.

Three people at the scene were arrested. A 43-year-old woman was arrested for resisting. A 32-year-old woman was arrested for obstruction. A 34-year-old man was arrested for resisting, disorderly conduct and criminal damage to property.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and may be eligible for a monetary reward.

The investigation is ongoing.

A drunk driver was taken to the hospital following a rollover crash on the Beltline.

The woman was driving westbound on the Beltline, near Mineral Point Rd. when she left the road, went into a grassy median, overcorrected and then rolled her vehicle twice.

The woman was taken to the hospital for her injuries.

Open alcohol containers were found inside her SUV.

Lori A. Frisch, 57,  was cited for third-offense OWI, operating after suspended and failure to control a vehicle.

Two people reported hearing several gunshots on the city's south side Monday evening.

Officers checked the area and were unable to find any shell casings or property damage.

No injuries were reported.

The investigation is ongoing.

At 6:01 p.m. officers were called to 1700 block of Loftsgordon Ave. for a domestic incident involving a firearm. Officers safely arrested one adult male and there is no threat to the community. The investigation is ongoing and the department asks the public to respect the privacy of those involved in this incident.

Update: The man on the video was identified within an hour of the news stories being broadcast asking for identification of the suspect. The suspect presented himself at the Madison Central Police District where he was interviewed and booked into the Dane County Jail without incident. Special thanks to the members of the media and the public for their partnership in solving this case.

Attempt to Identify


The Madison Police Department’s Burglary Crime unit needs your help in identifying a suspect in a Burglary that occurred in mid-October in the 100 block of N Mills Street. 

The pictured suspect entered an apartment complex and residence in the early morning hours, alarming the residents and causing a disturbance.


If you recognize this person, please notify the Madison Police Department Burglary Unit at 608-267-8695.


If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Arrested:
Carlos T Davis, 40 years old
Charges: 3 counts PTAC felony Identity Theft


Tanya L Alling, 34 years old
Charges: 3 counts PTAC felony Identity Theft
Details:
Madison Police Department officers responded to a Burglary report in the 2400 block of East Washington Avenue.  The victim reported that entry had been made into the home and items taken.

Within a few minutes of discovering the Burglary, the victim began receiving notifications of credit card use at a nearby business.  An MPD Officer obtained surveillance video of a vehicle used in those transactions.

A few weeks later, that same MPD Officer observed the suspect vehicle and contacted its driver.  Based on that contact, MPD Officers and detectives from the Burglary Crime Unit identified the suspects and charged them.

The Dane County District Attorney's Office charged the above defendants with felony crimes.  All defendants are presumed innocent until proven guilty.

Address: Wheeler Rd East of Sherman Ave
Details:
Madison Police Department assisted with a dump truck roll over accident on Wheeler Rd around 11:24am. Injuries are noted, appear not that serious at this time. Investigation continues.

Barricades were used to re-route traffic at Sherman and Wheeler to CV.

An OWI charge is pending for an individual that hit three occupied and parked vehicles this morning on the cities North side. The individual was finally stopped around Norris Court after heading from Packers Ave. Pending blood draw. Investigation continues.

On November 6, 2023 at approximately 9:20 PM, the victim was walking alone through Warner Park when he was approached by two suspects. One of the assailants brandished a knife and threatened the victim. After grabbing the victim’s wallet, the suspects tossed the victim to the ground and fled on foot. The victim suffered non-life threatening injuries.
 
No arrests have been made and the investigation is ongoing at this time. Anyone with information regarding this incident should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Toned out as a Weapons offense, pending charges for disorderly conduct while armed. Madison Police were called to Cedar Street at Park Street for a report of a woman chasing a man with a machete. When officers arrived, the victim was located. He reported he was head-butted in the lip by his former girlfriend but felt no pain. Caller reported the machete chase and the victim verified but stated the machete was never raised in a threatening fashion. None the less, the victim feared for safety and probable cause exists for disorderly conduct while armed. Suspect information was very light from the victim and the caller could not be reached. Investigation continues.

Officers responded to the lobby of the Hilton Hotel on Wilson Street to a call of an individual pacing frantically and destroying property in the hotel lobby.

Upon arrival officers located the individual in the hotel elevator along with the night manager for the hotel attempting to keep the suspect in the elevator.

The suspect is a resident of the hotel for a conference in Madison and had been causing a disturbance for about an hour before police were called with the hotel staff trying to resolve the issue themselves.

Hotel staff described punching at walls, shouting and swearing, throwing and slamming of items in the lobby and physical battery to two hotel staff.

Erratic behavior continued in the back of the squad and officers worked hard to try calm the suspect down while in custody and in the sally port of the jail. Metoxen is arrested on initial state charges of physical abuse of an elderly person, battery simple, and disorderly conduct.

This morning the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU) arrested a 25-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.
 
Members of MPD's SVU, MPD's East Community Policing Team, and the Dane County Sheriffs Office Tactical Response Team served a search warrant on Kendall T. Sytsma’s residence on Bishops Bay Parkway, Middleton, WI.
 
Sytsma has been the subject of an ongoing investigation and lived within the City of Madison before recently moving to Middleton. He was booked into the Dane County Jail today on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

A train heading in one direction yesterday saw an individual in a grassy area approximately 75 feet from the crossing near Wilson St at Blair St. Today the train was heading in the opposite direction and saw that this individual was in the same position and decided to stop the train in order to check on him.
The individual was deceased.  MPD Officers and Detectives investigated at the scene, and the Dane County Medical Examiner's Office also responded.  At this time, this is not being investigated as a suspicious death.

At approximately 9:30pm, November 8th, Madison Police received multiple calls for a single-vehicle crash on E Johnson St near the Yahara bridge. The crash appears to be the result of excessive speed which caused the vehicle to roll over. Two people were taken to the hospital with injuries. MPD had the road closed for a significant period of time while traffic specialists from Madison PD and Wisconsin State Patrol processed the scene.  Scene is cleared and the road is open.

On the evening of 11/7/2023, a candlelight vigil was held in the area of Library Mall.  As a group of attendees was walking home, one individual reported being hit by an object which they believe was a rock.  Members of this group also reported hearing an individual making profane and racially insensitive comments to the group.  The complainants believe the incident to be racially motivated.
 
The Madison Police Department was made aware of the incident and we are actively investigating it.  We encourage anyone with information related to this incident to contact the Madison Police Department.  You may also submit a tip through Crimestoppers (follow the prompts to select Madison WI): https://www.p3tips.com/community/index.htm
 
We also encourage anyone who wishes to report incidents which may be racially or ethnically motivated (potential hate crimes) to contact Police immediately, at 608-255-2345, or 911 if appropriate.  While the MPD self-report system is available, direct communication with an on-duty Officer most often provides us with the best possible initial information.

On 11/10/2023 at approximately 1:29pm, Officers were dispatched with Madison Fire Department to the area of Packers Ave and Manley St for a report of a traffic crash with injuries. Some parties on scene were transported to a local hospital for their injuries. 

This is still an active scene with officers conducting an investigation. Individuals are asked to avoid the area and there will be some traffic delays. This incident is being investigated as a fatal crash.

Increased Traffic Enforcement

In November, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, will continue to conduct extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's alcohol and seatbelt laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 

The goal of these extra patrols is not only to enhance public safety, but to prevent needless tragedies. Someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin and thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.

The Madison Police Department needs your help to make our roads safer.  Please put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.

Officers noticed an intoxicated person outside of a State Street restaurant late Tuesday night. 

The man was placed into protective custody due to the level of his intoxicated and taken to a local hospital.

While at the hospital, the man created a disturbance and attempted to hit an officer in the face.

Austin R. Sheley, 29, was eventually transported to the Dane County Jail on charges of disorderly conduct, resisting arrest and attempted battery to a law enforcement officer.

A man chucked rocks at two people and tried to kick his way into a random apartment building Tuesday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Lake Street shortly before 4 p.m.

Witnesses said the man filled a hat with rocks and began flinging it at people. Two people in the area reported being struck by the rocks. They suffered minor injuries.

The man was also involved in a disturbance in another jurisdiction earlier in the day.

MPD officers caught up with him near the apartment.

Journey Mental Health was consulted and the man was taken to a medical facility for additional help.

Address: N. Fair Oaks at Milwaukee St.
Details:
A witness called for help after seeing a heavily damaged vehicle weaving all over the road on the east side early Tuesday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the area of N. Fair Oaks and Milwaukee St. around 7:50 a.m.

Officers arrived to find the vehicle with its airbags deployed and front bumper dragging.  An investigation revealed the driver hit an occupied car on Fair Oaks earlier.

Varshon H. Reed, 25, was arrested for second-offense OWI and felony bail jumping.

A man ran from officers and into a vacant apartment as the officers responded to a domestic disturbance call Thursday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to the 2300 block of Allied Dr. They arrived to find two people fighting behind an apartment building.

Upon seeing officers ,the suspect ran through the building’s basement and into a vacant apartment. He refused to come out when police tried talking to him.
 
Officers were let into the unit and the suspect surrendered.

Kyann M. Barr, 28, was arrested for domestic disorderly conduct, batter, damage to property, trespassing and resisting arrest. There was also probable cause to arrest him for a previous domestic incident.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a fight about social media usage. 

Officers were dispatched to the Perkins Family Restaurant around 10:30 a.m. on Friday.

A man said he was beaten when he asked another man to mute the videos. This upset the suspect and he began striking the victim. Another person tried to intervene, but was also battered.
 
The suspect was not at the restaurant when officers arrived, but later turned himself in.

Micheal L. Garrett, 53, will be taken to the Dane County Jail on substantial battery, battery and disorderly conduct charges after he is medically cleared.

An intoxicated driver was arrested early Thursday morning after crashed into an unoccupied ambulance.

A bystander called to report concerning driving behaviors from someone attempting to merge onto I-90 from E. Washington Ave. The driver crossed over the grassy median area multiple times, causing damage to his front bumper and tires.

The driver was unconscious in his vehicle when first responders arrived. He attempted to drive away after awakening, but ultimately crashed into the ambulance.

Drug paraphernalia was located inside the vehicle.

Michael J. Holloway, 58, was arrested for 2nd-offense OWI.

The Madison Police Department monitored a is neo-Nazi group that marched through the city Saturday afternoon.

Around 20 people, carrying Nazi flags, walked up State Street to the Wisconsin State Capitol before heading to James Madison Park.

No weapons were displayed.

The group was roughly in the city from noon until 2 p.m.

Many called 911 to report this group.

The Madison Police Department does not support hateful rhetoric. The department has an obligation to protect First Amendment rights of all.

Arrested:
Taylor J. Rasch; 31-Year-Old Female

Charges; 
1) Disorderly Conduct while Armed, 
2) Resisting Arrest, 
3) Intimidation of Victim, 
4) Threats to Law Enforcement, 
5) Probation Hold, 
6) Trespass After Notification
Details:
At approximately 12:59am, Madison Police Officers and a Sergeant were dispatched to 4830 Hayes Road (Red Roof Inn) regarding a Weapons Offense-Person with a Knife. Taylor Rasch engaged in a verbal argument with a man staying at the Red Roof Inn. After she was not allowed into his room, she walked to the lobby and confronted the attendant on duty.

When asked to leave by the attendant on duty, she produced a large rock and threatened him by saying “I’ve got something for you”. Following this, Taylor drew a knife from her person, flipped the blade open and threatening the victim while holding both objects. The attendant called 911 and Taylor fled back to the direction of the room where the argument began.

Officers arrived on scene quickly, observed Taylor, and ordered her to the ground. She refused to comply with their lawful orders and then resisted arrest. After being taken into custody, Taylor threatened the officers/sergeant on scene. The knife was recovered and she has been taken to the Dane County Jail; booked in on six different charges.

Although witnesses were contacted on scene, anyone with information regarding this weapons offense should call Madison Police at 608-255-2345. Anonymous tips can also be submitted through the Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

Increased Traffic Enforcement in December

This December, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's seatbelt, alcohol and bicycle and pedestrian laws. 

These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 
The goal of these extra patrols is not just to arrest drivers.  The mission is to enhance public safety and prevent needless tragedies by discouraging people from making dangerous decisions and engaging in unsafe behaviors while driving.

This holiday season, the Madison Police Department and the Dane County Sheriff's Office need your help to make our roads safer.  Please celebrate safely and make responsible choices.  Put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.

Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over Holiday Campaign

Every 39 minutes in the United States, one person is killed in a drunk driving crash. More than 13,000 lives are lost each year.  December is a particularly deadly month, especially during the holidays. 

This year, from December 13, 2023 through January 1, 2024, the Madison Police Department and the Dane County Sheriff’s Department are taking part in the Drive Sober or Get Pulled Over campaign.  The goals of this campaign are to educate people about the dangers and consequences of driving drunk, decrease impaired driving, prevent needless tragedies and save lives.

But, we cannot do it alone.  We need your help to make our roads safer.  If you are celebrating and drinking this holiday season, always remember to have a plan to get home safely.  Just one drink before driving can put you and others in danger, because alcohol impairs thinking, reasoning and muscle coordination.
  • Always drive 100% sober. Even one alcoholic beverage could be one too many.  
  • Plan ahead: Before you have even one drink, designate a sober driver to get you home safely.
  • You have options to get home safely: designate a sober driver or call a taxi or rideshare. Getting home safely is always worth it.
  • If it’s your turn to be the designated driver, take your job seriously and don’t drink.
  • If you have a friend who is about to drink and drive, take the keys away and let a sober driver get your friend home safely. 
The Madison Police Department and the Dane County Sheriff’s Department wish you a happy, healthy, and safe holiday season.

Increased Traffic Enforcement in January


This January, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's seatbelt and alcohol laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 

The goal of these extra patrols is not just to arrest drivers.  The mission is to enhance public safety and prevent needless tragedies by discouraging people from making dangerous decisions and engaging in unsafe behaviors while driving.  Someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin and thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.

This new year, the Madison Police Department needs your help to make our roads safer.  Put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.

Arrested: Jonathan M. Reese Jr., age 19, of Madison
Details:
Shortly after 3:00 p.m. on Thursday afternoon, Madison Police officers were dispatched to Dick’s Sporting Goods located in the East Towne Mall for a report of a subject who had dropped a handgun while leaving the store.
 
The caller reported that the subject had dropped the gun in the vestibule area of the store, between the exterior and interior doors. Further, it was relayed to officers that the subject was acting unusually in the store prior to dropping the firearm.
 
Numerous officers were able to respond to the area quickly, and located the subject near another business in the immediate vicinity.
 
As officers confronted the subject, the subject was non-compliant and began reaching for his right hip area. Despite officers continually giving verbal commands to the subject to show his hands and surrender, the subject then ran from the officer.
 
As the subject was running, he threw the loaded handgun onto the ground in front of another storefront in the East Towne Mall area.
 
Ultimately, officers were able to take the subject into custody safely near yet another business, without further incident.
 
Jonathan M. Reese Jr., age 19, was booked into the Dane County Jail on one count of Carrying a Concealed Weapon and one count of Resisting an Officer.
 
Photographs of the loaded handgun and its recovery location are included with this incident report.

Details:
Madison Police Officers were dispatched to the 1300 block of Jenifer Street for an active disturbance.

Upon arrival, officers encoutered a chaotic scene with numerous people inside a house with one injuried by stab wound.

The victim was transported to an area hospital with non-life-threatening injuries.

Marlena Ray was contacted at the scene and placed under arrest for 1st Degree Recklessly Endangering Safety, Failure to Render Aid, and Disorderly Conduct while Armed.  All of the charges were of a Domestic nature.

A woman, who had just won several thousand dollars, was robbed while trying to leave a Madison casino.

Officers were dispatched to the 4000 block of Evan Acres Rd. around 2:15 a.m. on Monday.

The woman and her husband were walking to their vehicle when they were approached by a stranger asking them for a ride.

When they declined, the suspect grabbed the woman’s purse and forcibly ripped it off of her before running away.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence in this case.

No arrests have been made yet.

The investigation is ongoing.

Three children were inside a vehicle when a suspected drunk driver was pulled over early Monday morning.

Officers stopped a vehicle for speeding at E. Washington Ave. at Highway 30 around 1:05 a.m.

Officers smelled intoxicants coming from the driver. The driver also had a revoked driver’s license.

Jalon M. Thomas, 37, of Milwaukee, was arrested for third-offense OWI with a passenger under 16 and having a suspended registration.

Two other adults, in addition to the three children, were inside the vehicle.

They were picked up by a sober driver.

A hotel employee was punched in the face while trying to help an intoxicated guest get safely back to her room.

Officers were dispatched to the Madison Concourse Hotel on W. Dayton St. around 1:30 a.m. on Monday.

The guest was taken to the hospital before being transported to the Dane County Jail.

Sarah N. Neindorf, 27, of Madison, was arrested for battery, disorderly conduct and resisting arrest.

Address: S. Park Street at Erin St.
Details:
A snow plow driver called for help after seeing a vehicle crash into a traffic pole.

Officers were dispatched to S. Park St. at Erin St. around 12:10 a.m. on Sunday.

The driver attempted to pass the snow plow on icy roads when the crash happened.

No injuries were reported.

A 21-year-old man was cited for no driver's license and driving too fast for conditions.

Part of Park St. was closed for thirty minutes as a result of this crash.

Address: Schroeder Rd and S Gammon Rd
Details:
MPD officers were dispatched to a report of Metro bus that was struck by projectiles as it was driving in this area.  The bus was empty of passengers at the time, and the driver was uninjured.  The damage to the bus is consistent with BB gun projectiles.

MPD officers are reviewing area video surveillance and will continue to investigate.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

A teenager was arrested after officers responded to a disturbance involving a stun gun Monday evening.

Officers were dispatched to the 4300 block of Britta Dr. around 8:45 p.m.
 
Three teens were playing with a stun gun when an argument started. A 16-year-old male then threated one of the teens with the weapon.

The 16-year-old was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center for disorderly conduct while armed and possession of an electronic weapon.

The investigation is ongoing.
