The Madison Police Department responded to a fight involving several students of Vel Phillips Memorial High School.

Officers were dispatched to the 200 block of S. Gammon Rd. around  12:10 p.m. The fight occurred off school grounds.

While officers were investigating, a student showed up at the hospital with a superficial wound. The student was injured during the fight. 

No arrests have been made.

Detectives are working with Madison Metropolitan School Staff during this investigation. 
 
This case is actively being investigated at the time of this release.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man arrived at a local hospital with a gunshot wound.

Officers responded to the 200 block of S. Park. St. shortly before 10 p.m. on Wednesday.

The man said he was moving the gun when it went off and injured him.

The man was charged with being a felon in possession of a firearm and taken to the Dane County Jail after he was treated for his injuries.

Officers were dispatched to an east side grocery store for a man causing a disturbance and directing racial comments toward staff.

Officers arrived at the Hy-Vee located on E. Washington Ave. around 8:20 p.m. on New Year’s Eve.

Daryl J. Copus, 61, of Fitchburg, was arrested for disorderly condct with a hate crime enhancer.

MPD’s newly formed Hate Crimes Task Force has been notified of this incident.

A woman woke up to find a stranger attempting to break into her apartment early Thursday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of Northport Dr. around 2:30 a.m.

The man left the area, by going on the building’s roof, before police arrived. Officers saw his footprints on the roof and were able to follow them to another apartment.

Officers cleared that apartment and no one was found inside.

No arrests have been made at this time.

Anyone with information is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers responded after a drunk driver crashed into a light pole Wednesday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 2100 block of East Springs Dr. around 7:35 p.m.

Witnesses said the a vehicle was driving at a high rate of speed and nearly hit another car before the crash.

The 36-year-old driver was taken to the hospital and cited for first-offense OWI.

A person, pretending to be a Milwaukee police officer, scammed a Madison resident out of more than $1,000.

The Madison Police Department was notified Wednesday night of the scam.

The teenage victim said he was contacted by an officer with the Milwaukee Police Department in December. The “officer” told him he would need to cover the amount of a psych evaluation as part of their criminal investigation. The “officer” then told the victim was the evaluation was completed he would be refunded the money.

The victim paid the officer via Apple Pay and contacted the Milwaukee officer when he never received his refund.

The scammer used caller ID spoofing and made it appear as if he was actually calling from a Milwaukee Police Department phone line.

The Madison Police Department is reminding people that legitimate officers will never ask for payment as part of a criminal investigation. Nor would they ask for payment for any service using gift cards or bitcoin.

A drunk man entered a stranger’s home, thinking it belonged to his family member, and caused damage to the property on Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 200 block of N. Gammon Rd. shortly before 7 p.m.

The victim told police the man broke her patio door and refused to leave on her requests.
 
The man also caused damage in the basement of the home. He found officers as he was taken into custody.
 
Jose L. Oviedo Ponce, 53, of Madison, was taken to the Dane County Jail for criminal trespass to a dwelling, resisting, felony damage to property and disorderly conduct.

The investigation is ongoing.

MPD and MFD were dispatched to a call of a fully-engulfed pop-up camper parked on the street.  MFD exinguished the fire.  No loss of life.  The street was shut down briefly while the area was made safe.  MFD and MPD Arson Investigators will be investigating.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after someone attempted to break into three liquor stores early Sunday morning.
 
Officers were initially dispatched to a wine shop located on S. Bassett Street around 4:25 a.m.
 
During this incident, the suspect shattered the front glass door to get inside. Several expensive bottles of liquor were stolen.  
 
Shortly after 6:30 a.m., someone tried breaking into a liquor store located along the 4500 block of Cottage Grove Rd. The suspect was unable to gain entry to this business, but the front door was damaged during the process.
 
Less than thirty minutes later, someone used a landscaping rock to break a glass door of a store located along the 6400 block of Cottage Grove Rd. During this burglary, someone once again stole expensive bottles of liquor.
 
Detectives are working to determine if the same suspect was involved in each burglary or attempted burglary. They are reviewing digital evidence recovered from several of the targeted businesses.
 
At this time, no arrests have been made. Anyone with information about these burglaries is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a monetary reward.
 
These cases remain open and active. The Burglary Crime Unit is leading these investigations.

Arrested:
Jontrae Larson, 22
Keyonte Barksdale, 21
Tommy L. Nicks, 17
Address: White Sky Pass at Redan Drive
Details:
A Madison K-9 officer was able to lead his handler and other officers to three suspects and a loaded gun following a crash on Saturday.

A family was turning into their neighborhood when their vehicle was rear-ended by a stolen Jeep. The crash occurred around 11:30 a.m. on Saturday in the area of White Sky Pass and Redan Drive.

Three people ran from the Jeep after the crash.

Officers noticed footprints in the fresh snow and a K-9 unit assisted. K-9 Bowie did a track, leading his handler and officers to a 22-year-old man. This suspect had thrown a loaded gun under an air conditioner on Ancient Oak Lane.  Jontrae Larson, 22, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent (party to a crime).

K-9 Bowie continued his tracking and found two other suspects hiding under a porch.

Keyonte Barksdale, 21, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent (party to a crime).

Tommy L. Nicks, 17, was arrested was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent (party to a crime).
The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A photo of the gun recovered from this incident is attached to this release.

Address: Warner Park entrance at Northport Dr.
Details:
A rideshare driver crashed into a light pole after swerving to avoid a chunk of ice in the road.

Officers were dispatched to the Warner Park Entrance at Northport Drive around 1:15 p.m.

The rideshare driver had two passengers in their car at the time of the crash.

One of the passengers, a 37-year-old woman, was taken to the hospital for her injuries.

The driver was cited for driving too fast for conditions.

Photos of the crash scene are attached to this report.

A woman out shoveling her driveway was hit by a vehicle that lost control due to the slippery, snow-covered roads.

Officers were dispatched to the 1200 block of Seminole Hwy around 2:25 p.m.

A 20-year-old driver began to slide while navigating a curve in the area. He noticed the woman outside and began honking his horn to get her attention.

The driver ultimately slid into the 73-year-old woman. She was taken to the hospital with non-life- threatening injuries.

A Silver Alert has been issued for a Madison man who was last seen leaving his home Tuesday morning.

Please be on the lookout for 71-year-old Carlos Malave. He left the 1000 block of Mound Street around 9 a.m. and was headed to Chicago. He never arrived and has not been heard from since.

Malave was last seen wearing blue jeans, a red Wisconsin Badgers hoodie and brown shoes. He has short white hair and is roughly 5 foot, 6 inches tall. A photo of Malave is attached to this release. 

He drives a black Ford Escape with license plate EU6891.

Anyone with information on Malave’s whereabouts is asked to contact the Madison Police Department at 608-266-4730.

A man was arrested for his fourth OWI offense following a hit and run crash Monday afternoon.

The man was driving a truck down Crescent Road when he hit a parked car and kept going.

A witness followed the driver to a parking lot about a block away.

Officers arrived to find the truck damaged. An open container of alcohol was also found inside.

The man was taken to the hospital to be medically cleared.

Corey A. George, 45, of Madison, was arrested for 4th offense OWI. He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

Madison police responded after someone shot a BB gun during a domestic disturbance.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment along the 3100 block of Ridgeview Ave. shortly before 9 p.m.

A man said his window was shot at after he asked two people known to him to leave his apartment.

No one was injured.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A woman exposed herself to officers and others passing by following a disturbance inside a clothing store.

Officers were dispatched to the 600 block of State Street shortly before 3 p.m.

Store staff called for help when the woman started yelling and banging on shop windows. She then went outside and began pushing people passing by.

As officers responded, the woman pulled down her pants and made sexual statement. She then ran from the area.

She was later detained in the 400 block of W. Gilman after dispatchers received reports she was attempting to start fights with strangers.

Joanna K. Lee, 33, was arrested for disorderly conduct, lewd and lascivious behaviors and resisting arrest.

Address: W. Washington Ave. at N. Bassett St.
Details:
Officers responded after a vehicle ran a red light and crashed into a Madison Metro Bus.

Officers were dispatched to the intersection of W. Washington Avenue at N. Bassett Street around 12:20 p.m.

A passenger on the bus reported being injured but walked away and did not have contact with responding officers.

The driver that ran the red light was injured and taken to the hospital.

This remains an active investigation at this time.

MPD's Burglary Crime Unit is looking to identify the suspect in these pictures connected to several burglaries reported in early January.  The suspect is believed to be a while male that forced entry into multiple businesses on the east side and downtown.

Please contact MPD if you recognize this person, his clothing, or have any information that could help the case.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

A teenager was arrested for beating a student at La Follette High School.

Officers were dispatched to the 700 block of Pflaum Rd. shortly before 2 p.m.

The victim was sitting at a desk waiting for class to start when she was attacked. She suffered visible injuries.

A teacher broke up the fight and suffered a minor injury during the process.

The 15-year-old female was contacted at a home on the north side and taken into custody. She was taken to the Juvenile Reception Center for battery.

A victim called police after having a gun flashed at him during a road rage incident.

Officers were dispatched to Highway 12 at S. Gammon Rd. shortly after 3 p.m. on Wednesday.

The victim was able to pass along a vehicle and suspect description and a license plate number.

Officers located the suspect at a gym on Watts Road around 4:15 p.m.

A gun was found in the suspect’s vehicle.

Rashawn J. Jefferson, 27, of Madison was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed and carrying a concealed weapon.

Madison officers were dispatched on a “check person” call after a man ran away from home following an argument.

The man was not dressed for the weather and his family was concerned.

An MPD drone and K-9 unit were called in to help locate the man, who was last seen heading toward Heritage Heights Park on the city’s southeast side.

The MPD drone operator located the man lying in the snow and directed officers to his whereabouts.

The man was treated by EMS for cold exposure.

Officers responded to a domestic disturbance on the south side Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the W. Badger Road around 7:45 p.m.

The 22-year-old male suspect hit, bit and choked the victim.

Officers developed probable cause to arrest the suspect for domestic disorderly conduct, mayhem, strangulation and battery.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a group of students agreed to fight each other off the West High School campus.

Officers were dispatched to the 2200 block of Van Hise Ave. around 3:45 p.m. on Thursday.

During the incident, one student suffered a superficial stab wound. He was found off campus and brought back to the school for medical care.

Officers contacted the suspect at his home.

The 15-year-old male was arrested for simple battery and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.

This incident remains under investigaiton.

A woman was arrested for her third OWI following a crash where a child was also inside the vehicle.

Multiple people called to report a crash and a vehicle in a steep ditch at Highway 12 and Fish Hatchery Road.

The driver of the vehicle was located around 8:45 p.m. at nearby business. A child was with her.

Shani M. Brown, 29, of Madison, was arrested for third-offense OWI with a passenger under 16 and obstructing an officer.

No injuries were reported.

The child was released to the care of a family member.

Address: E. Washington Ave. at N. Paterson St.
Details:
A man attempted to hide bindles of crack cocaine on him after he was arrested following a traffic stop.

Members of our Central District Community Policing team pulled the vehicle over in the area of E. Washington Avenue and N. Paterson ST. around 1:15 p.m. Thursday.

Drugs, multiple cell phones and a large amount of cash were found inside the vehicle.

While being booked at the jail, more drugs were found hidden on the man’s body.
 
Richard L. Baines V, 35, was arrested for possessing with intent to deliver THC, possession with intent to deliver cocaine base, possession with intent to deliver fentanyl, obstructing and on a parole hold.

The Madison Police Department is currently investigating a missing and endangered person case involving Brent Wray. MPD has devoted many investigative resources the last 24 hours and is requesting the help of the public to locate Brent.

The Wray family has provided the following public statement regarding Brent:

"We are concerned about the whereabouts of our son Brent Wray. He was last seen on the morning of January 11, 2024, in the area of Highland and University Ave.  He was not in his usual state of mind when he left our home on January 10, 2024, on foot. 
 
He was last seen wearing a beanie hat, a lightweight, light-colored hooded sweatshirt with red lettering on the front, dark-colored athletic pants, and white bottom Converse gym shoes. He is a black male, 5'10"/5'11" tall, weight is approximately 160 lbs.
 
A Missing Person's report was filed with the Madison Police Dept. on Friday, January 12, 2024.
 
Therefore,  please call 911 to contact the Madison Police Dept. immediately if anyone has seen or been in contact with him. ( We sincerely appreciate the support we have received from Madison Police Dept.)  His family and friends are greatly concerned about his welfare, especially with the current weather conditions. We love him and do not believe he is a danger to himself or others. 
 
With An Abundance of Love & Concern,
 
Noble, Michelle, & Elliot Wray"

A man was given a municipal citation on Tuesday for accidentally discharging his firearm.

The 21-year-old man called to report the incident shortly before 3 p.m. on Tuesday.

He was cleaning the firearm in his apartment, located along the 5000 block of American Pkwy, when it discharged.

The bullet shattered the man’s glass door and entered the outside courtyard.

No one was injured during this incident.

The man has a valid concealed carry license.

Officers spoke to him about safety measures to follow when cleaning a firearm. 

He was issued a citation regarding the accidental discharge.

Officers were dispatched to an east side restaurant early Wednesday morning for a burglary alarm.

Officers arrived to the 700 block of Cottage Grove Rd. around 12:40 a.m.

The first officer on scene noticed broken glass.

Officers cleared the business.

Nothing was reported stolen.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a monetary reward. Funds may also be collected anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating an armed robbery that occurred at a title loan business on the city’s north side.

Officers were dispatched to the 3000 block of E. Washington Ave. around 12:57 p.m.

An employee said a man entered the business and inquired about a loan. As she was helping him, he pulled out a knife and demanded money.

The man hit and injured the employee during this incident. She was taken to the hospital for her injuries.

The suspect stole the employee’s vehicle before leaving. The vehicle was located unoccupied around 3 p.m. in a parking lot on E. Karstens Dr.

A K-9 team attempted a track, but could not locate the suspect.

Anyone with information on this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a financial reward. Funds can also be collected anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.




Photographs added.

Strangers called for help after seeing a caregiver hit an elderly client outside of East Towne Mall.

Officers were called to the mall shortly before 7 p.m. on Tuesday.

After talking to the witnesses, officers contacted the suspect.

John R. Pfeiffer, 52, of Madison was arrested for physical abuse of an elder person.

A woman said a driver flashed a gun at her as she was loading her kids into a car Tuesday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 1900 block of Northport Dr. around 9:20 a.m.

The woman said she waved at the driver trying to determine if it was safe for her and the children to cross the parking lot. After this, the woman reported hearing the man yell at her and displayed a firearm.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department’s Special Weapons and Tactics Team (SWAT) carried out a search warrant at a home on the city’s west side early Thursday morning.

A large police presence could be seen outside a home located on Laurie Dr.

Domon T. Goodwan, 20, of Madison, had multiple felony warrants for his arrest. He was wanted for first-degree recklessly endangering safety, robbery, escape, four counts of operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent and bail jumping.

During a past encounter with law enforcement, he deliberately drove a vehicle into a squad car in order to escape.

Goodwan was taken into custody without incident at the home.

Another adult male and female were also taken into custody on Thursday for their actions on scene.

MPD officers are assisting MFD with traffic control on a fire response in the 3000 block of Commercial Avenue.  We are asking our citizens to avoid this area until the scene is under control and traffic can be opened up.

Arrested: Jayden M Escamilla,  19 year old female
Details:
An MPD Sergeant was driving on Cottage Grove Road at Stoughton Road when he observed an oncoming vehicle sliding on ice in front of him.  The vehicle made a turn into the oncoming lane and t-boned the Sergeant's squad before fleeing the scene.

The Sergeant was treated at a local hospital for minor injuries and released.

The investigation is ongoing and investigators are reviewing evidence recovered at the scene, as well as video evidence from the area.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.






Traffic Investigators working this case were able to identify a suspect and establish Probable Cause.  Escamilla was arrested at her home this morning in the 1300 block of Starr Grass Drive for Hit and Run - Causing Injury.  Investigation continues.

Someone called 911 late Sunday night after seeing three juveniles attempting to break into vehicles parked on the north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 2000 block of Tennyson Lane around 11 p.m. on Saturday.

The trio initially ran from responding officers but were quickly taken into custody.

Officers also found a realistic-looking facsimile firearm in the snow.

One vehicle had a smashed-out window.

Those involved are a 12-year-old male, an 11-year-old male and a 15-year-old male.

They were released to their parents and given referrals to our Restorative Justice program for criminal damage to property.

While assisting with a hit-and-run crash investigation involving a sergeant’s squad car, a patrol officer’s vehicle was hit by a different driver.

The officer was sitting inside her squad car around 12:30 a.m. on Sunday when the crash occurred.

She attempted to stop the vehicle, but it drove away.

The vehicle was found unoccupied a short time later off of Monona Drive.

No citations or charges have been issued yet but are likely.

The investigation is ongoing at this time.

A woman was arrested for OWI after crashing a vehicle while a child was inside.

Officers were dispatched to eastbound Highway 12 at Fish Hatchery Road around 11 p.m. on Sunday.

Multiple people told officers they watched a car crash into a median and roll over.

One witness told police they pulled a toddler from the vehicle. The toddler was not injured in the crash.

Officers found bottle of beer on the road near the crash scene. An empty bottle of alcohol was also found inside the vehicle.

The driver was taken to the hospital to be checked out. Yanira N. Vasquez, 22, of Madison was arrested for first-offense OWI and neglect of a child. She was also cited for failure to keep a vehicle under control, violation of child safety restraints and operating without a valid driver’s license.

Child Protective Services was notified of this incident.

The Madison Police Department is investigating the theft of a trailer behind a church on the city’s east side.

On Thursday, officers were dispatched to the parking lot behind St. Bernard’s Catholic Church on Atwood Avenue.

The victim reported his enclosed trailer was taken from the spaces he rents in the lot. The trailer was full of outdoor adventure equipment including high-end bicycles and paddleboards.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a monetary reward. Funds can also be collected anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a substantial battery that occurred at a home on the city’s east side.

A 47-year-old woman was physically assaulted at a home on Thorp St. around 3 a.m. on Dec. 31.

The victim was dropped off at a local hospital and has remained unresponsive and in serious condition since the assault. 
 
At this time, no arrests have been made.
 
Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tps.com.  Information may be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a monetary award.  Funds can also be collected anonymously.
 
The investigation is ongoing.

A woman called 911 when a stranger began throwing snowballs at her car and began pound on its window.

Officers were dispatched to a gas station along 1100 block of S. Park St. shortly before 5 p.m.

The woman said the man was upset with how long it was taking her to get gas.

The woman stayed in her vehicle and did not engage with the man. He was ultimately booked into the Dane County Jail for disorderly conduct and bail jumping.

Address: W. Gorham St. at N. Carroll St.
Details:
A woman was taken to the hospital after she was struck by a vehicle Tuesday night.

Officers were dispatched to W. Gorham St. at N. Carroll St. around 8:20 p.m.

The woman was walking in the crosswalk when she was hit. She was conscious and alert when officers and other first responders arrived. Her injuries are not considered life-threatening.
 
There were no signs of impairment at the time of the crash. The driver was cited for inattentive driving and failure to yieldto a pedestrian. 
 
The investigation is ongoing.

One person was taken to the hospital after crashing into a row of garages.

Officers were dispatched to an area near Packers Ave. at Northport Dr. around 1:15 p.m. on Monday.
 
The driver likely suffered a medical event before hitting a tree and crashing into the garages.
 
A nearby bedroom wall was also damaged during this crash. No one was inside that home at the time.
 
The Madison Fire Department’s Heavy Urban Rescue Team responded to the scene to shore up the garage.

MPD officers were dispatched to a citizen call of shots fired near Gene Parks Place and Mike McKinney Court.  Officers arrive in the area and find bullet casings in the street.  They began to process the scene and conduct witness interviews.  A short time later, a 23 year-old man arrived at a local hospital with non-life-threatening gunshot wounds.  Detectives with the Violent Crime Unit responded to the scene and hospital to complete interviews and collect evidence.  They continue to investigate this case.  The suspect or suspects remain at large.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

On Wednesday, the Madison Police Department Special Victims Unit (SVU), arrested a 66-year-old man for Possession of Child Pornography.
 
Members of MPD SVU, Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT) and Special Weapons and Tactics(SWAT) unit served a search warrant on Cornell H. Rattliffe’s residence in the 6400 block of Raymond Road.
 
Rattliffe has been the subject of an ongoing investigation.

He was booked into the Dane County Jail on charges of Possession of Child Pornography.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after two women reported having a gun pulled on them.

Officers were dispatched to the 2200 block of Cypress Way around 5:10 p.m. on Monday.

Two women were sitting inside a vehicle when a stranger walked up and held a gun to the driver’s window.

The women drove away from the area and called for police.

The women were not physically injured. No arrests have been made at this time.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a monetary rewards. Funds may also be collected anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

Arrested:
Troy J. Rowe, 35
Terry J. Buttke, 42
Details:
A man called to report his vehicle had been stolen from an underground parking garage Wednesday morning.

Officers were dispatched to a building on Whitcomb Circle.

A few hours later, On-Star was able to track the vehicle to a store on Eagan Road.

Troy J. Rowe, 35, of Madison was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without the owner’s consent.

Terry J. Buttke, 42, was arrested for operating a motor vehicle without the owner’s consent.

The vehicle was returned to its owner.

A man called for police after a gun was flashed during a road rage incident.

Officers were dispatched to the area of S. Gammon Road and Watts Road around 12:30 p.m. on Thursday.
 
The suspect’s vehicle was located in a nearby store’s parking lot unoccupied.
When the suspect returned, he admitted to have a gun in his center console.

Stephen J. Peterson, 29, of Waterloo, was arrested for carrying a concealed weapon, disorderly conduct while armed and intentionally pointing a firearm at a person.

Madison Police Officers are working on a traffic incident on the Highway 12 Beltline at Fish Hatchery Road.  At this time, EASTBOUND lanes of traffic are closed from TODD DR to FISH HATCHERY RD while the scene is stabilized and the investigation begins.

We are asking motorists to avoid the area at this time and further updates will be posted when available.


The Highway 12 Beltline has been re-opened in all directions.



___________________________


MPD Investigators and Officers worked this scene until the early morning hours.  The first officers on scene reported that a person was struck by a vehicle.  MPD and MFD attempted life-saving efforts, but the subject was pronounced deceased at the scene by the Dane County Medical Examiner’s Office.  The blue SUV that struck the decedent fled the scene and was last seen traveling southbound on Fish Hatchery Road from the Highway 12 beltline.  Traffic was restricted on Highway 12 as investigators processed the scene and collected evidence.  Video surveillance is being collected, preserved, and analyzed from this area.  At this time, investigators are looking for the suspect vehicle, which may be a blue 2003-2009 Lexus GX 470 with likely damage in the front driver’s side headlight area.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man’s vehicle was stolen at gunpoint.

Officers were dispatched to the Menards on Commerce Dr. around 4:15 p.m. on Monday.

The victim was returning to his Jeep Grand Cherokee when he saw three masked people surrounding it. All three were armed with handguns and demanded the victim give them his keys.

The victim called 911 when the suspects drove away. They left the area in the victim’s vehicle and another vehicle parked nearby.  

The victim provided descriptions of both vehicles to officers.

Responding officers spotted the vehicles around Frisch, Schroeder and Hammersley Roads.

Officers attempted to pull over the suspect on Frisch Road, but it sped away. It entered the on-ramp for the eastbound Beltline at Whitney Way. The driver got off at Todd Dr. and crashed into a sign on the frontage road before driving away. The vehicle was found nearby unoccupied.

As of Tuesday afternoon, the stolen Jeep has not been found.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and could be eligible for monetary reward. Funds can also be collected anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

On 1/30/2024 at approximately 9:09 PM, Madison Police were dispatched to the 2100 block of East Springs Drive for a disturbance and shots fired incident.  Officers contacted individuals who reported being shot at following a disturbance in the area.  Evidence of shots being fired was located but no injuries or property damage were observed at this time. It is believed the involved parties are known to each other and there is no known threat to the public.

Address: Parkwood Ln. at N. Walbridge Ave.
Details:
The Madison Police Department is investigating an armed carjacking.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Parkwood Lane and N. Walbridge Ave. around 10:10 p.m. on Tuesday.

The victim explained he and another person were parked on Parkwood Lane when an SUV boxed them in. Four masked men, armed with handguns, took the victim’s car. The vehicle was later found unoccupied.

No physical injuries were reported during this incident.

Officers are trying to determine if the victim was targeted.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after several eggs were launched at the UW Hillel Foundation on Tuesday night.

Hillel Foundation staff self-reported the incident to the Madison Police Department on Wednesday morning.
 
The eggs hit the higher floors of the building.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence. Hillel security cameras show the eggs hitting the building around 9:20 p.m. Tuesday.

The building was not damaged but staff estimate it will cost several thousands of dollars to have cleaned. 

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The Hate Crimes Task Force has been made aware of this incident.

Anyone with information is asked to conact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information can be shared anonymously and may be eligible for a reward. Funds can also be collected anonymously. 

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a Memorial High School student brought a facsimile firearm to school in his backpack.

School staff called for police around 11 a.m.

They were able to separate the student from his backpack before officers arrived.

No injuries were reported.

The student was cited and released to a guardian.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man made threats after being laid off from his job.

Officers were dispatched to the Dean Care located along 1200 block of Deming Way around 10:05 a.m.

Other officers went to the man’s home and he was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The man admitted to being upset and randomly saying things in response.

Anthony T. Seils, 50, was arrested for disorderly conduct and making terrorist threats.

The investigation is ongoing.

A woman said a man ran over her hand following an argument outside of hotel Sunday night.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 4800 block of Hayes Road around 7:15 p.m.

A woman said she was fighting with one of the men inside the car when the driver ran over her hand.

The driver was found at a home in Verona.

Travis B. Heffel, 42, of Verona, was arrested for reckless driving causing bodily harm, hit and run, operating while revoked and resisting.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man was cited after accidentally discharged his firearm while cleaning it. 

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building located along the 400 block of W. Washington Ave. shortly before 7 p.m. on Friday. 

A round hit a sink and went into a cabinet behind it. A photo of the damaged sink is attached to this report.

No injuries were reported.

The 23-year-old man had a valid concealed carry license. He was cited for discharging a firearm.

The Madison Police Department responded to a burglary at a construction site early Monday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 500 block of S. Yellowstone Dr. around 1:30 a.m.

Officers, with support from the MPD drone unit, formed a perimeter around the construction site.

Two 18-year-old males were taken into custody. Both told officers they simply waited to explore the site.

Nothing was taken from the site.

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: S. Midvale Ave. at Waite Lane
Details:
Four teens were arrested after crashing a stolen vehicle Friday morning.

An officer observed a vehicle driving recklessly in the Midtown District. A traffic stop could not be attempted due to the speed of the vehicle.

The officer followed the vehicle’s direction of travel and found it had crashed into another vehicle near S. Midvale Ave. and Waite Lane.

Four people ran from the vehicle.

Other officers responded to the area and were quickly able to find three of the teens. Another teen was located hiding in a nearby backyard.

A 16-year-old male, a 15-year-old male, and two 13-year-old males were arrested for operating a motor vehicle without an owner’s consent (party to a crime).
The Hyundai sedan involved was a rental vehicle.

An employee called for police after arriving to find someone broke into their workplace.

Officers were dispatched toa restaurant located along the 400 block of W. Gilman St. around 6:55 a.m. on Wednesday.

The front door of the restaurant was smashed and cash register trays were missing.

Officers are reviewing digital evidence.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com.

The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a bank on the city’s southwest side was robbed Thursday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to the Old national Bank, located along the 5700 block of Raymond Road, shortly before 5 p.m.

A man walked into the bank and handed an employee a note demanding money. The suspect then ran away after getting some cash.

A K9 track was attempted and ended at the 5800 block of Russett Road.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously and could be eligible for a financial reward. Money can also be collected anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers responded after a woman was found deceased in a restroom stall at West Towne Mall.
 
Officers were dispatched around 6:15 p.m. on Thursday.

Durg paraphernalia was found at the scene. Nothing else suspicious was located.

A man armed himself with a gun following a disturbance at an apartment building on the north side.
 
Officers were dispatched to the 2500 block of Monterey Dr. around 4 a.m. on Friday.

Neighbors said the man began banging on their windows and doors and wanted to fight someone trying to help him.

The man was holding a gun at the entryway of the building when officers arrived and attempted to run away.
 
Responding officers were able to safely take the man into custody and separate him from his weapon.
 
No injuries were reported.
 
Budford B. Baker, 30, of Madison, was arrested for going armed while intoxicated, disorderly conduct and carrying a concealed weapon.

Address: W. Wilson St. at S. Henry St.
Details:
An officer suffered a minor injury when their squad car was rear-ended during a crash.

The officer was stopped in traffic on W. Wilson St. near Henry St. around 5:40 p.m. Monday.

A woman was driving a black sedan when she rear-ended the vehicle in front of her. That  vehicle then ran into the squad car.

There were no signs of impairment.

The officer was taken to the hospital for minor injuries. The other drivers involved did not report any injuries.

A maintenance worker was cleaning up at a job site when a masked man hit and pointed a gun at him.

Officers were dispatched to the 4800 block of Camden Road around 6:15 p.m. on Saturday.

The victim said he came outside to find the suspect in his cargo work van. He said the suspect jumped out of the van, hit him and pointed a gun at him before running away.

A K-9 track was attempted.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

A man was arrested Saturday afternoon for attacking an elderly person earlier in the day.

Around 9:15 a.m., officers were dispatched to the area of Wisconsin Ave. and W. Mifflin Street for a battery.

A man told officers he was on he walking to a nearby pharmacy when a stranger began hitting and kicking him, continuing to do so even after he fell down.
 
A witness yelled at the suspect to stop and provided officers with his description. Officers also reviewed and noticed the suspect on city cameras.

Around 3:30 p.m., an officer noticed the suspect along the 2800 block of E. Washington Ave. at the East Towne Shopping Center.

The suspect refused to talk to the officer. He also attempted to fight officers taking him into custody.

As this was happening, a crowd formed, and officers had to also try to keep people from interfering with the arrest.

Joshua J. Berkahn, 36, of Madison, was arrested for battery to an elderly person and resisting arrest.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail after he was medically cleared.

Madison officers assisted after a suspect vehicle crashed during a pursuit with another law enforcement agency.

Officers responded to the 2900 block of Milwaukee Street around 9:30 p.m. Sunday.

The suspect drove through two front yards to get away.

The driver was given a citation by MPD but received additional charges from the other law enforcement agencies involved.

A man had just arrived to a convenience store when a stranger approached him and attempted to steal his keys.

Officers were dispatched to the Kwik Trip on N. Third St. around 2 p.m. on Tuesday.

The suspect demanded the victim hand over his keys and a struggle took place when the victim refused. The victim was able to break free and safely get inside the store.

Officers arrived to find the suspect still in the parking lot. He attempted to run away but was taken into custody nearby.

Krekwom M. Smith, 23, was arrested for attempted strong-armed robbery, disorderly conduct, battery and resisting arrest.

Address: High Crossing Blvd. at East Springs Dr.
Details:
Officers responded after a truck crashed into a traffic pole on the city's east side Wednesday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to High Crossing Blvd. at East Springs Dr. around 3:25 p.m.

The driver demonstrated signs of intoxication. 

Drug paraphernalia was found inside the vehicle.

The driver was taken to the hospital and processed for first-offense OWI.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail on charges of possession of fentanyl, felony bail jumping, resisting and a probation hold.

Officers responded to a fight between two people in the parking lot of a convenience store Wednesday afternoon.

Officers were sent to the Kwik Trip located along the 2600 block of Fish Hatchery Road around 3:55 p.m.

An injured woman told police she was assaulted by someone she knows using brass knuckles. She was treated at the hospital for her injuries.

The suspect left the area as police arrived on scene. She was found at a business located on Sirloin Strip in Madison.

Tea M. Thomas, 25, was arrested for substantial battery and disorderly conduct while armed.

The other woman involved was issued a disorderly conduct citation.

Increased Traffic Enforcement in February


This month, the Madison Police Department, in partnership with the Dane County Sheriff's Office, has been and will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's seatbelt and alcohol laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 

The goal of these extra patrols is not just to arrest drivers.  The mission is to enhance public safety and prevent needless tragedies by discouraging people from making dangerous decisions and engaging in unsafe behaviors while driving.  Someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin and thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.

The Madison Police Department needs your help to make our roads safer.  Please, put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down and drive sober.

MPD Officers were dispatched to a rollover accident in the 700 block of E Johnson Street at approximately 3:19am.  An SUV struck a curb, hit several parked vehicles, and rolled over in the roadway.  Traffic was closed off to this area for about an hour to remove the vehicle and a large debris field.  The driver was processed for Operating a Motor Vehicle while Intoxicated.  The investigation is ongoing.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a shots fired incident that occurred Sunday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 600 block of Vera Ct. around 9:15 a.m.

Multiple people called to report hearing the gunshots.

No injuries were reported.

Officers canvassed the area and located shell casings.

There have been no reports of property damage.

No arrests have been made.

This remains an active investigation.

Madison police responded to the 4700 block of Hayes Road early Sunday morning after a rideshare driver was robbed at knife point.
 
2 suspects approached the rideshare driver, forcing him back into his vehicle and demanded the driver make various ATM withdraws across the city’s north and east side.
 
Once at their final location the driver was able to alert a hotel employee about the incident who then called police. The suspects fled the area prior to officer’s arrival.


Investigation is on going.

Madison police officers responded to a chaotic scene that left one officer injured.
 
Officers responded to the 2800 block of Hoard Street Saturday evening for a disturbance where an individual needed to be removed from a home. During the removal of the subject, an officer suffered a serious ankle injury.
 
The scene chaos continued as another subject approached an officer from behind and attempted to disarm them. Their attempt was unsuccessful and this subject was subsequently arrested.
 
Both subjects transported to the Dane County Jail.
 
Jonah T Sobacki, 27, arrested for resisting causing substantial bodily harm, disorderly conduct, discharging bodily fluids and threats to law enforcement.
 
Shaun Sobacki, 37, arrested for obstructing and attempting to disarm an officer.

Staff and a patron at Ian's Pizza were assaulted after asking a subject to leave early Sunday morning.
 
Madison Police Officers responded to Ian's Pizza downtown after being called by staff who reported a subject refused to leave then assaulted a patron and their staff.
 
While on scene the subject re-entered the restaurant and was able to be taken into custody. 
 
Minor injuries reported by victims.
 
Louis Miranda, 30, arrested for 3 counts of battery, disorderly conduct, resisting and trespassing.

Address: Frances St and W Johnson St
Details:
A man was arrested after striking an officer in the face Saturday evening in downtown Madison.
 
Around 9:30 p.m., officers observed two subjects fighting at the intersection of Frances St and W Johnson St. 
 
While officers approached, two subjects took off on foot. Officers are able to catch up to one who, in an attempt to keep fleeing, struck one of the officers in the face.
 
The suspect was subsequently arrested and booked into the Dane County Jail.
 
Darnell Holmes, 23, arrested for battery to law enforcement, resisting and disorderly conduct.

Address: John Nolen Dr and S Broom St
Details:
Downtown officer’s responded to a 3 vehicle car accident just before the intersection of John Nolen Drive and Broom Street around 12:30 p.m.
 
Witnesses stated the driver attempted to swerve around slowing traffic but ended up colliding with two other vehicles.
 
Responding officers attempted to make contact with the suspect driver who was still sitting inside his vehicle while it started to smoke, refusing to get out.
 
Officers had to physically remove the driver from the car and then transported the subject to the hospital and processed him for third-offense OWI.
 
AJ Washington, 43, arrested for third-offense OWI and probation violation.

Address: Liens Rd at East Washington Ave
Details:
Road rage incident on the city’s east and north side leads to an arrest.
 
Around 3 p.m. on Friday afternoon, officers responded to the Kwik Trip off Lien Road to learn that Booker chased another vehicle around the north side of Madison after it made an unsafe lane change causing a minor collision.
 
Booker became upset with the other driver after both pulled over. Booker became aggressive which caused the other driver to flee out of fear.
 
Victor Booker, 27, was arrested for disorderly conduct and the other driver was cited for unsafe lane change.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man arrived at a local hospital with a gunshot wound Saturday evening. 
 
The man mentioned he was jumped by subjects familiar to him on Westward Way and shot in the leg. The man also stated some of his personal property was stolen.
 
Officers checked the area but did not locate any signs of a shooting.
 
The investigation is ongoing

Man jumps from a balcony in an attempt to flee police.
 
Monday morning Madison officers responded to the 1000 block of Williamson Street to arrest a man. As officers arrive and attempt contact, the man jumps from a second story balcony and leads police on a short foot pursuit.
 
Officers are able to apprehend the subject who is taken into custody and transported to the Dane County Jail.
 
Justin Beasley, 40, arrested on several warrants, resisting, and possession of drug paraphernalia.

Team work between Madison and Fitchburg police leads to the arrest of two suspects.
 
Madison police responded to the 2900 block of Coho street on the city’s south side for a disturbance where a victim was threatened with a gun.
 
Suspects fled the scene in a vehicle prior to police arriving but was quickly spotted by Fitchburg police and stopped at a nearby gas station.
 
Officers were able to make contact with the suspects and observed a gun in plain view in the car. Both suspects were arrested and transported to the Dane County Jail.
 
Edwill Miranda, 27, arrested for 2nd degree recklessly endangering safety

Sergio Arias, 24, arrested for party to a crime 2nd degree reckless endangering safety and 2nd offense OWI

Multiple concerned citizens called in Monday evening to report a person threatening to hit people and acting “crazy”.
 
Officers arrived on scene and make contact with a subject who then resists their attempts to arrest him. The subject was stabilized, medically cleared at a local hospital and transported to the Dane County Jail.
 
Adam Hirssig, 34, arrested on charges of domestic disorderly conduct, criminal damage to property, theft and an additional charge of resisting.

Loitering turned into an arrest after a subject is found to be in possession of methamphetamine 

Madison officers responded to the 2500 block of Fitch Hatchery Road for a loitering complaint around 8:30 p.m. During their contact with the subject he was found to be in possession of methamphetamine and the subject later admitting to ingesting more prior to officers arriving.

The subject was left at the care of hospital staff for observation with a felony order in citation.

Madison officers responded to the 1400 block of McKenna Blvd Tuesday morning after a resident found a bullet in his apartment.
 
Earlier that morning officers responded to the area for a disturbance but no person or scene was located.
 
Resident recalls hearing the disturbance and then later on finding the bullet and a hole in his ceiling while cleaning.
 
Investigation is ongoing at this time.

Wednesday morning Madison officers responded to the 5700 block of Raymond Rd for an attempted bank robbery.
 
A silent panic alarm was activated by a teller at the Old National Bank and the suspect fled the scene without any money.
 
About 30 minutes later there was another bank robbery in Fitchburg but this time the suspect was able to get away with money.

It was later determined that these two cases were related. 

The suspect was identified as Lisa Harding, 38, and was taken into custody this morning after the Dane County Sheriff’s Office located Harding driving in the Town of Dunn and initiated a pursuit.

Madison police provided traffic control assistance to the pursuit and follow up support. For more information about the pursuit portion of this incident report please refer to the Dane County Sheriff’s office.

Downtown officers responded to a disturbance between a cab driver and customer after customer refuses to pay.
 
Officers arrived to the 100 block of Dayton Street and learned the customer tried to walk away without paying.
 
When the driver tried to confront the subject, they become more upset and aggressed toward the driver like they were going to fight him.
 
Jonathan Schwartz, 47, arrested for disorderly conduct.

Madison Police responded to a report of an adult missing from a group home. Lucas Skram, age 29 left the home the day before and has not returned. Skram is a white male with blonde hair and hazel eyes. Skram is currently listed as missing.

Anyone with information regarding Skram’s whereabouts are encouraged to contact the Madison Police Department.

This week Aidison Yang was found guilty of three counts of First Degree Sexual Assault by Use or Threat of Use of a Dangerous Weapon in a Dane County Circuit Court. This was reference a sexual assault case which occurred on a bike path in Madison in 2005. This conviction would not have been possible without the incredible work of many individuals and organizations that assisted in this case. The Survivor has been brave and patient throughout the decades of investigation and finally the judicial process.

These organizations include the Wisconsin Department of Justice-Division of Criminal Investigation, Wisconsin Department of Justice, Attorney General’s Office, RCC Sexual Assault Resource Center, Minnesota Bureau of Criminal Apprehension, Carver County Sheriff’s Office (Minnesota) and Wisconsin Statewide intelligence Center. The Madison Police Department extends its gratitude to these organizations as their help in this case led to Justice for Aidison Yang.

Madison police responded to a fight call in the 600 block of E Washington Ave. During the fight, one of the combatants grabbed a knife and threatened the other combatant with it. Officers were able to speak with witnesses on scene that led to recovering the knife.

Lavera Marshall, Age 33 was arrested for Disorderly Conduct While Armed.

A man was arrested for yelling racial slurs and threatening people during an incident Sunday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of W. Gilman St.

A witness was walking home when he noticed the incident.

The suspect was walking away from the area when police arrived.

Jose L. Espinoza, 58, was arrested for disorderly conduct with a hate crime enhancer and intimidation of a victim.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

The Madison Police Department’s Hate Crime Task Force was notified about this incident.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery that occurred on the city's north side late Thursday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 1800 block of Loftsgordon Ave. around 11:45 p.m.

A 30-year-old man was upset and hitting the building. Another man exited the building and swung a scooter toward the 30-year-old. The 30-year-old was injured during this incident and taken to the hospital.

The other person involved was not at the scene when police arrived.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

This incident remains under investigation.

The Madison Police Department was dispatched for a fight between students at East High School on Thursday afternoon.

Staff requested assistance from MPD in resolving the situation. 

Seven students were referred to restorative justice for disorderly conduct.

A 16-year-old male was taken into custody for obstruction and a warrant out of Milwaukee County.

Officers provided extra patrols around the high school around dismissal times as a result of this incident.

Address: Tokay Blvd. at S. Whitney Way
Details:
A man called police after a driver pointed a gun at him during a road rage incident.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Tokay Blvd. and S. Whitney Way around 9:20 a.m. on Thursday.

The man said he was driving westbound on the Beltline and accidentally cut off another vehicle near the S. Whitney Way exit.

The man said the other vehicle followed him as he got off the Beltline. He reported the other driver yelled at him and flashed a gun in his direction.

The man said he did not interact and called police for help.

The vehicle was located at an address along the 5200 block of Brindis Ct. in Middleton. A loaded handgun was seen in plain view of the car.
The owner has a valid concealed carry permit.

Jafarvis Jordan, 25, of Middleton was arrested for pointing a firearm and disorderly conduct while armed. 

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

A man was arrested for pulling a folding knife on a staff member at a downtown comedy club.

Officers were dispatched to the 200 block of State St. around 8:30 p.m. on Wednesday.

The man was upset that he was unable to perform at the club.

Officers located the man nearby.

James A. Bailey, 77, of Madison, was arrested for disorderly conduct while armed and bail jumping.

A man wanted for a string of burglaries at underground parking garages was arrested as he was on his way to court for sentencing on five other open cases involving similar crimes.

In early February, the Burglary Crime Unit began investigating a series of thefts from the underground parking garage at an apartment complex located along the 600 block of W. Main Street.

Using building security video, detectives were able to get still-frame images showing the suspect stealing a bike.

Shortly after this investigation began, another victim from a previous burglary involving this suspect noticed him on the street with a bike. This victim knew the man was prohibited from possessing bicycles due to an open case. This victim took photos of the suspect and shared them with police.

The suspect's appearance and clothing matched the video provided from the apartment complex on W. Main Street.

Daniel P. Oheron, 31, of Madison, was arrested on his way to a sentencing hearing. His new charges include burglary and five counts of bail jumping.

A delivery driver's vehicle was stolen as he picked up an order Wednesday night.

The driver flagged down an officer in the area of State and Johnson Streets around 8:15 p.m. on Wednesday to report the theft.

Hours later, the suspect was later stopped and taken into custody by Sauk County Deputies.

Moustapha Gueye, 22, of Madison was arrested for operating a motor  vehicle without an owner's consent and felony bail jumping.

An intoxicated driver crashed into a parked vehicle outside of East Towne Mall on Tuesday afternoon.

A woman and two small children were inside the vehicle.

No injuries were reported.

The driver showed signs of impairment. An open bottle of alcohol was also found inside his car.

David A. Collins, 58, of Sun Prairie, was arrested for fourth offense OWI and bail jumping.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman was injured during an incident last Friday.

Officers were dispatched to the 900 block of Royster Oaks Dr. around 5:20 p.m. on Feb. 23.

The woman got into an argument with an acquaintance at the address. During the argument, the woman says a man stole her purse and hit her.

The purse was later recovered.

No arrests have been made at this time.

The investigation is ongoing.

Address: County Highway AB at Hope Hollow Trail
Details:
A man was arrested for driving under the influence following a crash on Sunday evening.

Officers were dispatched to County Highway AB at Hope Hollow Trail around 5 p.m.

The 20-year-old driver was taken to the hospital for a minor injury. He was released and cited at the hospital for first-offense OWI, failure to have control of his vehicle and underage drinking. 

Officers with other agencies, who were nearby, also responded to this crash scene.

Multiple people called to report an intoxicated driver after her vehicle hit two parked cars.

Officers were dispatched to the area of Wisconsin Ave. at Gilman St. around 2:40 p.m. on Sunday. 

When officers arrived, the woman showed signs of impairment.

Erin N. Colvin, 45, of Madison, was arrested for OWI, bail jumping and tampering with an ignition interlock.

Address: N Park St and Regent St
Details:
MPD and MFD Officers are responding to call in progress at this intersection.  Traffic is shut down.  We are asking the public to please avoid the area at this time.  An update will be coming.





This mental health situation has safely resolved and the subject is receiving help and treatment.  Traffic is open in all directions.  Thank you.

Madison Police are looking for your help in reuniting a little boy with his bike.  MPD was dispatched to the underground garage of the apartment complex at 903 Delaplaine Ave for a report of a stolen bike.  Officers interviewed a mother, who reported that her disabled son has a green tricycle-style bike with a blue horn and special straps that was designed just for him.  That bike was stolen by a suspect on 3/2/24.  Officers are reviewing video evidence from the complex and area, and are interviewing residents from the complex about this crime.  Due to its design and specifications, the bike is of high monetary value; but is of much more value to its owner and little boy.  A picture of the bike is attached.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

Address: W. Dayton and N. Broom Streets
Details:
Officers were dispatched to check on an injured man found lying on a sidewalk Tuesday evening.

The man was near W. Dayton and N. Broom Streets around 8:45 p.m.

The victim told officers he was assaulted by someone he knew.

The suspect was located nearby.

Korey V. Johnson, 40, was arrested for substantial battery and bail jumping.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

Officers responded to an east side clinic Monday afternoon for a patient with a gunshot wound.

Officers arrived to the 2400 block of Winnebago St. around 1:10 p.m.

The patient said this was an accidental injury he caused himself.

A preliminary investigation reveals this incident occurred in another jurisdiction.

Officers responded to a domestic disturbance at an east side apartment late Tuesday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 700 block of Vernon Ave. around 10:30 p.m.

The suspect injured several individuals and prevented one from calling for help.
 
Jeremy J. Hornung, 40, of Madison, was arrested for domestic battery, domestic disorderly conduct, felony intimidation of a victim, battery, disorderly conduct and criminal damage to property.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

Wednesday evening officers responded to the 1500 block of Arizona Pass for a battery complaint.
 
When they arrived to the area Madison Fire was on scene treating a patient who was unable to talk due to a broken jaw they sustained during an altercation.
 
The victim was able to communicate through note writing and indicated that they were unsure of what might have led to the assault.
 
The suspect was known to the victim and the incident is still under investigation.

Disturbance on a Madison Metro bus leads to the arrest of one.
 
Wednesday evening Madison officers responded to the intersection of Northport Dr and Dryden Dr after being called regarding a patron who was acting unruly.
 
Officers arrived on scene and were able to detain the subject who was refusing to get off the bus, threatening the driver and then turned his anger towards the officers.
 
Deshunaro Kirby-Robinson, 33, was arrested on charges of disorderly conduct and threats to law enforcement.

A driver was taken to the hospital and cited for OWI following a crash on the city’s east side.

Officers were dispatched to northbound US 151 near I-90 around 4:25 a.m. on Sunday. They arrived to find a car on its side in the median unoccupied.

Evidence at the scene indicated someone was injured during the crash.

The owner of the vehicle lived in a nearby city. Officers found her and another woman suffering from injuries while checking this address.

The vehicle owner was determined to be the driver during this crash. She was taken to the hospital for her injuries and cited for first-offense OWI.

Officers received a report that dozens of people were fighting at an arcade and restaurant Saturday evening.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block of Grand Canyon Dr. around 5:20 p.m.

Officers arrived to find multiple vehicles driving away from the area.

No charges or tickets were issued.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers responded to a domestic disturbance outside of a fast-food restaurant late Sunday night.

Officers were dispatched to the 2400 block of S. Park Street around 11 p.m. after a woman ran into the dining room asking for help.

The woman told officers she had been shoved out of a non-moving vehicle during an argument with a man. The woman was not injured.
 
A 29-year-old man was arrested for domestic disorderly conduct and first-offense OWI.

The Madison Police Department Increasing Traffic Enforcement in 2024


In 2024, the Madison Police Department will be conducting extra patrols that will focus on enforcing Wisconsin's bicycle and pedestrian laws.  In addition, MPD will continue to work with the Dane County Sheriff’s Officer to enforce seatbelt, alcohol, and speed laws.  These additional enforcement efforts are made possible through traffic overtime grants provided by the Wisconsin Department of Transportation. 
  • On average, every day, twenty pedestrians are killed by a moving vehicle in the United States. 
  • Pedestrian deaths have been climbing since 2010 - primarily due to motorists who drive recklessly and aggressively, speed and are distracted.
  • Pedestrian and bicyclist deaths make up approximately 20% of all traffic-related fatalities in the United States.
  • Approximately 76,000 pedestrians and 47,000 bicyclists are injured in roadway crashes annually in the United States.
  • Speeding is a contributing factor in approximately 30% of all traffic fatalities in the United States.
  • Someone is injured or killed in an impaired driving crash every two hours in Wisconsin.
  • Thousands of unbuckled passenger vehicle occupants are killed every year in crashes throughout the United States.
The goal of these extra patrols is not just to arrest drivers.  The mission is to enhance public safety and prevent needless tragedies by discouraging people from making dangerous decisions and engaging in unsafe behaviors while driving. 

The Madison Police Department is asking for your help in making our roads safer.  Please, put your cell phone down, buckle up, slow down, drive sober, and watch out for and yield to pedestrians and bicyclists.

A delivery driver called police after seeing an injured man during a drop-off.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment building along the 1000 block of William St. around 12:50 a.m. on Saturday.

They arrived to find blood smeared in the hallway of a common area.

Officers traced the blood to a unit where they found an injured 53-year-old male. The victim said he got into a verbal argument with an acquaintance and was injured by him when he tried to leave the apartment.

A 67-year-old man also had visible injuries and reported being punched by the suspect. He said he was doing laundry when he was randomly approached.

The suspect was walking out of the building when officers arrived. He resisted arrest and refused to identify himself.

David F. Atkinson, 48, was arrested for physical abuse of an elderly person, substantial battery, disorderly conduct, false imprisonment, resisting arrest and bail jumping. He was also cited for trespassing.
 
Officers also located several people hiding in common areas of the building.

A 53-year-old man was arrested for outstanding warrants and possession of drug paraphernalia. He was also cited for trespassing.

Another 53-year-old man and a 62-year-old man were also cited for trespassing.

The incident remains under investigation.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery that occurred downtown early Sunday morning.

Officers were dispatched to the 300 block of W. Gorham St. around 12:25 a.m.

A man was walking with friends in this area when he was punched by the suspect. This caused the victim to fall to the ground and strike his head.

The victim was taken to the hospital for his injuries.
The suspect yelled racial slurs at one of the victim’s friends who intervened.

Caleb A. James, 21, of Illinois, was arrested for substantial battery, damage to property and disorderly conduct with a hate crime enhancer.

The Hate Crimes Task Force was notified about this incident.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a road rage incident involving a gun that occurred Wednesday afternoon.

Officers were dispatched to inbound Highway 151 near the American Parkway exit around 1:30 p.m.

The victim during this incident, the suspect rolled down their window, pulled out a gun and fired several shots.

The victim did not report any injuries.

No damage has been reported.

This remains an ongoing investigation.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a man pulled out a knife on a woman during a domestic disturbance.

Officers were dispatched to an apartment located along the 2300 block of Independence Lane around 10 p.m. on Saturday.

Another man was able to intervene and stop the suspect. Officers located the suspect inside the apartment building.

Jose R. Talavera Padilla, 46, of Madison was arrested for first-degree recklessly endangering safety, strangulation, false imprisonment, battery and disorderly conduct while armed.

He was taken to the Dane County Jail.

This remains an active investigation.

Officers were dispatched to a stabbing on the city’s north side Tuesday evening.

Officers arrived to the 1900 block of Aberg Ave. to find a victim with a stab wound to the hand. He was taken to the hospital for his injuries.

The victim and suspect knew one another.
 
The suspect was found by Wisconsin State Capitol Police on Wednesday and was taken to the hospital before being booked into the Dane County Jail.

Marcel Taylor, 56, of Madison, was arrested for second-degree recklessly endangering safety, disorderly conduct while armed and felony bail jumping.

A Madison man was arrested Wednesday afternoon in connection to an ongoing child pornography investigation.

On Wednesday, members of the Madison Police Department’s Special Victims Unit (SVU), Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT) and Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) unit served a search warrant at a home located along the 2600 block of Moland Street.

Ben T. Mattice, 22, was booked into the Dane County Jail on probation violation. Additional child pornography charges are pending.

The Madison Police Department is investigating a battery that occurred Wednesday evening along State Street.

Officers were dispatched to the 100 block around 8:15 p.m.

People reported seeing a group of juveniles jump and beat up an adult male. The victim is in his 60s.

The suspects were located by Wisconsin State Capitol Police on a bus a short time later.

Several teens involved were runaways. They were given restorative justice referrals and turned over to their guardians.  

A 13-year-old male was missing from Milwaukee and taken to the Juvenile Reception Center.
 
The incident remains under investigation.

Address: 9400 block of Lost Meadow Road in Middleton
Details:
On Friday morning, members of the Madison Police Department’s Special Victims Unit (SVU), Gang and Neighborhood Crime Abatement Team (GNCAT) and Special Weapons and Tactics (SWAT) team served a search warrant at a residence located in the 9400 block of Lost Meadow Road, Middleton, WI (located within the City of Madison jurisdiction).
 
The search warrant was regarding an on-going Internet Crimes Against Children (ICAC) investigation specifically for the possession of child pornography.

An additional residence within the City of Middleton was also searched as part of this morning’s investigation.

This investigation is still on-going.

The Madison Police Department is investigating after a woman reported being sexually assaulted inside of a home Thursday evening. 

Officers were dispatched to the 2200 block of University Avenue around 8:45p.m and took the report of the assault. 

The MPD does not believe there is any danger to the public at this time and the investigation is ongoing.


UPDATE

A suspect is in custody in this case.  Further information will be forthcoming.

Madison Police Officers were dispatched to Lien Road at Parkside Drive for a report of a vehicle vs bicyclist accident.  Traffic was blocked off in the area for some time for scene processing and evidence collection.  The victim, a 35 year-old man, was pronounced dead at the scene by the Dane County Medical Examiner’s Office.  Officers and Traffic Specialists were able to locate the suspect vehicle and seized it as evidence.  The operator of that vehicle was contacted and the investigation is ongoing.  The scene has been cleared.

If you have any information regarding this incident, please contact the Madison Police Department at 255-2345. If you wish to remain anonymous, please contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 266-6014, or, on the web at p3tips.com. Individuals contacting Crime Stoppers can receive up to $1,000 in cash rewards for tips that lead to an arrest.

On Thursday, officers responded to a burglary at a home along the 5100 block of Open Wood Way.

A neighbor noticed a woman walking through backyards and enter a home.

The woman was inside when officers arrived around 6:30 p.m.

Julie A. Hurley, 64, of Madison, was arrested for burglary and possession of drug paraphernalia.

A property manager called police after noticing what appeared to be bullet holes in an apartment building.

Officers were dispatched to Kessel Ct. around 4:10 p.m. on Thursday.

The front of a building had some damage. A projective was also discovered in the wall of one unit.

No injuries were reported.

There have been no reports of shots fired in this area in recent days.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers arrested two men Wednesday night following a disturbance on State Street.

Officers were dispatched to the 400 block around 10:45 p.m.

As officers were taking one man into custody for disorderly conduct another men began yelling and indicating he wanted to fight officers. Officers asked the man to back away from the area, but the man refused. He continued to threaten officers and kick at them as he was taken into custody.
 
Claude Johnson, 58, of Madison, was arrested for disorderly conduct.  Ernest W. Holley, 54, of Madison, was arrested for disorderly conduct, obstructing, resisting arrest, threats to law enforcement and a PO hold.

Officers were dispatched to several areas in the east and north districts for gunshots and fireworks. 

Officers checked several addresses around 11 p.m. on Saturday. During their search for shell casings, officers could hear fireworks being launched.

Three shell casings were recovered in the area of Esther Court and McCann Rd.

No injuries were reportd.

No property damage was reported.

Anyone with information about this incident is asked to contact Madison Area Crime Stoppers at 608-266-6014 or online at p3tips.com. Information may be shared anonymously.

The investigation is ongoing.

Officers were dispatched following a dispute between two neighbors Friday morning.

Officers were sent to the 4300 block of Mohawk Dr. around 8:15 a.m.

A woman went to speak to a neighbor after noticing damage on her vehicle. As the woman was leaving, a dog escaped from the neighbor's apartment and charged at her.

The woman fireda shot at the ground to scare the dog away.

Officers reviewed digital evidence of this incident. 

No arrests were made. No citations were given.

A man was taken to the hospital following a battery on the city's east side on Monday.

Officers were dispatched to the 4000 block of Nakoosa Trail around 4:40 p.m.

A 30-year-old man said he was punched at a nearby encampment and went to a shelter to call for help.

He was taken to the hospital for his injuries.

At this time, no arrests have been made.

The investigation is ongoing.

Arrested: Isabel C Wessell, 25 year old female
Details:
Officers were dispatched to a battery at the Blue Moon Bar and Grill.  We contacted a 71 year-old female customer that had been assaulted by another patron of the bar.

The victim had bloody scratches to her face and reported that while walking to use the restroom, she was attacked by a subject unknown to her.  That suspect, Isabel Wessell, grabbed the victim by the face, scratching her.  Several other witnesses in the business reported the same to the officer.

Wessel was contacted at the scene and placed under arrest.  She was lodged at the Dane County Jail for Physical Abuse of an Elder Person and Disorderly Conduct.

The Madison Police Department is investigating two disturbances, that occured at the same address, within 90 minutes of each other.

Officers were initially dispatched to a multi-unit property along the 500 block of E. Johnson St. around 11:10 p.m. on Thursday.

Officers arrived to find an apartment door had been kicked-in and damaged. A 69-year-old man was punched multiple times and had visible injuries.

A vape pen was stolen from his apartment.

The suspect was not inside the building when officers arrived.

At 12:17 a.m. on Friday, officers were dispatched to the same building. 

Officers arrived to find a large, exterior window had been shattered. 

Another person was found inside with visible injuries.

Officers followed a blood trail outside of the building and also located several identificaiton items along this trail.

Through more investigative work, probable cause was developed to arrest Latroy D. Castle, 32, for these burglaries.

Castle was found sleeping in the entryway of the City-County Building early Monday morning. He was arrested and taken to the Dane County Jail, where he began to fight and spit on deputies.

Castle was booked on battery and criminal damage to property charges, as well as new ones to include, resisting arrest, discharging bodily fluid at a public worker and bail jumping.

The investigation is ongoing.
